items.title: Consistently delayed and/or running…
items.review_text:
Consistently delayed and/or running short trains with no seat reservations and overcrowding all the while charging you £120 for journeys a little over an hour at peak time.

But apparently privatisation works.

items.title: I was overcharged for a day return…
items.review_text: I was overcharged for a day return ticket, I did not realise straight away but followed up with GWR customer services the day after. They just quoted T&C's. May as well talk to a lamp post. Customers have to suck it up as they have a monopoly and do not give a stuff.

items.title: Zero stars for the hard nobbley…
items.review_text:
Zero stars for the hard nobbley uncomfortable cramped seats on a journey from paddington to penzance & back to paddington of more than 10 hours we are in danger of blood clots in the legs, posterior & thighs. Very regressive choice of bumpy 
 seating which once upon a time was a comfortable ride to the south west with good seating. Now The changes are especially bad for pensioners & people with back problems, and those with long legs, like me. Please take away the painful bumps in the seats.😟🤞👍

items.title: Used them twice in the last few months
items.review_text: Used them twice in the last few months, first time 45 minutes late to Truro from London, then Easter Monday, London to Swansea, had to take an Uber from Cardiff to complete the journey , as no replacement buses. Then try and claim compensation that they advertise everywhere, absolutely zero customer service . The worst of all UK rail franchises,  and that's a real achievement.

items.title: Wheelchair user abandoned and injured
items.review_text: I booked return Oxford to Newton Abbot as wheelchair user with visual impairment.. No ramp or help at Newton Abbot. I had to climb out holding on, pulling wheelchair onto platform after throwing handbags out first. Wheelchair ended up upside down,  damaged wheel alignment, injured hand and shoulder in the process. On platform trying to upright wheelchair someone in high viz said "did you book"( which I had done) he walked away without helping me upright chair and get back in it saying he would "get someone". By the time they arrived I had got myself back in wheelchair but no apology etc i explained about hurting my arm and hand in process expecting an injury report but again nothing. On return journey again at Reading no assistance/ramp etc buffet staff got me off using internal trolley ramp. Left on platform in pain dealing with a wheelchair not running properly from previous incident, heavy luggage on back. Finally found railway person after long wheel. He was aggressive and abusive, his response to no ramp etc "no one told me". Initially refused to help. I told him my connecting train was still in station  he was insisting late at night I wait an hour for a different connection. He spoke to me like I was an imbecile for asking to get on my original connection. Gave me a lecture about not being frustrated by his lack of help wasting more time. Absolute disgrace. Left in pain, stressed, shaking all the way to Oxford with a broken wheelchair. Thanks GWR. As usual I have reported it but Passenger Assist just does not improve and is not fit for practice

items.title: Fraudulent advertising
items.review_text: How this company can call itself “Great” is beyond me. Continual price hikes with a relentlessly appalling performance. My wife and I have wasted days of our lives waiting for trains on the Bath line. We get the bus whenever possible now. Far cheaper and a whole lot more reliable. F you GWR. (I had to put a date but this is probably 90% of the time we use them which unfortunately can be unavoidable.)

items.title: Cancelled my train for later
items.review_text:
Cancelled my train for later, now unable to travel and can't reach them on the phone.

Absolutely disgraceful

items.title: Personal Assistant
items.review_text: I travelled recently on GWR. I had Personal Assistant and they went above and beyond to help me getting on and off the train this is a excellent service and I was so grateful for it .

items.title: Avoid it like the plague
items.review_text:
If you’re thinking of using this service, DONT. You would honestly have a far more relaxing experience sitting on the railway tracks than on the trains. 

Even though they run the same routes everyday, they don’t have to worry about traffic, and they have been doing it since the 1800s, they are completely incapable. These mouth breathers keep hiking the price as almost all their services are delayed and the trains are packed because they forgot about rush hours (they will also forget tomorrow). 

Only decent parts are the trains are clean and the staff are friendly

items.title: Dear lord. The seats.
items.review_text:
The seats. Where do I begin? Did they change recently? Its like sitting on a piece of polystyrene that has flattened. There's a peculiar square bump in the middle almost like a square bike saddle that digs in either side of your upper inner legs. I have used three GWR trains this week and all the seats were like this. Then there's the angle of the back of the seat. It's pretty much a right angle which when combined with the aforementioned seat creates a stress position which is extremely unpleasant even for a brief journey. 
Two stars for friendly staff and a relatively clean train.

items.title: Rubbish.
items.review_text:
10 mins until scheduled departure: departure board “on time”, application “on time”. 

Time of departure: departure board “on time”, application “on time”. 

10 mins after scheduled time of departure: train cancelled, next train in 45 mins

items.title: Great Service!
items.review_text: Oh my goodness I cannot believe all the negative reviews!! All I can say is those people need to try Southern Rail because I have travelled twice on GWR this past week, both journeys were over 4 hours and I have nothing but good things to say. The trains were clean and comfortable and every member of staff that I encountered was friendly and helpful. It was an absolute treat to have a buffet service (operated by yet another friendly and helpful member of staff). Seats are bookable and there is a helpful light system to indicate which seats are booked and where exactly they are booked to and from. Tickets were not expensive either although to be fair I used splits. I understand that we all have different experiences but mine could not have been more different from the negative reviews that I have seen below. GWR were a pleasure to travel with and I shall look forward to my next journey with them.

items.title: Embarrassment
items.review_text:
First, it is expensive.
Second, never on time.
Third, delay refound is embarrassing, you are losing money from your paycheck because you are late at work!
Fourth, the cashiers most of the time dont know what they are doing!
The only thing that I can praise are the workers on the barriers, they really are trying to protect companys money 💰 😀 
Overall, if this was a company dealing with competition it will go bankrupt in a week!

items.title: GWR WhatsApp enquiry service.
items.review_text: During  an Industrial action period, there is uncertainty about train schedules.  I have used the GWR WhatsApp enquiry  service. The response to my questions was both prompt and congenial from somebody called Alexandra. This service is a credit to GWR, thankyou.  Ken Bromfield7

items.title: Worst train experience ever
items.review_text: Worst train experience ever. On foot for 2 hours If you don't have a system for managing seat capacity at least give cheap ticket prices. If you have an alternative train service you use, use them. Trust me you will save yourself tainted service of this company.

items.title: Excellent Social Media
items.review_text: Social media team very good. Can't fault it. Have Xd GWR Help a couple of times and they reply immediately. Answered my question today and relieved my anxiety about travelling. Train left on time. All staff helpful and pleasant.

items.title: What a terrible company
items.review_text: What a terrible company. Very greedy to overcharge . Train fares are so high and for what ?! Always delayed , cancelled , strikes and the trains are very slow. I try to use alternative transport as a result, its just not worth the hassle.

items.title: I've been emailing for weeks back and…
items.review_text: I've been emailing for weeks back and forth trying to get a refund on my taxi fare and tickets as the trains were cancelled on my return form London. It is an absolute disgrace as the service was not provided but that doesn't seem to matter to them. No other business would get away with not giving you something you haven't paid for!

items.title: Poor quality and expensive
items.review_text:
Poor quality and expensive. Tickets cost too much compared to driving, how will we ever reach any of our climate targets like this. 
Service is shocking no attempt to run on time and timetables are changed be a couple of minuets between booking and departure to prevent delay repay claims.

items.title: Clearly don't value their customers
items.review_text:
Not informed of 2nd cancellation until arrived at station. Told I could only travel on a train either immediately before or after original journey even though LNER let you get on any train you can. Submitted a claim through the national train delay scheme for an almost 2 hour delay to a journey travelling with 2 children. This was rejected by GWR as I travelled on a later train. The compensation is meant to be for delay and clearly states you can travel on an alternative train if you're able to.  On top of this, when  I submitted an appeal, they bizarrely cut the compensation they said I'd be entitled to by £40. Nearly £200 for a journey on a crammed train with no seats and no trolley service to at least try to distract children because it couldn't get through the crowds 

To add an update. following GWR response I contacted customer service who kindly confirmed that on their screen they could see my refund had now been authorised following my appeal for the original amount and that I would receive an email confirming this within 2 days. I've now recieved said email telling me the appeal was unsuccessful. For some reason they continue to claim I travelled on an earlier train which is completely untrue. am happy to provide receipts of food I bought whilst waiting for the later train seriously need to sort out their customer service.

items.title: Late and rude
items.review_text: I use the trains most days of the week and you would think this would make my journeys stress free. The trains are late and not always for a reason thats out of their control, the expence of the tickets is a joke especally for the younger generation i have 2 jobs and go to uni i can barely afford just getting there. If GWR are messing their customers around like this then no wonder hardly anyone uses them and they will have to raise the prices this makes it unfair on customers that have no other option .I am gob smacked with how most of the staff treat people on the trains- I was 15 years old travelling by train alone becuse I couldn't buy at ticket at my local station as there was not a ticket machine or ticket officer they took £90 nearly all of my savings at the time. The train strikes are so pathetic it's the NHS we need to be worrying about and the millions of people that are being fu*** by the system, train drivers are fine being paid well above average. My blood is boiling

items.title: Let me praise GWR just for once
items.review_text: Let me praise GWR just for once.  Train from Paddington cancelled due to flood on line. Submitted refund request and two working days later have received email saying it's on way to my bank account.  Thank you.

items.title: Avoid avoid avoid
items.review_text: I had to cancel my journey for bad weather conditions and they charge a ludicrous amount of cancellation fees and I am still waiting for a refund.

items.title: Using WhatsApp customer service for enquiry
items.review_text: I used the WhatsApp service to enquire about delays or disruptions. Got an answer back within minutes. Quick and efficient. Thank you!

items.title: Delay repay is a disgrace
items.review_text: I travel regularly on GWR trains and appreciate that certain things are out of their control. However when a train is delayed more than 15 mins we as customers are entitled to claims m delay repay. Every announcement advertises that fact. The procedure to claim is deliberately designed to make it nearly impossible for the everyday consumer to apply. It’s long winded, confusing and misleading. In my experience it has also asked me to sign in again taking me back to the beginning of the process hoping no doubt that I would give up. This should be looked at by a higher authority to stop all train companies paying back compensation that their customers are entitled to.

items.title: One star is too many
items.review_text:
One star is too many. 
I often travel with GWR, not because I choose too, but because I have no other way of getting back and forth from my Central London university. 

Countless times have I been scammed, had to pay an extra fee to change my train to an hour later, after the extortionate fee I’ve already paid to sit on the stinky disgusting trains. This is just an example of how they’ve robbed my bank account. How do they get away with it? 

The trains are almost always delayed or cancelled. 

A few weeks ago, I had accidentally bought a ticket for the wrong time - my fault completely, however was totally an innocent mistake.  As I said, I attend university, hence not being famous for having extra cash to spare. The man told me I can either pay £80 for an ‘any time single day ticket’ or get prosecuted. I continued to pay which left me pocketless, I planned to spend the £80 on food and travel for the week. I had already paid £22 for the single ticket so that single, 50 minute journey cost me £102. I later did some research, a single any time day ticket is £55. Bloody scammers. GWR only get customers because it’s literally the only option we have. 

Needs to be changed, why am I paying so much money? What does the customers money go towards? It’s certainly not improving train quality, train punctuality or efficiency.

I would rather die than travel with GWR. They’re lucky most of us have no choice. I despise these trains and get angry sat on them. F’ing scammers.

items.title: Awful service no attempt to run on time
items.review_text: I have used this company approx 10 times in the last month (no choice) and they’ve never kept to time once. Absolutely embarrassing and annoying when you organise taxi’s for the time they are supposed to arrive. How they are allowed to have such an awful performance record is astounding.

items.title: Unreliable service
items.review_text:
Unfortunately I have use the GWR frequently as we live near Chippenham.  I do not understand why the company is allowed to run such an unreliable service. It has actually
deteriorated in the last twelve months; the last six trains that I have boarded have all been late. Frankly I am weary of listening to recorded apologies for a service which must be causing Brunel to spin in his grave.

items.title: Three over heated journeys in a row
items.review_text: Three over heated  long distance train journeys from GWR in a row. No excuse for it as outside temp was no more than 15c at any point . Will be driving next time

items.title: GWR abysmal service from management but train staff fabulous .
items.review_text: Gwr gets worse year by year. Or at least its management and train controllers do. I appreciate some things are outside their control but when delays are encountered now they seem to take planned  stations stops off at a whim and then they change it again and then today a third time in one journey . For the customers who don’t really know where they are and have to re arrange transport and lifts a numbers of times in a row it’s a nightmare . I have travelled up to london from Cornwall a few times recently and every single time they have been delayed significantly.  Today I’m on a train that has been delayed and stops taken off and people told to get off at Exeter. So we stayed on and then they decided to take even more stops off. Upon the second round of planned station stop removals we were advised to get off at Plymouth and catch the 18.21 instead, with no concern  shown it isn’t really the 18.21 because that in turn is delayed but they don’t mention that. Then something that is 100% in GWR’s control . The unreliable catering. It is so hit and miss and on last three legs the trolley wasn’t there or ‘they couldn’t get to all the coaches’. To travel four to five hours with no catering is abysmal and this happens to me on at least half my journeys all the time.  I feel for the poor staff who have to deal with grumpy customers , it can’t be easy for them and probably accounts for many shift absences. It was so easy when they had buffet cars. Other companies have new trains and manage it. Anglia have buffet cards AND trollies. I love travelling by train and have lived in many areas of the country but Gwr seem to have a knack of making travel miserable and frustrating.  They need to take a hard look at themselves and start putting their customers first and provide a better service than they seem able to. It’s getting worse every year. However as always the train staff are fabulous , the catering staff, ticket inspectors , train managers , they are all just brilliant but I feel for them where management, bean counters and train controllers, all of whom,  don’t have to face customers make all these decisions from behind the safety of a desk . Thank you to all the train staff doing such a fabulous job but as for Gwr train designers and buyers , senior managers and the train controllers it so often feels like a complete shambles .

items.title: Over crowded and / or delayed and / or cancelled.
items.review_text: Journeys always over crowded. Just book a seat ahead you say? Given 80% if the time the trains are either delayed or cancelled, this doesn't really work. Best bit is it seems the mainline from London towards Bristol / Cardiff suffers from flooding with just the slightest hint of rain. Good thing that never happens in the west of England... Brunel will be rolling in his grave over how shoddy this line is run.

items.title: Invariably an excellent service
items.review_text: We live in the GWR area (Reading) and often use their trains, both the fast units and the slower units.We invariably have a very good experience - the rolling stock is modern, comfortable and always clean. Sometimes, the trains are delayed or cancelled but this is usually because of national strikes or because of circumstances beyond the control of the company (e.g trespassers on the line, signalling failures) . For a truly awful train service, travel on  Cross Country Trains!

items.title: The king of awful transportation services
items.review_text: GWR are truly the most awful transport company I've ever used, and it's enfuriating that I'm forced to use them. The last 6 months the only guarantee I've had is that the service I book will either be delayed or cancelled. You have commuter trains to London at peak hours with half the number of carriages and everyone is packed in like sardines, and you have the gall to continue to charge prices through the roof for tickets during a recession despite offering such slipshod services... You truly are the king of all that is wrong with the British transport industry.

items.title: Another day, another batch of cancellations
items.review_text: Another day, more cancellations. This isn’t a real train company it’s more like trying to hitch a ride but you have to pay for it. This evenings service out of Paddington is appalling. Just seen my last train has been cancelled. Every week just sees more delays and cancellations. Bring the railways back under Govt control and stop the race to the bottom tendering exercise….

items.title: At least Dick Turpin wore a mask when he robbed you.
items.review_text: Yet again, this shambles of a transport company has let me down. Train cancelled due to signal failure, following two weeks of work to upgrade the signals between Exeter and Camborne. Trains regularly late, tortuous and convoluted refund process, complaints page won't accept complaints. Obfuscation at every turn with no accountability. Come back British Rail.

items.title: Very comfortable seats!
items.review_text: I admittedly have very limited experience travelling on GWR but I am giving five stars because, unlike all other trains ever, the seat on my train was sooo comfortable with great lumbar support! Just the job for someone with a bad back. I will be getting the train more often now. My train left on time too.

items.title: Last Saturday was nothing short of a…
items.review_text:
Last Saturday was nothing short of a mess in London apart from again the GWR Padington to Stroud line service.
Staff / trains / communication faultless.  
Fact !!
Well done.

items.title: I travel on the trains a lot but this…
items.review_text: I travel on the trains a lot but this is about todays experience. 78 year old mother who suffers from extreme anxiety and despite having travel assistance booked between Seaford and Penzance today, was clearly panicking when I dropped her off at Seaford. Due to a tight turnaround between Fratton and Salisbury she missed her connection, and pre booked seat to Exeter and had to wait for the next train. The next train was packed and she is vulnerable. GWR kindly escorted her to a first class seat at no extra cost. Despite the criticism of the railway companies this is kindness which deserves recognition. My thanks to GWR and all the staff involved. I would give them 10 out of 5 stars if I could

items.title: The Government say use local transport…
items.review_text: The Government say use local transport its reliable.. what a joke!! My dad is coming back from Manchester the train stops in Shrewsbury everyone has to get off!! this is 2hours away from his actual stop. Now they've decided to put on a bus at 10.49pm. from Shrewsbury to newport!!! 😲🙈😱

items.title: My complaint is about train step…
items.review_text: My complaint is about train step heights. The new trains are higher and therefore stepping up onto the train is very difficult for people like me who have knee problems.  I also have problems with balance so getting off the train is even worse and very painful for my knees. As I don't drive I used the train a lot. Short and long journeys. (Including First Class).  I am no longer able to use GWR trains. If I have to (to visit my daughter in London) I absolutely dread it. I am glad my children are grown up because getting a child, pushchair and suitcase on board and off again would be a nightmare! I imagine GWR have lost many passenger's fares due to this! GWR ought to build a hump like the station in Wales (Ibelieve it's called the Harrington Hump) in every station affected. They make enough money in expensive train fares!

items.title: Sh*# service
items.review_text:
Off-Peak and peak train times move around everyday. 
Info Boards aren’t reliable (today, for instance, didn’t say service wasn’t valid for off-peak, but they were turning off-peak ticket holders away at the barrier?). Useless. 
Peak tickets cost 50 quid - so much for net zero! It’s cheaper and more straightforward to drive. 
As it is, we had to wait over an hour and a half at Paddington station… until seven twenty five, for next off-peak service. Apparently three mins to seven is still “peak”. Absolute joke. 
Was late to evening appointment because of pointless rules, ridiculous ticket cost and infrequent trains - thanks Great Western Railway!

items.title: DELAY REPAY REFUND...
items.review_text:
Train stayed on departure platform for over an hour.Was told we could get a refund for our tickets through delay/repay.Went online a few days later to claim refund,what a palaver! Uploading proof of tickets and asking all sorts of questions,only to be told my claim had to be sent to complaints department.
6 WEEKS later I have just got a reply saying they are just letting me know that they are still looking into my claim and they haven't forgot about me! Absolutely disgusting.
11th January and still waiting for my refund.

items.title: Truly inspirational staff on the train
items.review_text: I was on the 3:39 train to Milton Keynes central- on the 8th of March. Of which the gentlemen who was announcing on the train what our next stations stop was- was truly inspirational, he was positive and immediately put a smile on my face, wishing those a happy weekend the list of kindness goes on. Likewise the gentlemen who was coming through the carriages checking tickets and oysters cards- was wonderful, a ray of sunshine and extremely polite. I travel on trains all the time and- These are the people we need more of in this world! Keep doing what you’re doing gents. Made my day. I hope you can find these people and give them the recognition they deserve.

items.title: Horrendous staff
items.review_text: Horrendous staff. Had a pleasant journey back through the capital on the tube to come up the stairs at Paddington to find every board showing delayed or cancelled. No staff to help with anything. Got on a train back to Oxford via a change like canned sardines. Got out at Oxford to find my return ticket had expired. Had to face up with horrendous staff who clearly lack customer service. They could see my ticket and had zero compassion to a genuine mistake. Slapped me with £66 for a new return ticket with zero compassion. Such a shame to see an institution like GWR being ran by money grabbers. The train used to be such a pleasant experience, clearly this has changed for the worst and I will need to use other transport methods in the future…

items.title: Furious!!
items.review_text: My son was on his way back from a party in london when a lady who claimed to be the manager of the great western train line told him he was causing a disturbance on the train which he needed to get back to reading. However this altercation was not caused by him but by another man a lot older who stayed on the train. My son stayed very calm and didn’t come across violent or aggressive to this lady, however she then decided to call the police. Minutes later my son was banned from the great western train line. The police escorted him to a different train line which would take him nearly triple the time to get home (2 hours) when his original train would have only been 20 minutes. I am furious of the way the manager has treated my son and if i could give the railway zero stars i would. No minor should have to be waiting this long and be told to take a different train at his age and so late at night over a situation provoked by another person. Furious.

items.title: The difficulty with GWR is the staff a…
items.review_text: The difficulty with GWR is the staff a lot of the time. Read the many reviews. Delays are never good as are other issues that occur. However with the right approach from staff the a difficult situation can be mitigated. Again read the reviews. Today my wife with disability and I had a terrible return journey. Some staff contact upon review was terrible, whatever the process helping the customer should be a great priority. We do recall in all of this great service on the Bristol to Penzance 2.55 from Bristol today. That service came from the guard/ticket inspector. He made a point of returning to us when train arrived in Weston super mare to see if he could assist my wife having noted her disability earlier. With more actions like this GWR could improve overnight. Sadly I can only conclude that management are to weak to travel on the service themselves and take up issues when they come across them. Asking passengers to fill in a complaint form is really quite poor. My experience today was not good. We have been using the trains more frequently of late & I can understand why customer satisfaction is at a low level. I have been responsible for customer service of millions of customers and if the culture is not right poor outcomes are unavoidable. There is confusion in GWR as to who is the customer. The customer is the passenger and not the regulator looking at targets.

items.title: Worst railway network in the UK
items.review_text: Worst railway network in the UK! Extortionate prices for a very poor service. Constant cancellations and delays. I’ve been told to stand in the toilet before, rather than sit in first class as it’s “unfair to the people who paid for it” - did I not pay for my seat too?? Clearly GWR only cares about taking people’s money and not good service. I once got a GWR train to Devon and had to stand the whole 5 hours with no compensation or refund. AVOID IF YOU CAN!

items.title: You are forcing customers to take…
items.review_text:
You are forcing customers to take coaches!
So expensive. I can’t travel using this service anymore, please reduce your prices, no where on this planet are trains this expensive. 
I can literally get a return flight to Europe at the same price!

items.title: Abysmal service
items.review_text: Abysmal service. No reason why this operator should be allowed to operate with their track record. With prices we pay the level of service disgraceful, constant delays and packed trains and that's if your train isn't canceled! I have always tried to minimize my co2 footprint and commute instead of taking the car but it's clearly no longer viable.

items.title: Great staff, expensive snacks
items.review_text: Every single staff member I’ve met with GWR has been amazing, friendly and fantastic! Only downside to the company is the high price of food and drinks on board the trains, buts it’s generally just as expensive as any other rail company.

items.title: My name is Grace Leslie and every-time I…
items.review_text: My name is Grace Leslie and everytime I get the train to college there are not enough carriages! I cannot count the amount of times I have had to stand up for an HOUR AND A HALF journey the whole time! This is not only unsafe but it is also unacceptable please send more carriages this is the Barnstaple to Exeter Central train DO BETTER

items.title: Clean modern train and helpful staff.
items.review_text: Clean modern train and very helpful staff.  I don't take the train very often but after this trip I will try to use it more often.  On a recent trip from Carmarthen to London Paddington the train was actually 30 mins late, but this was through no fault of GWR and notwithstanding this was much less stressful than driving to London.

items.title: Thieving fastards
items.review_text: Too expensive, even when the tickets are cheap they’re expensive, daylight robbery.

items.title: Getting a refund is like getting blood from a stone.
items.review_text: I booked tickets to travel yesterday from Cardiff to Chichester using the Trainsplit website. I used a GWR train which was cancelled at Bristol. There was no alternative train which would get us there in time for the event we were attending so we spent some hours in Bristol before returning home. Today I have been on the GWR website for a refund. It clearly says I have to apply to the company which sold the tickets. The Trainsplit website says I have to apply to the service provider = GWR. This is a total muddle and I have wasted  hours on it so far. AAggghhhhh!

items.title: As per all British railway services…
items.review_text: As per all British railway services utterly useless. A train with supposedly 10 carriages rocks up 20 minutes late with 5 instead. It's a reoccurring theme I've been using the railway services in the UK for 8 months and it's utterly hopeless. GWR and the rest of the shamble companies need to be held accountable and fined

items.title: Usually very good
items.review_text: Lovely staff on the train, polite and helpful...however been left with a very distressed child after the door was closed very quickly giving us barely any time to get off.... Leaving my daughter stuck on the train terrified unable to open the door, and the train about to move. Luckily managed to get her off the train somehow before ending up miles away! Can't imagine how somebody with a pushchair or crutches, walking difficulties would be able to get off in time?

items.title: caused huge inconvenience to my…
items.review_text: caused huge inconvenience to my journey. They made us miss our stop as they did not call out the correct stops which made a 2 hour detour to our journey and cancelling trains last minute. i had an unpleasant experience don't recommend

items.title: Customer service takes more than 4 weeks to reply
items.review_text:
The customer service clearly needs help. They said they take up to 4 weeks to reply to emails, in my case it’s almost 2 months and haven’t received a resolution yet. My train got delayed in December and my account got locked for no reason. Their replies on WhatsApp are quicker, but they just apologise for the delay without being capable of working on your case. At some point, they even stopped replying.
Also - the overall experience on board is overpriced/rated. Train ticket price is sky rocketing and the disruptions are frequent.

items.title: Brilliant service
items.review_text: I used GWR trains on 2 numerous occasions and found them  to be very good and on time and without any delays  so I'll guarantee I'll definitely use them again once again thank you GWR! 🙂

items.title: Standing for 2 hours… update
items.review_text:
I purchased a ticket from Salisbury to Cardiff leaving Saturday lunchtime. Instead of 4 carriages only two turned up which were already full to capacity. I got on and at the next stop yet more people got on. This continues for the whole journey with absolutely no control at all from staff. People were stood in the toilets! 2 hours standing. On complaint I’m told you didn’t have a seat reserved directly through us so no compensation will be awarded. Who would voluntarily pay to stand for 2 hours?!? Awful service, worse customer service. 


So update to this review. Clearly GWR work on the principle that providing they ‘look’ as though they are interested in their customers experiences on line then readers will look at them more sympathetically? No. I messaged as you requested over a week ago and absolutely no response. So either GWR are inundated with complaints or this is BS for the purposes of Trust Pilot. I would welcome the conversation with you GWR.

items.title: Paying full price but NO SEATS
items.review_text: Not only was the train late to Bath but we had to stand shoulder to shoulder on the train ride from Bath to London. I was not able to reserve seats due to buying the ticket the day before travelling and the system would not allow me to reserve. Totally disgusted at having to pay full price for the two of us travelling to London. Shameful GWR charging full price for inadequate service!!!!

items.title: Worst train company ever
items.review_text: Staff at Paddington Station are very rude especially assistance staff when getting on the train as disabled had a go at me for sitting in a free seat even though it wasn't reserved. Train guards allow customers with standard tickets sit in first class which is fraud that is a crime as its not fair on the passengers whonpay the extra for that luxury. I challenged a guard who let this happen and he was so rude and had a disgusting attitude you can't treat people like this. Its their job to move them or make them upgrade. Passenger assistance booked well in advance often doesn't turn up. When trains are cancelled they give no alternative way of getting there. Staff at ticket office run by them give no help either. In first class they don't offer free meals or alcohol like on avanti or lber you have to pay for it an utter con. Staff at Paddington first class lounge have a go at you for eating the fruits thsts on offer that's the whole point. There's nothing first class about their services. Promised me a refund then changed their mind and wouldn't give it utter disgrace.

items.title: I tried to use their app to get two…
items.review_text:
I tried to use their app to get two tickets from reading to London travel card zone 1
The message was no tickets available?
It is a standard journey why can't there app cope? The most expensive and unreliable in Europe!

items.title: Rachel on the St Erth to St Ives train
items.review_text: We took a train from St Erth to St Ives today (10th March) and my daughter was very anxious. The conductor on the train, Rachel, could not have been more lovely. She didn’t need to stop and talk to my daughter but she did and she was so kind and reassuring to her and it really helped. She explained what all the noises were and why the horn would be blown and how safe everything was and went above and beyond what she needed to do. She made my life a lot easier too-little treat on Mother’s Day! Please pass on my thanks and please know she’s doing an exceptional job 😊

items.title: Won't bother to tell you a train you've booked has been cancelled.
items.review_text: Won't bother to tell you a train is cancelled, their website will still say the train is running but when you get to the station you'll find it is actually cancelled. They'll gladly keep your money though, which seems less like a transaction and more like theft. Shamelful. They won't bother to provide any alternatives for getting to your intended destination. Depressing that you can't reliable travel the UK by train, I had to rely on a family member's car to help me get home after visiting for Christmas. How is this a functioning business?

items.title: If only I could use another company
items.review_text: It is not a surprise that my review will be negative. I live in Bath and I am stuck with them—so much for liberalization when your only option is one company—the ridiculous prices at peak times—the opposite of what public transport should be with the climate emergency—and then we go to their cancellations and delays, like today stuck on Bristol with no real explanation. If I could, I would never use them, and I can’t wait to see the day when all these frauds and private scammers return to the public domain and hopefully run better.

items.title: My daughter age 15 was threatened and…
items.review_text:
My daughter age 15 was threatened and intimated by a ticket inspector on the Redhill to reading route. The inspector accused her of lying about her age and forcibly took her phone from her to try and prove she was over 16 and needed to pay an adult fare 

He then proceeded to issue a penalty fare dispite her offing to pay the fare and showing she had the means to pay the fare 

Gwr have not taken my complaint seriously and refuse to accept any responsibility for faulty ticket machines or their staff behaviour and instead send me threatening letters 

I’d rather walk than ever get a gwr train

items.title: Gross incompetence!
items.review_text: Gross incompetence. This company needs new management because whoever runs it currently clearly cannot do their job. My train into London from Moreton-in-Marsh has been on time ONCE in three months, this causes stress and has a knock on effect for my working day. It’s like GWR has given up, and with a monopoly on service from Gloucestershire why would they bother? Constantly increasing ticket prices, delays, cancellations and strikes to top it off. The UK rail industry needs a massive shakeup and GWR should be ashamed of the ABYSMAL service they provide. Even their Wi-Fi doesn’t work properly!

items.title: Poor punctuality, frequently shortened trains, invalidating seat bookings
items.review_text:
Punctuality has plummeted in the last 6 months or so, meaning I use delay repay almost as often as their poor train service. Today I received an email from a delay repay I put in 8 weeks ago (when the online tool wasn't working) asking for my title and phone number to progress the claim. 8 weeks and zero action.

GWRs latest, regular trick is to cancel half the train (their long distance service is 2 trains attached together. They frequently pull one of them) leaving a half-sized, overcrowded train where uour seat bookings are for a non-existent carriage.

And the strike service is woeful. I've had a 1.46 (normally) service (for which they happily sold me a ticket) take well over 3 hours/3 different trains (one of them dangerously overcrowded). Their answer-delay your journey or accept the service (with no delay repay-apparently I wasn't delayed because they chose to double the duration of the journey).

A great service, once, which has been consistently run down.

items.title: The Reading-Newbury line is routinely…
items.review_text: The Reading-Newbury line is routinely shut and a replacement bus service employed, which will be the case for this weekend 24/2/24. What was the point of the work to upgrade it if it never runs. most of the local services in week are now hourly out of peak times unless you're going to a major station. It is no surprise the A4 is like a car park at times..... Just a big joke that isn't funny. PS I know network rail do the work but what is GWR doing about it and the service when it does run

items.title: This is the worst company I have ever spoken to. Ever.
items.review_text: Impossible to get a timely reply, and then they act with callousness and a lack of care towards customers when they eventually do reply. They don't hold themselves accountable, they act with impunity. Richard (Roland) should be ashamed of himself, bet he gets his bonus and drives his luxury car thinking he's amazing when hes just a huge failure leading this companys customer care into the ground. Resign Richard, resign.

items.title: Failure to operate a functioning train service
items.review_text: The staff are the only redeeming aspect of GWR. Every other train I have taken from Bristol to London for the past three months has been delayed sufficiently for delay repay. Would love to know what GWR is doing to improve services with the amount that tickets cost. The staff - at stations and catering - go out of their way to be friendly and polite. But the train delays are always due to an excuse about breakdowns at the depot, broken signal points, missing train drivers, less carriages than expected. Take accountability GWR for your failure to provide an adequate service.

items.title: Beyond incompetent
items.review_text: Beyond incompetent. Trains are late more often than they are not. When you look up departures before driving to the station, they never show as late, but always are. They're overpriced...whoever decides to have a five carriage train on a busy route, with two of those being first class and largely empty, needs to be shot for crimes against humanity. So having to pay a lot of money to stand up, is appalling. You really should be ashamed of yourselves but you're too busy counting cash to care about customers. Honestly. Your entire management team need sacking.

items.title: The journey from hell
items.review_text: A regular trip to Carmarthen from Barnham often results in some hold up. However they outdone themselves on my latest journey going home to Barnham. A journey that is estimated to take 6 hours and 9 minutes took 8 hours and 50 minutes. I tried to get some kind of refund on line but this wasn't available as I bought my ticket in Carmarthen. Truly a service for the 21st century! Definitely an argument for renationalsation.

items.title: If the train isn't canceled it's late
items.review_text:
If the train isn't canceled it's late, so what's the point?
The reason it was cancelled today was rain, you'd think that in England we're pretty used to rain by now.
No replacement services, so two hours total driving in and back to the station was wasted. Would have been nice to tell me earlier.

items.title: Speedy
items.review_text: Polite, efficient, prompt (accessed via X).

items.title: It’s crazy how crap is this company
items.review_text: It’s crazy how crap is this company, I’m gonna end up loosing my job because of them . THEY ARE NEVER ON TIME !!!!  NEVER !!! I’m sure even you go to third world countries you will find a better railway companies. 110£ weekly from Paddington to Windsor including underground is just rubbish with the service they provide . Cancellations are like normal for them everyday my train get cancelled .seats very uncomfortable .Guys I would recommend you to not waste your money !!! Find another alternative!!

items.title: Absolute joke of a company
items.review_text:
What an absolute shower of s***. Return direct train to paddington. Total joke going to paddington-
Not direct, had to make 1 change. First train 40 min late and over crowded, standing room only. 2nd train even later and more overcrowded, again standing room only.
Return trip, train showed as delayed 5 mins before departure time, no further information given (other than the app changing the departure time every minute). Then all of a sudden 20 min after original departure time, it flashes up on the board the train is ready to depart, which resulted in the traditional UK stamped. Absolute joke

items.title: 2 trains cancelled to weston super mare…
items.review_text: 2 trains cancelled to weston super mare from Bristol this evening been travelling all day on the train with my friend to Woking and on the return journey didn't get home till 11.30 was supposed to get into weston at 21.44 takes the mick really both of us are disabled travellers with rail card staff at Bristol were very unhelpful would like formal complaint about this and want full compensation on both tickets for the inconvenience

items.title: Thank-you
items.review_text: My wife was due to travel from Barnstaple to Bridgwater for a dental appointment, checked the live travel and it said it was cancelled so went to the station anyway.  The train was running got to Exeter and the next train to Bridgwater was cancelled so she would miss her appointment, but managed to get it moved to 12am. But if it had not been for the member of staff on the turnstile who helped my wife with her tickets so making a very difficult day much easier, (who likes going to the dentist any day of the week!!) Thank-you.

items.title: AVOID! If anything happens you’re on your own!
items.review_text: Was stranded on the way home after a birthday trip. GRW told us to sleep in the station with my dog because they didn’t have money to get us a taxi or any alternative transport. Hours later I finally got them to agree on writing to reimbursing my £200 taxi fare I was forced to take as I didn’t have my medication. I made a claim. They said they’d get back to me within 4 weeks. It has been well over that and I cannot get a reply. I am still down £200 +train fare in a cost of living crisis. irresponsible company that doesn’t have the common courtesy to pretend to care about their customers. AVOID if anything happens you’re on your own

items.title: Most expensive and least reliable train company in Europe
items.review_text:
I've tracked my journeys with GWR over the last 2 years that I've been using them. They've been significantly late 60%+ of the time.

Always overcrowded, stood in the middle carriages by the toilet as there are never enough seats. 

Stressed and condescending staff.

Currently on a train delayed by 20 minutes +, stood still on the tracks with no communication from the driver as to why we're not moving.

The most fortunate thing that could happen to South West UK would be GWR going into administration.

items.title: GWR only cares about First Class…
items.review_text:
GWR only cares about First Class Passengers. Was on the 08:51 from Paddington to Penzance. Only saw the Buffet Trolley Once after Two Hours & with No Coffee or Tea Available. It was Restocked at Plymouth but Due to Staff Shortage it couldn’t come to Second Class Passengers. Absolute Joke of a Company!

Rail Staff Travel Booking Ref FBRXWR29

items.title: Possibly the biggest false advertising…
items.review_text:
Possibly the biggest false advertising ever,…..
What’s actually “Great” about Great Western? 
“Below Average’’ would be a far more accurate name.
Late running Sunday service, as usual…..
So finally decided to bother to try and claim compensation, wow, possibly the most impossibly difficult task ever - certainly deliberate….
Come on railway ombudsman, get this sorted. What an absolute disgrace. It should never be as difficult as this.
Only good part of the journey was the staff, whom GWR management certainly don’t deserve. They managed a lot of underwhelmed clients very admirably.
Doubt this feedback will get passed onto the staff which is a shame but there you go.

items.title: Just shocking yet again
items.review_text: Just shocking yet again. Several Sunday services on the Swindon - Cheltenham line cancelled. Service from London - Swindon so full people not even able to get on (first class almost empty !). This on the back of constant cancellations and delays on weekdays - points, broken fails , flooding. This is not a cheap service but it is a terrible service.

items.title: London to Pezance
items.review_text: I can’t believe these Hitachis were ever bought with these short journey seats. They are a total nightmare to sit on. Rigid, ugly, bland and extremely uncomfortable. Furthermore the use of white light leds even on overnight journeys makes the experience even worse. Terrible train design that is a blight on the British rail industry. Bring back comfortable seats

items.title: I bought a ticket to Gatwick Airport…
items.review_text: I bought a ticket to Gatwick Airport and return, by mistake I added only one person, I tried immediately to cancel it and the system didn’t allow me and I had to make two separate claims. I booked a new whole ticket for two people for the same days and hours, however I have been charged admin fee of £20 for the ticket I mistakenly bought. My ticket was not advance, I paid the full price of the ticket and I still got charged, because in their policy says so. I explained to GWR if I was on the counter you would have refunded me the money in full but I haven’t been heard. I have been told that the tickets were single and it is in the terms on the web site, I challenged it by telling them when I booked the ticket through the app I can’t go and check the web page. Personally I will never use the app again and I will start going back to the counter as I can’t trust this company and their app anymore. I raised a formal complain hoping they will look my case with reasoning.

items.title: Never enough room
items.review_text: Never enough room, putting just two carriages on in peak times has to be the stupidest thing a train company can do, it's a health and safety risk, people are also paying way to much to not have seats, great western railway do better!

items.title: Pretty good service
items.review_text: This is based on three journeys on the main line in Devon and Cornwall.  The trains were on time.  The carriages were very clean and the toilets were fairly clean.  There was ac power and intermittent Wi-Fi.  Staff were friendly.  Refreshments were only available on one of the trains.  Excellent on-board announcements.  Booking online and using the app for tickets works well.  When I had to cancel a booking the refund was instant.

items.title: Disingenuous GWR refund policy
items.review_text: Trying to claim a refund for a day travel card when all trains were cancelled. The refund was refused because the ticket was not cut in half on the claim image. This requirement is not stated on the claim and besides the date has been and gone so its a ridiculous and irrelevant demand. Seems like a deliberate and disingenuous policy.

items.title: Dreadful!
items.review_text: Dreadful!! Delayed on my mums 80th birthday celebration by 1.5 hrs so late for lunch in London which will now just be quick afternoon tea !!  No wonder no one uses public transport! Ruined a whole day out to London !!

items.title: Absolutely atrocious service just like…
items.review_text: Absolutely atrocious service just like every other wretched trainline in this abysmal country. I am currently standing on a train to London from Bath, which for whatever absurd reason only has two standard carriages and two first class carriages during peak Saturday morning time. We are currently dangerously cramped with 90 percent standing. Trains are always late and massively overpriced for this shocking system. All of higher management, CEOs etc deserved to be sacked and banned for life from working in the public transport sector.

items.title: Too short train for a three-and-a-half…
items.review_text: Too short train for a three-and-a-half hour journey , two weeks in a row ,1F23 on the 9th (158768) and 16th (158760) of December . I was only onboard Newport to Bristol Temple Meads and all seats were taken , people were standing everywhere , if you needed the toilet , you had no chance . If you wanted to get on/off at Pilning (this train at the time of my journeys /review ) provides one of two trains a week at this station .

items.title: Better off walking
items.review_text: Used to be great. Now absolutely useless, cancelled trains, delayed trains, dirty trains, trains full so you can't use the toilet. Oh and have to pay £305 for a return ticket from Bridgwater to London, it's an absolute discrage. The sooner the rail companies are renationalised the better.

items.title: Minus 10 if I could
items.review_text: Minus 10 if I could. Disgusting, over priced and run by a bunch of jobs worths that pass the buck, don't talk to each other and no one is interested in helping their customers. They don't give a rats! Unless you want to give them more money than their already exorbitant fares. £90 ticket and want another £70 to get an earlier train. SWT cheaper, £50, easier and helpful staff. NEVER AGAIN will I travel with GWR! Worse than awful. The absolute pits!

items.title: They need to shut down ASAP
items.review_text:
They need to shut down ASAP, still waiting for my refund.  over 1 hour late, nearly missed the last train because of them. awful people, awful company, awful customer service. despicable. shamble. trash. 

I am currently looking to take legal action against them and start a public lawsuit in order to get my money back, including the emotional distress caused .

What a circus!

items.title: The girl really helped me resolve my…
items.review_text: The girl really helped me resolve my problem.

items.title: I’d rather not give any stars but I…
items.review_text: I’d rather not give any stars but I don’t think that is an option. It’s no surprise to me that the reviews on here are dreadful, because the service is exactly that. Ticket conductor has a huge superiority complex. Platform wasn’t announced until two mins before departure which isn’t ideal with a baby and a pram. No seat reservations now and I jumped on the train in a panic that it was going to leave and now I’m not even allowed to stand next to the first class toilet. Not safe to stand apparently - they didn’t mind me standing for two hours when I was 6 months pregnant. It actually puts me off wanting to ever travel by train again. Insane prices and then you’re greeted with a bunch of inconsiderate egos.

items.title: Another week
items.review_text: Another week, another clown show from Great Western.  Last week, despite knowing all day that two trains were cancelled on Sunday evening they laid on a five carriage train for the north Cotswolds line which meant I and I presume a couple of hundred people had the delight of standing for ninety minutes.  This week, with a regular service all evening, they decide to have an eight carriage train.  And after a grand total of two stops we have a fifteen minute delay because a train coming the other way is using the “single track” (in 2023, really?) and we have to wait for it.  Incompetence doesn’t even begin to describe it.

items.title: Massive delays between London, Swindon, Cheltenham
items.review_text: I do not remember a time when I bought a ticket and there were no delays. One of the most expensive railway services in Europe and the most unreliable. Last time, I ended up catching National Express bus back to get home from London as well due to cancelled train services. What was it there about tackling global warming by using cars less? It is not possible with railway service/ absence of it.

items.title: Trains cancelled frequently
items.review_text: Trains cancelled frequently, overcrowded and so expensive. I honestly hope this company goes bust soon. Compensation is a joke, cancelled train, got £1.30 back... As soon as there is something else I'll stop using this Circus to go to work.

items.title: Nothing great about it.
items.review_text:
Told I would be removed from the train today because I refused to leave First Class while Second Class was standing room only. Of course, I'm well within my rights to remain seated, so I did. Fortunately for both me and the conductor (Revenue Protection Officer) a seat became available before they had to "have me removed".

Every week GWR either doesn't have enough carriages or had a cancelled train on an earlier service or some other BS excuse why they've cancelled all reservations. 

If reservations are to be cancelled, cancel class too. Better yet, cancel yourselves - there's nothing "Great" about you.

Date of Travel: 30/11/23 - Paddington to Taunton - 16:28 Train. Incident before Reading.

items.title: Cancelled at the last minute train left…
items.review_text: Cancelled at the last minute train left several families with small children stranded on the platform at remote Calstock station for 3 hours at dusk. Absolutely no assistance, alternative transport or compensation offered. 4.30pm on mothering Sunday, no station facilities, no alternative transport available. Very disappointing!

items.title: Remove the Great
items.review_text: Quote simply they need to remove the word Great from GWR and replace it with Abysmal. No information no thought for customers. They should just cancel all Sunday services as the timetable could have been written by JK Rowling. Total fiction.

items.title: First class service and a slick booking system
items.review_text: Booked 2 tickets to Gloucester through the GWR portal, very easy and allows tickets to go into Google wallet which I always prefer. But the supplier I was visiting cancelled the meeting so I went online and cancelled my tickets which it did 100% and confirmed in 5 minutes. Great service and the portal is great too!

items.title: Congratulations for maintaining your…
items.review_text:
Congratulations for maintaining your 100% failure to run trains on time or at all. Every month for the last six months I have had a day return ticket to Bath.  In August there was a strike and I had to drive instead and every other month not one train has either not been cancelled or delayed for a considerable time. Yet again I am on Swindon Station waiting for the 12.22 which is delayed, at the moment for 15 minutes at least!  Weather has not been bad on any day I have been travelling. The service is absolutely appalling!
Now back on Bath Spa station waiting for 17.13 which has been cancelled.  You have managed to ruin every trip to the theatre I have made as I never know if I am goi g to get there in time for a performance or home at all afterwards!

items.title: INADEQUATE CATERING
items.review_text: Not having a buffet car in the new Class 800 trains is a disaster!  The current ‘airline trolley’ system is not fit for purpose. A passenger can wait 2-3 hours for the thing to arrive and then find little choice. First trip - no sandwiches left. Return trip - no water left. GWR MUST do something about this soon.

items.title: Grateful
items.review_text:
Grateful
Thank you to Zulamar who works at the Torquay station. I'm living overseas and didn't know how to get a value for money ticket to Norwich. He was extremely helpful and because of him I got a great deal.

My journey was from Newton Abbott to Norwich on 05.01.2024. Scheduled departure time was 11:54 (it was an hour late in arriving at Paddington) to Norwich on a split ticket

items.title: I would give minus stars if possible
items.review_text: I would give minus stars if possible, delays, cancellations, signalling issues are all the norm for this terrible business who lets its fair paying public down on a daily basis. The only things GWR are reliable with is charging excessive fares and raising prices every January and providing standing room only - for what?

items.title: The worst experience never ever getting…
items.review_text: The worst experience never ever getting a train again.

items.title: Appalling service this weekend to Frome…
items.review_text: Appalling service this weekend to Frome and back to London. If you just paid your staff what they deserve there would be no strikes and therefore your customers would not be treated to such a poor service. Profit over people only benefits your investors.

items.title: Great Western Railway charge over £100…
items.review_text:
Great Western Railway charge over £100 return from Swindon to London and the trains are always delayed and are always overpacked.

On the 23.11.23 I was commuting back from London on the 19.02 train to Bristol Temple Meads. The train was so packed that the Tranline team announced it was unsafe to travel despite the train still continuing its journey. We were squashed together in the carriages and it was incredibly unsafe.

I am appalled that the Great Western Railway charge such expensive tickets for unsafe travel.

I hope you review the service you provide to your customers as safety should be at the forefont of your services

items.title: Feeling very badly treated as a…
items.review_text: Feeling very badly treated qs a disabled passenger. Delays all over the underground resulted in me missing a train from Paddington. I had a ticket brought with a disabled railcard and booked seat. They refused to let me get on the next train, taking 0 account of the physical difficulties disabled people have whan trains are running slow or planned /unplanned disruptions and general lack of assistance and understanding available. I had to rebuy a ticket and they claimed they couldnt reserve me  seat. They offered no assistance to ensure I cud get on the train on the unreserved carriage which no dout will be the longest walk from the gqte and told me the wrong info so that if I hadnt doubled checked I would hVe miswed the next train which rhey told me would be at 3.15 when it is infact at q few mins past 3pm. GWR - not impressed. Your kack of customer care is just one more example of why this country is so stressful to live in, and hostile to disabled people in general.

items.title: So the Southwest cut off again from the…
items.review_text: So the Southwest cut off again from the rail network for fourth day out of last seven. Floods, overtime ban, strikes, overhead power cables down! Reliability really is zero and GWR network close to collapse it seems

items.title: Home by 6? Make it 8.
items.review_text:
Receiving a 1* service for a 5* price. Squashed onto delayed trains like sardines. Who cares if you’re old or pregnant. No refunds are considered, only if delayed over 15 mins which you really have to fight for. Working people do not need the extra stress of not getting home on time to see their families or say goodnight to their children. Constant issues this company just get away with! 

Only positive *staff are normally nice*.

items.title: Possibly the worst train company in the…
items.review_text: Possibly the worst train company in the UK. Poor service, delays, missed trains, totalitarian approach to ticket checks, diabolical customer service centre. They don't care, they have little or no competition. GWR has all the traits of a struggling company that is turning the screws on its customers to keep their increasingly anxious shareholders nourished.

items.title: l have to give a big shout to Bob…
items.review_text:
l have to give a big shout to Bob Lawrence at Weston Supermare station on the night of Monday 04 December '23

With all the train cancellations at Bristol Temple Meads and the lack of coach / taxis transport made available there for onward journeys l made my way to Weston Supermare

Bob kept all passengers informed as to the status of the line and arranged Taxis for all passengers waiting there.
He was extremely courteous and professional throughout, in dealing with some very stressed passengers.

He put the heating on the in inner waiting area and offered tea / coffee to groups of 4 or 5 passengers at a time whilst we were waiting.

Transport was arranged to Exeter St David's and he liaise with the staff there for an onward journey back to Torquay.

A big, big thank you. We need more staff like Bob

Frank
Torquay

items.title: Just when I thought Great Worstern…
items.review_text: Just when I thought Great Worstern couldn’t get any more useless, they manage it.  The next two trains to Paddington on a Sunday evening have been cancelled all day.  So does GWR put on an eight carriage train, knowing that the five carriage ones are normally standing only after Oxford?  They do not, it’s a five carriage special, and it didn’t let me reserve a seat.  So I get the pleasure of standing for ninety minutes, probably more as we will no doubt be late, because every one of their trains I have taken in 2023 is late.  The contempt they have for their customers is incredible.

items.title: like getting blood out of a stone
items.review_text:
i had bought a ticket to travel on nov 30, but not collected it.  I was taken ill with covid, so couldn't travel. My assumption (wrong) was that if you didn't collect the ticket, you could transfer it. There are different types of ticket - an off peak ticket purchased in advance does not equal an advance ticket, and unless you're a born bureaucrat you don't check when you book.  For an adance ticket you can only claim a refund for unused tickets if you buy a new ticket before the original travel date.  GWR refused to accept a covid test, and not collecting the ticket as evidence for a refund.

i think the moral of the story is a) book as late as possible, b) never expect them to refund anything if they can possibly find small print to avoid it and c) personally i will try and avoid gwr altogether where possible

items.title: Trying to pay a fine which I am fine…
items.review_text: Trying to pay a fine which I am fine with but I can’t pay online because it can’t find the reference after 10+ days and the local ticketing office is shut so I can’t pay there either. Customer service is also rubbish, they tell me to email but the email takes 15 days to respond which is way over the deadline? Just poor overall.

items.title: Jon and Jess on GWR 18/11/2023 Reading to Chippenham - Thank you!
items.review_text: This is a review not only for GWR - though it is my favourite tramline - but very especially for Jon and Jess who were the guard and catering hostess on the 10.25 train on Saturday 18th November, from Reading to Chippenham.  They were exceptionally delightful! So kind, so helpful, so warm - funny, charming, generous with their time and help to two older women who had got their trains mixed up.  They could not have been nicer in themselves, nor a better advertisement for the company they work for.  If only everyone were like them this world would work so much better.  Thank you Jon and Jess.

items.title: Average service, where's my seats?
items.review_text: Average service. Great on outward trip, Return trip booked seats on coach B, coaches D and E turned up, but no B! Seats very hard and uncomfortable on the new 800 series trains.

items.title: Monday morning 7am
items.review_text:
Monday morning, 7am - I bought a ticket at Wool station for a business trip to Bristol. I suspect the staff member knew the train I needed to swap to in Dorchester was already cancelled but said nothing as she sold me an off peak ticket despite me trying to arrive before 10am

I got myself across Dorchester to find out the train was cancelled and I'd have a 2hr wait for the next one to pray wasn't cancelled as well.

A shelter aside, there appears to be zero services on the station for a 2hrs wait. I even had to use a bin as a table to work on my laptop owing to the fact I will be at least 2 hrs late to my destination. No staff, no toilets I can see.

Poor beyond words.

items.title: Delay delays delays - rarely on time
items.review_text: Well, a very happy Christmas from GWR. Train from Paddington to Chippenham delayed by 30 minutes. Return train to London after Christmas delayed by over an hour. Well at least GWR don’t rest on their laurels when upping their delay game. Can someone from GWR share here the annual percentage of their trains that run on time? No chance.

items.title: As a great train enthusiast
items.review_text: As a great train enthusiast, regular service user and team leader for the GWR volunteers at Freshford station, I am determined not to let this week's experience tarnish my appreciation - I have to report that claiming a refund for a ticket purchased in error today has been a truly awful ordeal. I won't labour it here, but please do look into it GWR....hardly the swift, hassle free experience one would hope for...and a £10 admin fee to boot!

items.title: GWR an hour late but simply do not care
items.review_text: Yet more problems with GWR. Caught the train from Penzance to Swindon. This involved 2 trains, a Crosss Country to Bristol and a GWR train from there to Swindon. The GWR train was belted for over an hour. I applied for compensation and it was rejected by GWR o the basis that it was the fault of Cross Country who not only departed on time but arrived on time too. It was the GWR connecting train that was over an hour late. GWR seem to not be intelligent enough to grasp this fact despite giving them the train number ticket number and times of their train. Absolutely awful customer service, and shameful, lazy compensation staff. I would give the 0 stars but it is, sadly, not an option.

items.title: Ruined all my journey and plans
items.review_text: I started travelling every month with the same route that takes one change in between. For the past two years, I never made it to my change station on time, and the train was departing without me. Every single time I have to wait until midnight to get the closest next train, with the wait another 30-40 minutes in dark and cold station simply because swr train didn’t make it on time, again. Recently a delay was TWENTY minutes, bear in mind I’m only given 8 minutes to change in between the trains. Right now I’m once again taking the train which arrived to me on time, there were no strikes or warnings that it could be late - however somehow I’m once again 8 minutes behind, leaving me with no time to change for my next train. I only ask to be humane and understand that people can have multiple changes and delays in 5-10 minutes will result in the failure of the whole journey. I was meant to meet up with my friend this evening for the cinema but now it’s cancelled because they won’t wait extra 40 minutes. No one will. However I’m forced to do it when it’s cold and raining, at the time when my journey was planned.

items.title: Switcheroo, return only valid Monday
items.review_text: Booked a return ticket. After paying, it says return only valid Monday, no refunds or amendments.

items.title: Absolutely useless!
items.review_text: Booked train tickets to Bath this weekend and now they’ve decided to go on strike so we’ve had to cancel the tickets and our hotel that is non refundable. Absolutely gutted! Thanks for ruining our weekend we’ve been looking forward to for a while. You should be ashamed of yourselves.

items.title: Terrible journey standing from Oxford…
items.review_text:
Terrible journey standing from Oxford to Paddington if we get there because at Reading there was no bloody train driver available !!!
Disgusting. I WANT A REFUND!!!
How do I get a refund??

items.title: Wish I could avoid like the plague
items.review_text: Unfortunately I have to use this dire service daily to travel to/from London Paddington. Frequent delays, cancellations, issues with the track or train. Overpriced, poor service, trains overcrowded (due to the infrequent services) and awful staff.

items.title: Horrendous
items.review_text:
Took a train journey from Trowbridge to Bristol. It was a very busy period, so I was expecting some delay. But unfortunately the journey went from bad to worse. The first train was packed  so couldn't get on. Then the next train there were only two carriages and it was like being packed like sardines.  

It took over an hour and a half and horrendous conditions in a boiling hot carriage. 


I don't do train travel very often, now I know why!!!! Absolutely shocking. GWR kept making up excuses as to the delays with a different reason every time....I paid for an open ticket and I might as well not bothered.


I won't be rushing back anytime soon.

items.title: Kind and helpful staff
items.review_text:
Good trains, great experience overall.

Despite being a strike which affected my journey, the crew had been very kind guiding through alternatives using the same company which allowed me to reach the destination with a small delay.

items.title: Reliably terrible
items.review_text: Train again delayed 30 mins each way from Newport to Paddington, and standing room only on train back from London. Happens on a regular basis, this service is unreliable, expensive and needs major improvements.Usual excuses given, pick from -  not enough drivers, slow running train in front, more trains than expected today, train in front running slowly, unexpected engineering works etc etc but you can waste more time and claim compensation ……..

items.title: Trains are always filthy
items.review_text: Trains are always filthy, often delayed and the staff are very rude and unhelpful. No compassion what so ever. The worst train line I've had to travel on in the UK.

items.title: absolute sh**ty service
items.review_text:
absolute sh**ty service
the farnborough north station is known to the train worker that is popular for the college student yet they only have 2-3 carrage to carry 100+ student in addition to the people on the train
and I get if the train worker failed school but it doesn't take that much logic to lnow that to provide a large amount you're going to need to increase the amount of carriage 
on top of this today the 16:00 train was delayed by over 30 minutes, I reach the stagion in time yet the train driver, making eye contact with me, says no and closes the train doors
I hope that all the train workers have a very shi**ty christmas and that their 2024 will be the worst year they experienced so bad that they'd start regret they chose to live
If you want to be paid more go find a better job, do ruin other people's successful future just because you messed up yours

items.title: I left my bag on the train with travel…
items.review_text: I left my bag on the train with travel card and weekly pass which was £360 plus my purse my cards and new clothes. Naturally you think who to contact, Gwr contact service was amazing, I used the whatsapp line and Celia was straight back to me helping me and the bag managed to go back to Bath had I catch the 6am train. I can't thank Celia and the team enough and for making the process so easy. I also find the same for the compensation if a train is late it's easy to do and comes within a few days. Impressive - thanks again GWR

items.title: No buffet car
items.review_text: No buffet car, trolley service very slow with appalling coffee. Sat here wondering what century I'm in. Not a patch on LNER.

items.title: 0/10 avoid at all costs
items.review_text:
You could hire a group of monkeys and they would do a better job at running the train service than First Great Western. 

They will tell you they offer compensation in event of cancelation/strike/ excessive delay and tell you to make a ticket on the website to receive your refund, only to refuse to pay anything.

items.title: Thank you to lovely Stewart who came…
items.review_text: Thank you to lovely Stewart who came through with the hospitality cart on the Plymouth to Penzance train on Wednesday 6thDecember at 13.15 - so friendly and helpful and fun - five star service - thank you Stewart 👏👍

items.title: How bad can you get?
items.review_text: OVERPRICED, cancelled OUT OF THE BLUE, delayed... are we in the 1960s? Or in some banana republic? Oh no it's the UK & 2024, but GWR would make you think otherwise 🤦🏻‍♀️🤦🏻‍♀️🤣🤣

items.title: Broken rails
items.review_text: Broken rails, overhead power lines, signal failure's add up to a totally unreliable service. It is a rarity to complete a journey on time.

items.title: First time on a train for years okay…
items.review_text: First time on a train for years okay getting there but cancelled train on the way back as there was not enough trains??! then next train packed us in like sardines, to the point it was so hot on there I nearly passed out! Vomited once i got off the train!! And they want us to take public transport, its a joke! As for striking for more pay, they don't deserve it, can't keep trains on time, trains are always being cancelled, no care towards their customers and over inflated prices. Supposed to be travelling by train on Thursday again, but that certainly will not be happening, I would rather not travel then have to travel on a train again. Worst experience on any form of public transport ever!

items.title: From Portsmouth Harbour to Cardiff Central
items.review_text: The train from Portsmouth Harbour to Cardiff Central has been very bad for many years. Last Friday, I decided to travel from Southampton Central to Newport Gwent. It went something like this: 'The first train to arrive at platform 4 is the (time) to Bournemouth ONLY.' A huge train with about 10 carriages pulled up - virtually empty, and only ONE person got on. Then: 'The next train to arrive is the 11.10 to cardiff Central ........consists of THREE carriages!' People were packed like sardines into these 3 carriages. Terrible, but then it has been like this for YEARS! I usually drive, but decided to see if things had improved with GWR. It HASN'T!

items.title: The train from reading to Penzance using cattle class
items.review_text: The train from reading to Penzance standing room only on a pre booked ticket,still only a 5 hour trip in cattle class. Also when returning from to Newquay to parr 7.45 train cancelled , next train 10.15 God help anyone trying to get to work on time.

items.title: Suprise suprise the train was late by…

Ask to give me my money back, they say I don't have the ticket number and the information I give is incomplete, call them multiply times and explained that I can't give the ticket number as I never had it, customer service people agree with me every time, but four months later I am still got nothing back.
