items.review_text: 5 coaches for Plymouth to paddington service is a disgrace shame on you GWR

items.title: Had to wait 2 hours and 40 minutes
items.review_text: I finished work at 18:00. I looked on my GWR app, and I saw that all of the trains had been cancelled. So, having no other way back home I had to wait for a bus at 19:50. I checked the GWR app again at 19:00, and it said there was a train at 19:43. So I walked to the train station and when I got there, all of the information boards said the 19:43 train was on time. 19:43 passed. No train. I looked on the GWR app again and it said the train had stopped at the platform I was on, which it obviously hadn’t because I was standing waiting for it. I could’ve been on the bus home if GWR hadn’t updated the app stating there would be a train at 19:43. I then had to wait in the cold until 20:40 when the train finally showed up. By the time I have got home, I am too tired to cook myself dinner. The rail line has been shut for the past three weeks because they’ve been “upgrading it”. Where is the upgrade GWR? I am fed up of waiting for hours on end for trains. When is this issue going to be resolved? I spend £50 on trains every week, though for the past month, every train I have caught has been delayed. I have missed hours of college and hours of work due to GWR. Also, £6.40 for a 15 minute train journey is absolutely appalling. I can not wait to drive so I will NEVER have to rely on GWR AGAIN. What a waste of my night.

items.title: Unacceptable Service at a Premium Price: The Great Western Rail Maidenhead-Paddington Debacle
items.review_text:
Paying over £4500 a year for the Great Western Rail (GWR) service between Maidenhead and Paddington should guarantee a seamless commute. Instead, GWR offers an experience that borders on the intolerable, blatantly disrespecting both the time and finances of its passengers.

Punctuality is Nonexistent: GWR’s concept of timekeeping is abysmal. The routine delays and cancellations are a direct insult to any notion of professional commitment or personal time. The lack of communication during these delays only compounds the frustration, showing a blatant disregard for passenger convenience.

Sardine Can Conditions: The overcrowded trains during peak hours are a clear sign of GWR’s failure to accommodate its passengers comfortably or even safely. Charging a premium for what amounts to a daily ordeal in cramped conditions is outrageous. The deteriorating state of the train interiors further demonstrates GWR’s neglect towards maintaining a standard of service.

Customer Service is a Myth: Encounters with GWR staff, on the rare occasion they occur, have been utterly disappointing. Their indifference towards passenger grievances shows a systemic failure in training and customer service ethos. The robotic and impersonal responses to complaints are a testament to GWR’s disregard for its customers.

A Gross Mismatch of Value for Money: The audacity to charge exorbitant fees for this level of service is astonishing. GWR appears to operate in a bubble, oblivious to the standards of value and service that customers rightly expect. This isn’t just poor service; it’s a comprehensive failure to deliver on basic promises.

GWR’s Maidenhead-Paddington service is a textbook example of how not to operate a train service. We, the passengers, are not mere revenue streams but the lifeline of your operation. Our patience has its limits, and they have been thoroughly tested.

Immediate and significant improvements are non-negotiable. GWR must take drastic actions to overhaul its service, focusing genuinely on enhancing the passenger experience. Until then, passengers have every right to question the utility of their investment and explore alternatives that respect their needs and contributions.

To GWR: It’s high time to recommit to your passengers or step aside for a service that will.

This version intensifies the critique, emphasizing the need for urgent action by Great Western Rail.

items.title: Terrible Company
items.review_text: Terrible website, lack of information, out of date procedures, jump through hoops to get refunds. Tickets mis-printed and a ripoff

items.title: Almost always late
items.review_text: In 4 years of using GWR regularly, i have never been on time. No matter what, they’ll be late because no one can do their job

items.title: Shambolic
items.review_text:
Shambolic. After every single south western rail train cancelled for the last two days, stuck in Somerset, we decide to head to Yeovil Penn Mill for the great western experience. So far it has been 4 hours at a nearby pub as evert single GWR train is cancelled with minutes to spare. We spend £45 on a taxi to get out here, hopeful to return us to London and not be fired from our jobs and lo and behold the West country druids have decided that this is where we must remain until death. £100 of GWR train tickets, £100 of South west rail tickets, a £45 taxi, lunch and my cat traumatized beyond belief. All we want to do is leave this God awful county and it's rubbish transport system behind. Big up Dracula cabs though for getting us through the floods. Because excellent driving and he knows our address. 

Updated as per below reply - we used the WhatsApp service throughout the whole time and unfortunately received no response. What we would like is compensation - we arrived for one train, was told it was cancelled went to a pub to wait for the next, return to discover it did in fact run and the later one we were told to wait for was then cancelled. We were then advised to taxi to castle Cary - despite the road being blocked so wasn't an option and eventually we're re route to WEYMOUTH to get back to London. 10+ hours of travel, exhausted and contracted flu. But thanks for the reply GWR - but no you don't answer your WhatsApp so best not recommend it...

items.title: Excellent staff experience

items.title: STD class passengers get seats in first class leaving full paying first class passengers standing
items.review_text: Purchased first class ticket in advance and arrived at Paddington to find train cancellations including the train with my seat reservation, boarded a train and couldn’t get a seat in first class because standard class passengers refused to move, spoke to steward who unhelpfully informed me they would sort it out after departure. Finally after pushing into a seat occupied by a bag of a std class passenger and heated argument from three std class passengers who told me first class was declassified which was ridiculous the train departed. It was very distressing as a lone traveler to be berated for trying to find a seat, the stewards stayed out of the carriages until the train set off instead of helping, why do GWR not seat passengers with first class tickets before allowing std class passengers to take seats? Finally the ticket checker sold upgrades at an insulting £20-25 so all the full fare paying passengers, very poor customer experience

items.title: A first class ticket will get you…
items.review_text: A first class ticket will get you broken (sometimes) and dirty (always) seats. And a bottle of still water and crisps. No meal service, no drinks. Value for money is very poor. I feel bad for the employees who must get a lot of grief from travelers

items.title: Dire GWR Service
items.review_text: Of late, an utterly appalling service. Cancellations appear to have become endemic, are unexplained, and invariably without passengers being offered an alternative such as bus replacement. The reasons for the continual delays and cancellations seem never ending. Often cancellations are notified shortly before schedule service times. One suspects this is to ensure that as many persons as possible purchase tickets for a service that is not available to them. Station staff seem unable to offer apologies or empathise with what is often substantial inconvenience. It is as if the travelling public are an inconvenience. Why is it seemingly so impossible to run timely, clean, state of the art trains such as are enjoyed by the Spanish?   The problem is the travelling public soak up this dire service whilst there is little means to hold top management to account. I suspect that taking the Trans Siberian Express from Moscow to Vladivostok would be less of a challenge for the traveller than attempting a timely, uninterrupted journey from, say Newbury to London Paddington. However we will all continue to shuffle like so many lemmings onto these dire services when the inevitable price hike hits.  I suppose we just have to be grateful that any train is running. One of a number of reasons to emigrate.

items.title: Excruciating seats & torturous overall rail-experience: This is the age of the pain.
items.review_text: GWR’s Hitachi trains give a ghastly rail-travel experience. 1) The terrible seats are surely the most uncomfortable seat on any train that’s ever existed.  Your posterior will be sat on a metal bar - that’s thinly covered with a layer of fabric; it’s like sitting on a rock.  The thin and far too upright back-rest is no better (seats in First Class are barely better; an utter waste of the extra cost).  You’ll be squirming and aching within 20 minutes. Evidently every expense and consideration for physical comfort has been spared by GWR. This is not my opinion; every fellow-passenger and GWR worker that I’ve ever spoken to agrees that the seating is horrendous. 2) The loud and CONSTANT tannoy announcements will frazzle your brain.  You can’t think without interruption (aside from the ongoing agony of your posterior and back) for more than a few minutes at a time, before you’ll again hear a set of inane, unnecessary, repetitious-to-insanity-producing announcements. 3) All year round the carriages’ temperature will almost invariably be too cold.  For whatever unfathomable reason, there’s seemingly a policy of ‘we’ve got air-conditioning in trains now, so let’s use it maximally’. 4) The harsh, blinding – interrogation luminosity – lights of the carriages at night will ensure you cannot relax, doze or sleep (even if you could do so miraculously through your bottom’s pain and ignore the tannoy).  5) The demise of the buffet car, and its replacement with the trolley service, is a sad, sad thing.  In addition to a notional buffet car motivating you from your stupor of discomfort to stand up and walk somewhere to try to ease your seat-induced aches, and warm up, the buffet car was an institution – for the opportunity it gave to chat to fellow passengers. 6) The water dispenser for washing your hands in the WC cubicles almost never works well or at all.  Thus back to your torture-seat you’ll stiffly hobble, with liquid soap all over your hands (until you learn to never pump soap until you’ve experimented firstly to see how bad, if at all, the water is dispensing).  You arrive at your destination, even after (hopefully) a short trip, aching from the awful seats, freezing from the temperature, brain dead from the tannoy, squinting with tiredness/eye-strain from the glaring lights, and with sticky hands.  GWR clearly holds its heritage and its customers with utter indifference...or even contempt.  For with these trains GWR could hardly have engineered a more unpleasant train-travel experience if they tried.  And GWR merely reply with words that would deny us - thousands of us - of our (very) painfully real experience; they’ll write such as “our trains’ seats are ergonomically designed and are supportive on long trips”; as if their hollow words magic-away the incontrovertible GWR-shaming facts, such as that of their seats being horrendously uncomfortable (for all trips) and so that of our bodies seriously aching from sitting on the back-breaking, bottom-agonising, presumably cheapest seats GWR could buy for their Hitachi trains.  This is the age of the pain.

items.title: Cramped, poorly designed IETs
items.review_text:
Took the weekend train from Bristol to London recently, but the new(ish) passenger trains (class 800/802 apparently) are a joke. Both ways the train was so overcrowded that i ended up sitting uncomfortably in the aisles. No major events in London, so i can only assume that this is a regular occurence. No food service at all, not that a trolley could navigate through the aisle, couldn't use the loo because the train was packed, corridors are narrow and difficult to navigate (bruised hips abound), doors also very narrow, suitcases spilling out into the aisle because they have space for about 5 cases in a 60+ seat carriage. For £70 i would expect more than a small square of dirty carpet and severe leg cramp. 
Still not my worst experience with the new trains...took the train to Reading a couple of months ago to go on a bike ride...LOL! The tiny broom closet bike storage was already filled with 2 bikes, which apparently is the TOTAL storage for bikes on the train. Kinda glad, watched someone struggle to get their bike out, which involves climbing practically into the cupboard to lift your bike up above your shoulders to hook it onto a tiny hook...no chance i would do that. I just stood in the aisle with my bike, fortunately train was again so busy people were standing as insufficient carriages were provided, so no-one could move even if they wanted to. 
Never getting GWR again, such as shame as the service was prompt and fast but a company run this incompetently, it's clearly easier to drive to a town on the outskirts of London, park and get the tube in. So much for 'let the train take the strain', more like 'let the train give you pain'. What idiot bought these new trains?

items.title: Im absolutely disgusted with GWR
items.review_text:
tIm absolutely gutted with GWR . I ordered return tickets online for a trip with my mother, i recieved an email a few days before our trip to make me aware the train was cancelled and if i wish to claim a refund - do so online. The refund system is not the best , you need to make a different account in order to make a claim for this and your made aware that there will be a £10 'admin fee' on your refunded tickets which for me means i will only recieve one full ticket price back and Gwr keep the second ticket purchased for 'admin fees' although i filled out all forms online , provided evidence myself & correct bank details for a refund , wheres the admin in that process other than making it difficult and tiresome for people to request refunds. The journey was cancelled by absolutely no fault of my own but i loose one full price ticket because of Gwr cancelling the train , this to me seems very unfair. I could almost grin and bare a £10 admin fee on one ticket but they have taken £10 off BOTH tickets. Even the wait time on confirmation of refund is severly slow, i do appreciate the level of upset customers probably waiting for responses as well leaving the company a little snowed under. Can i also add that i purchased both tickets under the same order and they both have the same reference number on them - under one single order for two guests travel BUT im still being charged for two seperate ticket ' admin fees'. Its no wonder the trains are always cancelled as you must make enough money off the admin fees. 

 Times are hard , people are struggling and that is food taken off my familys table so close to christmas. I had to front more money on the day of the event for alternative transport which i did not account for and i am still waiting to recieve half of that price back . I spent months saving for the trip at a stressful and financially pressuring time christmas can bring. 

'Great western railway' certainly not the name this company deserves , its by no means great & gives little emphaphy for its customers.

 In response to GWR’s response below this is incorrect , i Whatsapped , rang & emailed and still received the same outcome . NOT a full refund issued nor any help .

items.title: Simply the worst company I have ever…
items.review_text: Simply the worst company I have ever dealt with, consistently

items.title: Dog given my reserved seat in First Class
items.review_text: GWR staff allowed a dog to have my reserved seat in first class today!! Owner of dog with no seat reservation told me to find another seat, ticket checker and first class steward said dogs are allowed to be on seats, I have subsequently checked policy which very clearly states dogs are not allowed on seats, was made to sit elsewhere as I am allergic to dogs and asthmatic so dog and owner had 4 seats, numerous other passengers complained to steward about the dog on the seats and how I was treated, have submitted complaint with copy of ticket, no automated acknowledgement so not sure if received, awful journey, train delayed missed my connection and having saved up to travel first class and reserve my seat, it was given to a dog

items.title: GWR: Dreadful Service Gets Worse
items.review_text:
I am shocked and appalled by the dreadful nature of GWR. They clearly believe they are a cut above the rest of us and have NO perception of what customer service looks like. 

Below is my copy of the appeal to the ridiculous penalty fare I was given. 

Today I received notification that the Appeal service have decided that I have missed the deadline to appeal and therefore they will increase the fine. 

UNBELIEVABLE. I could not Appeal as their system blocked me out as GWR Person had filled in their form incorrectly. 

Smacks of a money making scam from GWR. Who's service is appalling - making people late or not able to get places due to strike action. 

In my work commute I travel from Hungerford to Liverpool Street via train and tube.  As I travel on demand I buy tickets as required. There is no way to purchase the travelcard required for my commute from the machine on the station only a Anytime Day Return travel card which is more expensive.
If time and queue allows it (there is only one ticket machine) I will purchase the more expensive option, otherwise I purchase it from the conductor on the train.  On this particular morning when attempting to purchase my ticket on the train from the conductor, I was told that he did not have a printer that printed the correct ticket.  Due to this the conductor suggested I could purchase the ticket at the ticket office at the barriers coming off the trains.  I'd note I've always purchased my tickets and never ride a train without paying.  
I went to the ticket booth and got in line roughly 10th in the queue.  I was talking my 7 year old daughter on the phone whilst waiting when a revenue office pulled me from the queue when I was next up to purchase my ticket.  I assumed he had the mobile ticket machine like the conductors and was going to sell me my ticket as this does happen sometimes.  Instead the officer asked what I was doing, where had I travelled from and he then rudely informed me that I he was going to issue a penalty notice for not paying for my ticket.  
I explained to him what had happened but he kept insisting that I was trying to cheat the system, which is categorically untrue.  At this point I told my daughter I had to hang-up as this rude officer was harassing me.  He accused me of abusing him, again untrue, (I had only called him rude for interrupting me on a call without even an apology), and threatened to call over the police.  I requested he did as it would be helpful to get someone capable of rational thought to explain this situation to.  But it was an empty threat and he continued to tell me he would write the penalty notice.  I tried to get one of the ticket officers to intervene as they see thousands of customers using this same approach to pay for their tickets when unable to purchase on the train.  Whist he agreed with me he could not intervene due to the fact the officer had already started to write the ticket (he did not have my details in which to do so, so he can’t have really got far).  After getting the notice I still waited in line and bought my ticket as I had originally set out to do. 
You can check the CCTV in the station as I'd assume we were in a place that would be recorded.  In fact I encourage you to review it, talk to the ticket office, and even the rude revenue office.  The story won't change, I was waiting to purchase a ticket at Paddington Station, as agreed by the conductor.  The officer was totally out of line and represents the type of bullying we frankly do not need.  I'd expect that the footage is reviewed and appropriate disciplinary actions are taken against him.
Please note the time of this harassment was approximately 9 AM not noon as stated on the notice.
I would appreciate your prompt review and expect the evidence of my statement, interviews of the ticket office, revenue office and of course the camera is surely enough to overturn this penalty.

items.title: Yesterday we had the train from…
items.review_text: Yesterday we had the train from Gloucester to Cardiff at 16.30. When one of our friends was taken ill. We would all like to thank Abdul the conductor who kept everything calm and took good control of the situation.

items.title: The 2 starts they got is a gift to…
items.review_text:
The 2 starts they got is a gift to them. 

ZEROOOOOOOO what a loads of rubbish! Complete lateness telling you the train stopped we dont know why.  Jokers!! Wifi is non existent! Ive had no wifi for 8hours!  Im going to arrive super late because they are rubbish.  Glad i know now.  This is the first and the last time I use this company. Makes me want to vomit

items.title: cancelled coaches, had people standing, cancelled seats. No refunds
items.review_text: Train from London to bath return. 5 carriages instead of 10, so they cancelled all reservations and had people standing whole journey but kept money and no refunds

items.title: Storm Babette and rail delays affected our journey
items.review_text:
Storm Babette affected our journey to Bristol. Our train was cancelled and they switched to an hourly service. The first train we could catch was too full to join. So we waited for the next one running 30 minutes late

However we got a seat and arrived in Bristol after about 1 hour. The usual journey time. 
The staff apologised at regular intervals for disruption
They also clarified how to claim for delays. 
This was processed rapidly with payment arriving within 3 days. 
This helped restore what could have been a seriously affected trip.

items.title: Terrible service worse customer care
items.review_text:
You scumbags. 

I’d like to escalate my refund claim to an official complaint of the appalling service I’ve received both on the train that took nearly seven hours instead of the scheduled four hours (how the heck is that not delayed?!)

And the return journey you (GWR) contacted me to tell me I was entitled to a refund (screenshots provided) so why are you now refusing to paying that when it was you who contacted me about it!!?

And thirdly for the amount of hours I’ve since wasted on the phone, on web chat, and on back and forth emails with an incompetent peon who doesn’t know that a train is even delayed!

This is wholly unsatisfactory and shockingly bad customer service at every single interaction I’ve been unfortunate enough to suffer.

I’d like to hear from your manager or complaints department, someone isn’t a lazy incompetent prat please.

Useless.

items.title: Kind employees
items.review_text: We didn’t travel on a train today. But came to Temple Meads with my train mad son. The driver and guard on the 9.58 to Penzance were really nice. The driver telling us this was possibly his last HST drive. Invited my son in to have a look. We always find this when we come to TM. The GWR staff always nice.

items.title: The staff is very rude and never listen…
items.review_text: The staff is very rude and never listen to what you are saying and explaining.

items.title: They used to be good before the…
items.review_text: They used to be good before the pandemic and the staff usually are friendly and helpful. However in last 2 years  (and I travel regularly) there hasn't been a train not subject to a delay of some sort. Reality is most journeys could be smoother and faster,  yet they always have to slam the breaks on somewhere. These sort of sloppy interruptions and longer delays each week for various infrastructure failures are poor in the modern day. They could do it, shame they can't roll with the times and keep a half decent service going.

items.title: My trains were all late
items.review_text: My trains were all late, this is common place with gwr. The last three stops ended up being cancelled without notice at the platform and even the rail staff at said stops were not aware. Because of some light rain.

items.title: Useless
items.review_text:
Constantly delayed or cancelled; the staff never know what is happening, are mostly rude and don't care.
The trains when they do run are always smaller than needed for passenger numbers.
Utter Shambles.

items.title: Unbelievable service
items.review_text: Unbelievable service. On a train from Paddington to Weston Super Mare the trolley girls announced that they were unable to provide a service due to a flat tyre on the aforesaid piece of equipment, Realistically if they lost a few stones they would not get wedged between the seats as they went.

items.title: Admin fee is absolutely disgusting on…
items.review_text: Admin fee is absolutely disgusting on refund claims.. basically means they can be as late as they like and there are zero repercussions. Absolute disgrace.

items.title: Great hospitality from Rob the train manager
items.review_text: Had reserved seating for forward facing on train from London Paddington at 19.02 on 17th October 2023 but when I got to my reservations they were backwards facing and unable to sit backwards due to my disability so I end up being sick the train was packed and was unable to find seats that was forward facing that was available but there wasn't any and I spoke to the train manager Rob and explained my situation where I even had reserved forward facing seats because of my disability and he was so kind that he allowed us to sit in first class section which I was grateful for to just be able to have a seat as I was panicking as the train was really busy and unable to find available seating. So I want to thank Rob the train manager for his hospitality.

items.title: God-awful Western Railway
items.review_text:
Saw the many 1 star reviews when we booked but shrugged them off and hoped we'd be lucky. Started well with the 1103 Paddington to Bodmin Parkway via Plymouth departing on time with an allowed 5 minute changeover at Plymouth. Then apparently "congestion" near Exeter St Davids made us around 5 minutes late. This then became 8 minutes and by the time we had gone far beyond Exeter to arrive at Plymouth it was 15 minutes.

If you allow just a 5 minute change at Plymouth then you really need to be able to run the incoming service on time! The Paddington train was so late arriving at Plymouth that we missed the connection, with the result we then missed onward bus connections to North Cornwall and had to get a taxi at our expense. 

Train "captain" had already radioed ahead to hold a branch line service somewhere, but apparently the service from Plymouth on to Bodmin could not be held despite it being obvious the connection would be missed. Not impressed. Later 1446 Plymouth to Bodmin was also only 5 coaches so was rammed due to passengers like us who missed the 1418.

Spoilt what should have been the start to a very special weekend. Our first journey on GWR for around 20 years and we were both really looking forward to it. Never again - we'll drive next time. My wife doesn't like watching me go purple.

items.title: Cancelled
items.review_text:
Monday - Pay over £300 for a monthly travel card
Tuesday - all trains into London cancelled
All you have to do is provide a basic train service. Another example of Rip off Britain!

items.title: Unbareably uncomfortable seats!
items.review_text: The train journey is fast enough, I don't often have issues with the timings, but then I don't travel often, but I am seriously disappointed, in the age of memory foam and ergonomics, that the new "improved" trains running from Penzance to Paddington are so uncomfortable. Why are they so unbarably upright and why have they got less padding than the cheapest pipe lagging available!? Do better or charge less!

items.title: Worst Trainline
items.review_text:
Worst Trainline. Taken multiple journeys with GWR now, and every single one has been delayed by over 15mins ( one being over an hour and a half). I am yet to take a train that gets me at the station on time/ train arriving at the correct time and allows me to get the correct train I have booked. Will be driving home and deal with the M25 traffic over this rubbish from now on. Such a scam paying over £70 even with a railcard to just be delayed every time. 

Update : 21:05 15/10/23
Yet again another train delayed with the GWR service. Currently delayed by 30 mins undoubtedly it will increase.

items.title: Utterly useless
items.review_text: Utterly useless.  Journey from Paddington on Thursday 25 minutes late, journey to Paddington this evening will take an hour longer than normal because of some sort of maintenance work, barely a month after a similar delay.  They continue to run five carriage trains on a Sunday evening when they know full well the train will be so crowded from Oxford lots of people will have to stand.  The brazen contempt they show for their customers is remarkable.

items.title: First Class lounge
items.review_text: Travelling from London Paddington to Plymouth. On the last 4 occasions of making this journey, the comfy seating area has been roped off, denying weary travellers rest in some comfort as advertised on the GWR website. I have checked the website and can’t see anything saying this area closes after 7pm. It’s a shame that the ticket price doesn’t reflect the reduced service level. I have complained before and have received an unsatisfactory response; the usual 'We'll feed it back to relevant team,' etc but I suspect they didn’t get the memo and i'm sure after my latest protest I’ll get more of the same. It’s just so disappointing. It used to be so much better GWR.

items.title: Always late
items.review_text: Always late, unreliable service

items.title: Constantly cancelled, delayed and cramped trains
items.review_text:
Always delays, cancellations, signalling failures, random stops on the railroad. CRAMPED and quite frankly  inhumane conditions during rush hour, squashed up like sardines and the windows do not open... all this for £20 return ( and that's with a 16-25 railcard).

If you can avoid them and use another train company to get into London, please do and avoid like the plague!

items.title: Avoid if disabled
items.review_text: Avoid if disabled. They've made it clear that they couldn't care less about my safety as a disabled person. Excuse after excuse and nothing changes

items.title: the power sockets don't work

items.title: GWR trains
items.review_text: Very helpful train manager on my trip from Bath Spa to Newport nice air conditioned rolling stock

items.title: No drinking water anywhere on the train
items.review_text:
The service is crowded, but (so far) on time. The reason for the one-star review is that on this new train, there is no way to obtain drinking water: no dining car, no dining cart, and - unforgivably - no drinking water fountain.

So I am having to endure a one-and-a-half-hour trip in extreme thirst. I'm an adult, and can deal with this, but what about children? It's outrageous that these new trains no longer have drinking fountains - another example of how our privatised railway system continues to slide backwards...

items.title: How are they allowed to continue?
items.review_text:
This is one of those companies that are getting away with far too much.

My journey:  first:  waiting whilst the train is "preparing" for half an hour, then 3 minutes to board.

Not only was it delayed (which is normal for this company) but the brakes fell apart on the way, because they were not maintained.  

Then after booking a seat a long way in advance I had to leave the train with a baby and cases to board another (now delayed) crowded train behind.  

Internet not working of course, and the new staple, viz., no hot drinks because the water heater is not working (either not maintained or too ****ing lazy to replace it or use it properly).

Then they tell you about the refund you are owed, but  do not bother to just refund you (given they have all your details already), no, you have to spend about 40 minutes ****ing around with their designed to be difficult and put you off claiming procedure, including the uploading of a photo of your physical ticket that was collected at the station barrier in order to leave! 

It might seem a little strong, but I would enjoy watching the controlling owners of this company hang.  

Sell your shares now, this company is doomed!

items.title: Improvement desperately needed
items.review_text: The staff are brilliant and extremely helpful... unfortunately, they're let down by the terrible infrastructure and train services. There always seems to be delays, signal failures etc. The last service I used was delayed and the catering staff apparently missed the connection, so no refreshments were available.

items.title: Just can’t do this anymore!
items.review_text: I have had a look at the planed time table changes for my commute to work from Heyford to Reading. The planned change has reduced the service to the point where it is no longer viable to use the train to make a 9 till 5 shift in Reading, or for that matter Oxford! Over the last 3 years  I have suffered an increasingly poor service from GWR (and Arriva) on this route with cancellations, overcrowding and unreliability on a regular basis. However this is the last straw, I just won’t be able to use the train. I am an enthusiastic rail user as it should be less hassle than driving and a greener way to travel, however would I recommend using the the GWR service …No, as it is just so badly managed it is practically unusable.

items.title: An update to my previous 3 reviews.
items.review_text:
An update to my previous 3 reviews.
Finally GWR have settled my Delay Repay claim. 
I have received a cheque with a full refund for the return leg of my journey, after previously being turned down.
I don't know if this is a response to my reviews here.
Unless their service dramatically improves I will not travel with GWR again.

items.title: Awful Service
items.review_text: GWR are totally unable to run a train service. Delays, cancellations, hugely overcrowded trains and conductors who thinks it's hilarious. The fares are staggeringly expensive and they still run a awful service. If you have options, do not travel with GWR.

items.title: WARNING - GWR ARE FRAUDSTERS!!
items.review_text:
I am writing this review so to warn other passengers of the abysmal customer service the Great Western Railway.

On the 31/07/23 I went onto GWR website to book a ticket for 02/08/23 from Redhill to Swansea, I proceeded to the card payment section and entered all the details. However, after waiting a few minutes the GWR website advised me they were having problems with their site and I should try again later, I therefore cancelled and logged out understanding my payment had not gone through! Later in the evening I went back onto GWR website and this time was successful with payment being accepted and my booking made to travel on 02/08/23, I had an e-ticket which I travelled with on the booking date and as far as I was aware everything was fine.

However, on 18 August I logged onto my bank account where I could see that 2 payments for the same amount had been taken from my account for the same journey!!  I immediately contacted GWR customer service, waiting 40mins to get through, to explain the situation and was informed by an unpleasant and indeed unhelpful customer service member that I had to wait 28 days or at least until the 28th of August to receive an automatic refund which she informed me was called a "ringfence payment" I was very sceptical that this would the happen but gave them the benefit of doubt  and waited until the 28th of August but to no surprise I did NOT receive my refund! I had no option but to waste another half a day trying to contact them to find out why I had not received the refund as previously informed!  

After waiting another 55 mins to get through I did eventually speak to another advisor who was far more helpful and explained that the "ringfence refund" was not for my situation and she was going to log a complaint and request my refund for double payment for the same journey be refunded asap. I waited 10 days as I was advised it could take 7-10 working days for the refund dept to sort the refund  but I would definitely get a refund this time!! 

However, you can guess, no refund was ever received!! 

To my astonishment however, what I did receive was an email from a customer Support Advisor informing me that they only offer refunds on claims made within 28 days of the tickets expiry date and as it was now 11th Sept they would NOT be refunding me as it was over the 28 days!

Double payment had been taken erroneously by GWR, they had given me incorrect information by way of the "ringfence payment refund" they had advised my to wait 28 days and again to wait another 7-10 days to receive my refund and YET they have the audacity to inform me they are not returning my money because I am out of time, not only is this unbelievable it is FRAUDULANT and I following trading standards advise I will be logging a formal complaint as advised, however, this does not deal with the distress and time wasted spent trying to get my money back which GWR should never have taken in the first place!!  BEWARE, if you pay by card be careful they do NOT do this to you!!

If I could have given a zero score I would have but as 1* does not reflect their total incompetence!!

items.title: One of the worst companies in Britain for customer service.
items.review_text: Trains late both ways. A month and a half later, I'm still waiting for the late payments I'm due. I've been in touch with their customer service three times and despite apologies and promises still nothing. E mails aren't being answered now.

items.title: Awful.
items.review_text: Train from Salisbury to Bristol was very overcrowded. Service again reduced to two carriages. The most crowded and uncomfortable train that I have ever travelled on. No facility to open a window. Irritating “jokey” tannoy just rubbed salt in the wound. A terrible service. I will never travel with GWR again. Had to stand from Salisbury to Bath. Awful.

items.title: Really poor
items.review_text: Train booked Saturday, cancelled (strike) rebooked for the Friday (cancelled last minute bad ill train). Rebooked to change at Reading train late leaving Newbury then missed connection. You have one job and that is to run a train service. Which you do very badly.

items.title: Ridiculously priced
items.review_text:
Ridiculously priced. Just traveled by train  from Budapest to Prague...Total cost? 25euros
If you are planning doing this type of milage with GWR you'll be required to take out a mortgage. Why can literally every other country get this done correctly just not Britain??

items.title: 22 years of use and still no good
items.review_text: 22 years of use, and still no good!

items.title: Last min cancellation
items.review_text: I arrived at station only to find that the train got cancelled. I bought ticket electronically via GWR app. There's absolutely no notification about the cancellation, no email or app notificiation. How difficult is it to give a little notification to passengers so they don't spend unnecessary time and money? I still had to pay parking fee. My train ticket can be refunded, but what about my parking fee!?

items.title: Went from Durrington by sea at 12 .30…
items.review_text: Went from Durrington by sea at 12 .30 to London Victoria, and jumped a taxi to London Paddington for the 14.03 to find it pull out before time..so got the 15.03 . Heading for Cornwall..but was told they could only serve 1st class with a hot drink because only one heater working !!! But it only took 3 hours to get a cold drink not bad for a 4 hour journey... . So why the kettle was boiling,,, why didn't they continue to serve cold drinks?  Oh yes that's right the lady whom was serving was loan working!!!

items.title: Avoid
items.review_text: GWR are happy when you buy a ticket. Try getting a refund when it's their fault.  I purchased rail tickets with GWR for a return journey.  GWR gave me two options either receive tickets via post or from station.  I chose post.  There was plenty of time for tickets to arrive, but they did not arrive.  So on holiday without return rail tickets . Contacted GWR apparently it was my fault as I should not have used the post. Buy new tickets GWR said.  I did without choice, not from GWR . I have since tried to obtain refund for my tickets which did not arrive in time . This has been weeks of excuses from GWR and repeatedly asking for proof of tickets which I submitted 3 times. Today they have said refund unsuccessful as they do not have any evidence of tickets..... Blatantly factually incorrect.  Avoid GWR tickets as customer service does not exist.

items.title: Delay repay
items.review_text: I love traveling with GWR lately as nealy ever y trip i take is Cancelled or Delayed and you get your money back through Delay Repay ,Who ever thought this up is a total Legend ,may it long continue guys 👍🏻

items.title: They ruined my trip and I advise no one…
items.review_text:
They ruined my trip and I advise no one to book with them again, unless you feel like being stranded 168 miles from home.
After buying a return ticket for almost £100. This company cancelled the train and sent no alternative. When I request a refund for half of my journey, they sent me £25!! What a complete joke and a waste of money and time. NEVER AGAIN!!! Please please please just book with LNER. Don’t waste your hard earned money on this scam of a company

items.title: Refusing a valid delay repay claim
items.review_text:
GWR refusing delay repay claim, claiming that another operator (TfL) is responsible for my journey.

However, my journey was London Paddington to Swansea, and only GWR operates that route. Delayed because GWR’s service didn’t depart Paddington on time, then they announced the service would be cut short at Bristol Parkway, then everyone had to get off and wait for the next train which was also late.

The actual journey was okay with helpful staff, but having a passenger charter give reference to delay repay seems pointless when you try denying you run these services.

items.title: Bad service and overcrowded trains
items.review_text: Trains always delayed and they need more trains to fit with demand as they are overcrowded. They are now thinking of closing ticket offices which doeesn't help, what if machines break or there is a power cut? I unfortunatley have to keep travelling with them but they need to up their game.

items.title: Good
items.review_text:
Travelled to Bristol recently. Train was delayed for over half an hour and I applied for a delay repay, which I received nearly immediately. 
Intercity trains are fast and nice, the seats are completely average (much better than Thameslink's), and if not for the delay plague of recent years it wouldn't have been bad at all.

items.title: Why is the government or railways…
items.review_text:
Why is the government or railways ombudsman not doing anything about  gwr service.  They provide the worst train services ever.  They  are deceiving customers.  It is clearly written that  if your train is delayed by 15 minutes  you will get  full refund.  My train was delayed  over 20mins and they gave me a 1/4.of my fare. 
Their first class service is the worst, l have ever seen. Trains are filthy with crumbs . APPALLING!!!!!

items.title: Dreadful journey to St Austell, no food or drinks
items.review_text:
Dreadful journey to St Austell, Cornwall.
The train was full. No food trolleys. Extremely expensive.
Our public transport is not fit for purpose 
Return journey 20 minutes late and no apology.

Worse service ever

items.title: The staff at Chippenham station have…
items.review_text: The staff at Chippenham station have always been incredible. They are friendly, helpful and are about the only good thing I can say about GWR. Yet GWR seems to be intent on closing them down and relying on ticket machines. Yet another disgusting attempt by this company to try and make more money. The workers at this station are wonderful and I can only hope GWR sees sense and keeps them there as machines don’t help solve any problems that arise.

items.title: Train late again from Paddington to…
items.review_text:
Train late again from Paddington to Barnstaple, missed the connecting train to Barnstaple by 8 minutes.
Unable to claim for late train due to 15 minutes clause.
It’s like they know the train will arrive at Exeter late but don’t care😡
Need to adjust timetable, I’d rather wait 15-20 minutes for a connection to Barnstaple rather wait around for 50 minutes.

items.title: GWR take money but don't give tickets
items.review_text: Went through online booking procedure. GWR took money from credit card but did not provide tickets. We phoned - takes 20 minutes to get through - but the operator not helpful: did say if no email to us no money taken. No email. Credit card company still have the amount pending after two days. Have to wait 15 days before raising a formal complaint. Rubbish.

items.title: Bad service!
items.review_text: Bad service!

items.title: Bought a first class ticket thinking to spoil myself and then they went and spoilt it
items.review_text: Bought a first class ticket from Cardiff to London Paddington on the basis that I would have a superior comfortable journey. It was a complete waste of money. Seat reservation a waste of time as the train was arbitrarily reduced from 9 carriages to 5. Nothing worked as a first class experience as the whole train was brought down to a third world experience with so many poor passengers having to stand right throughout the train. A complete fiasco added by pathetic apologies to complete insult to injury. 16.54 Cardiff to Paddington on September 13th September 2023. GWR - Great Western Rip-Off

items.title: Promises of compensation never paid.DO…
items.review_text:
Promises of compensation never paid.DO NOT TRUST GWR

Hopelessly late, 1st class ticket paid for. No service, no tea. coffee. water. loo roll!!  2.5 hrs late and told by a surly female customer care - I use the words loosely, that I won't get my £300 or part of it back. I paid for a service that I did not get. On line court claim against GWR to follow .

items.title: My return journey was cancelled
items.review_text: My return journey was cancelled, the ticket machine failed to print the tickets and the ticket office were no help at all, call trainline they said, trainline said to call GWR terrible journey £54 wasted needlessly they could've just let me on the train id already paid for.

items.title: Cancellation, delays, problems with connecting trains
items.review_text:
in two trips we had two delays, one train cancelled shortly before departure - it seems impossible to plan with GWR, connections to international trains are not guaranteed.
One additional star for the friendly staff at the train stations and in the trains. Otherwise it would be one star :(

items.title: Dreadful Service
items.review_text:
We had booked advanced single ticket to St Erth on the 8:44. The 8:44 was cancelled out of Paddington. We boarded the 7:52 because we were early and were kicked off at Reading because we have an advanced single. The guard was called Anisha. This is the worse service I’ve ever experienced. No common sense. Please reprimand Anisha as this is little Hitler syndrome and not what you want from your staff. The earlier train was empty and  later train is full. Also 10:03 is cancelled. 
The trip is also a bus replacement from Plymouth to St Erth.
Need I say more - If you can avoid using this service i would.

items.title: Avoid traveling with lazy thieves!!!
items.review_text:
The company is a absolute joke ,all the time cancellations, delays and strikes!!!!! Even in Eastern Europe the trains are much much more reliable. I'm travelling to work by train, the fee for one station is £9 its a f..... joke!!!!! You bunch of thieves, and getting refund is almost impossible!!!!! 
I would suggest to create a group on Facebook and collect few hundred thousand unhappy customers and sent a demanding letter to the minister of transportation to strip this useless company of their licence! 
One star is much to generous for lazy bunch!!!!

items.title: Don’t pay in advance from platforms
items.review_text: You are encouraged to buy a ticket on the platform in advance and then with monotonous regularity they cancel the service!! Don’t buy in advance is my advice, or don’t support their strike, they give an awful service.

items.title: Trains delayed by signals again
items.review_text: Trains delayed by signals again. Nearly ever train you run is delayed. Your service is totally unreliable and its a joke that your people are on strike all the time. Why do you think you deserve a pay rise for a service is so poor. You're pathetic.

items.title: Disgusting service...
items.review_text: Disgusting service... bought a ticket went to check it this morning 2 hours before my train. Ticket didnt load, contacted GWR and was continuously got passed around there different customer services, eventually talked to someone who was 0 help and tried to make me buy anouther ticket using the same channels. I told him I didnt have money to buy a new ticket until this one was refunded. He told me there was nothing they could do. Dispite me having every form of evidence that I had booked the ticket. Now stuck in yorkshire until this corrupt gives me my money back. Couldnt take up to 3 weeks!!!! Will never use GWR app again.

items.title: My train was delayed by 59 minutes
items.review_text: My train was delayed by 59 minutes. I was informed that I was due compensation for this. I tried to do it on line , as suggested. After over 2 hours of trying to do it I gave up. They had removed the first email saying I was intiteled to it, and when I tried to find the on line ticket they had removed this as well. So making it imposible to sumit my claim. This is just dishonist. My booking Ref. No. was 408540997057, so they can reply to me via this. Journey was from London Paddington to Plymouth at 13.03

items.title: First great Western have become totally…
items.review_text:
Edited after reply. 
I will , but have before. You lot won't do anything about your terrible service in house. It needs to be dealt with above, whoever that is.
All you lot say, on here in replies, on the phone etc.... Is "oh sorry about that.. blah blah *insert bs excuse"
It's been getting worse gradually the last few years
Clearly you won't do anything yourselves. Disgusting you can mess about with peoples means of transport and answer with an oh sorry.
You all need a massive shake up. 



First great Western have become totally unreliable and a joke 
You can check trains are running as much as you like, get to the platform...... Train cancelled. It's becoming almost daily,at least one train,just cancelled.
They never "have the information" when asked why cancelled and on the rare occasion they do, guess what? "Signal failures"... Again. Come on. 
It's shocking when a train is on time and it's become shocking if a train shows up. 
I'd like to know how the hell they're getting away with 'running' such a ridiculous, unreliable service. 
Sick of it.

items.title: The most unreliable train company I…
items.review_text: The most unreliable train company I have used. Late. Frequently. Often a breakdown of refreshments- no hot drinks, no trolley service. How they can conduct such an inferior service is beyond me. There just is no culture of service and second best seems endemic.

items.title: Service on board (1st class) was good…
items.review_text: Service on board (1st class) was good however no toilet paper in toilet.  Come on guys this is basic stuff, should have been checked in depot b4 arriving at Paddington.  Couldn't get any til Exeter which is where I got off 2.5hrs later.

items.title: This is the last time I will ever use…
items.review_text:
This is the last time I will ever use these ar%#holes . Worst train company  out there. GWR Are an absolute  joke.
 Driving for me from now on . F Y V M

items.title: Access problems at Chepstow station.
items.review_text:
I just would like to give a big thank you to a staff member at Chepstow station.  

I travelled back to Cardiff from this station on the 10th of August on my folding mobility scooter. 

To my horror, I noticed that the only access to the platform I needed was across a footbridge.

Luckily a staff member actually carried the folded scooter across the footbridge, at 28Kg this was no mean feat!

Thanks again, GWR.

items.title: A lovely first class experience
items.review_text:
A lovely first class experience. 
Comfortable, friendly, plenty of coffee.

items.title: Bank Holiday advanced ticket travel
items.review_text: As we arrived early to find our advanced ticket train cancelled we were promptly escorted on to the platform to catch the earlier train.  11:18 from Cardiff Central on Monday 28/08/23 to London.  The host Arianna was exceptionally attentive and rearranged our travel assist and waited with us until my mother was collected directly from our coach.  Omar the driver was a little more maverick and persuaded a couple of the ladies to squeeze up to allow my mother a precarious place on the back for which he decided no seatbelt was necessary.  He gave me instructions about how to get to the taxi rank to meet them and to be fair delivered her safely but I wouldn’t say he had the clearest idea about managing disabled passengers.  However, I do think Arianna should receive credit for her customer focus.  Despite being in first class, I am still not impressed with the new stock of trains - they are definitely not as comfortable as the pre-electrification stock.

items.title: Delays and cancellations once again
items.review_text:
As per, my train from Bristol to London was delayed by 20 minutes; also as per, the train back from London to Bristol was cancelled, with the next one having 5 coaches instead of 10, meaning it was rammed. 
I don’t usually (/ever) give these kind of reviews, but the frequency with which trains are delayed or cancelled is almost impressive, and obviously there isn’t much you can do except claim a (usually paltry) amount back through delay repay.

items.title: Why do this company still operate?
items.review_text:
Why do this company still operate? Again this morning the train is delayed. One PA saying problems, not updates provided, no ETA provided. This company is a joke and should loose their license. 

Contacted 'customer service' who simply just said : "Hi [NAME], sorry to hear your journey has been delayed. If you arrive at your destination 15 minutes or more later than planned, you can claim compensation at [LINK] - [NAME]"

This company clearly think that repaying a small amount makes it ok to screw-up their customer's lives and appointments. 

Stop this company from operating.

items.title: Neath to Swindon
items.review_text: Great service loved the staff would always go on gwr

items.title: I have travelled on GWR very frequently…
items.review_text: I have travelled on GWR almost weekly in the last year as my son now lives in Bristol.  The trains rarely run to time and they are usually either cancelled or overcrowded.  The ticket prices are outrageous for the service we get.  Today for example going out there was a five instead of nine carriage train and coming home was nearly an hour delay due to a signalling problem between Didcot and Reading and the driver getting off at Reading so a new driver being needed.  After a year of travelling weekly, I have now lost patience as there is at least one problem nearly every time.  From now will be requesting refunds so the delays have to be logged by GWR.  South Western Railway are excellent so this is not a national issue.

items.title: Do not trust them
items.review_text: The refund policy is misleading. I was very disappointed with the way they handled refunds due to recent industrial disruption. I wouldn’t use them again. Awful company.

items.title: Train Cancelled
items.review_text: Return journey from Paddington to Bristol was cancelled (same as my outbound journey).

items.title: The staff are rude
items.review_text:
The staff are rude. No customer service.  
Trains never on time and cost to much. This is why I now drive. They are always on strike the platform station dispatch a train and then go back in they office until the next train comes in.  They need to get into the real world.

items.title: If I could give less than one  star I…
items.review_text: If I could give less than one  star I would. Prices are  way too high for the rubbish “service” they provide. Their employees are completely useless when it comes to ask for information. I was on a train and they change destination one minute before departure. It is just disgraceful. I feel I am being robbed by this organization. Less developed counties have better public transport than this. This service is led by thieves. Just shameful.

items.title: Dangerously Chaotic
items.review_text:
I do not mind the train was running late, despite you not bothering to inform passengers.
What I object to is everyone trying to board the train at once, blocking the platform and bumping into each other.
Dangerous & stressful.
I only just reached my carriage at the furthermost end of the 2 trains joined together, as the frantic beeping alarm sounded.
It was a dreadful experience.
First Class also has to be the worst first class ever & has changed hugely (for the worse) in the past decade I have been able to afford it.

items.title: Uk train services
items.review_text: Absolute crap service, the trains in this countryare an embarrassment. But It is hilarious how there's constant strikes for more pay and demands when the service they provideis so abysmal. Rude ignorant staff across the board, Packed into the train tighter than sardines, serioua safety risks ignored, if something went wrong it would cause serious harm if not death. Avoid and find an alternative way to travel..

items.title: Frustrating refund experience
items.review_text:
Frustrating refund experience
I was emailed that train has been cancelled, spent ages trying to claim refund - clunky, difficult and frustrating experience. Hats off to Avanti who seem to have a much more sensible system. Still don't know if my claim has gone through.

items.title: CPassengers being treated with contempturrently on a train that was due to…
items.review_text: Currently on a train that was due to leave Paddingto at 12 today. Left at 12.20. Was due in Temple Meads at 1.38. Now 15.00 hours and we are sitting at Bath Station, Excuses, Excuses flowing from  GWR

items.title: Unsafe service whilst obviously pregnant
items.review_text: Travelled on their train to London Paddington whilst pregnant and over-crowding was so bad it was not safe. Couldn't get to the toilet the whole journey, despite trying, pushed into seats trying to get to my reserved seat and no staff to ask for help as they couldn't get around the train either. When I complained via email they did nothing to make up for the issue. It wouldn't be so bad if it wasn't ridiculously expensive. Seeing all the bad reviews they are obviously not interested. Concerned it won't be safe to travel with them again to see my family.

items.title: I paid an extra £20 to travel on and the service was just as bad…
items.review_text: I paid an extra £20 to travel on an earlier train home this evening to avoid the overcrowding and usual rubbish over will the seat reservation system be working or not. However, the earlier 18.50 train was reduced to 5 carriages instead of 9, there was no seat reservation system on the train, and because it was so overcrowded the trolley service was suspended. If this was a one off, it would be OK, but almost every train out of Paddington I have been on for the last 6 months - 12 in total - has had an issue. I have complained 3-4 times and you get the same patronising rubbish about how much extra capacity they have put in. Funny that, because I am on an overcrowded train every journey back from Paddington to Bristol Parkway.

items.title: An absolutely appalling set of journeys…
items.review_text: An absolutely appalling set of journeys over the past few days. My partner and I travelled from Worcester to Bristol return with our bikes, on both train journeys we were treated awfully, train conductors were almost offended because we had bikes and it was like they found us to be a problem even though we had done NOTHING wrong. On the return train the doors were open for what felt like 30 seconds not giving my partner enough time to get off with his bike after me. I shouted to the train conductor to please wait and all she did was blow her whistle and say it was ‘too late’???? This caused my partner to have to get off at the NEXT station almost 20 minute drive away and all we got was a TOO LATE? If you are taking your bikes on the train then it’s not worth train conductors being so rude to you for no reason. I won’t be getting on any trains for a very long time - disgusting.

items.title: Consistently appalling service on the…
items.review_text: Consistently appalling service on the London Paddington to Hereford service. Trains cancelled regularly for no reason, always late to arrive when running, often with a reduced number of carriages forcing standing room only. Absolute failure of regulation that this company still exists. An embarrassment to the UK frankly.

items.title: We Trialled a Train Trip
items.review_text:
We trialled alighting a train from Thatcham to Reading on 09/08/2023 we were a party of 8.
Having read most stations are not to be manned I immediately used the self serve ticket machine on the platform. Only to discover 1. You can’t get group discount of a third off on machine 2. It will not issue more then three tickets on one payment. BUT no where did it say this!
Fortunately for us my colleague noticed there was a woman manning the ticket office so we received brilliant service, the discount and all 8x tickets on one receipt.
PLEASE CAN YOU UPDATE YOUR DISPLAY SCREENS????

Reading station was clean, lifts worked for our limited mobility adult plus rainbow bench a huge photo opportunity. Thanks for upgrading the station.

items.title: Utter shambles
items.review_text:
It is impossible to do something as simple as buy a ticket online.

I am required to login to my account, but I have forgotten the password so ask for a password reset.  An email is promptly sent but the time by which I am required to reset my password has already expired!  So it is impossible to reset my password.

In the end I bought my ticket using another rail company where my login details are recognised.

If I had been able to award zero stars I would have done so.

This outfit is an utter shambles!

items.title: Total rubbish - more delays
items.review_text: Another journey on GWR and surprise surprise yet another delay - 20 minutes at present and counting - I don’t think GWR will ever be able to run on time - totally beyond its abilities! Delay repay isn’t enough to motivate them - think if train delayed by 15 minutes you should receive a full refund!

items.title: Absolute joke and a rip off
items.review_text:
The trainline towards Hereford and Gloucester with GWR is an absolute joke. With the train ticket prices they rip people off with you would expect to have your seat reservation as a minimum. However, my 6 (!) last consecutive journeys within past month on this line have been a) insanely expensive vs service received b) trains cancelled or delayed c) in no service there has been seat allocation (=seat reservation cancelled, but not compensated in price) d) not enough space to host all the passengers with a ticket, because they don’t run full length trains for whatever mad reason e) wifi never works (great service for commuters).

GWR is by far the poorest trainline I’ve used to go anywhere from London. You really get nothing for the high price you pay for.

items.title: Continuing 'non service). From GWR, just like the trains.
items.review_text:
An update to my previous review....
GWR have finally got around to emailing me.
The problem is they have ignored all my emails and tel calls explaining the situation.
The result is that after nearly a month of tel calls and emails from me, I am no further forward as the reply is totally useless to me.
Am I dealing with humans or a robot who thinks it funny to ignore the customer's responses to their correspondence.
I cannot tell you how extremely angry and frustrated I am.
Perhaps this is the point, to make me go away...

items.title: Really helpful staff
items.review_text: Cancellation due to strike meant travelling later on another train without seat reservations.  Staff onboard could not have been more helpful finding us seats as in group of five including children. Clear announcements of what was happening, very impressed

items.title: Changing date of 'anytime' ticket
items.review_text: I'm happy that I was able to change my 'anytime' ticket date without it incurring a fee.

items.title: Terrible Service and Attitude
items.review_text: I booked and paid for a (e)ticket online while in Taiwan I got a booking reference and proof of purchase. I noticed a message saying the App doesn't always work abroad. Didn't think much about it. I got to Paddington in the late evening GWR offices were closed. I took the 11.45 pm train to Cornwall. I only then noticed there seemed to be a technical glitch as I couldn't find the ticket. The onboard inspector was understanding (he could see the proof of purchase etc). However, when I got to Truro, the ticket revenue employee demanded I pay for a second ticket despite me showing I had already paid for a valid ticket for that particular train. I wrote to GWR customer services 100% certain I would get a refund.  But, no refund, just went on that I didn't travel with a valid ticket... TLDR this company has gone downhill so badly, from being a trusted company, to being a technically incompetent bully.  Dreadful attitude. The fish rots from the head I suppose. They should be happy when passengers pay for journeys and be reasonable when something goes wrong ( with their systems).  ps. After looking at GWR response below, didn't I make myself clear? Did they actually read my 'review'? I only got angry AFTER the response from the Customer Services Complaint team. Bad service and lacking common sense is one thing, doubling down on it, is completely unacceptable (and shooting yourself in the foot as a company)

items.title: Train was disgusting
items.review_text: Train was disgusting. Literally, filthy. God knows what people from other countries landing in Gatwick think. Does cleaning exist??

items.title: Absolutely fabulous service
items.review_text: Absolutely fabulous service, clean train, great friendly staff and a tea trolley on board. Will definitely use GWR again. Thank you.

items.title: Health and safety worries over this company.
items.review_text: Another day of failure today,on every occasion i've travelled on GWR this year its been late ,you just expect it these days.This is the experience i had from the dirty toilets and chaotic scenes in Paddington (which also seems to be the norm these days)the train was worse than the 1103 am from Delhi to Bangalore ,it was packed to the rafters with no movement either way up and down the carriage with people falling over cases ,large cases dangling off the overheads and arguments over seat reservations,refreshments again as on previous occasions cancelled as no one could move up or down the carriage it wasn't until 2 and a half hours in until there was enough space to get to the toilet and when i did it looked like and smelt like a cow shed.How anyone wasn't injured is a miracle,if there ever was an accident or fire i would be very surprised if there wasn't a large fatality count (just wonder if their insurers are ready for it) and again late by 48 minutes.This has finally finished me off ,im off to London again in 6 weeks and have come home and booked the National Express coach,which yes takes an extra 2 hours but at least its one seat per person with no one standing falling on you bags securely under the bus and you can actually get to the toilet when you want to.This countries train service is now 3rd world any visitor to this country must have their eyes opened to what state we are in.

items.title: Extremely poor service  GWR service from Hereford to…
items.review_text: The GWR service from Hereford to Paddington has been checking since Covid. Every day of every week there is delays. Strikes are one thing but it’s not just that. It’s lack of staff, lack of rolling stock. Endless delays and cancellations. It’s been a living hell commuting to London from Moreton. It used to work like clockwork - not now. I’ve lost complete faith in the service and it’s not cheap and when you try to get compensation you get £4! Refund. Never mind that I’ve missed my key business meeting and spent far too long on a platform waiting for my train. It’s so poor that I’m going to consider driving into London again. I never thought I’d say that. GWR you need to get a grip!

items.title: Appalling
items.review_text:
Appalling. 

They forgot to send me QR code. I asked in advance if they could resend it. Answer was a flat and very rude no. I tried to board the train with my ticket and receipt they said no. Asked the station to help me. A man behind the desk told me it wasn't his problem. I asked if he worked for GWR he said yes but who why on earth would I think I could get a QR code at the station. He took enjoyment from the fact that I'd only been sent the ticket part and said it wasn't his problem. I asked if there was a manager I could speak to he said no. I was told by the website team to just buy a new ticket. I said I can't afford to. They said they would write it all down and make sure it's recorded so I get refunded but I wouldn't be allowed on the train. I was never refunded. They said they will not refund me because I didn't purchase another ticket. I said that would have put me £220 in debt. I never made it to Plymouth.

items.title: I boarded a GWR Train at Reading with 2…
items.review_text:
I boarded a GWR Train at Reading with 2 minutes to spare as my Cross Country Train from Southampton was running behind schedule. I got onto the Train and the first thing that I noticed it was packed. I walked down 2 Carriages and there were even People sitting on the floor despite having paid for a Ticket. Admitted that it was a Sunday the 6th instant and I guess People were heading home despite the fact it was just after 5pm. After having gone through 2 Carriages I noted the First Class being virtually empty. Rather than having People sit on the Floor all the way to Paddington,bearing in mind they have paid probably an extortionate price, why not downgrade one of the First Class Carriages and let People sit in comfort? 
I saw an empty Carriage and said to Robert who was on Duty that I had a bad cold so he said nothing and I remained seated and he even offered me some water.
Blow me down 5 minutes later Mr Ticket Inspector comes along and rudely demands £10 extra. I told him that Robert never told me to move whereupon Mr Ticket Inspector was virtually shoving the Machine under my Face and demanding extra money.
I left in disgust.
Lesson to be learned
Manners Maketh Man as my Dad used to say to me.
Go back to School Mr Ticket Inspector and learn something called manners
I shall be bringing The Health and Safety Executive into this and a Screenshot of this message will be sent.
GWR you are putting your Passengers at risk by allowing them to sit on the Floor. 
What if the Emergency Brake were to be pulled. There were People sitting by the Doors that would have been at risk plus anyone sitting anywhere on the Floor could have been thrown by the impact of the sudden stop
As for me, I got a seat eventually as a previously gready person taking up 2 seats ( one with Luggage) lifted said item onto his Lap when I flashed my over 60 Senior Rail Card
Disgusting performance GWR leaving 2 Carriages virtually empty and have everyone else being treated like Cattle in a Cattle Truck

items.title: What an absolute rip off.
items.review_text:
What an absolute rip off of a company.
Prices way higher than other rail company’s.
Garbage trains with hugely overpriced tickets!
Disgraceful!!

items.title: Rude train sales woman
items.review_text: If I could give this less than half a star I would. All these strikes so the staff can have more money and yet they can't speak to customers with even a small amount of decency. Cutting me off as I was talking and lecturing me on tickets. Extremely ill mannered thats for sure. Also to do it in front of my 3 young children is vile. Should have a pay rise and use it to go to charm school

items.title: we were going to london on a gwr train
items.review_text: we were going to london on a gwr train. but they didn't tell us the train was cancelled. we've been trying to get our money back for 3 months. it is the worst website ever. you can't make a complaint, and when you do get a complaint through, it just deletes. i believe that they don't want you to put a complaint, because they won't get any money out of it. they don't even deserve a 1 star review.

items.title: GWR the worst
items.review_text: Bought a ticket for a short journey at a cost of £3. Unknowingly turns out my railcard was expired so the ticket was about £1 more. Rather than asking I pay the extra amt they seek to impose a £55 penalty.Absolutely ridiculous that companies like this allowed to do this and get away with it.

items.title: Welcome to GWR
items.review_text:
Welcome to GWR, where our trains leave mainly late, sometimes early, never on time.

Dashed for train this evening at Bodmin Parkway due to late running bus, only to see train sauntering out of station early. Guard saw me arriving on platform before train left, made no effort to hold train up until actual departure time. Led to an hour's wait in Bodmin. Just when I think GWR can't find another way to make my life a misery, they pull this little beauty out of the bag...

items.title: An absolute disgrace of a company.
items.review_text:
An absolute disgrace of a company.

These trains couldn't turn up on time even if the useless thick operators lives depended on it.

I have had to get the train 5 times in the last month, with a connecting train at Exeter st David's from either Pinhoe or Digby and Sowton.

It won't be a shock for most people on here (hence the 2 Star approval rating) to hear none of them were on time and 5/5 times made me miss my connection train.. and these idi0ts are on strike?!?! Get your service actually working before you even think of a pay rise an absolute joke.

If anyone works there and sees this do your job properly you lazy useless bunch of...

items.title: OMG!!!! RUBBISH
items.review_text: Trains always late, or cancelled which is causing my job to be unsafe dude to being late to work etc...   The app is absolute sh always crashes or when you buy a ticket the app wont open to show the ticket ending in having to buy a physical ticket. The app was probably made by a 7 ear old...

items.title: Excellent service from GWR customer…
items.review_text:
Excellent service from GWR customer support. Contacted them regarding incorrect information on their website. They updated the information very quickly, and kept me informed of progress.
Were prompt and also very polite - wish all companies had such a good team!!

items.title: utterly horrendous service
items.review_text: utterly horrendous service. A complete cesspit of delays, filthy trains and useless staff. The entire operation is a disgrace.

items.title: Great Service!
items.review_text:
Great rail service! Elizabeth line keeps having disruption and this line is always available to step it and because of it I manage to get to work not that late. 

Thank you so much for this!

items.title: If you can drive.. drive
items.review_text:
If you can drive, drive! 

All the normal stuff - heating on in the train instead of a/c , no seat reservations and for a 2hr+ express journey they seem to think it’s ok to use an uncomfortable “commuter” type train which means no space for any luggage in the overhead compartments, exceptionally noisy, uncomfortable seats with less space with no ability to work and no food or drinks service … o yes and filthy trains too :)

items.title: When travelling from London to Exeter…
items.review_text:
When travelling from London to Exeter yesterday the ticket officer was very patronising in manner to customers. When she got to us she rapped her scanned down on the table in front of my daughter who had been sleeping and said ‘ no one is listening’ . She has autism and was wearing noise cancellers. I said she was with me and was quite shocked she did that…..she then scanned my codes and it seems they were the ones for the cancelled train I had purchased. I had tickets for this new train at extra cost to me , and we were sat in the reserved seats . I showed the jnfo for this booking, however I was struggling to access the wifi to show the email with the new tickets. ( I thought they were the ones I had given her) I had to make several changes due to the strikes and didnt delete original cancelled codes as was worried about deleting the wrong ones)
She was rude, instantly said I had to pay for new tickets and I refused as I had tickets. Then the penalty was brought out. When i eventually managed to locate the correct codes she just scanned them and said nothing. I felt like a criminal and told her so. Poor carriage full of people who had to endure this….. sorry …… but I am not prepared to be bullied by people like her when I had done nothing wrong. She ruined my trip and caused great distress. Very very bad attitude towards law abiding people.

items.title: I travel from Iver  station in bucks…
items.review_text:
I travel from Iver  station in bucks most days into London. 
Where sometimes the train service is self  completely out of sync on dome days 
. I had to write a comment on the actual staff at the station 
it is first class and I can only say that the experience that I’ve had there has been nothing more than five star  if other stations gave this service I think the reviews the great Western  would get woukd  be so much better. Well done Iver 👏👏 and to all the people who work there from one very happy customer

items.title: Nightmare with next to no…
items.review_text: Nightmare with next to no air-conditioning

items.title: wow you put us on a cheap ass train…
items.review_text: wow you put us on a cheap ass train going cardiff to manchester. disgrace of a company i will be getting a refund. these trains are barley okay for 10minute joyrneys let alone 3 hours

items.title: Really pointless excercise
