items.review_text:
Really pointless excercise, GWR print on their information, you can get a refund on a return ticket, but  sent photo of ticket, copy of email confirming booking.
Not enough proof of purchase?
I don't expect a refund if I don't use something, but why offer it if you are not going to honour it?

items.title: Horrendous journey from Penzance to…
items.review_text:
Horrendous journey from Penzance to London on 25th June on 12.18pm. Had two seats booked together in carriage L. When got on the train, it didn't exist or did our reservation. The train was half the amount of carriages it should have had. Managed to get two seats but not together. When at Exeter, managed to get two seats together. At Taunton was asked to give up seats for an elderly couple, which we did and stood in the packed carriage. It was like a sardine can and could not even access the toilet. Staff said we would get refund if we wrote to GWR 1st class which I did; but nothing back. Only paid us back £11.30 for two tickets due to delay. This was not the first class experience I paid for and will be intouch with my credit card company for "goods as not described etc" 
Snacks had to be passed around, as the train staff could not get through. 
If I pay for first class, I expect first class and not having to stand in the middle of the carriage for nearly 2 hours.

items.title: Bad experience with Vincet on GWR 15:03 to Penzance
items.review_text:
It's because of experiences like this and Staffs like Vincet on the 15:03 to Penzance on 19th July, 2023, that the GWR has poor rating and bad customer experience.
Unfortunately didn't realise that I was traveling on an advance ticket which unfortunately permits me to travel on a specific time. 
Tried explaining to Vincent. He wouldn't even listen(no human feeling at all). Just wanted to issue me a new ticket of £60 when I already have a £123 ticket. 
I then told him to issue me a penalty(hoping to appeal and make the appeal team sea reason with me). This must have upset him. He just went funny on me. Smirking and giggling at anything I said after. Holding my ticket hostage(Apparently he wants to go get the people to issue me a ticket).
If you are not the one to issue me a ticket why not give me the ticket I paid for back and go get those people. 
No he refuse, continue to make fun of me with his funny attitude. 
This went on for like 10-15 minutes. Eventually the revenue team came through and took over the case. The 2 ladies were very nice. Issues me a ticket(fair, I hope to appeal it because I do have a ticket and the one I booked was more expensive than the other one there so I thought it was valid and never encountered an issue like this I didn't check it much)
Through out the time these ladies dealt with my case. They never held my ticket hostage. Gave it back when I asked. I even asked for some explanation why they gave me back my ticket when I asked and Vincet decided to find it hostage. No vivid explanation was offered except that it states on the ticket that this is a property of the train(even though it doesn't). You see lots of used tickets in the bin. That won't be the case if it's a property of the train.

items.title: Oven trains cr@p windows
items.review_text: OK I know it's a nation-widespread thing that trains are becoming more and more expensive as they're becoming more & more unreliable....but wt f is with the sealed windows even in the height of summertime heat???...I think paying almost a tenner for a mere return ticket should at the very least entitle u to not be boiled alive in a moving oven....I begged the ticket woman twice and she sort of half ass tried but just said if u move on down to the end of the train it's cooler....why should I have to do so??? Something as basic as functional windows if the aircon is crap or nonexistent should be at very least a right not a privilege

items.title: 1st Class Not Worth It
items.review_text: I would have liked to give no stars for this. GWR reduced our 10 carriage train to 5. We had 1st class seats with reservations however they removed the reservations because of the reduction of carriages. We were fortunate we managed to get a seat (albeit without a window right at the back). We paid just short of £100 for 2 1st class seats for comfort and refreshments but as they allowed standard class passengers to sit in the corridor they couldn't get through with the trolley. They said for safety they can't provide refreshments. They managed to walk through with water so I am at a loss why the crisps/biscuits/snack boxes could not be carried through with the reason given was for safety, hot drinks I agree there is a safety issue but the snacks could have been carried through. We contacted Customer Services to complain as the staff on the train told us to do that, but Customer Services couldn't care less. They requested copies of the train tickets which we provided and they basically said its better to run a train with less carriages than to have it cancelled and nothing about not having the refreshments we had paid for. Why ask for ticket proof if that was going to be the response. Had the train been cancelled at least we would have been given our money back on the delay repay and potentially had a better service on a later train. This train was packed so they made money on that and also saved money because they did not provide refreshments to all the first class passengers who had paid for them on that train. I will avoid this company in the future unless it goes back into public ownership.

items.title: Lovely ticket inspector
items.review_text: I caught the 5.51 from Exeter to Reading on the 18th July. I had had some upsetting news and a female ticket collector came over to offer me sympathy and some tissues. What a lovely lady. First Great Western you should be proud of her!

items.title: What an absolute mess this company is
items.review_text: What an absolute mess this company is. Buy a ticket, which they’re happy to take your money for, and then 12 hours later, once I’ve gotten up early and walked to the station, they’ve cancelled the train due to strikes. The people that work for this company haven’t a clue what a hard days work and it shows. What an absolute joke. The company should just shut down all together, seems they staff are better at sitting around all day doing nothing than attempting to work.

items.title: Not enough carriage ,train from…
items.review_text: Not enough carriage ,train from Southampton to Cardiff was completely over crowded .not enough room for luggage . I boarded the train at Westbury there was no where to sit .one man had been stood from Southampton to Cardiff extra carriage were needed

items.title: Booked a return ticket Exeter to…
items.review_text: Booked a return ticket Exeter to Torquay. Got to Torquay fine. Return train 22:45 was cancelled, absolutely no explanation. Had to pay to get a bus to Newton Abbot and then a taxi back to Exeter. Another fantastic service by GWR 🙄

items.title: Nothing great about GWR today
items.review_text: Nothing great about GWR today. Arrived to find the parking meter’s in constant reboot. Finally got a ticket to find cafe closed absolutely no chance at costa, 2 staff trying to serve everyone in the station. Never mind we’ll get a coffee on the train, oh no we won’t no catering service on the PADDINGTON train today. Fabulous GWR no wonder we only use you when we absolutely have to and still you charge top dollar!!!!!

items.title: No way to treat anyone
items.review_text:
The lift was broken at Exeter St Davids and I needed a hand with my suitcase. The man who carried mine was foul, insulting and abusive. I was so upset that I collapsed into a heap on the floor of the train and couldn't stop crying. I am disabled and don't have long to live. My disability is invisible but I am in constant pain and struggle to breath due to cancer. I made a complaint and was told there would be an investigation but I would hear no more. Unacceptable - surely a refund and apology would be appropriate and the opportunity for me to tell the man about the effect his behaviour had on me. This was an opportunity for conciliation and learning which was lost. It's awful travelling as a disabled person and has made the end of my life more challenging. I now stay at home....it's not worth the risk

UPDATE: letter from GWR saying refunds not offered as people could make up incidents. What happened to me was witnessed by a train manager. Not sure why you bother GWR - your 'investigation' was meaningless and insulting. Shame on you

items.title: Crooks
items.review_text: 3 times I have made claims for delayed or cancelled trains. 1 claim was rejected because I didn't provide the ticket. I informed GWR that the ticket was retained by the ticket machine at Cardiff Central. I received no acknowledgment of the other 2 claims. I sent manual applications which because its free post you can't send them recorded delivery so there is no proof of them being delivered and when challenged they say they didn't receive them. Waste if time trying to deal with these scammers.

items.title: What a joke of a train company no hot…
items.review_text:
What a joke of a train company no hot drinks coming out 
Then sold a anytime return only to find not a anytime return 
£95 for a dreadful service better to drive 
Always late and a dreadful service 
SHAME ON GWR

items.title: Shocking experience due to no refund
items.review_text: Shocked and appalled. Can’t provide refund for the journey they were unable to provide for the tickets I booked on their website.

items.title: Seating Comfort & Assistance
items.review_text: Travelling in 1st Class for a fairly short journey however the staff on-board were still very helpful and offered me a drink however, from a limited menu as I boarded the train late in its journey. The seating in 1st Class is very comfortable and feels secure, it's also quite quiet on-board and is overall a nice experience for a short journey.

items.title: Top rated train journey
items.review_text: Lovely train trip from Bodmin to Exeter. Loos at Bodmin were spotless, staff friendly and helpful on platforms and trains. Trains clean. Buffet sandwich delicious. Whole experience was top rate and far better than going north recently.

items.title: Poor Treatment of Customers on GWR Falmouth to Truro Route
items.review_text:
I strongly dislike the way this company treats its customers, particularly on the route between Falmouth and Truro. The entire experience is consistently unpleasant. Their approach to customer service leaves much to be desired, as they manage to make passengers feel unwelcome and tense. The staff treats everyone as potential criminals until they provide proof of their tickets and railcards. It's a given that they will check your tickets and railcards without fail. 

If you attempt to purchase a ticket on board, you will promptly be scolded for not buying it at one of the smaller stations along the Falmouth to Truro route or online. If the company insists on policing everyone, it would make everyone's lives easier if they installed gates, clearly indicating that the only way to board is by purchasing a ticket in advance. Alternatively, they could at least put up some signs to inform passengers of the proper procedures.

Recently, I witnessed an elderly lady, between 80 and 90 years old, attempting to buy a ticket on board. She was completely shocked to learn that she would be fined next time and that she must acquire a ticket prior to boarding. This is particularly concerning considering that some people only use their service once a year or may have difficulties with their memory. Additionally, the machine at the Penryn station is hidden from plain view, making it easy for passengers to forget to purchase their tickets. To make matters worse, there have been instances where the machine has food smeared on the screen, making it even more difficult to purchase tickets. These issues are clearly evident from the accounts of other unhappy customers. It's disheartening to see how the company makes its customers feel, especially considering that it has only been six months since they installed new machines and everyone is well aware of the strict ticket checks.

Edit: 

Thank you for taking the time to respond and provide the link GWR. I appreciate your confirmation of the policy. While I understand and respect the need for ticket checks, I would like to emphasise the importance of a customer-friendly approach. It can be discouraging and stressful when customers, who have valid tickets and railcards, feel intimidated and stressed during the process.
I have noticed that some passengers still believe it is possible to purchase tickets onboard the small service between Falmouth and Truro, which suggests a gap in communication. Installing ticket gates and clear signage directing customers to the ticket machines or online options could be effective in ensuring everyone boards with appropriate tickets.
Continuing to make honest and paying customers uncomfortable may discourage them from using the service and potentially lead to them seeking alternative means of transport. Additionally, it could create a sense of hostility within the community.
I genuinely believe that by adopting a more customer-centric approach, the overall experience for both passengers and staff can be greatly improved. Thank you again for your attention to this matter.

items.title: Poorly designed trains, expensive tickets.
items.review_text:
Poorly designed trains, not enough seating, not DDA suitable, what century do you operate in? 

Tickets are outrageously priced!

items.title: Bloody awful
items.review_text: I'm travelling to London from Cornwall. I paid for 1st class so I ASSUMED I wouldn't have to think about food became it's part of the package. But breakfast? Nothing except biscuits or a mystery snack box (bread sticks, hummus, pretzels - all mini). Then we get to lunchtime and... No food on Sundays, just the choice of biscuits or a mini snack box (see breakfast). I can't eat 2 snack boxes - nutritionally terrible. So I'm bloody hangry instead. And furious that I've paid so much more money for nothing. Absolutely appalling and unacceptable. And this is after my outward journey was delayed 3 hours and GWR is trying to reject my refund request. To say I furious is an understatement. How is this a justifyable service? Shoddy shoddy shoddy service.

items.title: We were served by Nicola in the ticket…
items.review_text:
We were served by Nicola in the ticket office at Torquay Railway Station this afternoon. 

She was extremely helpful, friendly and professional - a credit to GWR. 

I find it hard to believe that a decision may be made to close all ticket offices.

items.title: Manager tried to cancel the service due…
items.review_text: Manager tried to cancel the service due to "too many bugs being on the train" - unanimous dissaproval from everybody onboard - forced them to continue. This kind of thing only happens in the UK, where we pay more than anyone anywhere in the world for public transport.

items.title: Travelling home to Penzance i now…
items.review_text:
Travelling home to Penzance i now always drive and leave the car at Family members near Newbury since the HSTs were taken out and replaced with the tinpot uncomfortable seats in the Hitachi carriages.
I had the misfortune of having to use the so called service given by the lines operator Poor Western trains last week.
Overcrowded i gave my seat up for an elderly lady stood 3/4 of the journey. Toilet facilities disgusting, No refreshments though i always bring my own ! Once bitten!
The seats are the most uncomfortable i have ever sat, ticket prices extortionate, passenger information none existant. If like me you dont not do social media.
Im not surprised i know Mark Hopwood from my BR days so no surprises with the company.

items.title: I cannot recommend this railway enough.
items.review_text:
I cannot recommend this railway enough.
On the 03/07/23 my friend and I were traveling from Ruben to London Marybone but ended up on the wrong train.
We ended up in Hereford and the staff there were excellent and put us on another train from there to Paddington.
We were looked after tremendously by B Skinley and a lovely lady who was serving drinks etc 
Great customer service.well done you guy's.

items.title: Terrible website and customer service
items.review_text: I tried to book a ticket through the GWR website, the money was taken from my account but no ticket was issued. When I queried this with GWR it was my card issuers fault and not theirs. I needed the ticket so booked again using the GWR app, exactly the same thing happened. I contacted customer services to once again be told it was my card issuers fault. I am now waiting for £108 to be returned to my account and I have no ticket. Terrible customer service, a website that is unfit for purpose and an app that doesn't work. Avoid buying tickets from them, use train pal or trainline.

items.title: Not even ok western
items.review_text:
That was the worst train trip ever, more people than seats, standing room only. Quite certain having so many people wedged into corridors completely blocking them off is against your own safety standards. To top it off the broken toilet, stinking up the entry was just an added bonus. 

Never again, next time I’ll take a coach!!

items.title: Pretty bad service
items.review_text:
Pretty bad service. I literally can’t remember the last time I travelled (I regularly do Taunton to London return) when there wasn’t a problem. 
If they’re running at all and not striking, cancelled, diverted or late 95% of the time meaning people miss connections at Reading, there’s usually an issues on the train. Always something, toilet doesn’t work, they run out of water both times drink and to wash hands, they’ve over booked the train, or it’s over 30 minutes late. They then tell you you can claim compensation for that, whenever I’ve tried, using the reference number they read out, they’ve denied it! 
  Then they keep jacking up the prices so you end up paying more for the usual poor service. If there were an alternative, I’d take it.

items.title: First Class doesn’t deliver
items.review_text:
We  travelled F/C CPM to PAD on 29 June and returned at 1500 from PAD the next day. 
Positives: 
1) The return train was on time.
2) The new F/C seats and coach were clean with useful plugs and usb ports.
3) The outbound stewardess was friendly and pleasant.
4) Our tickets were checked on the journey.
Negatives: General
5) It’s a pity that the seats have no form of lumbar support.
6) It’s a pity the website doesn’t give access to the seat layout on booking, as do airlines.
Negatives: Specific 
7) The outbound journey suffered a creeping delayed departure of 20 minutes.
8) On the outbound sector, although offered a coffee and fruit cake, the catering trolley didn’t come through the coach. We had to enquire if that was the only choice. 
9) On the much busier return sector:
a) Our booked seats were occupied. As they were showing ‘Available’ the fault didn’t lie with the family occupying them.
b) We didn’t see a staff member on the journey.
c) There was no catering.

items.title: Let down by this rip of service!
items.review_text: Once again let down  by this service last Sunday  came back from return fare to Paignton  which cost me a fortune! On my return  journey  this train was  late..again! I do not remember  how late it was but it was late....called a number and ask for help....the women on the phone was not helpful at all, as s result I put the phone down as she made me feel very frustrated...no one wants to help As they make it so difficult  to get a refund! Sick to death of trainline & Great Western  Travel it's all about them making money & not carring about  the customer are they both connected?

items.title: Disappointing at best
items.review_text: From staff that are impatient toward passengers with hidden disabilities to plug sockets that don't work, uncomfortable seats and trains that haven't seen a decent clean for a while it was a most disappointing experience travelling with GWR. Considering the price of tickets these days you'd have thought they'd use some of their billions to update the trains or at least make sure the existing ones have working sockets and clean carriages. The only reason they deserve a star at all is the fact they ran on time for once.

items.title: Unfair business
items.review_text: They have something really dodgy with the railcards. They as a policy don’t remind you that it’s expired, then hire people on commission to catch people with expired railcards. I got fined by forgetting when I would have of course renewed if I knew… I think that’s unfair business practice

items.title: Expensive, uncomfortable and a little misleading
items.review_text: Such a lot of money for such a poor service. I travelled from Somerset to meet my sister for a trip to the theatre in London. I only needed a one day Travel card. The CHEAPEST ticket was £99.80. I caught the 10:42 from Taunton (which was on time- miraculously) I had a seat booking which I was told by another passenger was void because the previous train had been cancelled. I would have liked to leave London about 5:30pm, but if I had done that my one day travel card would have gone up to over £125- which is just ridiculous for one day. The earliest cheapest train I could catch was 19:04, which was much later than I wanted to leave. I had a seat booking for this train too, and had requested a window so I could see where the train was. The train left approximately 20 minutes late, got slower and arrived just after 9:20pm, not 20:47 as it was timetabled to. My booked seat was not a window, it was a blank wall- why was I given seat 92 as a window when it's a blank wall? This is not the same. Expensive and unreliable- do better!

items.title: Again having to stand Hanborough
items.review_text: Again having to stand Hanborough - London again. Allocated seats not honoured, unable to work….

items.title: My train from Paignton to Bristol on…
items.review_text:
My 20.06 train from Paignton to Bristol Temple Meads on 24/06/23 was cancelled. 

GWR states: "If you abandoned your journey due to ... cancellation you can claim for a "Journey Cancelled/Disrupted" refund. Despite this, they refused my compensation claim, saying I could have made up for all but 7 minutes of lost time by travellling to Newton Abbot, then on to Bristol. 

GWR have many grounds for rejecting genuine refund claims. However, their revenue inspectors accept no excuses from passengers travelling without the correct ticket.
.

items.title: Not worth it, time to buy a car.
items.review_text:
As usual, cancelled and left stranded in a city with the next available train only tomorrow at 5 am, so 100 pounds for a hotel plus cab to get to the station.
I have had the pleasure to travel quite a bit and the UK trains overall are some of the worst, chaos and cancellations define them. Terrible experience as a client, no compensation for loss of money due to their cancellations, constantly struggling.

items.title: Great Service from staff
items.review_text:
Staff helpful, polite and informative at all times. My 3rd trip in a year and GWR have always been absolutely brilliant. I have used other services but I now try to book with GWR due to their efficiency and efforts to maintain great customer services. 
The passenger assistance service is fantastic 👌 every time.

items.title: Well done crews!
items.review_text:
Sunday 25th June
2023 Paddington to Newport 
via Swindon and Gloucester 
due Severn Tunnel closed

There were two crews, with crew change at Swindon at 2115. The standard of the journey was excellent despite its extended length. Both crews were marvellous, friendly too. In particular the Swindon crew were fantastically caring and proactive in the face of a couple of difficulties.

Well done all!

items.title: This train company is terrible
items.review_text:
This train company is terrible. Couldnt even get on my train hat i paid iver £200 for and have to arrive 2 hours late. This company is a joke.
Finally get on 2nd train. Only to find i have to sit here for 4 hours without power to charge my phone cos this train is sooo old the power outlets dont even work.

items.title: Did a Plymouth to London 25/6 and the…
items.review_text: Did a Plymouth to London 25/6 and the return 26/6. Absolutely amazing service, really friendly, polite and professional staff throughout my journey. Station staff, trolly service (Matt) and train manager were superb on both trains and I couldn’t recommend them any higher. I will travel again on this service. Thank you.

items.title: worst experience of my life
items.review_text: Train was late and was so overcrowded I spent an hour and a half sitting on the floor wedged between a bicycle and an open toilet door (which stank of pee) on a ridiculously hot day. Worst rail experience of my life. Trains in third world countries are better.

items.title: Disgusting
items.review_text:
Missed a GWR train due to having to arrange emergency response for a member of the public, and their purposefully unhelpful staff at Paddington station.

It took multiple emails for them to agree to a goodwill gesture of less than £20 to cover the new "on the day" ticket I needed to complete my journey.

Disgusting.

items.title: Travelled to London on the 19th
items.review_text:
Travelled to London on the 19th.  Train from Exeter delayed then the service was withdrawn at Reading. 
Return journey on the 20th from Paddington left on time only to be withdrawn at Reading.  Not a very pleasant experience.  What makes matters worse is the poor communication to passengers. We are basically left to work out how to complete our journey.  A railway company not fit for purpose

items.title: More wasted taxpayers money
items.review_text: Reading train station. 4 trains supposed to be going to London 30 minutes late minimum. What an excellent service. 21:55, 22:04, 22:25 and the 22:55. So now I am walking from Wimbledon to Croydon, due to the incompetence of GWE, this is precisely the reason when I don't use the railways. 1 train I can understand, but all the trains going to London

items.title: Started as delayed by 30 min eventually…
items.review_text: Started as delayed by 30 min eventually delayed and hour. Also they must have most uncomfortable seats on the network

items.title: GWR service Reading to Gloucester
items.review_text: If i could give zero i would. A journey taking an hour and a half has taken me 3!!!! Trains rammed, late, and filthy. Wont be using a train again any time soon.

items.title: Overcrowded constantly and every train…
items.review_text: Overcrowded constantly and every train journey I take for the past 12 months has been delayed. I make at least  8 journeys per month from totnes to London and there is always an issue. As for delay repayment they never have paid out

items.title: Every day this week the Trains are…
items.review_text: Every day this week the Trains are delayed then cancelled. Every day it’s a different excuse, too hot, congestion, bad points, no drivers. As a regular user of the Truro to Falmouth train this happens throughout the year, every year. You can never rely on them, avoid if using for an important journey

items.title: Train breaking down
items.review_text: Delays, trains breaking down, d stations, no help desk…. They should pay you to travel with them, not the opposite

items.title: The train was late due to the manager…
items.review_text:
The train was late due to the manager oversleeping! Got to London after the meeting I went for ended. 

When I tried ti make a claim for my lost journey, they wouldn’t process it because it was after 28 days (only a few days late) as a result of disabilities. Apparently they aren’t bothered about people with disabilities.

items.title: Take your car don't bother with train
items.review_text: If you going on journey take your car far easier, trying to claim compensation for 2 hour 20 minute journey took over 5 hours in the end but company making it hard for me to claim so looks like lost a day of my life and can't get money back. Never going to use trains again

items.title: Always on strike
items.review_text: Always on strike, absolutely ridiculous, even when they are running 80% of the trains I’ve got are on strike. The prices for how diabolical the service is are ridiculous. Selfish people.

items.title: First Class rip off.
items.review_text: I paid extra for First Class travel as it was a special occasion and I had never travelled First Class before, but the train was so crowded that no trolley service came round. I should at least be offered a refund of the difference between Standard Class and First Class as it was not my fault that the train was so busy.

items.title: I couldn't make a claim for a refund…
items.review_text: I couldn't make a claim for a refund for a 90 minutes delayed because I claimed after more than the 28 days from the day of travel. Please make sure to be aware of this as this service deliberately hide this information

items.title: The worst company to ever…
items.review_text: The worst f****** company to ever exist, they have a total monopoly on train travel in the south but are the least competently run company I’ve had the misfortune of interacting with in my entire f****** life, always late or cancelled, paying for parking would be better

items.title: Well done Matt & Team!
items.review_text:
Currently on a train home from Cheltenham to Paddington, and unfortunately was on the receiving end of racial abuse from a bunch of little brats that were trying to hop on for a free ride.

Flagged the train staff who not only started dealing with it quickly, but had the train Manager Matt come and speak to them.

They were very quickly kicked off the train and the nicest part was that you can tell the staff actually care.

Matt has made sure I’m okay, and insisted on moving me up to first class to ensure the rest of my journey home is a good one.

It could easily have been ignored, or they could have asked me to move/moved the kids, but they made sure I was the one that was being considered.

While having racial slurs thrown at me wasn’t fun, the response to the whole situation was brilliant.

Matt and his staff deserve recognition for going above and beyond.

items.title: Grim and grimey
items.review_text: The train carriages on the Paddington to Cornwall line are relatively new (approx 5 yrs old?). They are already in a disgusting state. Carpets are filthy ( who decided to carpet train carriages???!), corridors do not seem to be cleaned, and seat trays are covered in grime. Why is it that British public service infrastructure is so badly maintained? Why isn't there a maintenance plan for cleaning?

items.title: The Worst in Britain
items.review_text: Complete and utterly useless company. If they're not going on strike, they're upping the fairs. If they're not diverting you for no reason whatsoever, they're cancelling your journey without even warning you. They won't refund you, nor will they care if you're late. GWR is, in all honesty, the worst train operator in all of Britain.

items.title: This morning’s train from Taunton to…
items.review_text: This morning’s train from Taunton to Paddington was 40 mins late by the time it got to Taunton. Return home - delayed boarding then  sat on the train in Paddington for 30 mins before it eventually left. Happens regularly today was both journeys. Costs a fortune and this is the standard we get. Really really hacked off

items.title: Just awful very unreliable
items.review_text: Gave it one star because no stars is not an option.  I travel twice a week a literally every journey is either delayed, cancelled or short formed it makes my blood boil that we have no alternative.  Nobody would use this service through choice

items.title: Cancelled Train No refund
items.review_text: The train was cancelled, from London to Oxford, and we had to go to another station to catch another train. The help at the station was poor as well and no empathy. When we tried to claim for the delay in the journey the website was crashing. Tried a few days and this was the case. Then we spoke to customer services and was told to email with detail to get the claim processed. Now they want to refuse as it is beyond 28 days. Very appalling attitude and service causing a lot of aggravation and inconvenience. Making money out of others misery.

items.title: Pay rise, price rise what joke.
items.review_text:
This company must have a policy for employing from the bottom end of the food chain.
So far today Railtrack can't repair anything, drivers can't be bothered to turn up and then they cancel the service halfway through the 8 mile journey.
Complete waste of space, with employees that should thank themselves lucky they get paid at all.

items.title: COMPENSATION what compensation?
items.review_text:
COMPENSATION
Can anyone tell me, why GWR call it compensation, when actually all they are doing is refunding less than the actual amount a passenger has already paid for a journey.

How can they call this compensation??

items.title: Ridiculously Priced & Poor Service
items.review_text:
I‘m all for encouraging people to use the train but charging people £60+ for a Peak return ticket from Reading to London is absolutely ridiculous. Especially when you consider that in other countries like Germany you can use public transport as often as you want for a month for only €49!
And they are mot even delivering on services that warrant such prices. Often trains are delayed or downright cancelled. And this is ignoring the strikes which is just a further sign of the company‘s greed for not even passing these extortionate prices on to their employees as salaries.
Trains in the UK are a public good and should definitely be nationalised

items.title: Every time I sit on their trains … I’m…
items.review_text:
Every time I sit on their trains … I’m late. These lot could make you late when you’ve got no time to be anywhere.

Avoid

items.title: Train staff
items.review_text: Was on train that unfortunately hit a person just outside Slough just like to thank all staff on board for their professional service and support to everyone on board

items.title: GWR going  on strike  again
items.review_text: Going on strike  again  can Not run a service. Unreliable all they think about   is money and disruption   to passenger  getting  to work. Then they put up the train fair.  THIS NEED THE GOVERNMENT  TO STOP the strike  action  until they can run a train service.

items.title: First class is a complete waste of money
items.review_text: Unless you are travelling the Swansea / Paddington Service, GWR First Class doesn't have a refreshments trolley. So on a four-hour journey from Cardiff to Cornwall we couldn't get as much as a cuppa, or even a bottle of water. First class? They're having a laugh!

items.title: Extremely poor customer service from a Train Manager
items.review_text:
I now am uncertain of the role of a Train Manager; it is clearly not to help a passenger. We had our suitcase ‘taken’ from the 11.04 train from Paddington to Plymouth on Tuesday 16th May; only made aware of this when we came to leave the train at Taunton. The TM had a total disregard and was utterly dismissive for what had happened and his sole interest was to keep the train moving.  He didn’t take a name, description anything.  This is now in the hands of the Transport Police and lost property but no thanks to any input from him but from the assistance of staff at Taunton station. He had absolutely no customer service empathy and should be advised concerning this.

I hope no one else experiences this TM in these circumstances - a disgrace.

items.title: Paddington to Maidenhead service is…
items.review_text:
Paddington to Maidenhead service is possibly the worst line I have ever experienced. Not sure I’ve ever arrived on time. The Maidenhead to Marlow service is great when it’s working. 10 mins late leaving today, 45 mins late getting in. 
Makes you wonder where the money from the constant price rises go. It’s certainly no on improving the service.

items.title: Diamond Employee
items.review_text: I have travelled on the 16.18 out of Paddington to Swansea today (16th May) and the back train manager/conductor (Sorry I didn’t get her name -Kind blond Welsh lady) is an asset to your organisation. She went over and above to ensure I made my connecting train to Carmarthen. GWR often comes in for much criticism but there are a lot of diamonds in the organisation. Thank you!!

items.title: Try getting a refund when GWR cancels a service...
items.review_text: GWR's cancellation of the Night Riviera Sleeper this week has plunged me into a dystopian nightmare, trying to get a refund on fares and sleeper reservations, not to mention connecting services. GWR gave me three days notice of the cancellation, but are refusing to refund four sleeper berths because I needed to apply more than seven days prior to travelling. It has also charged a £10 admin fee for refunding the fares, and a further £10 for cancelling a GWR connecting service. The refund procedure is awful, and there is no telephone help line. I will never, ever risk using GWR, let alone the sleeper again. I will get my refund if it takes going to the ombudsman, but it will take hours of effort. My advice is, steer clear.

items.title: Lauren based at Exeter St David is a credit to GWR, I hope she goes far
items.review_text:
Lauren, based at Exeter St David, is amazing !!!
Today, while doing her ticket activities, she moved my extremely hard case & then she carried it right over the bridge to the Paddington platform, then kept me company until she put it on the train.
I was so happy l hugged her.
Great employee !!!
Got to add the refreshment staff on this Paddington train are lovely too.
So very good travelling experience all round 😊

items.title: Major issues with both website & app, and inadequate customer service
items.review_text:
Where to even begin? I lost 1,5 hours trying to book a London - Barnstaple ticket. Similar to the reviewer below (@Richard de Neufville), I got all the way to the end of the booking procedure, indicated my address, ticked all the boxes and pressed "Buy now". Nothing happened, the page just kept reloading, without giving me the possibility to enter my visa card details, and without any error message popping up either. I tried again multiple times, on two different browsers, unsuccessfully. 

I then decided to try to buy the tickets through the GWR app, downloaded the app, but as soon as I tried to enter London as my starting point I received the following error message: "We're sorry but we can't complete your request at the moment due to a technical issue, please try again later". 
I contacted Customer's service via the online chat, who was unable to explain what had gone wrong with the booking through the website. 
In the end, they found the explanation: the system blocked because it turns out that when you book from abroad (France in my case), you cannot choose the electronic ticket option, you have to collect the paper tickets at the train station. Aside from the absurdity and environmental impact of such a policy, it is nowhere indicated on the website, which does allow you to tick the option "electronic ticket". 

Customers' service was completely inadequate, and said the issue would be fixed very shortly. Three days later, nothing has changed on the website and the "temporary" glitch on the app has not been fixed, making it effectively impossible to book a GWR ticket.

items.title: The only consistency with GWR is how terrible it is!
items.review_text: I thought I had bought an advance first class ticket through Trainline for £62.95. This turned out to be a standard class ticket and was my mistake.The first class ticket was only £66.95. The utterly rude and unhelpful train manager then smugly told me that the on train upgrade was £90! How can such a price differential be justified? This was a demonstrable mistake that was clearly evidenced. The charge from GWR for the mistake amounted to being punitive. Particularly when there was no hot water, the train was running late (as usual) and multiple toilets were out of order. The trains are cheap and falling apart, the service is utterly unreliable. Ticket prices are far outside of the service and yet nothing changes. The service is almost comically bad.

items.title: Inflexible luggage policy and a very unfriendly member of staff
items.review_text:
I arrived to London Paddington to catch an 8am train on a bank holiday Monday to Bodmin (Cornwall) with a 6 foot surfboard in a board bag. When I arrived to the gates, I was informed that the GWR policy states they don't allow surf boards. Now, despite this being the case, I was able to do this coming from Bodmin to Paddington a week before without any issue.

When I arrived to the gate, a man (kindly) notified me that I couldn't take my board on the train but perhaps because it was quiet I could ask at the information desk and they'd make an exception. So there I went, and I spoke to another polite man who said the same thing: that it's against policy but perhaps because it's quiet the train manager would allow it.

I then attempted to get back through the gates so that I could speak to the train manager, one of the staff at the gates was immediately unfriendly to me and told me that I couldn't go through and that I will not be allowed to board the train. After trying several times to politely ask if I could just go through and have a conversation with the train manager (as I had been instructed to do) he started shouting at me. I ignored him due to the fact he was being totally unreasonable and then went to back to the gate where the first member of staff (who asked me to go to the information desk) allowed me through. The extremely impolite employee, then came round and proceeded to shout at both myself and his colleague who permitted me to go through so that I could talk to the train manager. He then threatened to call the police to remove me because I was not permitted to be there - to be threatened like that was, quite frankly, a disgusting level of customer service. I ignored his threat and proceeded to find the train manager.

I spoke with the train manager who, respectfully, employed his common sense and saw that my 6ft surfboard would fit in the bike storage of this practically empty train. I was then allowed to board the train and put my surf board in the storage (of which I have a photo - it's an empty bike storage with a 6ft board bag upright in the side, perhaps taking up 10% of the storage space).

After being on the train for a few minutes, just before departure and just after I'd eaten my breakfast, the train manager came and found me and asked me to leave the train. It wasn't worth the argument and it was clear that the shockingly impolite employee had escalated the issue and made a big deal out of nothing. I felt as though he was purposely going out of his way to ruin my day.

I got off the train and then as I walked back to the gates the impolite employee proceeded to raise his voice at his colleague who let me through to which point they got a manager involved to speak to the polite member of staff. I was then asked to leave and not be involved but I can't help but think what a sad, pathetic situation this is that the manager is talking to/perhaps disciplining the member of staff who was kind to me and tried his best to help out a customer  despite a nonsensical arbitrary policy which says I can't bring a surf board on an empty 8am train. Instead of this incredibly rude man who repeatedly raised his voice at both me and his colleagues and was nothing but unhelpful, unfriendly and unreasonable.

I then had to get the tube with my board to London Waterloo where I caught a train with SW trains to Exeter St. Davids and then ask my girlfriend to drive 1.5 hours to come and pick me up. A huge inconvenience to both of us.

Not being able to take a 6ft surfboard in a bag on an empty train that would have made no difference to anyone's journey and only served to completely ruin my day - what a ridiculous policy. It should be at the train manager's discretion. I purposely got up early and caught a super off peak train because I wanted to ensure it wasn't any hassle.

The fact that every member of staff had to deflect the decision of permitting me onto the empty train with my surfboard to someone else makes me question how GWR treat their employees. I would perceive this as there existing a work culture where your staff members are discouraged to use their common sense and initiative in favour of upholding your inflexible, nonsensical policies to avoid being disciplined. I truly hope nothing has jeopardized the career of your polite employee and that you read this and consider changing your policy to something more flexible. Perhaps you could also consider identifying and educating the impolite employee on what is considered acceptable customer service.

items.title: Totally impossible to use GWR website…
items.review_text:
Totally impossible to use GWR website to buy tickets
Got all the way to end, set up international address, checked all the boxes, pressed “buy now” 
System never proceeded !!
Tried several times from scratch no luck at all.. AND NO EXPLANATION
THIS SITE IS CLOSEST TO WORST EVER

items.title: Terrible at refunding. Useless app.
items.review_text:
Trains are fine. I travel Bristol-London at least twice a month and delays are common. I can live with that, but what really annoys me is how difficult it is to claim a refund for a delay. 

I have no doubt GWR are very happy with this situation. Perhaps they would be willing to publish how much is saved for shareholders due to unclaimed refunds?

I had a go using the GWR app to see if they had brought it into the 21st century. How hard can it be to figure out that if I have a ticket for a specific train which is then delayed, the refund should be automatic?

But no, one has to go through the clunky claiming process.

I am set up with Delay Repay but have never received a notification from it.

The app is still pretty rubbish in all other respects. Trainline is still a better option.

items.title: GWR need to improve
items.review_text:
I travel frequently on GWR. Roughly 1/3 of all my journeys are late (particularly the more long distance ones to London), sometimes even cancelled. There's multiple issues with GWR. Where do I start. 

It is quite clear that this company doesn't provide enough care for their staff. I heard this from the horses mouth only yesterday from someone within the organisation overhearing my partner's displeasure with the train service, and we were given all the real reasons why. Insufficient staffing, the closing of kiosks, track maintenance issues, several companies are involved in the participation to keep the railway track together rather than one consolidated rail service, no pay rises for the last 4 years etc (the list goes on). Morale is at an all time low. 

Customers want to speak with real people; whether it's on the train, or at the train service. Stop closing the help desks and making staff cuts. 

As a customer it is incredibly difficult to claim a refund. I use the trainline app in most cases and the app deletes my ticket. Most of the time I have to have a printed off ticket, and I provide this ticket for friends and family that I pay for to use the service. If that person doesn't keep the physical copy of the ticket, and a train is delayed or cancel, you cannot get a refund. Despite the organisation has full proof of the transaction and the code etc (which I can forward) Why is that? Surely that's proof enough?

The UK needs to nationalise the railway service in my opinion. It's evident that private companies don't have a handle on the situation.

items.title: 3rd class treatment with a 1st class interrail ticket!
items.review_text: Be aware, if you travel on GWR using an interrail ticket (including seat reservations) and get delayed (more than 60 minutes) plus incur extra costs trying to make up for lost time you're entitled to nothing despite the train guard telling to claim on delay repay.  Alot of work claiming to get nowhere.

items.title: One of the few reliable train operators in the UK
items.review_text: I am lucky to live in a region where GWR operates, literally the best rail operator in the UK. I was in Bournemouth last weekend, got on an SWR train to get a transfer to Guildford, and it was totally fatal. I got off at Southampton and was so relieved to see a GWR train that goes to Bristol Temple Meads. Other operators such as SWR and Cross Country are just not reliable, with bad timetable management (e.g. stopping every 5 minutes on a direct train). Overall, the trip was very nice and the train ride was comfortable with kind staff. I then got into Bristol Temple Meads and got on a train to London Paddington, the train was comfortable and is a chill ride overall. This is how train rides should be like in this country, GWR is a good example for other operators to follow, absolutely amazing experience.

items.title: Cancelled Train & Refused to Refund
items.review_text:
** In response to GWR - you do not state what your WhatsApp, Twitter or Facebook contact details are.  In any event, I do not use Facebook, Twitter or WhatsApp... so your Customer Service continues to be useless.

What Happened...

Our train was an hour late leaving the station and then terminated altogether before our intended stop.  The train manager was most apologetic and advised we could get a full refund plus the cost of a taxi etc required to get us to our destination.  However, when we applied for the refund and costs it was a completely different story.

Our first refund request was rejected with a short email that stated refund “unsuccessful”.  There was no reason provided.

When I complained, an agent said they would look into it and asked for more evidence which I provided.

A week passed and I heard nothing more… hence this bad review.

To date, GWR have simply washed their hands of the fact they failed to provide the service I paid for and have actually incurred me additional costs.

I feel like I’ve been robbed.

GWR trains are, in my experience, frequently overcrowded.   Why is there no regulator to ensure safety on trains? 

If you must travel via GWR, book with The Trainline who have an exceptionally good and easy refund policy.  GWR do not appear to want to refund their passengers at all.

items.title: First time back on a train in a long…
items.review_text:
First time back on a train in a long time. Last 3 trips cancelled due to strikes. Thought I would give it another try....
0914 Worcester parkway to New Street. 5 of us. Train was packed before we got on. 2 Carriages. Horrible. Granddaughters having to stand all the way.

items.title: App requires further development to improve customer experience and refunds process needs reviewing
items.review_text: App takes time to load digital tickets and there have been cases where the tickets haven’t worked at barriers due a technical issue. Don’t like the fact that if a train is cancelled, you can’t get a refund on a ticket paid for through the app/online from the teller at the station. Need to have bought a paper ticket to get refund from teller. Don’t like the fact that you have to set up separate login details for GWR ticket refunds. Why not integrate refunds into the single online GWR account already set up to buy tickets in the app? That way, if there are cancellations, already frustrated customers don’t have to become more frustrated going through the long winded process of logging into the separate GWR Refunds website that also crashes on you whilst you’re providing all the proof requested. Also, again on the GWR refunds website, if you already have a ticket reference that you can only obtain after purchase, why ask the customer to upload the actual ticket also? What’s even more frustrating, after you’ve finally managed to go through the long winded refund process, you get a message at the saying “we will typically respond to your claim within 28 days”. Reduce this period to an acceptable 3-5 working days. The customer pays you there and then to buy the ticket but then due to an error in your train service, it takes nearly a month to refund the customer? Now the customer must bankroll GWR whist finding alternative transport. It’s not often that train services are cancelled but when they are, an already frustrating situation is made even worse by how GWR deals with these situations. Why not provide a better experience as per feedback above and have returning customers that’ll be happy to use your services again?

items.title: The GWR 15.17 from Hanbough to Oxford.
items.review_text:
The GWR 15.17 from Hanbough to Oxford.

It was nearly empty. The train was well maintained and the seats are comfortable. The interior decor is OK. They need to deduct a carriage.

items.title: Worst train station I’ve ever been to
items.review_text: Worst train station I’ve ever been to, horrible employees. I’m glad I don’t have to use their service as often as I used to. Waste of money.

items.title: Wrong station
items.review_text:
Whilst travelling on business last Wednesday there was a mix-up and I was dropped at the wrong station for my return journey home, and without enough time to reroute to the correct station.

Had this been my local network it would have been a customer service ordeal and I would have likely been pressed into purchasing extra tickets.
I was pleasantly surprised to find that this wasn't the case at Bristol Parkway Station.. Graham promptly modified my journey with no fuss, gave me directions and had me home earlier than my original route.

items.title: provide the service we pay for!
items.review_text: Why are there so many 5 carriages services at rush hour in the evening? You know how many people want to use the service, so why on earth can’t you provide enough carriages so people might be able to travel? The situation is so bad, that we are not talking about people having seats, we’re talking about there being enough space for people to squeeze in and stand up! Given that the tickets cost hundreds of pounds, do you think this is any where near acceptable?

items.title: 3 cancellations in 2 weeks
items.review_text:
Return journey from Birmingham to Ashchurch cancelled. 
Journey from Pershore to London cancelled.18th April 
Journey on the 31st April return 1st May cancelled. No other direct trains running on this route. Just booked to go to London on 31st April as the hotel is booked and I’m meeting my sister. New route from Cheltenham to Paddington with one change 🤦🏻‍♀️ and it’s cost me £13 more.
So 3 cancellations in just over 2 weeks, I’ll have to pay 2 days parking, drive 25 mins to Cheltenham and pay more. Thank you very much

items.title: Compassionate customer service
items.review_text:
My wife was unable to travel for medical reasons and despite her claims being out of date (as more than 28 days had passed), Lucy in customer services refunded several journeys and was very kind. 

We're grateful for the compassionate service that she received. Thank you!

items.title: Had to sit on the floor while heavily pregnant.
items.review_text:
My return train was cancelled from London to Plymouth, I tried to get on the next one as many others did, the train was packed, as in no one could move around. It was terrible. People standing and sitting through every single carriage and corridor. I was heavily pregnant and had to sit on my suitcase for 2hrs of the journey. I told the GWR staff that I was pregnant, he tried to get on the train and find me a seat but he couldn't even get into the carriage and admitted there was nothing he could do. 

I tried to get a refund, this was their response; "Due to your service being removed and you boarding another service, your seat reservation is no longer valid as once your service is cancelled, any bookings/requests made on this service is also cancelled. We cannot transfer bike or seat reservations onto the next services. This is to avoid disrupting passengers who have booked on this particular service. This is also to avoid double-booking seats. Due to your service being cancelled, your seat reservation was also cancelled. I see you mentioned you were pregnant. We have "priority seats" which is available for customers who require a seat more than others. If these seats have already been occupied by other passengers who also require them, we cannot relocate these passengers as these seats are first come-first serve". 

Thank you GWR for your top notch service.

items.title: They charge too much and are unreliable
items.review_text:
So usually get the 5,48am train to avoid the exorbitant cost...(as their charging amounts are mental, and make me want to move to london)... get there and the train doesn't exist anymore, and the 6am one is delayed...so sat on a freezing platform for 45 mins now.
Found out the pre6am train is now 5:36 or somthing... makes me honestly depressed with my life at this point.

items.title: Huge range of excuses for being LATE.
items.review_text:
They waste their money installing speakers informing you that you are arriving to the end of the escalator.
They are almost always late.
GWR provides shameful services at luxury branded prices.
Absolutely appealing.

items.title: The most uncomfortable seat
items.review_text: I use the train on a frequent basis from Cheltenham to London. It stops too frequently before Swindon with an idiotic reverse journey over to Gloucester. On many occasions, it saves me 45 minutes by driving to Swindon to get a train from Bristol to London. At least a few services should run direct to Swindon, maybe stopping once at Stroud. It is far too slow. On a positive, I always find the staff excellent. I have suffered cancellations, but usually for reasons beyond GWR control (incidents on track) and the refund process is swift and painless. Sadly you cannot say the same for the new Hitachi trains. They are awful. Could anyone design a more uncomfortable seat? You are sitting on a block of wood. I miss terrible the old HST trains. They might have been 40 years old but had more space and were far more comfortable. As a passenger, the new trains are a disaster.

items.title: Booked first class Exeter to Cardiff
items.review_text: Booked first class Exeter to Cardiff. No benefits whatsoever. Train was virtually empty and no buffet car. No drinks or food provided for 3 hour journey. Response from customer services was sorry but tough luck basically. Don’t bother.

items.title: Shambles
items.review_text:
Really really bad. 
Always Cancellations and delays on the Bristol Temple meads Services , strikes all over the place causing me to have to pay hundreds of pounds on bus services to work.
Delays always making me late for work , train crew are often rude including ticket inspectors , one lady on the WSB TO BRI Train was so rude by telling me she had not checked my season ticket and threatened to charge me extra when she had checked it about 5 minutes earlier , I told her she had already checked it and she refused so I showed it again !!!

items.title: Steve the guard is fantastic
items.review_text:
10 April Bristol Temple Meads to southampton 19.25

Can I just say my journey from Bristol to Southampton was brilliant . Steve the guard was fabulous with his tannoy announcements and put a huge smile on my face. He should definitely be on TV or radio

items.title: ROBBERS!
items.review_text: Am disgusted with GWR. A couple of weeks ago we were delayed by 20 minutes and then they stopped service some 25 minutes walk from my (paid-for, intended) destination and I had to get a taxi to make my appointment on time. Not only have they refused to reimburse me for my cab (as I  had no idea where I was and had a time deadline) but also have not refunded my compensation for the delay. Appalling service and an appalling attitude. Avoid this train company!

items.title: Absolute trash service
items.review_text:
Absolute trash service. I have no idea who runs the service but they should be fired. Everybody in any management role of this organisation should be fired. Constant delays. Constantly running late.
Constant excuses.

items.title: Good
items.review_text: Usually not delayed, quite clean and comfortable

items.title: GWR 1st Class
items.review_text:
GWR 1st Class: On entry to the carriage, seats and floor were not spotless, and an empty water bottle had not been cleared from the table from the previous journey. 
Complimentary sandwiches were not on offer, over a 5 hour journey, due to the Easter weekend and sandwich suppliers not working or something. However, staff were pleasant and apologetic about this, and certainly not at fault: there is no promise of any catering delivery in the Ts & Cs anyway, where external factors are a cause; but they do their best. For some reason the staff were a lot chirpier on the return Penzance to Paddington journey, and very nice. Trolley service to seat was frequent, decent and friendly, with generous complimentary tea, coffee, biscuits, crisps, nuts, water etc. Good, comfortable solo window seat, affording nice views of the Cornish, Devonian and Somerset countryside. Both legs of the train journey ran like clockwork.
I go 1st class if the ticket price is favourable, and to mitigate against the risk of a busy, noisy and cramped Standard class carriage. It depends on what you pay for a 1st Class seat, as to whether it's worth buying/upgrading to it. I'd use GWR 1st class again as it was sufficiently good for me.

items.title: Delay repay will normally just waste even more of your time
items.review_text: Applying for reimbursement for delays is a lengthy process and most of the time they refuse anyway without explaining why.

items.title: Utterly useless
items.review_text: Virtually every time I have cause to use GWR at least one of the trains on my journey is either delayed by enough time to miss a connecting train or cancelled completely. The seats are like sitting in wooden boards with no back support and they are bolt upright. The service is absolutely unfit for purpose, or to put it more bluntly: totally, absolutely, undeniably fxxking useless.

items.title: A day of delays and cancellations
items.review_text: Couldn’t pull the steam off a rice pudding, a day in London cancelled service on way down and cancelled service home costing me an extra 79 pounds a total waste of a day trip to London with my son for some R&R now completely stressed out. Never again MR GWR  shocking service

items.title: GWR are a replacement bus company that occasionally run a train or two
items.review_text:
GWR are a replacement bus company that occasionally run a train or two. 

Unfortunately, on the days they run trains you are liable to face significant delays. Just had a 20 minute journey take more than an hour (so far) and nobody seems to have a clue as to why there is a red signal stopping progress. 

Best advice to customers is to walk rather than use GWR if you have the time as it will probably be better than any service they provide.

Best advice to the company would be to hire some people with an IQ above room temperature because they seem to be remarkably scarce in GWR

items.title: Badly run company
items.review_text: I thought that my request for a refund had gone through but apparently they didn't receive it in time. It was quite an experience filling in the form and gave me the impression that they try hard to put people off from persevering with it. 40 minute delay and had to stand for over an hour. As for the carer taking a client from Axminster to Exeter I think you'll find that line has nothing to do with GWR as it's run by SWR!! Shocking service and well overpriced. Apparently if you are successful with a claim there is an administration charge of £10 which is unheard of in my experience. Not at all surprised by the comments here ... even someone praising a rival thinking it was GWR.

items.title: Great friendly and professional staff
items.review_text: Great friendly and professional staff , clean first class carriage between Swansea and London , well worth the upgraded seats

items.title: Unreliable service, poor communication
items.review_text: Every time I travel with GWR there is always some problem. Today the train from Swindon to London Paddington was over an hour late and then when it was two minutes' away from the station, with hundreds of passengers on the platform, they decided to cancel the service. Communication as to why this was necessary was very poor. I think I'd rather take the bus next time then endure more misery with GWR.

items.title: Often late trains
items.review_text: Often late trains, I rely on these for work and unfortunately trains are delayed and cancelled quite often which causes stress and problems for me. But, much of the time the service is good.

items.title: Just because they are poop and not even…
items.review_text: Just because they are poop and not even capable of distinguish between platform 9 and 11 in Bristol !!! I mean did any of the people that work in Bristol temple meads  go to school and learned  the f difference between numbers ?????  Or are they too lazy to put the signs for different platforms ??? F off strike people !!!or btw my language of using appropriate adjectives to describe the service / set up is offensive to some people  that are poop at their jobs

items.title: Like a 5 star hotel, I'm the number 1 fan of GWR
items.review_text:
I took a GWR Class 387 from London Paddington to Hayes & Harlington, and the seats were ok. But the shapes of the seats recovered the comfortless. Good quality. Just a tip (me and my friend are making the revolt, me GWR him SWR. GWR WINS ALWAYS), the iron seats on the GWR class 387 are a little bit hard, perhaps add a little more padding?!?
No one was in the train, I had so much space, incredible views. WE LOVE YOU GWR (387 is my fav gwr train)

items.title: Expensive for a constantly poor service
items.review_text: I pay 10.10 everyday, with a railcard from Eggesford to Exeter. Every single during the train is packed with people standing through the isles and sitting on the floor. Not good value for money at all and the prices just keep getting higher and higher!!

items.title: Did not even want to give the a star
items.review_text: Did not even want to give the a star. Rubbish company always taken money for admin fee when you request a refund.

items.title: FIRST CLASS FARE NOT WORTH IT.
items.review_text:
Just travelling back from Penzance and after spending £500 on 2 first class return tickets, was totally shocked that you get very little for that!
On LNER and Avanti you at least get free food (even a full meal on LNER) and alcohic drinks and the fare is cheaper even though the journey is further.
All GWR provide is 25 free sandwhiches for a 306 mile trip with 15 stops en-route. So when you ask for one, nothing is availabe. The staff were very nice and said they have complained on many occassions but nothing improves. Having to pay extra for food and drink is not value for the £500 spent.

items.title: TICKET DRAMA
items.review_text: Myself and my friend brought our return tickets from the machine at the Weston Super Mare station to Bristol Clifton  23rd March 11:00am, we were chatting so just took the first tickets that came out of the machine and carried on to get a drink.  When we were on the train the young man Jacob Bowles ask to see our tickets and my friend got out the two tickets that we had only to discover that we didn’t wait long enough at the ticket machine for it to continue to print the rest of the tickets, we had proof that we paid on the bank statement, Jacob came back and gave us a receipt to say that he had seen proof that we paid so we could continue our journey and also get the return journey, he went out of his way to help us, so would just like to say thank you and excellent customer service from Jacob Bowles

items.title: Fantastic service
items.review_text: I'm a carer and today I took a client on a shopping trip from Axminster to Exeter. With all the negative reviews I thought it would be good to leave a positive one. The man at Axminster helped with the parking ticket and all the information I needed for the trip with my disabled client. He and all the staff we encountered were so helpful, kind and happy. Getting on and off the train, we were helped with ramps and kindness. Thankyou all very much.

items.title: Inefficient, late and EXPENSIVE
items.review_text: What to say about this train operator? Frequent delays and cancellations, short carriages meaning you have to stand in the corridor for hours and VERY Expensive.

items.title: Waste of time submitting a claim as they do not refund for delayed and/or cancelled train journeys
items.review_text: 11:28 journey on 14/03 from London Paddington to Didcot Parkway was cancelled due to overhead wires, my journey ended up being delayed by an hour so I was advised to submit a claim using their Delay Repay process. They will not refund as they deny that the journey was delayed which does not make any sense. Waste of time and poor customer service.

items.title: Their trains were late and that…
items.review_text: Their trains were late and that qualified for a partial refund and they said they were 2 minutes late basically lying out of their backsides instead of the 17 odd minutes late and told them view the cctv and no response absolute helmet’s

items.title: Travelled from Newcastle to Penzance…
items.review_text:
Travelled from Newcastle to Penzance 17/03/23 changed at Taunton (arrived 18/03/23). 
More often than not overcrowded and incredibly, intimidatingly noisy - felt very vulnerable and not at all safe. At one point in the journey (Cheltenham) we were all warned that the train was going to be packed with people leaving the racecourse - oh my god - if you know this already then you need to either limit the number of people getting on or lay on another service.  Gangways and exit routes completely blocked. 
Final incident, just after Plymouth, involved a number of people in drink/drugs fighting. It was a very violent incident with one member of the warring group already prepared wearing a stab vest. 
I feel sorry and concerned that staff have to deal with such situations and it begs the question why allow people to travel if they are not fit to do so. No reassuring words from staff after the incident - I was completely traumatised. 
The whole journey was a nightmare. 
No decent refreshments either outward or on return - a technical issue meant there were no hot drinks - how about getting a new kettle??? Seats incredibly uncomfortable for one who is 6ft 2ins. with back and neck issues. Lavatories were unpleasant. Just the most expensive,  traumatising, unsafe experience. Arrived an hour late. 
The suggestion that trains should be un-manned, from this experience, is putting innocent people at great risk of harm and vulnerability - you just simply can not heard a load of people into a tube that (when it’s all working ok) is travelling at high speed and have no one overseeing the situation - this is a very dangerous move and one that must be resisted. 
It’s been a long time since I travelled by train - this whole experience was disgusting - MPs and the rail bosses should be made to travel standard class on a long journey on a full train to experience the progress achieved in the 21st century. You seriously need to learn from experiences like mine and do an awful lot better. 
Flying is safer, more comfortable and has better services for passengers but sadly not good for the environment.

items.title: Refund Blocked - now paid
items.review_text:
On 8/11/22 I booked tickets for 12/03/23 whilst in Spain. After paying I found i purchased two tickets, in error. After dozens of emails, phone calls and three visits to Swindon Station I was getting nowhere with a refund. Then one of the trains (Elizabeth line) was cancelled, so I had to buy a third ticket. On 12/03/23, after Swindon Ticket office intervention, a fourth time, I received a refund on one of the tickets, thus one refund is still outstanding. I’ve expended dozens of hours on this issue and can no longer tolerate any more, I give up. However, all praise to Swindon Ticket Office staff who have been bent over backwards to help. I’ve been dining out on this story for months for it is as example of a dysfunctional organisation. Bring back BR.
Update: message received to say the refund debt will be settled. 14 separate communications: including 2 x complaints 4 x visits to Swindon stations, hours on the phone, return call promises unfulfilled and web templates completed to no avail. There’s got to be a better way GWR? After all if I get it wrong its £100 penalty fare plus full fare, or a summons to court (such as you did to my son). Thanks anyway, we got there in the end.
Update: 5/4/23, all refunds complete, phew that was a struggle. Lesson learned: buy at the station not on-line.

items.title: GWR TOTAL SCAM COMPANY
items.review_text:
GWR, a company depended on by so many to bring people to London from Reading, Tilehurst, Pangbourne and loads others etc. All we get is a company that is hiking prices astronomically and removing trains from the schedule. 

From Tilehusrt, there used to be a train a few months back at 6:41 to get to London early for an 8am start. REMOVED!! Why remove a very important train from the schedule? And with this train removed, surely our ticket prices would reduce? Nope, increased in price massively. So less trains and a higher price. Total scam company. 😒

items.title: Three hours Paddington to…
items.review_text: Three hours from Paddington to Maidenhead on my way home from work last night! People rely on this service GWR, we wake up early to get to work in the morning and rush home in the afternoon to collect kids from school, spend time with family etc. Only to find the rail system a complete shambles and with prices increased sharply just a week ago! This morning again, half the trains cancelled, all trains delayed with the result that we are packed like sardines into the few remaining services. Lift your game GWR, people rely on you! Right now we are disappointed.

items.title: Better bike than GWR
items.review_text: I used first time in my life this service and the train was late 40 minutes on Bath - Westbury! Late to work and lost lots of bonuses like 500 £ attendance bonus. Very angry

items.title: Removing carriages from busy services
items.review_text: Removing carriages from busy services. An apology doesn't cut it.

items.title: Dont travel with GWR
items.review_text:
I'm a frequent traveller who only source of transport is trains I was travelling from Redding to bath spa on the 9 March. In reading I was direct to a train after they check my ticket and told me to get on turns out they put me on the wrong train I quickly realised this and spoke to staff who completely ignored me and kicked me off. I got of in Swindon I saw 6 GWR staff talking I approached to ask for help the all ignored me completely. So went in side to ticket, information office no one there. I was able to find someone else I asked them they said platform 4 but you missed it there be another one at some point today. I went to ask when he shrugged walked off. I spoke to manager in bath spa about the situation and explained to me the mistake that happened in reading how too trains where beylayed so the train I got on was an earlier one that was beylayed and there staff member most likely didn't realise. Easy mistake it happens I have no issues there but with the staff who completely ignored me as the conversation were to important than there job. The managers I spoke to were very apologetic about it. However similar issues happen again on the way home from bath spa to reading on 11 march the train was delayed about 30 minutes.they also tried to get people to get on the next service as there was to many people trying to get on it was a struggle getting one lots of pushing and shoving shouting but I need to get on as at that point I could make my connection but through delays meant I missed it. I ask staff on the train if the now the next train I could take to make my connection. She said no I want to he
Deal with something  else. Very pleasant encounter. Not. At this point I gave up trying to deal with any staff from GWR. So went to south western railway they were more than happy to help even though I wasn't travelling with them they went out of the way to help.

items.title: Got ripped off and constant delays
items.review_text: Went to Paddington to get train to Reading. Went to buy an extended ticket, to my PEAK HOUR ticket that was on my smart card from London zone 6 to Reading. Paid £14.60. Went on the train, the ticket woman said this is off peak, gave her my smart card and told her I asked for a top up on my peak hour ticket. She said she had to recharge me for the entire journey all over again as her colleague in the ticket office ignored the peak hour ticket on the smart card and gave me a off hour ticket, cost me an extra £16.40. These people are a rip off so all in all, I payed for a journey there times over. If you should include return which was to zone 6 border. On the way back, missed my appointment by over and hour, every train to Paddington delay delay delay delay delay delay by 25 to 40 mins. I took the train because to cutbtime trave in car but it took me longer than the car. I know who won't be travelling on GWR no time soon. Government wants us to take public transportation, but dang, they are the most unreliable mode of travel. People should for one day, travel in cars and boycott these train companies that are raising fears but continue to offer mediocre service.

items.title: First Class Experience with GWR team
items.review_text: I cannot say enough how amazing our experience was with GWR yesterday when travelling from Chippenham to Paignton with my father. I was very anxious about the travel as my dad has severe sight impairment and limited mobility. We were wrapped in the capable arms of the team at GWR who looked after us so well every step of the way, the service was far beyond my expectations. Thank you so much for offering such a first class assistance service. Regards, Caroline

items.title: Such a bad train company
items.review_text: Such a bad train company! Don’t even bother if you want to get up work!

items.title: Absolutely abysmal service
items.review_text: Absolutely abysmal service! I was delayed more than an hour on 28th February 2023 and have tried to enter claim online twice and it didn’t work as it did not allow 2 part journeys and then I finally finally found a phone number hidden well away on their website and went through the details with the person who answered the call and have now waited nearly a week and have had an email that the phone claim has been denied because it says I have already made another claim, must be the unsuccessful online claim… OMG! Although I know I deserve compensation, I also have a life and GWR are so incredibly inept that I will leave it and let them essentially take my money due to their incompetence!

items.title: Disappointed
