items.review_text: Terrible half the trains are delayed or cancelled I have to leave stupidly early to make it to college on time currently waiting half hour for the next one to redhill. This has happened more than once. Great western my ass

items.title: Terrible first class experience
items.review_text: Terrible first class experience

items.title: Expandable customers for stats
Enough is enough
items.review_text: Enough is enough. This is the worst service ever. No refunds, no covering the cost when stranded. Trains canceled and other delayed. Never knew the government would let things get this bad. Save the stress and don’t use

items.title: Racist ticket inspector
items.review_text: So I am traveling from Swansea to Bristol, booked via trainline. The app that basically everyone uses. Anyways they offer what's called a split save ticket where they manage to find a set of tickets that get you where you need to go. So I got a ticket that is from Swansea to bath spa to visit my mate the ticket inspector on the train from Swansea to Cardiff (destination London Paddington) insisted to scan both legs of the journey. I tried to explain that it's going to cause me problems down the line because it's scanned on the wrong train but he insisted and was horrendously rude about it (I suspect there is a racial factor in as I am an expat working in UK). On my leg from Cardiff to Bristol to change trains (I purposely wanted this itenery because Mark 3 coaches is comfortable and I am not sitting on ironing boards for the whole duration on their class 80x which causes me severe backpain) the train ticket inspector tried to scan my ticket and it got rejected stating it has already been scanned and it's not going through on him because it's been assumed I'm changing at some other station and I should not be there or something similar. Explained it to hrr what has happened and she was understanding to let me go my marry way, which redeemed them the 1 single star, or else the entire experience would be 0 stars. Not to mention their class 80x trains (IET I think they market it as)  is really uncomfortable and caused my already bad sciatica to be worse than it is. Made worse by their 'lumbar support' not doing anything other than pushing your spine in the wrong direction at the wrong ppacr (I work as a physio) anyways I'm writing this at bath where I have taken gabapentin to dull the pain when it's really bad

items.title: Unfair fine system
items.review_text: Heavy handed approach & disproportionate fine for having an out of date railcard. Included court summons and being fined £304 for a ticket that originally cost £64.70.

items.title: Heartless and overpriced, plus rude ticket inspector
items.review_text: GWR are probably the worst train company in this mess of a country. Charge £95 for a return from Bristol to London (I could drive for half that) and then they have the nerve to charge me an extra £25 because I took the 22:48 instead of the 21:48 to spend a bit of extra time with my friends. In the middle of a cost of living crisis is this honestly reasonable? Do you take pleasure in ripping people off? Not to mention my outbound train was delayed by 2.5 hours. The train was totally empty and I was asleep yet the ticket inspector shook me awake and demanded my rail card and ticket, I hope he’s paid plenty of money to make that worth his while… oh and there was no price difference between the two trains, if anything the later one would have been cheaper but he still found pleasure in extracting more money out of me. £120 in total… shocking, absolutely shocking

items.title: I upgraded with Seat Frog to go First…
items.review_text:
I upgraded with Seat Frog to go First Class?
Tea & biscuits offered twice on route from Paddington to Truro
No other food available
Never will I pay to upgrade to first class, it’s just a rip off, okay you get a larger table if you have a big laptop.

items.title: Avoid GWR
items.review_text:
Avoid GWR - I bought an £80 train ticket on their website, they were paid but no ticket on my app. GWR Complaints told me something had gone wrong and to get a refund from their website. I bought a discount ticket which is not eligible for a refund. GWR customer services refuse to do anything.
---------------------------------------------------------
Thanks to my trustpilot comment I was contacted by GWR and we chatted on facebook. The GWR Media agent didn't even look at the issue and just tried to off load me to the GWR Refund Portal, the GWR Media agent was useless and nothing was achieved

items.title: Will not refund!!
items.review_text:
Sent me an email offering a refund. Wouldn't let me do it and wouldn't let me do the app. Not working!
Emailed asking for help. Told to send in some personal info and pics of tickets which I did. Everything they asked for. Got a pic of it!! They said it would take a few days.  Next day had an email asking for feedback on my experience.  Didn't fill it in as not sorted. Had an email today saying they won't refund me as I did not send in all the info. Have the proof. They will not refund any amount. Second time they have done this to me. Kept the full amount last time. Most DISHONEST COMPANY ever. Now I can't fill in the feedback so I can't leave anything bad. Just looked at previous feedback from others. All I can say is....AVOID THIS COMPANY IF POSSIBLE. Will give my money to National Coaches from now on.
I am 61 years old and disabled and had to stand in a doorway for the first 30 minutes of this journey!!

items.title: Distressing treatment of two female customers
items.review_text: 1) 14.28 Paddington to Cheltenham. A customer with a bike just manages to catch the train. She and her bike are in the vestibule of the front carriage, her only opportunity to board the train in time. Her bike has a flat tyre; she is clearly out of breath. The guard takes the trouble to walk the length of the platform and insist she get off as she is not in the bike carriage. She does so but is clearly in distress. Why didn't the guard instead take the trouble to help the customer reach the correct compartment? After the train pulls out, the guard makes an announcement blaming the customer for the train's late departure. 2) Reading, 30 minutes later. The same guard makes an announcement providing a physical description of a woman on the station platform.  She is, he says, responsible for a further delayed departure.  He asks any customers who know her to phone her and ask her not to do so again. Is this even legal?

items.title: £2 single fares on trains
items.review_text: you should put your prices on trains to £2 so that more people can get on the trains and keep it going for that price instead of putting it up where people will think its better to get the bus not the train

items.title: Con artists
items.review_text: Con artists. Travelling 2 days a week into the office I thought I'd give their flexi-season ticket a go to save c. £10 on my monthly commute. This ticket allows for 8 journeys in a 28 day period. Knowing there were some scheduled strike days falling on my usual commute days I asked if the ticket could be extend beyond 28 days to account for this. I was told no  but that I could claim back via the refund repay scheme for any days I would have been travelling in but couldn't due to strike activity. When it came to paying a claim it was rejected twice, saying I'd abandoned by journey. I'm in the process of escalating this as I feel I have been misled and lied to in the interests for gwr's profiteering. Don't use these tickets around strike periods or ever trust what gwr tells you. 8 in 28 days is also a breach of promise in legal terms too. I trust sense and fairness will prevail, but shouldn't have to go through so many hoops to get back my hard-earnt money!

items.title: Prevented from boarding a pre-booked train
items.review_text: Prevented from boarding a pre-booked train because I had skis with me - have previously taken them man times. Now no way to travel from Bristol by train. Real annoyance is that luggage restrictions are not highlighted/drawn to purchaser’s attention at the time of booking tickets or buying railcards - clearly Coaching is better than Training !

items.title: Scammers?
items.review_text: This rail company appears to be scamming customers whose trains are cancelled because of strikes. I booked a ticket in October and didn't get all my money back until January. Looking at other reviews, I'm not the only one. Is this deliberate? GWR insisted it would not give me my money back but wasn't sure why. Maybe an admin fee? Or something else? They didn't know, but they were sure I wouldn't get my cash back until I kept telling them to give me a deadlock letter so I could escalate to the rail ombudsman. Awful company, not to be trusted.

items.title: Fined blind man instead of helping
items.review_text:
My (newly)severely sight impaired partner experienced prejudice and lack of understanding. Not only did he accidentally take the wrong train, leading to a much longer journey, but he was fined £72 for doing so. He should have been helped to find the right train.
Appalled at lack of diversity training of ticket officers and lack of empathy.

items.title: Fantastic service
items.review_text: I just wanted to add my review, I was on the 10.18 today Sunday, from Penzance to London Paddington. I want to thank and compliment the on board crew. Their service was polite friendly and courteous throughout the entire 5+ hour trip. A really enjoyable journey, great job all thank you 5 stars

items.title: In the 2 years I’ve been using this…
items.review_text: In the 2 years I’ve been using this absolute mess of a train company not once have they left on time. Most likely train driver is on his phone and unaware. When I have seen the train driver he looks like something out of lord of the rings and morbidly obese. Joke of a company

items.title: Utterly fxxking useless.
items.review_text: Utterly useless. The saddest part is that their staff genuinely appear to enjoy having frustrated and dissatisfied customers. They clearly couldn't care less.

items.title: GWR SAY ROLL OVER SO YOU ROLL OVER
items.review_text:
I have been bullied into paying nearly £100 for not buying a ticket when I was refused a ticket! 

The conductor sold a lady one just before me and then discriminated against me and refused to sell me one. Then I received an out-of-court settlement offer - bullying me out of £98.10p - All they want is money. I gave plenty of explanations but they chose to ignore and then avoid to protect their own mistakes and exploit the minorities. SHAME

items.title: Train on time following yesterdays…
items.review_text: Train on time following yesterdays strike .. friendly service and lovely thoughtful lady serving from snack trolley

items.title: The brighter side
items.review_text: I know a lot of people will complain about the strikes and the people but yesterday i experienced some very kind workers. so yes the standard class train was packed as usual and i fainted due to an ongoing illness i had. The train staff were there when i woke up and tended to me. And the four women i fainted infront of were beyond kind, offering me water etc. i got taken to a first class carriage where a kind person gave up their seat for me just for a 10 min journey to swindon. Thankyou to the staff and thankyou to the people on that train.

items.title: Absolute joke of a company 5 pound for…
items.review_text: Absolute joke of a company 5 pound for 3 stops that took 9 minutes are you taking the pis ? Your a bunch of scaming rats no wonder trains anit never working the way your staff treat customers is a joke and the fact of your prices are a bigger joke I will never use fgw again i would rather walk everywhere

items.title: AWFUL - avoid the Riviera sleeper and GWR - just useless.
items.review_text:
We planned a weekend away in Cornwall via the Riviera Sleeper thinking it would be fun. It's not - it's awful. There was a fight between a customer and a member of staff at one point and then our cabin was not fit for purpose with lose panel making such a noise it was impossible to sleep - so we had no sleep and they had no alternative cabin for the pair of us.
On the way back they missed the breakfast completely. 8 weeks of complaining and they come back with an off of £45 compensation - we spent £345 on this shambles.

items.title: Scammers!!… they say they will refund…
items.review_text: Scammers!!… they say they will refund your money if the trains are delayed but they are liars and it’s more hassle than it’s worth!! I’m lucky it was small money. But I will never use this service again!! Just another big company scamming the small guy!!

items.title: GWR strike again
items.review_text: Third Sunday in a row on what should be a normal Sunday service and once again GWR find away to either delay or cancel the service to swindon ensuring we miss our connection to Gloucester. Compensation is less the 50% but that's ok, the children and I have warm heated waiting room and a cafe to buy a hot drinks!! Oh wait, I'm getting confused with a company who actually cares about costumer service. This ridiculous and poor excuse for a national service is disgraceful and frankly an embarssement to our country. Brunel would spinning in his grave as he lies watching the rich and powerful ruin his dream, you would be lucky to hit Bristol on time never mind catch a ship to NY. #GWRRAJOKE.

items.title: COMPLETELY unreliable
items.review_text:
I have to commute Mon- Fri every day. No joke at *least* 40-50% of the time there are significant delays. “Points failures”, “overhead lines”, “problems with main line” are phrases I hear all the time. You simply can not rely on this as a service and its a roulette every time you want to get into work.

To add to this it is often exceptionally busy, with people having to stand in the aisles and doorways because of them using short trains with 5 carriages, and the back up caused by the delays. Its just an omnishambles.

**UPDATE** 
THE DAY AFTER I submitted this review I am now, yet again severely delayed on a GWR train. Initially a points failure”, now a “person on the track”. The train will be “stationary for some time”.

Please, please people do not try and rely on GWR to commute to work. They are an unmitigated disaster.

items.title: The Excellent customer service for our trip from…
items.review_text:
The customer service for our trip from London Paddington to Bristol and back was the most pleasant journey. Comfort, ease and we had an issue that the staff were exceptionally kind with. The trains, toilets, tables everything was cleaned, staff available and the best thing was that when our train from Bristol Parkway 1L36 was delayed due to a broken down freight train the train manager called through and saved about 30 passengers having to wait for about an hour for the next train. They held the train for 5 mis and told us exactly where to go but asked us to be careful due to cold weather and ice  . We were updates with the exact information all the way in. It was refreshing and a testament to great customer support.  Excellent , even the snacks staff and assistants were excellent.  We had been to a funeral so they gave us a chance to have a warm drink. I am astounded at the level of care I thought it dis not exist. Also as a woman of colour I sometimes get paranoid at bad  treatment but was so warmed today Thank you station managers Mathew in the morning, thank you Chris on the  21.52 1L36 service. 
Thank you GWR for training your staff so well.

items.title: As if you actually have the cheek to…
items.review_text:
As if you actually have the cheek to charge full price for a replacement bus service 
You lot need to give your heads a wobble and start working on refunds for thousands effected by your below par service even without strikes your service is the worse customer service don't care three weeks minimum to hear back only to get a we feel your frustration looking into it or staff training will be given there needs to be a independent company we can complain to that first great western will actually take seriously because from these reviews and how there process is they don't care about customers as you can see

items.title: THEY REFUSED TO REFUND MY TICKETS FOR…
items.review_text: THEY REFUSED TO REFUND MY TICKETS FOR £72 BECAUSE THEY WRNT ON STRIKE I AM SHAMING THE COMPANY. THE WAY THEY HANDLE CONPLANTS IS DISCUSUSTING THE DONT CARE ABOUT YOU OR YOU MONEY THEY ARE THIVES AND SHULD BE HELD ACOUNTABLE FOR IT. DISCUSUSTING PEOPLE THEY ARE.

items.title: Charging sockets never work!
items.review_text:
OK, but don't expect the charging sockets to work. You will need to take a your own portable charging device. 
I've been disappointed on all of my journeys, luckily I've had to change trains and they do work on Southern.

items.title: Trains are always late
items.review_text: The train is always 17 minutes late and they are always cancelled every other week

items.title: Point of 1st class?
items.review_text: What is the point of first class on the trains? Travelling to Swansea, paid a handsome amount of money and what do you get? Stone faced staff, that clearly do not want to do the job and a cheap apple juice and a packet of crisps!  Listen, just get rid of 1st class and have normal coach on all trains.  The additional money does not warrant the seats, as everything else is coach class! I wrote the above before arriving in swansea, just to say that at Cardiff, virtually everyone was allowed in 1st class! Genuinely don't mind, but next time I won't pay 1st class fare and will just go into the 1st class coach like everyone else!

items.title: The GWR trains are always late arriving…
items.review_text: The GWR trains are always late arriving at Romsey . I missed my connection at Salisbury on the 13/1 and had to wait a hour for the next train.

items.title: I tried to change my e- ticket (which…
items.review_text: I tried to change my e- ticket (which was amendable,) within the required period and a glitch in their system prevented this from happening. I had no choice but to apply for a refund, which was rejected on the incorrect basis that there was evidence the ticket had been used. A no-reply email address means that I will have to waste more of my time explaining all this to them. With no guarantee of a sensible reply. I'll buy through Trainline or other platform next time.

items.title: I wish GWR would have “industrial…
items.review_text: I wish GWR would have “industrial action” more often. The trains have never been so reliable. All the services they run were on time. Well done GWR keep up the mediocre to poor work!

items.title: Terrible old-fashioned company with no respect for customers
items.review_text:
Awful company which can't deal properly with electronic tickets.
The problem comes from the fact that I received the confirmation email of my e-tickets with no pdf attached and then everything became a nightmare: they could not send me again the pdf tickets, we tried everything: by phone (1h of explanation ), at Paddington station wtih all the staff included the manager during 2h and then with the online claim service.
The only solution they proposed was to buy again the tickets and obtain the cancellation later with the claim service, that's what we did because we really planned to go to Bath that weekend. Today (1 month after my claim) I received an email saying that's impossible for them to refund my first tickets because I don't have the pdf tickets for proof. Eeven if the purchase can be clearly seen in my GWR account! Unbelievable!
And as you can see with the answer received below today, they propose to look at my claim but they didn't read my message because I already get through all the possible ways to make my claim (with at least 3h of time wasted on it): phone, staff at the station, refund service on line. And that's true, I forgot to tell that I tried also the WhatsApp channel who told me to call the customer service, who couldn't do anything. They just advise me to talk to the staff at the gates on the day of our departure to make us go through even with no pdf tickets! Which of course, was not possible on the day of the departure.
.

items.title: The train staff have always been good…
items.review_text:
The train staff have always been good when I travelled, wish I could say the same about their website and customer service team. Not able to cancel a ticket due to not needing it anymore for a journey in January or amend the travel date, I was informed I could only cancel if it was due to health reasons they would need proof of the medical reason, I have since discovered that the system won't allow a refund even if I follow instructions of re-booking and providing booking ref. 

Come on GWR get your act together! I think I will be buying via trainline from now.

items.title: Swansea to Cardiff
items.review_text: A fantastic train journey from Swansea to Cardiff. On time, clean , comfortable and the staff were lovely. I was talking to a Jamaican guy but I do not know his name, and also a Welsh guy called Keith. Both very friendly, kind and helpful.

items.title: Bad service and no compassion at all!
items.review_text:
Bad service and no compassion at all!

We went on holiday to Devonshire. I bought tickets in October for our holiday end of November. We were staying at the Traveloge in Barnstaple. At 25th November we went to the train station to inform about the train for 26th which we had booked.
There won't be trains on 26th because of the strike he said. We did not know this and had to take a train back on 25th. 
We were able to use our original tickets on the way back but we lost a night of accommodation for 25th November at Traveloge. 
Traveloge said we don't refund because GWR had the strike and this is not our fault. GWR showed no compassion at all and just said they don't refund because they let the strikes no in advance.

When I booked the tickets in October I did not know or I would have not booked for the night of 25th.
So we lost a night of accommodation because of this strike.
Everyone had less money now and we are suffering the cost of living crisis but the trains keep striking when everyone has problems. Bad service from all staff Karen etc no we don't refund. Show some humanity and compassion because of the strike we lost a night of accommodation. Do at least a partial refund for the inconvenience but no. We don't do any refund!

items.title: Rail Network Isn’t Always Bad.
items.review_text: Unfortunately I wasn’t paying attention to train changes. I had bought an e-ticket from Evesham to Worcester Foregate and a return ticket on the same day. I boarded the train at Worcester Foregate Street and forgot to change trains at Worcester Shrub Hill and didn’t realise this until the ticket man on the train said that I was heading towards Weymouth! So I had to change at Tewkesbury. When I boarded this train, the ticket man asked for my ticket and I explained the situation, he was very understanding and wavered my fee between Tewkesbury and Worcester. Despite the rail strikes and the disruptions, I was blown away by his compassion and professionalism. People are always so quick to read about the negative stories about our rail network but on this occasion I was really impressed with the service I received.

items.title: GWR should burn themselves to the ground.
items.review_text: Utterly shambolic. A complete joke. If you work for GWR, are you happy? Is your life going well? ARE YOU READY TO DIE A NOBODY?

items.title: Useless, betrayed, disappointed
items.review_text: I got in a train and it got delayed for an hour then they said we couldn’t go to our destined location. The service here is terrible will never use on here again DONT DO IT GUYS!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! Secondly I have been in this same train for 3 hours this is not acceptable. I am beyond disappointed.

items.title: Compensation claim through Delay Repay - constant road blocks
items.review_text:
When the GWR service I was on recently was delayed, the conductor announced that we were eligible for compensation and we should apply on GWR’s Delay Repay. Grand announcements indeed, which don't match with the reality of the system, which seems set up to keep successful claims (even legitimate ones) to a minimum. 

My return journey from Newton Abbot (NTA) to London Paddington (PAD) on 5 December was delayed by about 34 minutes on arrival. (scheduled departure: 12:55, actual departure: 13:14; scheduled arrival: 15:29; actual arrival: 16:04). So, I go to Delay Repay to make a claim but it was rejected because I submitted my booking summary (downloaded from my "Past bookings" in my GWR account, which had the booking ref but not the ticket - but that was the best I could do. GWR’s “Action Required” rejection email said: “Please provide a photo or scan of your travel ticket(s).”  The problem is: (a) the email confirmation from GWR did NOT attach a PDF of the ticket (like it was supposed to); (b) the QR codes with the ticket numbers on the booking have since been wiped from the app (apparently, the app erases them once the journey has taken place); and (c) "Past bookings" in my GWR account shows the booking reference and date of travel but NOT the TICKET NUMBER. I even went to the Paddington ticket office and spoke to a supervisor to ask for assistance, but he said they couldn't print a duplicate copy of my ticket because what I had bought was an ADVANCE TICKET. This supervisor was sympathetic to the fact that my ticket on the app had been wiped by itself and that the email confirmation had no PDF attachment. He even looked up the online schedule of train delays and confirmed that this train (No. 1A84) from NTA to PAD on 5 December was indeed delayed, and assured me the information was verifiable in the system. 

Fortunately, before the trip, I had gone to Paddington to change to an earlier train for the return journey (NTA-PAD). The person at the Paddington ticket office was kind enough to write down the ticket number (starting with A-xxxxxxxxxxxx) on the back of each seat reservation stub. Thankfully, because of that, I do have the A-xxxxxxxxxxxx number, but it is handwritten and not printed on a ticket.

So, I scanned those seat reservation stubs with the handwritten ticket numbers and submitted them on Delay Repay. But I got a rejection again. The “Unsuccessful” email said: “Your claim has been checked using a set process and the details of any delay verified using industry systems holding historic train running information. We have reviewed your claim and can confirm the following: … Decision: Unsuccessful.”

The fact is the train conductor on the NTA-PAD service scanned my QR codes when doing ticket checks, which should prove that my partner and I did indeed travel on that particular train on that day, on that particular booking reference. With all this being electronic, the information is there and verifiable. 

What is in theory a straightforward process is made impossible by the fact that: (a) Delay Repay insists on having the ticket (not just the booking reference); (b) GWR's email confirmation failed to attach a PDF of the ticket like they claim it did. The “Action Required” system-generated email saying that I needed to produce a copy of the ticket stated "A PDF of the ticket(s) purchased should have been emailed to you." Well, "should have been emailed" isn't the same as it actually having been emailed! (c) the app wipes out all QR codes and associated ticket numbers after the journey has been completed; (d) our past bookings in our GWR account only provide the booking reference but NOT THE TICKET NUMBER! B-D above show how impossible it is to get hold of the ticket. Why insist on us producing it when you are so keen to erase all record of it? I suspect this is designed to make the process difficult so as to keep GWR's compensation payments to a minimum. I also wonder if the non-PDF-ticket bearing email was on purpose so we couldn't produce a ticket to make a claim.

Another fault with Delay Repay is that it doesn't have a box for explanations. It only accepts a scan of a QR code or upload of an image/PDF. There’s no way for one to tell them “I can’t provide the ticket because of X” (though I suspect it's set up that way on purpose). GWR customer service repeated the same lines: that the email confirmation should have a PDF ticket attached (no, it didn't!) and that I'd be able to obtain it from my GWR account (again, no!). 

Those purchasing advance tickets online should bear in mind that the QR code & ticket number disappear from the app once the journey is complete. Print paper tickets at the machines so you have a hard copy!

And beware the Delay Repay sham!

items.title: 5 stars to Bradley answering the WhatsApp
items.review_text: I want to leave a positive review for Bradley who was answering that WhatsApp today. In what is no doubt a terrible time for customer service people he answered quickly, understood my questions, and gave clear and helpful answers. He helped me get a seat reservation that means I (hopefully) can take the train and won't have to get a coach instead.

items.title: Terrible service now these morons are…
items.review_text: Terrible service now these morons are striking its ten times worse. If you live in a remote area and need to access hospital appointments doing so by train is the only way. Now most services are cancelled due to these strikes. If you want public support this is not the way to do it.

items.title: Another terrible experience in first…
items.review_text:
Another terrible experience in first class.
Although this time we did get a seat, but no refreshments.
Why is it when the train is empty the staff come round asking to see your ticket, when the train is packed and you have to stand, they are know where to be seen!!!

items.title: Cathy on the 8:23 from Swansea to…
items.review_text: Cathy on the 8:23 from Swansea to London was excellent, went the extra mile with a smile.

items.title: Really rude and aggressive train…
items.review_text: Really rude and aggressive train manager who basically told me to f**king get out of the way. After many years of taking skis via train they are now outlawed except for trips to the Cornish Riviera. So no way to go green from Bristol have to fly🙁

items.title: You made me late, BUT
items.review_text:
You made me late, stressed me out and nearly cost me tickets for a pre booked event, HOWEVER I am super impressed for the reason behind this delay.
A track side monitor detected that there was an issue with a wheel on the train. 
Train was stopped, assessed, and then crawled at 10mph to the next station where a replacement was provided. 
That level of safety precaution is awesome. Well done GWR.

items.title: Team Michael <3
items.review_text: The train was late and SO busy but we didn't care because the ticket man Michael was an angel sent from heaven. So kind so lovely he made our whole trip. on the 18.00 Paddington to Bristol 1st Dec give Michael a raise.

items.title: I love this tram company
items.review_text: I love this train company and, unlike many others, have never had a problem or a delay. However, I am appalled at the amount of plastic used in bottles of water and spirits served. There has to be a better way!

items.title: Leaving disabled people with out help.
items.review_text: I am disabled and no help was provided to help me into the train. I was left at the station while the train departed as I am unable to board without assistance. I made a formal complaint in which they said I need to give prior notice of my assistance. This is the first time I have been made aware of this. I advise not travelling with GWR if you are disabled.

items.title: Bullied by staff at Paddington station
items.review_text:
On 28 July 2022, I was subjected to degrading and upsetting behaviour by a GWR staff member.

I was unable to scan my eTicket to leave the platform side, so I queued up to get help from the GWR staff member.

At least one customer pushed in front of me. The GWR staff member allowed this to happen. When I came to the front of the queue, another customer, who had been idle and allowed several customers to go before them, suddenly berated me for pushing in front. I apologised for not noticing this customer.

When I approached the GWR staff member for help with my ticket, I was told to scan it. I tried to explain that I'd already done this but the staff member was disinterested.

When I unsuccessfully scanned my ticket a second time, the GWR staff member finally decided to do something to help me progress. Unexpectedly, the staff member decided to put on their glasses to carefully inspect my eTicket, something which they did not do for other passengers with ticket scanning issues.

When I passed through the ticket barriers, the GWR staff member berated me for pushing in front of the previously-mentioned customer. Given that other customers had pushed in front of me without challenge, I found the GWR staff member's intervention to be nonsensical and upsetting.

When I approached the station helpdesk to raise a complaint, I was instructed to re-approach the GWR staff member I wanted to complain about in order to raise my complaint. I challenged this but was told again to do as instructed.

I re-approached the GWR staff member to advise that I wanted to raise a formal complaint against their conduct. The GWR staff member appeared indignant and stormed off to get another member of staff to take my complaint. I could hear raised voices behind the ticket barrier wall.

When I raised an online formal complaint against GWR and their staff, I waited over 4 weeks to receive an acknowledgement of my complaint.

GWR failed to offer any compensation for the experience I had with their staff. This was because they "don’t offer compensation for staff complaints".

I decided to take my formal complaint to the Rail Ombudsman. GWR decided to offer £25 in rail vouchers as compensation. I declined, because I did not value my upset at £25 and I did not want "store credit" for a company I am actively avoiding.

---

If GWR employ staff like the one who bullied me, with that person possibly being a supervisor, then it speaks volumes about the calibre of people that GWR employs.

Needless to say, I do not recommend GWR (Great Western Railway) to anyone.

items.title: Another terrible experience with GWR
items.review_text:
Another terrible experience with GWR.  I cancelled a trip, ticket costing £25, due to serious illness.  Serious in that I could not even get out of bed.  I reticketed as soon as I was able to travel - safely myself and considerate to those travelling on the same service.
I filled out the ticket refund form but my request was REJECTED!!  I needed to attach a LETTER from my GP stating I was ill.
In these times, when we hear the NHS is on their knees with work, my GP would have been outraged to have to provide a letter.  Indeed their advice for the flu is, "Get in bed an deal with it."
GWR should be ashamed!!  Did they learn nothing during lockdown!! about communicable diseases!
I am pursuing this with GWR.  Hopefully they can deal with my complaint when they are not on strike!!

items.title: Made me buy second ticket
items.review_text: The ticket machine printed a void ticket. The ticket desk said they are not authorised to issue duplicates. I said I hadn't been issued a single ticket. They said I had to check what was wrong with ticket machine etc. Cost me £180 for ticket. Ridiculous I had to fork out again, apparently I can get it back if I go through some long online process. Don't trust their machines. Or their staff.

items.title: Please give me water!
items.review_text:
I have made two journeys this week on the London to Penzance line and on both occasions there were no refreshments at any point in the 5 hour journey “because the payment machine is not working”
On the second occasion I was seriously dehydrated by the time I got off!

items.title: compensation trouble
items.review_text:
Having been told claiming a refund for late trains was now easy I gave it a try.
I struggled through the website until I got to “scan your ticket” Did not have a working scanner and gave up. 
Since then, I had twelve more trains I could claim for including five in the last week. I decided to try again. Got a scanner and got back onto claims website. Got the ticket scanned then was told need to scan my photo card as well. Went to find my photo card and got back upstairs web page had reverted back to start. Got a scan of the ticket and photocard and started again.
Once that was done I was told I need to verify my e-mail. When I did that, I got a message telling me was already verified from the first time I tried to put in a claim. 
After nearly one hour for a claim of £2.70, I have given up again. I could try claiming for the other four late trains but that would just take too long.

items.title: An appalling service of the highest…
items.review_text:
An appalling service of the highest order.  My 09:08 train was cancelled from Worcester Forgate Street to London Paddington, delaying me by over an hour for an important meeting.  The train was so crowded people were sitting in the isles, naturally I gave up my seat for an elderly passenger, toilets were also broken.  When we arrived at Reading the trains brakes were broken and we were advised to disembark to another train coincidentally traveling to Paddington.  The toilets were also broken on this train. 
Due to missing my meeting in London and having my day ruined by the appalling service of GWR, I decided to travel home as soon as I could at 17:57.  This being an on peak journey I thought the conductor would have some understanding of my awful day an let me travel first class home, my ticket was for first class but off pea giving me some customer satisfaction.  
I had to pay the difference of over £57.  An appalling service, terrible.

items.title: On 13.18 train from Paddington to…
items.review_text:
On 13.18 train from Paddington to Cardiff came across Scott on his catering trolly in carriage H.
Was a pleasure dealing with this young man, very obliging & supportive.
Take this opportunity of recognising his quality of service to customers - well done & keep it going.

items.title: Getting worse!.
items.review_text: Getting worse!.. I fully understand things go wrong but when they do GWR should respond and they don’t!

items.title: DREADFUL CUSTOMER SERVICE. …
items.review_text: I purchased a ticket to travel on the 26th Nov in addition to a 3 year rail card. My train has been cancelled due to the strike. I returned my tickets and claim form. No refund has gone back into my account. I have emailed GWR and reply says it may take 28 days to respond. I have tried speaking to a online expert at GWR who cut me off after I gave claim reference number. I also rang customer helpline who transfered my call to another provider although my ticket was bought from GWR. Absolutely dreadful customer service.

items.title: Staff are brilliant
items.review_text: After delays and cancellations, a member of staff came down the train to ask each passenger where they were trying to get to and advised best next steps to take. He went above any beyond to make sure we all made it to our destinations despite disruption.

items.title: Dire service
items.review_text: Late trains often with no explanation or apology, uncomfortable filthy  seats, staff mostly couldn’t care less. Try travelling daily with this dire operator and watch your mental health decline. Almost impossible to get both daily trains on time ever.

items.title: Got me there on time
items.review_text: Clean train, on time, friendly staff.. the WiFi ..hopeless..needed that for my journey

items.title: Above and beyond.
items.review_text: My wife and her 80-year-old disabled sister, travelled from Weston-Super-Mare to Carmarthen and the assistance given, without being requested, by the station staff was above and beyond the service expected. They could not stop praising the help they were given

items.title: Thank You
items.review_text: Just wanted to say thank you to GWR Customer Services for processing a refund for me.  My wife and I, OAPs, had booked to go to London.  First attempt, HM Queen funeral - tickets replaced by local station. Second attempt, possibility of train strike.  Uncertainty causes great stress to my age group and I asked if possible for a refund - granted - 3rd attempt 2023! Thanks for your understanding.

items.title: I was on the 14:31 service from Fratton…
items.review_text: I was on the 14:31 service from Fratton To Cardiff central, and noticed a woman needed help. I reported it to the staff on the train, whose name was Garion. This gentleman was incredibly kind and handled all the situation so well. He was so respectful and helped us in keeping her safe. He then checked that we were okay and rewarded me and my friend with a £5 drink voucher. Just wanted to thank this staff member so much for being such a help and handling the situation sooooo well. Faith in humanity was definitely restored.

items.title: If I could rate a half star I would
items.review_text: If I could rate a half star I would. Utterly hopeless. The cheek of all these rail strikes, if anything they should be paid less. Worse than useless.

items.title: As usual delays mixed with over priced…
items.review_text: As usual delays mixed with over priced tickets. And they strike for more money? Jokers

items.title: Hopelessly unreliable - and poor service onboard
items.review_text: I sincerely  hope that this company should lose the franchise if they cannot up their game! Trains are constantly cancelled and when they are - refunds take weeks. WiFi is patchy to say the least and not at all conducive to working. The 'first-class' service is the worst of any company I have used. Even Avanti serve breakfast, sandwiches and hot options into and out of London Euston- they could teach GWR a thing or two. On GWR there are no sandwiches or hot options even on an almost three hour journey to and from London. It is hard to sympathise with such a company....

items.title: Awful service
items.review_text: Awful service. Faulty ticket machine at Paddington Station wouldn't allow me to print my tickets. As such had to buy new tickets at a higher price and GWR still wouldn't refund my ticket. Will be travelling by bus from now on.

items.title: Terrible service for the high price they charge
items.review_text:
I regularly travel to Reading/Bristol/London and the service is becoming more and more unreliable and the tickets more and more expensive. You have to plan way in advance because you don't know if your train will be on time, late or even cancelled! 

Also, you should fix:
1 - The taps in your trains' toilets - 1 time out of 3 they do not work!
2- The ticket machines - most of the times 1 machine out of 3 has a terrible touchscreen or doesn't work at all!

items.title: Well done GWR
items.review_text: I travelled from Exeter to Penzance with my sister and disabled elderly father in September past.The staff were so kind and helpful to us  on both our journeys.Assisted boarding/exiting was seamless even when we hadn't previously booked the service(not many trains in N.Ireland so didn't know it was a thing!)Train was clean and if l had any critisism it would have been the toilets could have done with a bit of attention.Wonderful staff.

items.title: Appalling customer service and overall journey
items.review_text:
GWR-CR-1608058

Disgraceful 
There and return both legitimate claims for refund 
Denied by them 
Filthy trains LATE all the time 
Joke

items.title: I regularly travel between Worcester…
items.review_text:
I regularly travel between Worcester parkway and Paddington.  The staff are invariably helpful and friendly, trains are clean and on time.

Yesterday I left my case on the platform after helping a young mum into the train.

I contacted GWR who were incredibly helpful, keeping me updated on the search.  They kept my case safe for my husband to collect.

I think this is great service.  People are quick to criticise when things go wrong but I have always been happy with the service provided.  Thank you GWR

items.title: Unreliable service
items.review_text: What is the point of cancelling the train strikes if the trains still don’t run!!!! Even today the trains are delayed ‘due to the strike’ when today wasn’t even a strike day. Only 1 train an hour instead of 3, and that’s delayed! Since my daughter started college in September her trains have been cancelled at least 3 times a week, sometimes leaving her waiting on a dark station. I am very disappointed that we can’t rely on the service.

items.title: Terrible service
items.review_text: Terrible service! I really pay high price for the monthly ticket and they are constantly breaking the agreement with me due to the never-ending-story strikes. The replacement busses will cost me 7 pounds/day but they will return me only 3 pounds. Not to mention that I need to spend 3 times more time. Shame on them. Let them give up this business if they cannot run. I dont care about their dispute with the government, they took 116 pounds from me and service is not delivered. Its a mafia organization!

items.title: I was on a train to Cheltenham Spa on…
items.review_text:
I was on a train to Cheltenham Spa on the weekend, taking a rail replacement bus to Gloucester my actual destination. The train was delayed at Swindon for about 40 minutes due to a missing driver, so I put a claim on their delay repay website.
The website wouldn't let me search for trains to Gloucester to I put in the train to Cheltenham, and uploaded my ticket to Gloucester. They denied my claim as I used a split ticket, despite the fact they well know that there is a rail replacement service from Cheltenham to Gloucester. There is no way to add comments to my claim, and when you call Customer Service they say use the delay repay website. The entire compensation system seems designed to not compensate people, but frustrate them instead. Considering they have a monopoly on the line they can get away with this tragically awful service, because what choice do we have?

Let's not mention that at Cheltenham I missed the rail replacement service as the staff had locked the gate that leads to the car park, despite their being a sign to go through that gate. I then had to wait 30 minutes for the bus replacement.

So I lost 60 minutes of my journey. I tried claiming for 30. They rejected it on a technicality, unaware that there was a rail replacement on that service and making out it was my own fault. They'll get away with it too.

items.title: Come on GWR
items.review_text: Come on GWR. If you work long hours in London it takes hours longer to get home, even before the delays, to Reading! Not so far but very much too much trouble. You make the case for robot trains very eloquently!

items.title: Diabolically rude service
items.review_text: Diabolically rude service. Purchased the wrong ticket by accident and was fined 45 pounds rather than being simply charged the difference. The conductor issued the fine with disgraceful glee.

items.title: I was at Bradford on Avon station this…
items.review_text: I was at Bradford on Avon station this evening only to find the only access to the platform from the town and the car parks was flooded. I am informed that this situation has been brought to GWR's notice on more than one occasion, and nothing has happened to resolve this most unsatisfactory situation. It is a major blight on an otherwise very pleasant station. Customers do deserve better when it rains.

items.title: Absolute disgrace of a company
items.review_text: Absolute disgrace of a company. They should be ashamed to make people pay astronomical prices for trains that are NEVER on time. I truly believe this company owes us some much money in refunds and are as unhelpful as possible to prevent people from claiming successfully. SHAME ON YOU.

items.title: DON’T USE
items.review_text:
Train delayed.

On train but still not sure if it’s going all the way to my destination!  No announcement on board, internet suggests it’s terminating several stations short.

What a joke !

No explanation why

Still beginning to expect this from GWR

Atrocious!  No alternative transport being offered.

items.title: I usually travel by coach but …..
items.review_text: I usually travel by coach but having given GWR a go to travel back from a previous visit it has changed my outlook. Today my train into London was delayed and was worried after getting the tube I would miss my connection. Using WhatsApp I was assisted in finding which platform I needed. My hour overlap was swallowed up and if it wasnt for being  given this information I would have missed my train at Paddington whereas I caught it with a few minutes to spare.

items.title: I Normally get the train on my ticket…
items.review_text:
I Normally get the train time on my ticket but today got an earlier one. Sometimes people need to get an earlier train, i would have waited but i needed the loo and the station toilet
was closed so got the earlier train. Really pissed off as the lady I got charged an extra £27 ! What is normally a good customer experience with GWR was a terrible one! What's worse she said pay up or I chuck you off at the next station and you can wait for the ne t train.  I'm nearly 63! Is this how GWR treats its customers?

Really pissed off !!

This complaint goes on trustpilot

items.title: Overcrowded train
items.review_text:
Overcrowded train - standing in the aisles
No point in booking a seat. Stood the whole way from Castle Cary to Paddington. Constant apologies over the tannoy. Breakdown on previous train but who knows

items.title: Stop the train strikes and deliver reliable service
items.review_text:
I was hoping to avoid leaving this review, but enough is enough, the train strikes are beyond a joke now. 
As a regular commuter I am disgusted that the best GWR can do is apologise for the elongated strike action. My livelihood and business rely on me getting to my meetings in person. I am spending a fortune on alternative transport and overnight stays. 
The public are fed up with being held hostage to this dispute. As well paying customers we need and deserve reliability of service. No more excuses.

items.title: Wonderful trains and booking system
items.review_text: wonderful trains, a great app, and an online booking system!! Overall been using it since 2017 and have had only good experiences in both the normal class and the first class.

items.title: Buses on rail replacement
items.review_text: Buses on rail replacement, came late, took 25 mins to complete a 9 min journey, I miss my train! Ok, stuff happens, I get that! Next day I catch the earlier bus, I get to station and am not allowed to use the waiting room and made to stand outside station in freezing cold for 25 mins, until 09:10, when the off peak passengers are allowed in! Absolutely no common sense applied whatsoever, in difficult circumstances!

items.title: Great driver today
items.review_text: Great driver today! He communicated with us so much more than usual, warned of the bumpy Hugh speed bits and for the first time this year we arrived in Paddington to the minute on time! In case you can pass on thanks, I was on the 06.55 from Plymouth on 24/10/22. Thank you!

items.title: Terrible
items.review_text: Terrible. 09:30 Sunday from Oxford to London: 5 coach train, 10 coaches of passengers. Running late. Less than standing room only. Other passengers unable to board. Had to push/squeeze to my reserved seat. Booked a window seat, but no window, just a blank wall! Hemmed in to a tiny corner. No communication from any staff. Awful is an understatement. No discount. No apology. Terrible.

items.title: SUPERB CUSTOMER SERVICE
items.review_text: We ended up at Paddington station on our last leg from Cape Town 2 days ago, The train hadn’t stopped at the station we were supposed to get off at and it looked like we needed to go from Reading down to Devon. The tickets  didn’t work and a fabulous chap named Joel took us round to the manager, Kefan, and they could see how tired and stressed we were and they sorted our tickets and made sure that we got on the right train with further help from a lovely lady called Bee. It was absolutely fantastic customer service/relations from all of those guys and we wish to thank them all very very much, we got to Devon safely!

items.title: Terrible service on the Cotswold line for decades
items.review_text:
Terrible service on the Cotswold line which is more often than not delayed or cancelled. I was told recently after a three week wait that my refund claim (due to strike action) had been unsuccessful due to me not having sent them a photograph of my ticket cut in half. As other reviews mention, there's nothing about this on the refund website, and I've also successfully claimed many times before without cutting my ticket in half. Madness.

The company also seems to be in the habit of employing arrogant and unpleasant staff. There's a particularly despicable employee who works out of Oxford station named Cerney Kilbee. Customer service at its worst.

items.title: Not enough carriages so people forced to stand
items.review_text:
Two carriage, absolutely packed train Fratton to Cardiff. Many people (inc older)  forced to stand most of route. Why no more carriages laid on? It’s Friday & this is a heavily used route on this day. 
And train was late so I missed by connection. 
I guess poor service is what happens when you vote for govts (Tories) that sell off everything to the private sector. Hope the First Group shareholders are happy!

items.title: Delayed - Can't get refund
items.review_text: Had a day trip to Cheltenham from Honeybourne. The train was delayed and then further delayed due to the doors not closing. we arrived in Cheltenham over an hour late. We decided to get the bus home as we could not afford further issues. I have tried to claim my money back and the system is just rubbish. To try and claim for 3 tickets bought at once is impossible as they ticket number is the same for all three tickets and the online system states you are duplicating. My claim got refused and customer service then said I had to go back onto the same system that clearly has a design flaw to claim again - this has not only ruined my plans at Cheltenham but also spent 2 hours trying to claim my hard earned £60 back

items.title: Uncomfortable journey, Hitachi 0%,  HST's 100% comfort.
items.review_text: Love to travel by train when I can but unfortunately the overpriced ticket and uncomfortable seats on the Hitachi rubbish doesn't make for a memorable journey. Miss the good british made HST's, what possessed some idiot to choose Hitachi? I want to use my car less on long journeys, shame we are stuck with these trains and future uncomfortable journeys.

items.title: My wife travelled first class from…
items.review_text: My wife travelled first class from Truro to Reading last Tuesday across lunchtime and full train.Luckily they had crisps available but were unable to provide any food despite stops at PlymouthExeterTaunton and Bristol.At least if you travel by car you can get something at the Services.Apparently this is a regular problem.

items.title: Welchers
items.review_text:
Its showing 1*as -99* isn't possible but is truly deserved. This company broke its contract and thought a grizzle on TV would help. If it were a soap it would be carbolic. I made my way to Paignton despite being dumped at Bristol since it seems Westbury is a key service. Which GWR exec lives there? I will be claiming the additional expense this clueless company put me too. Worst Railway Company.
Letter sent18/10/22. GWR doing really good impression of ostrich with head in sand. Take away the franchise!

items.title: Sharall from GWR is an Angel
items.review_text: A man who works on GWR, named Sharall, went above and beyond for myself,my mother and my sister. He heard that we are traveling for a funeral. And made sure our journey was the most efficient, relaxing journey. Made our day. You don't get service like this any where else! Absolute Angel!

items.title: Sophie on your Paddington to Taunton…
items.review_text: Sophie on your Paddington to Taunton line 17.32 13/10/2022 makes you feel human again. Deserves a promotion

items.title: Greedy and corrupted GWR
items.review_text:
Greedy and corrupted GWR, probably the whole railrail system. I am a victim of train strike from 4Oct-9Oct, the worst case is on Monday 3Oct I bought a weekly ticket from Reading to London, £153.10, the counter guy he knew that there was train strike but didn't let me know what will happen, and still proceeded and stole the money from my card. And in the end of Tuesday my boss told me that there would be train strike and asked me don't go to office for the whole week. 
Today on 11Oct I went to the counter and asked for refund for the days I didn't take any tain from 5Oct to 9Oct. But the counter refused and gave me a form for applying DelayRepay. That form is the most tricky one, start from it it said 'If you did not travel, you need to apply for a refund instead of compensation. Refunds should be requested from the place you bought your ticket.' Or go the gwr.com refunds portal. I tried that gwr.com refunds portal, but on last step you couldn't ever see a submit button for refund. That is cheating people.
And the counter said you should try DelayRepay, but on that DelayRepay portal, it states that you can only claim 'DelayRepay' after you have travelled.
This is dead loop here, the counter they don't let you refund for the 'Train Strike Action', and the GWR 'Refund portal' never allow you submit the claim, then their 'DelayRepay' portal also never enable the 'Submit' button even you have sumit the photo of touch card.
This GWR and the whole railway system is so corrupted and greedy, they are cheating people, service is completely bad sometimes you have to stand from Reading to London for the 30 mins, but they charge you so much expensive fee. Why the government can't get it nationalized?

items.title: Love the Great Western Railway!
items.review_text:
Love, love, love the Great Western Railway! 
My wife, myself and 2 friends had to take the train a few stops. When we approached the platform a GWR employee named Busola asked if we wanted a free sandwich from a large container full of drinks and sandwiches. I thought it was for those less fortunate so I said no. Busola continued to explain however that it was for everyone to enjoy and this was because of the Queen's passing. She went on to explain that whenever there was a holiday or special commemorative event that the GWR gave away free food and drink. Busola was so friendly we ended up chatting a bit before our train arrived. Of course we had a delicious sandwich too and enjoyed them on the train with a clean table and comfortable chairs. We will definitely ride the Great Western Railway again in future and we hope you're working Busola when we come through! Thank you so much Busola and the GWR!!

items.title: I mistook Basingstoke platform 5's…
items.review_text: I mistook Basingstoke platform 5's location and ran around the corner to see the train about to depart. The fantastic Guard saw me and delayed it's departue for a few seconds to allow me to catch the train. Many thanks to him Basingstoke   arrived Reading 12:51 August 24th👍

items.title: Needed to get to Heathrow Airport in…
items.review_text: Needed to get to Heathrow Airport in good time. The first train was delayed, meaning I then missed my original departure timing. The next train available was then delayed too. There is a distinct lack or anybody actually giving two hoots!

items.title: Shambles of a company
items.review_text: Shambles of a company - you can’t rely on the trains running on time. Or even running at all! I’ve had to cut my time in London short to ensure I get home. Trains frequently cancelled. They can’t even pay the delay repay correctly. Paid for a ticket via card yet they somehow can’t pay the compensation back to said card and have to send a cheque. Useless. And they conveniently keep closing the Twitter customer service when people are in need of answers.

items.title: Terrible
items.review_text: Terrible.  Awful service delayed over crowded horrible dirty trains. The most annoying part was the announcer telling everyone on the platfom to stay behind the yellow line and let people off the train when there was no train at the platform. It was delayed and had not arrived. No information on how long it would be delayed just kept on telling us to let people of the none existent train

items.title: Train cancelled over 90 minutes…
items.review_text:
Train cancelled over 90 minutes delayed, advised not to travel and then they had the cheek to tell me my delay was 13 minutes!!!! Cheers GWR you cost me half a days pay and wont let me make a claim 

Don’t need a reply as you’ve made your decision - truly pants

items.title: Multiple trains cancelled due to…
items.review_text: Multiple trains cancelled due to 'overhead line problems', massive delays, unable to leave station due to no driver - just about everything that could go wrong went wrong.

items.title: Horrible service as always.
items.review_text:
I found out I had a fine with GWR, said date I had bought the ticket and the guy on the train didn't inform me my ticket was the wrong one. If he would have said so, I would have just paid the difference on the train. 
I instead had to pay almost 80£ for anyway an awful service. And guess what? I couldn't find a single way to call them and ask them about the situation. Also, trains are almost always late. Unbelievable.

items.title: Awful white heard staff member
items.review_text:
We were accosted and shouted at by the larger white haired member of staff for no reason and escorted out of the station because one of our party members was to Ill to travel.
Worst customer service we have ever experienced. Gwr get rid of this horrendous guy !!

items.title: My way to college everyday
items.review_text: My way to college everyday, great!

items.title: Can't pay online
items.review_text: Can't pay online. I get to the booking screen and the pay button doesn't work. I've input all mandatory fields. I tried on two different laptops and a phone and it doesn't work.

items.title: Expensive, just get a bus
items.review_text: Some trains are bad, some trains are good. Ticket prices are a scam.

items.title: I didn't want to give even one star
items.review_text:
I didn't want to give even one star. First of all it's not GREAT as you name your service (Great Western Railway). Everything the train is either cancelled due to the signal failure (where does our money go?) or there is a huge delay for (unknown reason) most of the time! And as a result last year I had to work extra shift to make up my time. (I had to cancel my overtime shift).
Change the name. Fix your trains and improve your service.

items.title: Energy crisis is expensive but the…
items.review_text: Energy crisis is expensive but the service by GWR is more. I got compensation for train being late of 84p. The next train was over an hour after that amazing they can’t just refund you the ticket cost And let you put that towards a taxi ride. Of us had deadlines to meet with probably walk everywhere. GWR is the worst company I’ve ever experienced late trains,cancellations and No sense of ownership for that terrible service

items.title: I'm 78 and they won't refund my ticket from their strike action
items.review_text: I booked a ticket to Bath at £69 and then there was strike action. I sent the physical tickets back to the freepost address provided with a letter and I got a claim reference. They then declined my refund saying they needed further evidence. What further evidence do you need other than the physical tickets I paid for? I've tried to contact online and put a new claim in, on twitter and told to call which i did twice and was on hold for over an hour each time so eventually hung up. I've emailed the feedback email as instructed with my original email with the booking ref and had no response still 3wks later. I am 78yrs old and cannot afford to lose this money yet have had appalling service and no consideration for the stress and upset this has caused me

items.title: Always late
items.review_text: Always late. Smelly trains

items.title: Biggest Con going after buying 2 first…
items.review_text: Biggest Con going after buying 2 first class tickets costing in total over £360. We were offered water during the duration of the 2 hour journey and then informed that out of the 4 people in the First Class carriage I was the only mug that paid for them. Whatever you do don’t buy First class as you can just jump straight into the carriage and the conductor will simply just let you stay for free!! If you do pay the full price be prepared to be informed there’s no guaranteed right that you will get drinks and snacks that you think you paid for as these aren’t complimentary and don’t come with your £360 tickets. Well done GWR you’ve totally mugged me off!!’

items.title: Rude Train Guard
items.review_text: I boarded the train from Cardiff to Paddington at around 2pm. Loads of people got on and all the seats were taken up when I got on with my suitcase. Me and another guy were both with a suitcase and stuck in the doorway because people were standing in the corridor of the carriage. The suitcase stand was full so we were left standing in in the doorway unable to move. The train guard came along from the First Class carriage and demanded we moved down. Is he blind because it was too full to move down especially with a suitcase. We told him we will try but we have to wait till there is less people. He said no go now as we were blocking the doorway but we said we can't it's too full. I said can we not just stand in First Class as there was space there he said no you don't have a First Class ticket. How ridiculous. That would of solved the problem but him being a Tory snob said no. I don't get why we couldn't we are not using the First Class privileges like the seats or free drinks and it would of sorted the health and safety. Obviously snobbery comes before health and safety according to him and maybe GWR. In the end me and the other guy waited in the doorway with the guard lingering around us and we eventually moved down after ages. But it could of been sorted straight away by moving us to the First Class carriage were there was loads of space to at least stand without blocking a door. But this snob could not have that. It makes me angry that everyone says oh don't drive it's bad take the public transport. Yet this is evidence as to why I will not do this.

items.title: Delay Repay Poor
items.review_text: As a long term and regular user of this rail company I have had to make a number of claims most recently for industrial action. Many of these are rejected as they seem to be using the booking reference rather than the ticket number so any multiple tickets booking is deemed to be the same ticket and all but the first rejected. The cumbersome appeals process normall results in silence, and customer service complaints in “ cut and paste” nonsense.

items.title: Tickets price is reasonable but…
items.review_text: Tickets price is reasonable but services are not great. I have bought 6 tickets as I had hotel rooms booking on 18/08/2022 but I was not aware about the railway strike and there were not a train departing from Gloucester that day. I wonder why did they sell the tickets for that day if there was a strike. I had to cancel the journey and buy new tickets book new hotel rooms. Apply the refund but have not refunded yet. I had to use my overdraft and credit card. Asked for compensation information they just hung up phone. And it takes quite long to get connected.

items.title: Prove you did not travel on this cancelled service
items.review_text:
You cancelled my train because your staff were on strike. A night sleeper cabin ticket, which is valid for a single train at a single time, not a ticket that could be used on any other service.

What would be the responsible thing to do? Refund the payment right? I have an account and you can see I bought tickets… but no. You want a picture of the ticket. Fine. I send a picture. Almost a month later (you said 10 days) you decline because the ticket isn’t cut up. 

Why on earth do I need to prove to you that I have cut up a ticket I physically cannot use?!

I now have to contact my accountant to go through all of my records searching for that one ticket to return it to me, so I can send a picture of it cut it up to prove to GWR that I definitely didn’t travel on the train that they cancelled.

Absolutely bloody ridiculous and a clear attempt to just con people out of money for services they did not provide.

items.title: Disgraceful Opportunitistic
items.review_text:
19/08/2022 10:55 Truro to London Paddington 
From the moment I boarded the delayed train, there were problems, as the reservations were not working which caused a lot of the passengers to become stressed. The excuse was that a 10th coach had been attached to the 9 coach train. Although this was initially frustrating, the extra carriage sounded as though it would be helpful as the train was expected to be busy due to strikes. 
Very quickly the train filled up, which meant there was no space for luggage or people. My luggage was taken off the train to make room for another person's suitcase, and luckily I noticed this otherwise my belongings would have been left at Plymouth. There is just no way that you can keep an eye on your belongings, which also highlights that if there was a suspicious package, no one would know or be able to escalate this- again putting customers safety at risk.
 The air conditioning is not  working and there is no way to purchase water, for a 4.5 hour journey this is unacceptable and dangerous. Furthermore, there are no access to bins or toilets and there are people piled up like animals. 
If an emergency was to occur, it would be a tragedy as there is absolutely no way that ANYONE can access emergency points. 
There is no food carriage, or any way to purchase water. Understandably, passengers are becoming irate because we are literally being treated worst than cattle. To make matters worse, WE are having to pay for this treatment. 
There is no justifiable reason for this horrific journey. GWR are opportunistic, greedy and do not care for their customers safety one bit. 

I think that everyone on this journey should receive a full-refund for this journey and GWR should stop exploiting there customers, by regulating how many tickets are sold.

items.title: Poor
items.review_text: Poor, and I've given them a very good chance. Delayed 5 of the last 6 times I have used them, and that is standard. Improvement is a must.

items.title: GWR TRAINS - SHAMBOLIC!!
items.review_text:
GWR TRAINS -  SHAMBOLIC day.. my birthday ruined . You cancelled 12 25pm to BATH..then 1 25 delayed ...FULL AS SARDINE CAN  I got in First class as I thought I could upgrade and get a seat.  I'm 77 TODAY and registered disabled. It  is FULL of people OBVIOUSLY  didn't pay upgrade. I could ONLY STAND near the DISABLED AREA and there were 15 pieces of luggage there...very dangerous TRIP HAZARD..  plus 2 you young women sitting on the floor on with a small boy 
 I was so stressed worried I might fall..Treating us like cattle!! I'm dreading going back.  I was shocked that there were NO TRAIN STAFF CHECKING TICKETS. .AT ALL  going and coming - I wonder how many  DIDNT BOTHER BUYING TICKETS ???
How NOT to treat regular customers.  Brexit has turned GB into a sad decline in standards 😕 😢

items.title: Constant delays and strikes
items.review_text: Staff expect a pay rise with all these strikes but when they are actually working and not striking the service is awful. Every train is constantly delayed or cancelled, staff are rude, no air con in the trains, then staff try to get you to buy new tickets if you're on a later train. If the trains run on time I wouldn't need be on a later train in the first place. Such awful service since Covid.

items.title: Delay Repay - In A Flash…
items.review_text: Our train was held in Par station for three hours due to a kink in the track ahead. On-board staff provided us with two bottles of water each. Upon arriving home, I submitted my claim for "Delay Repay and within three days received notification that my claim had been approved and payment had been sent to my bank. A first-class service. Well done GWR, no wonder it's called God's Wonderful Railway.

items.title: Rude disminatory staff shouting at me...
items.review_text:
Dear Team,

I want to bring a matter to your attention regarding my journey today whereby I was mistreated by staff. 

I was heading from Plymouth to London at 16:50 today: 12/08/22. The train experienced a half an hour delay today and staff checking my ticket instructed me to move from first class to standard. However, someone was sitting in my reserved seat there. Staff passing by told me that twice as they were handling the trolley. I was unable to go the first time because people were in way. The handling trolley was in the way the second time. In the third instance, the older brown haired lady in a ponytail with glasses rudely yelled and shouted at me “you still haven’t moved!”. I know I’m a younger adult, but she does not need to yell at me especially when I couldn’t move on the train. I don’t know whether she had a bad day, but I apologised for the inconvenience. I had to sit in a seat that wasn’t mine because the person was not going to move. What can I do about that?

Another man was also sitting at the end of the first class section; and she and other staff did not check his ticket as he was in the toilet when they were checking and he was also sitting in a seat in first class where it said “available”, as were others. I honestly feel upset and discriminated because of my minority ethnic or religious background. If others could sit there and they weren’t supposed to, why was I yelled at rudely?

I sat in a seat that wasn’t mine in another GWR train multiple times however I’ve never been treated this rudely before and shouted at. Today I experienced a delayed and nearly four hours journey I was not going to sit on the floor. Please see that your staff are trained on etiquette, customer service and discrimination training would be good. No customer should be shouted at by staff when paying over a hundred pounds for a train ticket and be discriminated on. I would like a total refund. 

Ticket number: TTC7RSP9FPT

items.title: Awful experience
items.review_text: Awful experience, delayed by an hour, train constantly stopping in between statios, trains are packed full, no room to move! Worst it’s been in a long time.. something needs to change

items.title: What an amazing member of staff!
items.review_text:
Me and my family were delayed on two trains on the way to Axminster and we then finally got off. On the train, it was extremely hot, keep in mind it was 33 degrees Celsius outside and there was a lot of passengers on the train.
Thankfully, when we arrived at Axminster, where this kind and caring member of staff, Alex Spryer, who offered to fill up our water bottles and gave us a free bottle of water each, along with giving any pets a bowl of water to drink from. Thank you to the kind Alex Spryer at Axminster who made our day positive and provided a superb customer service by being generous, helpful and overall amazing! Thank you for making our day better!

items.title: Refund process takes AGES
items.review_text:
Refund process takes AGES. I will report them to the department for transport. This is UNACCEPTABLE!

They seriously take so much time to process even simple refund requests. They can't keep our money for THAT long if they haven't provided the service. 

Completely unacceptable.

items.title: Trying to submit a claim with GWR has…
items.review_text: Trying to submit a claim with GWR has become really rather difficult. It keeps coming back unsuccessful for various reasons, even though my train was delayed over 2 hours, with my last train cancelled. Don't promote your delay repay service if you don't actually repay!

items.title: Still waiting on the train for the…
items.review_text: Still waiting on the train for the driver after 20min. The chairs are rock solid. I don’t think that they could have been tested before rolling out the new interiors. I’ve not taken a rail service that so clearly couldn’t care less about their customers.

items.title: Guard 45 minutes late to work
items.review_text: Guard 45 minutes late to work, stuck at station for 25 minutes. I want him fired NOW

items.title: GWR delayed payment process -  scandal
items.review_text:
GWR's handling of "delayed payments" which are due to customers following delayed train journeys is a scandal. Every point of contact is designed to put you off claiming - the delayed payment website which *does not work*, the long holding times on the phone, they "lose" the information when you make a claim by telephone and you are forced to be on the phone for over half an hour just to lodge your claim. They don't answer emails at all, so you have to phone up again. My claim has taken over a month and endless hours of my time, with over 10 emails unanswered by the completely useless GWR contact team. Only escalation to an Executive complaints handler finally got me my payment and any proper communication. 

GWR also initially falsely recorded the delay time internally as "1 minute delay" when it was over 20 minutes. I questioned this - I suggest every customer does too. Do NOT believe their own records.

It gets even worse. In addition to all of this, while stuck on a very hot train for nearly an hour whilst it was sat at a station awaiting a new driver after GWR messed up on that too, the refreshments trolley "Host" refused to serve anyone desperate for water or food who left their seat and approached her. She said she would eventually come to us, but she failed to. I was ill from the effects of heat and dehydration as a direct consequence of her refusal to serve us.

Scandalous from start to finish.

items.title: WAITED 7 HOURS IN HOT WEATHER
items.review_text: what a joke i finished work at 3 today didnt get home untill 10:30 from par to lostwithal... and waited over 7 hours to get home just to start work again at 7 in the morning. and the ticket man had the cheak to ask me for a ticket after waiting on the platform for 7 hours in this hot weather. disgusting. the only nice thing was couple of the staff in the train giveing out water but apart from that. 0/10

items.title: Chasing a refund for 3 months and counting
items.review_text:
My train was cancelled so I had to take the following train. On my journey to my destination I received an email telling me I could claim a refund. When I tried to fill out the form it wasn't working so I reached out to GWR via Twitter to ask for help - which I have proof of. On my way home I tried again and the website was working so I connected to the train's WiFi and filled out a form, in fact I have a screenshot of the compensation part of the form.
I then set a reminder for 1 month to check on the progress of this refund.
1 month later I reached out via Twitter to ask when I would receive my refund.
