I was told no refund had been logged to "clear browser cookie and cache" and try again again, but by this point I learned it was over 28 days which is the GWR time limit for applying for a refund. The agent telling me to clear my cache makes me think that this might be an issue they've experienced with other customers, that my claim was correctly submitted but that something went wrong in their end, particularly because the website wasn't working a few days prior to me submitting my claim as I know for 100% that I filled the form in. I have been trying to fight this case with GWR since May 24th and its still going on because they take so long to respond, and the gaps are getting further apart - 3 days, 5 days, 8 days, 24 days and now 5 days and waiting.. - it's ridiculous. And each response is restarting the conversation from scratch, dragging it out further, perhaps to make me give up? I won't. I've now reached out to an Obudsman to look into this case and their refund practices. My advice to others would be to keep a close eye on the progress of your refund and reapply/reach out long before the 28 days end to check on the progress of your claim. Going through these reviews, I see many others have very similar situations which I plan to share with the ombudsman and I reccomend you do the same!

items.title: Impossible to claim the delay compensation
items.review_text:
What an absolute joke and possibly not even legal!

Impossible to claim delay compensation because of GWR’s own rules. 

The delay compensation that a person can claim needs a copy of the Ticket which gets kept by the barriers / turnstile at the final destination, making it impossible to claim for the delay.

Even a copy of the receipt for buying the ticket at the station by card, will not be accepted because GWR say there is not enough information on the receipt, even though it is GWR that decide what information to put on the receipt. Is this done purposely to stop people being able to make a claim?.

In my situation, I had the receipt showing I bought the ticket in person at London Paddington at 15:19 and paid £65.20 for a single which is the correct fare to Weston Super Mare on the 15:32 train. Later trains would of been cheaper. This means that GWR can see I was physically in London Paddington at 15:19 and paid a higher fare to get on the 15:32 and naturally anyone wants to get hone and not sit in the station waiting around, especially having paid the higher fare for the next available train. They can also see by my home address I live in Weston super mare.

The 15:32 was late leaving Paddington and also terminated its journey early meaning that ai needed to get off and wait and get another train rather than one train all the way.

However GWR who decide what info goes on their receipts have informed methat there is not enough info on the receipt and they are the ones that set the final destination barriers / turnstiles to keep the actual ticket, this making it impossible for anyone to claim, nice one!

items.title: Worst first class journey ever
items.review_text: I have just had the worst experience ever in a first class carriage. A food trolley was parked immediately behind my seat for the entire journey, and it was serving food to the entire train. The noise was absolutely unbelievable. I will never travel first class on GWR again.

items.title: No working toilets
items.review_text: This is based on my recent experience,. I was on a train to Portsmouth & Southsea and in the 4 coaches, all of the toilets were unavailable/ not working. Imagine the discomfort I felt because I really needed to use the loo. Another guy was pacing back & forth as well because the toilets for the same reason. To be honest this is unacceptable. And I’ve noticed the trains are so filthy lately, like they haven’t been cleaned for days. Please do better, we pay to ride the trains.

items.title: They changed the coaches after…
items.review_text: They changed the coaches after boarding, and we lost our pre payed seats. This is a ridiculous progress and totally unacceptable

items.title: Dirty and littered carriage with all…
items.review_text:
Dirty and littered carriage with all kinds rolling around on the floor. Chocolate all over the tables. Absolute filth.

Also no shop as "unfortunately we only have one trolley and we're not an aircraft" so 3.5 hours with no water.

All for the pleasure of £150, they're a disgrace.

First class is also a joke you get a stale cup of tea with uht milk and a dry and sweaty fruit cake, this isn't the 80s.

items.title: Total Shambles,The New GWR Hitachi…
items.review_text: Total Shambles,The New GWR Hitachi Experience you having a Laugh , Get a better product and Maybe yet Maybe things will get better.

items.title: GWR; lacking organisation & inefficient.
items.review_text:
Paddington to Weston-Super-Mare. Awful.  Not surprised RMT are striking. Only one train manager who had to cope with an over-crowded, declassed train full of irate passengers.  Sun 17th July, hot weather, but not the extreme of the following 2 days.  2 other trains heading south west were cancelled and their passengers redirected to my train (which appeared to be a shortened version of the usual train).  GWR clearly had no plans in place with to cope with the unusual circumstances. The station lacked staff as did the train.  Apparently one train manager is enough for a train.  A rule made by someone who does not appreciate what happens on trains.  The overworked staff on the ground were left to cope with an extremely difficult situation with no help.  People were complaining because they had seat reservations but other people were sitting in their seats. One male passenger was taking 2 seats, intimidating anyone who tried to sit down and harassing the young lady sitting opposite him.  The train manager could do nothing and when reported to them, the British Transport police did not want to know as no crime had taken place.  So much for their “See it, say it, sorted” slogan.
The train manager did an exceptional job under difficult circumstances.  There were tourists from abroad who had been moves to this train and needed advice on connections.   2 older couples were struggling with the heat & crowding and she tried to keep an eye on them, providing water. 

Claiming for the delay was fairly straight forward although the amount given was paltry considering the awful journey.
When I commented on that, I was told that there were rules re what could be paid. 

I will look into taking the bus next time.

items.title: Best disability support I’ve ever had
items.review_text: I’m gutted I didn’t get his name however I got helped by a man at Totnes station at 14:50pm on 2/8/22. I am visually impaired so I need extra help with trains and finding the carriage and seat. This man was beyond helpful and took me to the correct carriage and seat as well as helped my carry a heavy suitcase. It’s my first time on a train in over two years so the anxiety was really high but this gentlemen really helped make it an easier experience. Again, disappointed I didn’t get his name as he deserved the recognition!!

items.title: Rubish company charged me 3 times for…
items.review_text: Rubish company charged me 3 times for my ticket !! Then I called costumer service where they hanged up on me. This is redicilous.

items.title: Excellent service
items.review_text: I just got in touch with the GWR team via WhatsApp to request a bike space. Speedy response from Brad with confirmation note. Excellent service, thank you!

items.title: Rubbish claims handling and customer service
items.review_text:
I called as I made a claim about a ticket I purchased online one day and claimed a refund the next day. Not only was the process very difficult and I had to register for another account but it also took a long time and the platform was difficult to understand and to use. 
I then finally got a decision that I got a refund-in the form of an e-voucher. As I no longer live in the UK, I wanted a refund to one of the cards I had to register throughout the claim process. So I called the customer service. I was on the phone for 50 (!!!) minutes altogether, speaking to 2 people. One of them seemed understanding and willing to help, however could not change the reimbursement form so he redirected me to another department. After I explained my situation I only got a “this is in our t&cs, there is nothing I can do”. I explained that I no longer lived in the UK and an e-voucher is GWR effectively robbing me as I am unable to use their services. Even though I purchased two tickets for both ways, the system somehow managed to show that these were single advanced tickets and hence “there was nothing GWR could do”. I find this reimbursement handling and I also find it hard to believe there was nothing GWR could have done when I was asked to give 2 bank account details in my claim submission and even in the email I received after submitting the claim, it said that GWR always tries to reimburse in the same way the ticket has been purchased. This is a blatant lie and as a customer, I woyld have had the right to get my money back when I asked for it, not having used GWR’s services. Also, buying a ticket for both ways and GWR somehow still managing to have it sold as single advanced (buying a few days before the travel, what would it be: single immediate?) just so that they can rip off customers is not best practice! Very unsatisfying and disgusting claims handling.
A never returning person (not customer) from the continent.

items.title: Delay repay not working yet again
items.review_text:
Yet again when I use the mobile Delay Repay for GWR it doesn't allow me to submit the claim because the ' I am not a robot ' box appears as an unhappy face. After 7 attempts I'm ' UNHAPPY' especially because this has happened on numerous occasions before despite their technical dept ' help' . I usually have to crank up my ancient Pc to use their system. 
Call me a sceptic but I think as this world make a lot of people give up..... Seems very convenient for GWR. 
I'm planning a formal complaint in case this is a common ' error' .

items.title: Unreliable and always delayed
items.review_text: I would give a zero if it was possible, they are delayed more than they are on time. They are unreliable and can't be trusted to run on time

items.title: Dodgy billing..?
items.review_text: Used website to try and book day return tickets for Tuesday, billed my card 3 times having gone through many pages then get server application error every single time. All other pages work fine. Disgraceful service, told me 5-10 business days for hold to drop off.

items.title: Excellent crew on 2.36 train from…
items.review_text:
Excellent crew on 2.36 train from Paddington to Castle Cary.
Kept us informed, friendly and great customer service. So noticeably good had to comment

items.title: £10 refund admin fee? even though I spent 20 mins doing all the admin for them????
items.review_text: Had to cancel a booked ticket due to positive covid test, GWR charged me a £10 admin fee. The funny thing is in order to process my refund I had to do about 20 minutes of admin for them, filling out their forms, with the same information multiple times, uploading evidence of cancellation etc etc. A convoluted and outdated system, we need faith in public transport don't charge people for refunds especially when you make them do all the work. Cancelling my accommodation took 3 minutes and was free. Please consider what improvements you could make and clarify why it seems people are striking for more money when they appear to get more than most people anyway? We need trains where is the plan for sorting this all out and when will you share that with the public.

items.title: If you’re planning on acctually getting…
items.review_text: If you’re planning on acctually getting on the train I wouldn’t bother just been waiting at the station 10 mins train arrives stand up to get on and by the time I got by the door we was getting shouted at as they were beginning to close, need more time or at least longer than 10 seconds!! How are elderly and young children meant to get on such a lash up of a service!

items.title: This feedback is for the lovely…
items.review_text:
This feedback is for the lovely gentlemen on the gate this evening at Swindon Train Station.
Due to a string of unfortunate circumstances I ended up missing my train.
He helped me find the next best train and then let me out the gate to tell my partner what was going on... then he let me back in again.
Such a nice genuine person.
I looked for elsewhere to give positive feedback but couldn't find any.

items.title: My journey was from Castle Cary to London Paddington
items.review_text: My  journey was from Castle Cary to London Paddington at 16.25pm on July 22nd 2022. I had brought my wrong debit card and couldn’t get my tickets from the machine so I was anxious about it but the lovely man who I spoke to was so laid back he put me at ease and sorted me lout with a ticket. Thank you so much to you

items.title: Bought first class tickets based and…
items.review_text:
Bought first class tickets based and was totally shocked firstly the conductor arguing I didn’t have first class ticket even though my ticket and receipt showed first class carriage and secondly despite every other first class service I’ve ever been on being able to have a free drink albeit alcoholic on this service they wanted payment !!!!!!!!!!!
overall very sub standard I’d rather drive next time  rip off extortionate price for no real added value 
If possible avoid

items.title: ABSOLUTELY APPALLING SERVICE!
items.review_text:
ABSOLUTELY APPALLING SERVICE!
Avoid at all costs!!

After almost 3 months I am still waiting to be refunded following train cancellations.

Have wasted hours sending and resending all the relevant information 

Beyond a joke !!!

items.title: Train cancelled
items.review_text: Train from Paddington to Pembroke cancelled. Paddington staff very helpful, caught a later train but no connection to Pembroke, train manager advised talking to staff  at Swansea. Arrived at Swansea, station staff arranged a taxi to Pembroke, can’t fault it.

items.title: They want a pay rise but they don’t…
items.review_text:
They want a pay rise but they don’t know how to tell you what correct platform is your train departing, lots of incompetent people working here. They change the platform 5 mins before departing, they tell you instead of getting to Gloucester to grab the Birmingham train at 21:30 having to pay hotel overnight to go back next day to your actual destination, delayed trains every day and these are just a few of the issues I encountered travelling only a few times with the train in 3 years! Great poor service, payrise for a incompetent services, I would not give you a penny more for how many bad instructions and how many times I missed a train because of the people working there!!!!

When you try to take your money back it takes months or you don’t even actually give it to you.

items.title: Impolite railway staff by beating me…
items.review_text: Impolite railway staff by beating me for just ticket checking. Ticket price is also unreasonable by double the fare for same distance comparing with other operators. I will definitely NEVER use it again

items.title: Very helpful Whatsapp staff
items.review_text: I had to change my ticket because my travel plans changed. I contacted GWR via Whatsapp and they were very quick to respond, with very helpful info and were very patient with me even when I messed up what I had to do! It took several Whatsapp conversations to resolve my issue (my fault, not theirs) and every time was handled with a smile by Phil.

items.title: Rail service. Coaches seriously high temperature.
items.review_text:
17-7-2022 - 10.08 train - London Paddington to Oxford. 

25 degrees outside and no air conditioning in any of the coaches. 

I had to spend over an hour standing in the door section just to stay moderately cool. 

Heaven help those later in the day when temperatures are Expected to reach 29 degrees - it will be even hotter than that in coaches full of people with all windows sealed so can’t be opened anywhere on the train. 

(A friend I was meeting at Oxford who arrived on a different GWR train told me that the air-conditioning on her train was not working either. )

Had they bothered to make an announcement at Paddington I would have taken the next train. 

Wi-Fi not working either. 

The only thing that did work efficiently was the app to take my fare.

Is Great Western Railway saving money, or just can’t be bothered?

items.title: Great staff make the journey a pleasure
items.review_text: I travel with GWR frequently. The trains are wonderfully air-conditioned and always clean. All the staff are lovely. They are friendly, knowledgeable and helpful. When there are problems or delays they make regular announcements so that passengers know what's going on.  Even on days when there are delays and trains are packed with standing passengers,  the staff remain efficient ad helpful.

items.title: Superb ticket collector…
items.review_text:
This evening I was really impressed by the ticket collector on the 19.32 train from Paddington to Bath.I have just arrived back in England from France and am loving his friendly English manner and his helpfulness to passengers.  I just heard him help one customer by looking up which connecting service he can get.
His announcements are also excellent and clear.
I would have given GWR 5 out of 5  except there was a slight delay to the service I was in.

items.title: Comfy train, good service
items.review_text: I caught the 9:24 from Exmouth to Central Station yesterday. It was very easy to buy my ticket the day before at the station as a conductor was in the station helping to keep the queues down. He was super helpful and efficient. It's only a short journey to Exeter but the carriage was airy and seats very comfortable with good lumber support. It was clean too. The same conductor was working on the train and I noticed how helpful and nice he was to everyone. And the train was on time for both journeys. Good job GWR.

items.title: Refusing refund despite 2 hour delay
items.review_text:
I was travelling recently from Stroud to Paddington on a direct train. The train was delayed on the journey by approximately 2 hours, stopping for long periods at stations. The train became solidly packed during this time with passengers standing. We were eventually told to change trains by the driver, to a longer train at Reading, as the longer train was being given priority to leave. We did as asked. The longer train then had to wait for a replacement driver due to delays. We eventually arrived in Paddington on the longer train. That evening I received an email telling me to request a refund. GWR are now saying I did not complete my journey by train and are refusing to refund?!
Update. I appealed the decision. GWR have now agreed to my refund. However, they are not refunding to the card details I gave them, as requested on their form. They have chosen to send me a cheque. My daughter, who travels regularly with them was entitled to a recent refund from GWR and again, GWR sent a cheque. I can only guess in the hope that some will not bank the refund cheques.

items.title: Travelling first class
items.review_text: Travelling first class, there was someone in my reserved seat but I easily found another. I didn’t want any of the free refreshments offered, but asked if I could buy some white wine, to be told there was only Prosecco. That’s fine, I said, and was give a plastic cup and a napkin, but the wine never arrived, nor an explanation. Why are people so useless at their jobs? I would be unemployed if I behaved this way to my customers.

items.title: Refund process
items.review_text: I begrudgingly had to give 1 star as there is no minus option. I recently purchased tickets to travel on GWR connecting with a flight. As my flight was cancelled I  changed my plans. I requested a refund following the instructions on GWR website and am annoyed to say the least. 15 days later I have been contacted by email requesting I resubmit images of my tickets cut in half!! I foolishly thought that when my request for refund was resolved the tickets would become void and unable to be used for travel therefore making the need for the ticket to be defaced unnecessary. I do not see the need for companies, of which GWR is a prime example, to deliberately prolong the refund process. I personally think 7 days is an acceptable time frame.

items.title: I’m on a train delayed for the saddest…
items.review_text: I’m on a train delayed for the saddest of reasons, a fatality at Maidenhead. Cardiff to Paddington. I was excited to experience for the first time a GWR Pullman train. I enjoyed a two course (and two bottle) lunch with wine delivered by fabulous hosts, Diane and Marc. Professional, natural, genuine, emotionally intelligent people. What a treat to be looked after by them. I like GWR a lot because of their people. Look after them or risk losing them like so many others, who put profit above people. Culture first, profit follows.

items.title: Really bad customer service
items.review_text: Really bad customer service. Bureaucratic and time-wasting, they make you chase your own money after they cancel services and tell you to claim a refund. Everything that is wrong with the privatised rail industry.

items.title: was supposed to catch the 11:46 train…
items.review_text: was supposed to catch the 11:46 train but the train pulled in earlier and left at 11:44 meaning that i missed the train. sort it out

items.title: poor customer service
items.review_text: I made the mistake of applying for a full refund on a return ticket when I needed the return journey. I rang them to ask if this could be amended - was told no. I spend a lot of money a month on trains and am struggling with the price increases. I said I can't afford to pay for another ticket. person I spoke to couldn't care less.

items.title: Nothing great…
items.review_text: All of the journeys with gwr have had issues. Shortened train. No reservation. Late. Packed. No trolley service. Appallingly bad app.

items.title: What an utter embarrassment this very…
items.review_text: What an utter embarrassment this very costly non-service is,  17:04 Paddington to Taunton and driver can’t be bothered to get in on time, no wonder there is not support for these lazy gits when they strike, even if it is legitimate.

items.title: Very helpful customer service
items.review_text: Very helpful customer service on WhatsApp. Thank you for sorting out my problem 💪🏻

items.title: Awful
items.review_text:
With GWR you will find only 1 of the following 3 features for each trip:

1) train departs and arrives on time
2) seat reservations work
3) wi-fi is functional

I struggle to understand how a company, so appallingly administrated continues to operate. Awful

items.title: I had the joy of travelling first class…
items.review_text: I had the joy of travelling first class on GWR from Totnes to Paddington on 27th June at 9.43 and again at 11.04 from Paddington to Totnes on 28th June. I was greeted by a delightful, kind, thoughtful young man, Freddie. He is so professional, anticipates traveller's needs. I had the privilege of travelling with Freddie again on 28th. He's elegant, smart and a joy to have helping me. Well done GWR, your HR team has made a wonderful appointment.  Can't wait for my next trip, I hope Freddie is working.

items.title: Excellent customer service
items.review_text: Freddie, the train crew member on the 11:04 service from Paddington to Plymouth 28th June was excellent. He is to be congratulated for his great customer service skills.

items.title: Left Stranded very disappointed
items.review_text: Very disappointed with @GWRHelp they sold us a ticket from London Paddington to Bristol Airport. This includes charging us for a connection shuttle bus from Bristol Temple Meads. The train arrived at BTM 23:40 and the shuttle bus supposedly would arrive 23:50 and every twenty minutes after that  however after waiting one hour and being stranded at a very precarious spot we found out the bus did not run in the early hours and we had been wrongfully sold a ticket for that bus. We were slightly lucky as we were a couple but they had also done the same with a single female and a 18 year old exchange student. We eventually had to get a taxi as we would miss our flight, we have tried to claim but @GWRHelp declined to help and have not accepted responsibility for there misleading sale! We always use GWR but on this occasion we are very angry and upset that they have treated their paying passengers like this. Please please please be very careful especially if you are travelling on your own when booking this particular journey. We will think twice about using @GWRHelp again and will be contacting the @RailOmbudsman for further assistance

items.title: GWR do everything they can do avoid refunds
items.review_text: We had to cancel a journey due to illness (thankfully not covid).  Standard return, not advance tickets.   The GWR website would only allow me to claim for one section of the journey.  Having taken over three months to respond I was informed that my refund was only partial as I had failed to declare I wanted both segments refunded, that they were charging a £10 admin fee per claim, and that time had now run out to claim for the other segment.  All responses received (after the three month wait) have been curt and unhelpful.  Sadly unable to give zero stars otherwise would have done.

items.title: My fave trains
items.review_text: My fave trains

items.title: Sat 18 June
items.review_text:
Sat 18 June - 12:24 Swansea to Paddington arrived at Swindon station 10min late with only 4 coaches and absolutely packed. Passengers standing in the doorways as no more seats, we could not get on the train and had to wait for next train 15min later. Next train arrived with a few empty seats. 
Sunday 19June, 12.21 Paddington to Swansea - our ‘Reserved seats’ (LOL) we’re taken by 3 young ladies from the Valleys of Wales, even with the seat signage clearly indicating the seats were reserved. When mentioning they were in our seats they just replied ‘well someone sat in our seats, so took these’. They refused to move and we managed to locate separate seats for the homeward journey.
What is the point of GWR offering seat Reservation if it’s a free for all and no enforcement? 
Really poor service, next time we’ll take the car!

items.title: Absolutely disgusting
items.review_text: Absolutely disgusting, train from Taunton 6 mins late, 10 mile journey starting at Taunton! Aircon not working in any carriage, 40+ and no openable windows. Home journey, again (almost always) late and need to change platforms. Sh!t hole state of train.

items.title: If I could give zero stars I would
items.review_text: If I could give zero stars I would. Always try to avoid traveling GWR. Great Waste of Resource more like. Waiting 50 minutes for a train, train suddenly cancelled because tracks are too hot…then suddenly that train becomes a London bound train. I think 7% of GWR trains I’ve ridden were on time. Quick to fine, over charge and blame others but radio silence when ever they mess up. If you are looking for uncomfortable, cancelled, late trains and a rotten train company to the core - go with GWR. Would rather horse and cart than give my money to this rubbish.

items.title: If you have to cancel you may be in for a long wait for a refund and the process is fiddly
items.review_text:
Update: After weeks of worrying, wondering whether I’d get my hundreds of pounds back, I got an automated email this morning saying my refund (less the admin fees they take) is on its way. Therefore I’ve given them an extra star because someone got to look at my case and they made the right decision behind the scenes for which I’m really grateful. 

No response to my complaint other than to direct me to the refund portal. You can’t win them all! 😂

Previously:

Bought tickets for the sleeper train from London to Penzeance, for my partner’s 50th, but now can’t go. Told GWR in plenty of time (nearly 3 weeks’ notice) - cabins sell fast, so there’s no reason they couldn’t put them back up for sale. Response to my refund request - no refund. No explanation, just no refund accepted. £400 down the drain. On their website it says they will refund the full amount less £10 admin fee, which is still a con, but I can accept £10, even £10 per person if they want to be greedy, but not to give me any of my money back in times like these is basically theft. They are not a reputable business in my eyes. There is no competition so they are able to charge ridiculously high prices for a tiny cabin and can then just choose to keep the money if something happens to you which means you can’t go. I’m very upset and angry with GWR and have made a complaint.

items.title: Awful Company
items.review_text: When travelling with GWR, when the ticket inspector checked my ticket, it transpired that my railcard had expired two days before. I had received no notification of this and was completely unaware of this. I apologised and said I would renew it on the spot, with the conductor watching. He said that it didn't work like that and I had to buy a new, full price ticket (despite having already purchased a ticket at 2/3 of the price). He refused to charge the difference and refused to get a manager that I could talk to about what had happened. He said I could appeal the decision after if I disagreed. I asked him to please allow me to renew the railcard, as that would make my ticket valid, and that I had very little money in this cost of living crisis. I was forced to buy a new ticket and when I went to appeal this, was told I could not appeal a new ticket and this was my fault. So I was forced to pay twice for the same journey with everyone I was interacting with being incredibly rude and unhelpful. In addition, the train was completely overcrowded (people sitting on the floor), and there was no refreshment trolley as a result (despite it being a boiling hot day). The train was also late. I was charged £100 for this journey (Totnes to London). I was absolutely disgusted and will not be travelling with them again.

items.title: I have spent an hour to put in a delay…
items.review_text: I have spent an hour to put in a delay repay claim. The GWR delay repay website says the website doesn't recognise my password. Which I know is correct. So I went through the process of resetting the password. It then said that the site was unable to reset my password. It seems pretty clear that GWR is creates barriers to people being able to put forward a delay repay claim. The delay repay site is extremely difficult and time consuming to navigate even when you can access it.Time consuming, cynical and frustrating.

items.title: First class is a scam here
items.review_text: Random noisy people sitting in first class. So if you pay extra for a quiet journey you’re in bad luck. Nobody comes to check tickets and to make sure only people with the right ticket sit in first class.

items.title: Overpriced
items.review_text: Missed my first train and was forced to pay double the original ticket just to get on the next one. Nearly tried to charge me quadruple the original too. Was told if I got a flexible ticket it would be fine; except the flexible ticket would have been hundreds of pounds more. Avoid GWR and get a coach instead.

items.title: Lost my ticket, it happens, but it will cost you
items.review_text:
Lost my ticket, had proof of purchase in the form of seat booking and collection receipt, but wasn’t enough and first great western made me buy a new ticket before they would let me head home. 

One of the worst customer experiences I have ever had and the ones that are worse are for train travel in the uk as well. How they get away with it I have no idea?!? Money seems to be the beginning and the end for first great western! Customer experience seems to be way down the list of things that they give a f*#k about! 

It would be nice if they could make it an affordable and enjoyable experience! I would be far more likely to travel by train if it wasn’t to expensive and unpleasant.

Th ask first great western for………. Nothing

items.title: Bad treatment of disabled customers
items.review_text: I had a very bad experience with GWR staff on the way to Bristol TM. The second I got on the train from Frome they asked if I had a ticket and then said you have committed an offence because i didn't have one. They made my say out loud why i didn't have one and I had personal reasons for not managing to get one in time which I didn't want to say, but I was always going to buy a ticket!! I told them how skint I am... they then made me say my home address out loud in front of a carriage of strangers who were staring at me, I said I don't want strangers knowing my address (as I've experienced harassment) but they were just like "oh..." and then still made me say it out loud. I have mental health and learning difficulties and this was really embarrassing as I get anxious enough being out in public anyway. Then when I got to the station I tried to tell one of the staff there that I wanted to make a complaint in person and she was like "there's not really anything we can do, I suppose you can talk to the station manager" She gestured at the station manager standing next to her, who then promptly walked off very quickly! way to receive feedback... I guess this is the only way to get you guys to listen to me now. Still can't afford the fine....

items.title: Excellent help and support from Bradley…
items.review_text: Excellent help and support from Bradley at gwr twitter. Thanks, Rory

items.title: Very little goodwill in the company!
items.review_text: I was issued a supposed goodwill payment of about £50 and went to claim it, to find out it had expired a couple of days before. The email issuing the link for the payment said nothing about a time limit to claim it. They refused to issue me another payment to replace the one not claimed.

items.title: Okehampton to Exeter
items.review_text:
Today my sister and I travelled from Okehampton to Exeter and back.  The trains were on time and the staff were all smart, friendly, helpful and efficient. 
It was an excellent experience and we will now seek to use the trains more often. Thank you.

items.title: Amazing staff and efficient service
items.review_text:
I went on a return trip from Taunton to London over Jubilee weekend. This was an extremely busy time and going there was completely smooth without a single problem. Coming back there were problems as lightning had taken out a signal (or something). This meant our train back to Taunton couldn't get to Paddington without major delays. They got everyone on an earlier train to pick up the delayed one at Reading and continue our journey without delaying anyone. They kept us all informed about everything continuously and everyone working within any of the stations knew exactly what was happening and could point everyone in the right direction. We were all apologised to several times even though we were all on schedule, thanks to all the quick thinking and hard work. 
We could not have been more impressed with the service while dealing with serious weather conditions. Thank you to everyone at GWR who made our entire journey stress-free.

items.title: A greedy company who leave paying…
items.review_text: A greedy company who leave paying customers to sit on the floor for their journey as they have oversold tickets.

items.title: Piled on like sardines
items.review_text:
Other train services between Plymouth and London Paddington cancelled
Signal failures leading to standstills
Poorly passengers

No fault of the driver bar agreeing to stop at all effected stations. I wish he’d said no so GWR could find a better solution to support all other cancelled services. Ownership to manage should not have been on one service. 

The 3:15pm service to London Paddington plays Martyre and overloads the train stopping at all stops that should have collected passengers on other cancelled services. It’s 18:33 and we are still on the train. 

It’s stuffy, smelly, noisy and overcrowded. Can’t breathe and no space to visit the loo. 

This was not a wise solution to the problem.

items.title: I put 1 star as I cannot put no stars…
items.review_text:
I put 1 star as I cannot put no stars in my evaluation. I had reserved a seat and the train was over booked for the trip Lindon Paddington to Bristol. Also, the reserved indication above the seats was not working properly!

Shameful! No wonder why railways in this country are at the verge of collapse. Not even a proper reservation they are not able to register properly in their systems.

items.title: Great Experience To + From Exeter
items.review_text:
Fantastic clean, comfortable train..to and from Exeter from Clapham May 31st/June 2nd. Loos were even clean. Bang on time both ways. Diligent, helpful staff who kept passengers consistently advised what carriages to be in, where to alight etc
Much easier than driving, and with a cheap advance ticket overall a v good experience.

items.title: I used to be fine with Margaret…
items.review_text: I used to be fine with Margaret Thatcher. After all, I hate coal so her killing the coal industry was kinda a win in my books. Until I had to interact with Great Western Rail, and now I feel a strong desire to p*ss on her grave.

items.title: I could not get refund for my cancelled…
items.review_text: I could not get refund for my cancelled EMR trip. I did try to make a complaint but their website gives me an error "Please enter proper characters". I didn't use any special character just a plain text...

items.title: Now I remember why I don't get the…
items.review_text: Now I remember why I don't get the train much. Not only does it cost more than driving but it took so much longer. Our return trip to barnstaple from Exeter took 1hr and 50minutes, apparently there were delays due to bad weather, which was puzzling as it was only lightly raining and had only been raining for half an hour. Staff were nice though and the train was clean and not busy.

items.title: Will never travel via rail for any…
items.review_text: Will never travel via rail for any concert or event ever again. What kind of company sells  train tickets but doesn't provide enough trains. Disgusting!

items.title: Delay repay more like delay won't repay
items.review_text: I was travelling from Liskeard to Guildford via Reading yesterday. The journey to Reading ended up being delayed on route and diverted to Westbury where we were asked to switch to another train on an adjacent platform. The scheduled train was due to arrive in Reading just before 13.00. We eventually arrived at 14.10. By the time I arrived in Guildford I was an hour later than the original schedule. Applied for a refund via Delay Repay uploading the pdf copy of my ticket. Shortly after I received an email advising that my claim had been unsuccessful as 'the uploaded ticket was not valid for the journey undertaken'. What nonsense! The ticket had been checked by on-board ticket inspectors. I have appealed but don't hold out much hope. I suspect that I will have to pursue the matter via the Rail Ombudsman or Small Claims Court.

items.title: NOBODY RESPONDS TO INFORMATION GIVEN
items.review_text:
Online claim for paid tickets for cancelled trains did not work.
 Have now been asked 3 times for information sent on 11 April.
Have been told on different occasions that I would get a response after 3 to 4 days then 7 to 9 days then 28 days AND HERE WE ARE 45 DAYS LATER AND NO RESOLUTION.
AND TODAY RECEIVED ANOTHER REQUEST FOR THE INFORMATION SENT ON 11 APRIL.

THIS IS THE WORST CUSTOMER EXPERIENCE I HAVE EVER HAD.

UPDATE….UPDATE…UPDATE 
16 HOURS AFTER REVIEW REFUND APPEARS….
SO SAD THE OPERATING SYSTEMS AND CULTURE AT GWR ARE NOT FIT FOR PURPOSE IN THEMSELVES.

items.title: Travelled from St Erth to Exeter St…
items.review_text: Travelled from St Erth to Exeter St David's - train seats are so hard and uncomfortable, toilet facilities are awful, water sprays everywhere when washing hands. They also need to look at putting a buffet car or shop in on these services, trolley service choice in pathetic.

items.title: I travelled from London Pad to Cardiff…
items.review_text:
I travelled from London Pad to Cardiff Central.
Honestly, after reading all the negative reviews here, I was scared to travel and was even considering taking the coach, but I risked it anyway. The trip was so worth it. The seats, the comfort, the staff, the views outside, everything was 10/10. Although, the tickets were kind of expensive, I would definitely use GWR trains to visit places in the near future.XNTN3B5X

items.title: Disappointing and more
items.review_text: I just don't get it. Some of the highest train prices in Europe but not the service to match. My 4 hour trip to London turned into six due to my train delayed at Exeter because there was not enough staff to run it on time. Non existent WiFi. How can you run a 4 hour evening train with only crisps, chocolate and mini cheddars as food. All cafes at all stations that I changed at were also closed. Shocking. Decent sized seats though.

items.title: The prices of tickets are ridiculous
items.review_text: The prices of tickets are ridiculous, I commute from London to Bristol and sometimes it’s 109£ for a single ticket, that’s more than going to Edinburgh or even Paris by train!!! So I end up taking the coach, which takes twice as long and it’s not eco-friendly. No wonder coaches are packed and trains empty. Oh and I love how on their website they say cheap tickets, cheap for who?!

items.title: Book with caution!
items.review_text:
Bought a ticket with returns, and I was delayed for the morning travel (thanks TFL), so I purchased another but apparently according to GWR there was "no need" to do so. 

As a first time user they have denied me a refund for the error, and on top they take a £10 admin for processing refunds which is basically their way of saying "we'll give you a refund, but not all of it".

A refund is a basic free service that no company should ever charge for. As you're returning what's rightfully belonging to someone else.

items.title: What a truly appalling company
items.review_text: What a truly appalling company. Bought a return ticket which had to cancel due to funeral arrangements and was then told that I had in fact bought a return 'journey' not a return 'ticket' for which a refund could not given only an e-voucher. I called up to question this and the customer service representative then tried to speak over me as I explained my situation and when I asked him to let me finish was told that I was being abusive and was raising my voice!!! This is my second poor experience in as many weeks so clearly something is not working in the GWR customer space! AVOID!

items.title: GWR have quick trains and are well priced
items.review_text:
If I am honest I had a meeting in Swindon, travelled from Newport. 40 minutes.

In a car an hour all day long and double the cost in a car.

I was surprised how quick the train was, what 150mph, I am still stuck in the 80s slam door trains.

On time, quick, cheaper than car.  A little lower perhaps from Newport to Heathrow and I'll travel on GWR everytime I go abroad. 1hr 42 into Paddington from Newport, sorry but that's quick.

items.title: Recent disappointing experience
items.review_text: Recent disappointing experience. Have held off using them as they are so expensive but got a good deal on split tickets. Was OK going out to Warminster, but coming back, a cancellation left me stranded for two hours and I had to take an alternative flight home. Due to the way I bought tickets, it was only a £8 refund. Would be hesitant to use again.

items.title: Terrible service
items.review_text: On 5.45 hour journey from Penzance to Paddington (journey time about the same as 100 years ago) stuck for 40+ minutes at Exeter as train manager joining at Exeter was 'stuck on another delayed train'. No catering during whole (what is turning into a 6.30 hour) journey due to 'staff shortage'. No water in toilet for whole 6.30 hour journey. Oh, and did I mention the pathetically inadequate wifi? And you're expected to pay a fortune for the privilege ...

items.title: Expensive
items.review_text: Expensive, uncomfortable journey. Very little to feel positive about.

items.title: Wifi didn’t work
items.review_text: Wifi didn’t work from Paddington to Newport on outbound or return leg week of 7/8 May 2022

items.title: Cancelled and overcrowded trains spoilt a nice weekend away
items.review_text: Usually drive but decided to try and be more environmentally conscious. Turns out to have been a big mistake. Gwr can’t even organise a short journey from Bristol to Gloucester without hours of delays and trains so full they resemble the tube at rush hour. Shocking service. 45 minute drive ended up taking three hours on the train. The vast minority of this trapped on the platform at Bristol with barely any seating. The journey cost about the same as driving and paying to park (even with using the two together railcard) If you want people out of cars you are going to have to do A LOT better.

items.title: Outrageous misogyny and discrimination from train manager aboard GWR Train
items.review_text:
I am heavily pregnant at 8 months and had taken my son for a birthday (day trip) to London from Bath. As we all are aware, train prices are exceptionally high having been raised recently but as it was a birthday trip I had no problem paying the high return fairs, unfortunately I felt unwell during the day and with shooting pains was instructed by my midwife to return for a check up immediately. We caught the 4.32 Taunton train (an earlier train back to Bath)  it was relatively quiet) only to be accosted by the train manager ( who's shift was between Paddington and Swindon) He demanded we pay £50 extra to continue our journey and when I explained my situation he had absolutely no interest or regard. He could obviously see how pregnant I was and in considerable discomfort, He then threatened to eject myself and my son at the next station to wait for 5 hours on the platform for the right train. For someone in management for GWR This man* demonstrated an incredible amount of hostility, discrimination, chauvinism, lack of empathy and dismissive attitude  towards not only women but also pregnancy and health and safety. Being forced to pay £50 extra to travel two stops further with him threatening  to throw me off the train is a DISGUSTING abuse of power and quite frankly I will NEVER travel GWR again if this is their policy of grabbing cash over the safety and health of their passengers. BEWARE! seriously 
misogynistic senior management aboard GWR train services. This particular service went on to have significant delays on track stopping for over 30 minutes both at Swindon and just outside Bath which caused even more anxiety and distress both emotionally and physically. The next train manager ( a lady) was much more compassionate but asked me to lodge a formal complaint online ...I received an automated reply stating I wouldn't receive an official  response for 4 weeks!!!!! I am outraged and appalled at such blatant discrimination, greed  and lac of care from one of the largest rail networks in the country. The least I can expect is a personal apology and a refund but I highly doubt either of these will be on the cards.

items.title: Train cancelled from Paddington
items.review_text: Train cancelled from Paddington. Should  have been a ruined evening but no, quick run to Reading with time to buy  a snack before boarding the original train that was now starting from Reading. A 10 minute delay but with comfortable seat, a cup of tea and a snack it passed in no time. Well done GWR for overcoming a problem

items.title: Bike space not possible with advance ticket
items.review_text:
When trying to book a bike space with an advance ticket for my journey, the website tells me I cant, because the service is full. 
If I select a standard ticket (3x the price) for the same service, the website is quite happy to book a bike space for me. 
What a pointless waste of time - travelling with a bike is difficult enough without this hassle.
Ended up using the Avanti website as they don't suffer from this 'bug'

items.title: (GWR First Class Review)
items.review_text:
(GWR First Class Review) 

A poor experience that is, in my view, worse than Standard Class. This review is based on a weekday service between Bristol Temple Meads and London Paddington.

First, the comfort levels were poor. The seats were hard and uncomfortable and the coach far too bright. 

Second, as soon as the conductor had been through the carriage at the start of the journey, many standard class ticket holders simply relocated into First making the carriage loud and impossible to work. The conductor made no further checks.

Third, the onboard catering was awful. Limited choice - far less than the standard class trolley service.

In sum I won't use GWR First Class again as Srandard Class is broadly equal.

items.title: Good experience only
items.review_text:
Thank you for connecting suburbs with big cities and providing a stable network. Personally I appreciated the chance to get to Southampton in 6 minutes using your services. Alternative transport had taken half an hour at double cost!
Trains can not always arrive/depart in time, due to circumstances that occur, understandably. 

Overall: happy customer.

items.title: Late as usual
items.review_text: Train was okay for once, BUT DELAYED AS USUAL. 63% delays for me at Exeter st David's. Done the math. Always something  going wrong. Faffin, waiting in the cold, no refunds, no good excuse for being late again other than gwr messin things up. And the prices!? NATIONALISE TRAINS AGAIN

items.title: Absolute disgrace!
items.review_text:
Absolute disgrace!
I am simply fed up with GWR... this company should be a synonym for chaos, recklessness and no respect for work and customers. I am regular comuter between Tilehurst and London Paddington and I simply can not understand how this company operates. Delays, cancellations are happening every single day. It is a normality rather than exception. For them everything shorter than 15 minutes delay is absolutely daily routine. There are even more nasty tricks they're doing to their customers. They can change the platform within literary 1-2 minutes from the departure time very often leave you no time to walk between the beginning and end of the station. Did someone from GWR thought about disables and prams? I have used SWT trains and GWR service is not even close. Their timetable is all over the place. It looks like they do not now what to do if even slightest thing on rail go bad... GWR shareholders  please send your staff for training as now they are very incompetent employees (including managers as well).

items.title: Horrific abusive treatment by ticket inspector
items.review_text: My son (18) recently travelled back from Bodmin Parkway to Paddington to return to University from a family holiday in Cornwall.  He was travelling with an adult ticket +16-25 year railcard.  When the ticket inspector came round to inspect tickets, he could not locate his Railcard on his phone wallet as he had recently got a new phone. He called me for help (he is dyslexic and has mild ADHD) and I forwarded the receipt for the Railcard and the reference for the card.  I also sent him a copy of the railcard from my phone.  THe inspector would not take this from him and refused to talk to me on the phone.  My son was verbally abused by the inspector which was embarrassing in front of other passengers, who seemed horrified by this.  He threatened my son and made him pay £25 cash as he could not find the actual railcard.  He was told he could get this money back at Paddington.  The ticket inspector then exited the train at the next stop.  My son was really shaken by this but went to the Ticket office to get his £25 refund.  He was told he could not get a refund and was given a "Delay Repay" form which is the wrong form.  I have complained on multiple times to Great Western Railway (online as there is no phone number to contact them) and I have heard nothing.  I still have not received the refund for the excess he had to pay.  My son is living on student grant, and a full time student.  This is outrageous behaviour and there Great Western Railway have done nothing to act on the complaint or refund his money.  BE CAREFUL TRAVELLING ON GREAT WESTERN RAILWAY.  Inspectors apparently receive commission for all the excess payment they can get from travellers.

items.title: Useless, unreliable rabble pretending to run a train line. Avoid.
items.review_text:
Let me start by sharing the link to 'Delay Repay'. 

Link not allowed

If you've had the misfortune of having to use GWR it's likely the most useful link anyone could give you. 

Please do claim. This rabble do not deserve to run a line as busy as this. 

In short, the level of delays from GWR is quite frankly a disgrace. Delayed trains are the norm; on time an exception all underpinned by friendly but poorly informed staff who will try, but invariably fail to help.

Occasionally, despite best intentions, they may even hinder your journey by sending you on a travel merry go round that leaves you really stranded.

Avoid GWR and the stations they run from if you can.

May I suggest unicycling along the M4 as a safer, faster, cheaper and certainly more reliable way to get home.

And do please do utilise delay repay every single time you're delayed.

items.title: Our Ukrainian family of 4 arrived last…
items.review_text: Our Ukrainian family of 4 arrived last night have taken the train all the way from Poland. The service, helpfulness and friendliness shown to them by the Paddington staff was fabulous. Thank you all for making them feel so welcome. 1830 from Paddington to cheltenham

items.title: Valuable item recovered
items.review_text:
Good day! This is a happy customer!
I am a visitor from the USA and 
I traveled on a 9:50am train from Paddington to Charlbury on 4/22/22 and I left my Canon T Rebel 6 behind. 
I am writing to let you know how grateful I am to your staff!

1. Sophia Williams (who found my camera and turned it in)

2. Ellie Baird (Train Manager) who tracked down who worked the morning and sent a message to the person and them took me to the Oxford stop to retrieve my item 

THANK YOU! I AM SO GRATEFUL!

Lots of appreciation from
Both @audi_ayana & @fernjoan_

items.title: GWR inflexible and a rip off
items.review_text: Okay so it's my mistake original tickets were ruined,I mistakenly put my wallet in the washing. So you would think GWR would replace even if they charged for this. I would have happy paid. But oh no, they couldn't replace once they were issued.  The resolution from GWR. Buy new tickets. Well I had to do that and for the same journey the cost had gone up to £165. This is a rip off and frankly scandalous.  I my living on a pension and have to make this journey for an important hospital appointment. If it had been pleasure I would not have gone. Thanks for your no wonder people are not traveling by train

items.title: Daylight robbery
items.review_text:
Shocking customer service 
GWR refused to refund me when I tested positive with covid, despite advising  them & cancelling in advance. 
I strongly advise you to book your tickets through a different service where you will be treated fairly should you be unfortunate enough to have to cancel due to illness. 
Daylight robbery

items.title: Yet another delay and no information
items.review_text: Unbelievable farce trying to pick son up from St Germans from the 20.37/20.44 from London Friday night. One hour late, no info on station or via DM, excuses on train ranged from engine fault to missing crew. Why do things always fall apart on services once they pass Plymouth?

items.title: St Erth Station in Cornwall
items.review_text:
Early train to Paddington and our ticket is not until 12.30ish.I managed to book earlier with the help of Sandra in St Erth Station. 
What a wonderful  to end a holiday with a helpful staff in the station. 
A credit to her.
Thank you

items.title: Worse than useless.
items.review_text: Bought tickets online, told can only view them on the app. App does not work (ever). Customer service claim that, after giving me incorrect information multiple times, they cannot send me the tickets nor can I collect them from the station. They tell me to buy new ones and THEN apply for a refund for my old ones, without any explanation on how I'm going to view the new tickets. I came here to see if this was actually some sort of scam website but feel I should share my experience.

items.title: Terrible - avoid if possible
items.review_text: Terrible, expensive service, staff couldn’t care less, delays on almost every train I’ve taken. Avoid rail travel with GWR if possible!!

items.title: First class but third class food
items.review_text:
I travlled first class from Lonodn to Penzance (return - over 5 hours) and on both journeys there were no sandwiches available, just crisps and cake to eat.
I complained to GWR: their response was pathetic - "We have recently made the difficult decision to stop serving sandwiches on board due to the reduced number of first class passengers" Why does the number of passengers matter? If I am the only first class passenger on a plane I will get first class food service, so what is wrong with GWR?

items.title: Poor Customer service
items.review_text: Pathethic customer service. On 6 April 2022, there was massive delay between slough to reading and reading to guildford. On normal day, it normally takes 1.5 hrs to travel slough to guildford but that day it took 4.5 hrs. Still delay claim department insist there was delay of 14 mins ????? GWR can u explain this ??? If so how on the earth I reached home in about 4.5 hrs instead of 1.5 hrs ????? 3 hours more than the usual time ....... And you refuse to pay back just £25.00 ticket claim........I would never ever recommend GWR train service to anyone because when it comes to claim, change ticket or refund they are very very poor in customer service - will simply hesitate to do it because they do not want to give back money. Out of 5 I would give them 0.00000000000001 for customer service.

items.title: helpful customer service on Messenger
items.review_text: I've contacted customer service on Facebook Messenger twice in the last 24 hours, with two different queries, one about an existing booking and one about booking bicycle spaces and both times I've been very impressed with the quick & helpful responses (from Jess & Brad)

items.title: Appalling service
items.review_text:
Appalling service. I just wanted to change my return time on my train ticket from Paddington to Cardiff from 19.18 to 15.48. It has taken me all afternoon and I've got nowhere.
It's meant to be simple just change the time on the app or website.Both don't work. I rang customer service they don't change tickets but I change them at a station. I live four hours away!
Twitter agent said buy two new tickets and cancel the ones I have and fill in a form to get reimbursed! It means I have to pay again for more tickets and they will cost more than the original ones I bought!
What is going on with GWR?
A change of train time on a journey should not cause so many problems!
I am not prepared to spend more money! Why isn't your app and website conveniently not working when it comes to making changes on train tickets? However, it works if you want to buy tickets. Disgraceful!!

items.title: Pathetic
items.review_text: Pathetic - started a new job - been late 5 days put of 10 - not fit for purpose.

items.title: I don't even know where to begin with…
items.review_text:
I don't even know where to begin with this organisation. First off the website is diabolical and if you make an error with your booking then you will have to jump through some serious hoops to get a refund by opening a refund portal account and the whole thing is just a farce. I'm certain they do it deliberately in the hope that people don't bother. No help whatsoever on the phone after waiting 40 mins to get through i was told that they couldn't ammend bookings over the phone
Absolute joke, I am utterly disgusted with thus company!

items.title: Back-breaking Seats
items.review_text:
A depressingly uncomfortable  experience. 

Used to look forward to a relaxing journey to London when the HST’s were still in service, one journey on the plastic torture devices GWR over charitably calls seats ended that notion completely.

Now I drive to London rather than take the train. It’s cheaper than the train and  it’s far more comfortable than the train.

The fact that driving oneself on a four hour road journey in preference to getting on a GWR train is a damming indictment in and of itself.

items.title: Lengthy delay receiving compensation
items.review_text:
Following a lengthy delay, I did eventually receive compensation for an operational delay of 28 minutes arriving at Exeter St David's. This delay in receiving compensation followed two appeals as I'd surrendered my ticket at the station barrier and had only the credit card receipt to validate my claim.
Can I suggest that the train conductor advise passengers not to surrender their tickets in the event of a possible compensation claim for operational delays.
Denise Turrell

items.title: The best trains in the country
items.review_text: The best trains in the country. Checkout cross country trust pilot. Now there's a real poor provider haha.

items.title: I’ve always brought my train fair on…
items.review_text: I’ve always brought my train fair on the train as when I always arrive the ticket office is shut and I don’t know how to work the machines as I’m only 14 I don’t respect the ticket man today as I went to do my usual thing buy my fair on the train (which has never been a problem) and this really rude ticket man came up to me and I said one single from exmouth to my destination and he shouted really loudly in my face saying that I should get a find as i should’ve brought my fair at the office I tried to explain my reasons and he was point blank refusing to listen to me I won’t ever be buying my fair on the train as apparently it’s a problem but if a person from topsham got on the train it’s alright for them to pay on the train I’m very confused and not very comfortable to be on a train anymore as he shouldn’t of shouted in my face !!!

items.title: GWR used to be ok, but now their behaviour towards customers borders on abusive
items.review_text: GWR used to be a decent train operating company, but since mid-2020 their conduct towards customers has seen a dramatic decline.  Most recently my wife and I used GWR to travel to Heathrow airport. We were greeted by a poster telling us to wear a face mask, even though this is no longer mandated by the UK government.  After buying our (rather expensive) tickets, the barrier attendant made the snide remark 'I don't know how you'll get all that luggage on the train' (we were within the luggage limits specified in the National Conditions of Carriage and GWR policy, travelling on a quiet and large train with ample luggage capacity).  We were then greeted by a poster advising us that simply staring at someone is now considered sexual harassment and perceived offenders would be reported to the police.  As I was moving our luggage along the corridor (no GWR staff had offered to help), another member of GWR staff decided to declare an item 'unattended' even though I was nearby and the luggage was within eyesight at all times.  He then became aggressive, lectured me that this was a major security hazard (this was at a provincial station not a major London terminus) and I wasn't allowed to bring so much luggage, though I knew full well I was under the conditions under which I had bought my ticket.   I said I was sorry for the disturbance caused and asked that he apologise too, reminding him that I was a customer - he declined and continued to be abusive.  Sadly this is not an isolated incident.  Earlier the same week, I witnessed a train manager spend twenty whole minutes giving a formal caution, to be followed-up in writing, to another customer simply because he had bought a ticket with disabled discount without a disabled rail card (this customer remained calm and co-operative throughout).  Furthermore, over the past two years, I (along with other customers) have frequently be threatened with fines and physical eviction from GWR trains by the British Transport Police if we fail to adhere to COVID regulations.  At times when these regulations were no longer mandated by the UK government, GWR staff accused those who didn't adhere to them of 'not respecting others.'  This has been accompanied by ubiquitous announcements, posters and platfom-mounted roundels promoting a COVID narrative that went well beyond anything sanctioned by official government policy and could be viewed as pschological abuse.  It's not the service I expect from a company I spend £1000s a year to travel with (usually with little or no luggage).  Cancelled, over-crowded and late trains I can accept; abusive behaviour towards customers I cannot.

items.title: Total waste of time every time
items.review_text: Total waste of time every time!  Yet again a train I’m in gets terminated before the end of my journey.  Now in a milling crowd stranded at Reading stn trying to get to London as paid for.  Will now be late once again. Absolute joke of a service! Won’t ever use again

items.title: Nightmare Communicating with GWR and nothing short of a Rip. Off
items.review_text: I booked a ticket with GWR back in October 2021 for two persons London to Cardiff in December at £146 but due to Covid restrictions were unable to travel so re-booked for April adding another £25.60 because the there was a fare adjustment. Unfortunately the ticket had a change in Bristol which due back problems and luggage transiting had to re-book another ticket at again £171.46 and applied for a monetary refund on the cancelled ticket. GWR sent me £25.60 only and stated later they had sent me a voucher for the £141. Living in Greece and only visiting the UK once a year a GWR voucher is of no use to us at all. In short a total rip off and trying to communicate with GWR was an absolute nightmare. Multiple mails with no reply for weeks on end - The GWR website is difficult to navigate - In short never again

items.title: Worst experience ever
items.review_text: Would have put zero if it had let me. I booked seats weeks ago as it was a celebratory weekend away for my husband's 50th. Boarded the train early at Paddington only to find four people together in our seats. They had the audacity to comment that we probably got the wrong carriage,  but GWR are at fault as they marked the seats as available.  Well done, you managed to ruin a fantastic weekend away.  Having paid £150 for BOOKED seats I feel completely ripped off.  Having to wander through the train trying to find a seat when everyone is settled is extremely embarrassing. You need to get your act together. Would definitely not recommend.

items.title: The Mobile Gulag
items.review_text: I am a regular traveller between Bristol and Paddington. First the positives: by British standards, this is a reliable railway. I travel every week and generally my trains run to time and are rarely cancelled. Here endeth the positives. Standard class passengers on the new intercity express trains can look forward to levels of comfort comparable with a park bench placed underneath a light source brighter than the Sun. It’s clear that absolutely no attention has been paid to passenger ergonomics. The seats lack any thigh or lumbar support and are way too hard and upright. These same seats are used in commuter trains on the Continent and are not fit for intercity purposes. The arm rests are at the wrong height and anyway offer no comfort given they are made of a hard plastic over metal with no cushioning. As mentioned previosuly, the lighting is bright and ice cold. Combine all these factors together and even a sufferer of acute narcolepsy would struggle to rest, nevermind sleep in these moving torture chambers. There is no buffet car and the trolley service - if it appears (big if) - never has any sandwiches left. The staff make the best of the situation but there is no polishing to be done of these turds for trains that we are now lumbered with for the next 30 years. Whoever at the Department for Transport is responsible for procuring these mobile gulags should be made to spend the rest of their lives living in one.

items.title: Just used several trains in Cornwall…
items.review_text: Just used several trains in Cornwall and the service was excellent!!! All trains on time, clean and efficient. Lovely staff at stations and on board. I managed to lose my phone, which was found and sent to Lost Property in Bristol. When I contacted them they could not have been more helpful and supportive. My phone arrived back today and all is well. Well done GWR - I am very impressed with your service. Thank you.

items.title: Great way to obtain your ticket for…
items.review_text: Great way to obtain your ticket for your full journey, but travel time leaves a bit to be desired. Ie train and taxi journey = 9 hours, the drive back in a car just over 5 hours. Trains wer clean and tidy and the staff very polite and helpful.

items.title: The service is horribly bad,the tickets…
items.review_text: The service is horribly bad,the tickets prices are shocking and they offer a refund on website but will never pay as they always find a reason not to,will never use again,rather drive my car

items.title: Always always cancelled trains
items.review_text: Always always cancelled trains. Pathetic.

items.title: Clueless
items.review_text: Twice this company have c*cked up my tickets. In 2019 I paid for a return journey and selected them to arrive by 1st class post. Only the outbound ticket arrived and I had to run around Paddington for 45 minutes to get my return ticket sorted.  Now again a week before I go on holiday I've found their stupid website has booked my Heathrow Express tickets for the 14th Feb despite it being included with my Newbury to Paddington journey.   These people have no clue what they are doing!

items.title: No refund sent
items.review_text:
They have not yet sent me a refund for a journey that took place more than 4 months ago.

They have initially said that they would have refunded my card. I then contacted them and after a few emails the said that they would have sent a cheque. The cheque never arrived. I contacted them again and they said that they will respond in a week. As a customer I donor need a response, I need a refund back to my credit card as it was supposed to be in the first place.

items.title: Swansea to Paddington with GWR return
items.review_text: Swansea to Paddington with GWR return. First time I'd been on this train since they retired the Inter-City 125s. I can honestly say the new trains are worse for passengers. The comfort level is poor. The standard class seats are like those on London commuter services, Ok for 50 mins, but not for nearly 3 hours. They foam is already compressed so you are sitting on steel and it feels like concrete. If you don't have back ache when the journey starts, you do by the time it ends. Really uncomfortable. Did anyone at First Group actually try sitting on one of these for 3 hours before they bought them? Compared to the seats on the West Coast Pendlino trains that Virgin Trains ran, that I would score as 8 out of 10, for comfort the GWR seats are 2 out of ten. Also the carpets are disgustingly filthy - they desperately need deep cleaning. Again on West Coast Virgin did that regularly. Now Avanti (First Group own part of Avanti) have taken over West Coast, no doubt standards will be dropping there too. The ticket cost an arm and a leg, far more than a comparable distance on West Coast. Why? To finish off, the lighting is a bright white LED. Come day or night it's on. Impossible to doze or sleep properly. Passengers have no control over it. Hopeless. Contrast GWR with West Coast - on West Coast each passenger has their own light so they can sit with it on or off. Much better. GWR are treating trains as if they are buses on rails. They are not. A train coach should have the same comfort as a road coach, not a double decker local bus. NEVER AGAIN. Just AWFUL.

items.title: Poor unsafe …
items.review_text:
Poor unsafe and waste of time booking seats
Friday seats booked train full no stand room left
Sunday 10 carriages due but only 5 supplied despite  cancelled trains . All bookings void a free for all all seats and standing room taken . Very full unsafe and unpleasant a total unsafe unpleasant experience

items.title: First time ever on this service from…
items.review_text: First time ever on this service from Paddington to Slough return. I can only say how impressed we were of the cleanliness, comfortable seats and spacious carriages. People who have left negative reviews need to travel on Northern Trains then they would see what we have to put up with. Think yourselves lucky I can assure you!

items.title: Another typical GWR journey
items.review_text: Another typical GWR journey. Booked 1st class tickets and paid more than the cost of a flight to Europe only for it to be delayed 22 minutes and all seats taken by standard class passengers. The guard's response was - "sorry- it's a free for all today". Welsh Labour won't improve the M4 around Newport but instead, encourage public transport. These people live in a different world. 🤣🤣🤣

items.title: Helpful staff at Truro Station
items.review_text: Darren at the Truro station was incredibly helpful when I needed to change my sister's tickets as she was unable to travel because of Storm Eunice. Lovely to find someone with a positive attitude rather than having to go through a call centre.

items.title: Shoddy treatment by GWR - Trainline
items.review_text:
I have had absolute shoddy treatment by this company. I'm not a train user and certainly won't be after this experience. I bought a return ticket through a company called Trainline for a service into Paddington from Bedwyn. In retrospect I realise I was travelling at peak time with an off peak ticket, a genuine mistake, that wasn't made clear to me on the app and they took my money for this ticket. At the station machine I couldn't retrieve my ticket with the numbers given by Trainline. On the train the conductor told me I had purchased the wrong ticket and to sort it out at Paddington. There I explained my situation saying it was a genuine mistake and I was happy to pay the balance. This was not accepted. I was told Trainline would sell any ticket regardless for what time, line etc!  I was asked to pay the full fare of £50+ which I refused. I gave my address and now GWR are threatening me with court action if I don't pay them £139.55. Been told to take up the matter with Trainline.........I have not been given a fair opportunity to redress this, I have tried.
If you purchase an airline ticket via a third party, a travel agent for example, you would expect the airline to accept your ticket! They always have done in my experience.
Why does GWR allow their tickets to be sold via Trainline and then not honour the purchase? 
Why would GWR not accept a genuine mistake?
Never again.

items.title: Use them as a last resort
items.review_text:
Trains are consistently late or just non existent regardless of weather. 
Refunds are a pain to collect and the tickets are insanely expensive. 

I use this service only when I have no other choice.

items.title: They don’t even deserve one star
items.review_text:
28.2.22 got a reply for delayed trains with an email address doesn’t work delayrepay.gwr.com
Terrible service. Even replying to a review.
If we could just replace such a terrible company.


They don’t even deserve one star. They make you pay for reserve Seat when the seat isn’t available because they’ve reduced the carriages. So I had to collapse on the floor as I couldn’t stand any longer with my heart condition.
They make you buy ticket for trains that don’t turn up and then you don’t get a full refund amazing how a scam/ poor service like this can keep going on and on and on and on and on.  Train stations without ticket machines and then overcharging children who haven’t got a ticket because there was no machine at the station. To say a poor show is not enough. If only we could all boycott the most expensive terrible service in the UK in my opinion. They never reply to Complaints to find out what the issue is. And probably they don’t care

items.title: Absolutely shocking
items.review_text: Absolutely shocking! No regard that they are meant to provide a public service. They should be removed of their licence.

items.title: Thanks to get cancelling all there…
items.review_text: Thanks to get cancelling all there services today just had to make a round trip 2 hours by car what a joke the British railways are in this country you should all be ashamed of this level of service and wasting people's time

items.title: The website disaster to book
items.review_text: The website and mobile site are complete and unmitigated disasters. Must have people paid to make their services not work.  Incompetence on a gold medal level

items.title: not very helpful at taunton station at…
items.review_text:
not very helpful at taunton station at all. staff i book to go back to burton on Trent no help from staff to help with luggage from taunton. staff on barrier gate was very rudeness and not very helpful he said have to treat them for a drink of coffee and cake? I class has a disabled person and the staff did not meet me to take the luggage up to the platform 5 to catch the train back to . train time was 12.53 catch from  taunton station they did not phone burton on Trent that I was on the train so that they help me to get of the train at burton on Trent. i contact customer service at g w r were not very helpful at all they just past from one person to another then back again it getting out of hand thinking takin them to court if they don't sort it out
 regard
jeremy olszenka

items.title: Eventually showed sense and sensibility.
items.review_text:
I wrote:

"Claims to protect customers with covid-complaint policy i.e. stating not to travel if unwell, but if you follow this advice which is also government advice, but have a negative LFT,  they won't give you a refund. Found this to be the case when I couldn't travel (to visit my 89 year old mum) at the end of January 2022.

This company also never replied to a letter with a copy of my father's death certificate."

Since the post above I complained to GWR and they have issued an e-voucher. I am pleased that they have showed some sense and sensibility.

items.title: Incredible customer service
