items.review_text: I stupidly left my suitcase on a GWR train on a Saturday evening and was very anxious to get it back, I received excellent help from Michaela, Tom & Philippa on the support team via twitter late at night and between them they were able to track my bag down before I’d even woken up on Sunday morning and was reunited with it by lunchtime. Incredible service!

items.title: Simon from Westbury.
items.review_text:
I want thank and shout out Simon from Westbury! Who was the train conductor on my journey from Castle Cary to Frome on the Bristol Temple Meads train today at 18:34. The guy is an absolute legend and I feel for him having to deal with drunks and vulgar people all on his own, he made sure of everyone's safety! Although he manages the situations very well I feel like he could use a hand or two. The safety of the employee should be as important as the safety of people riding the trains. Please look after him, he's a good egg! Would love to take him for a pint! - Adam

P.S. I don't know what this guy gets paid but I can assure it's not enough!

items.title: HUGE Thank you to Mike working with GWR
items.review_text: I had purchased a ticket through Trainline...and my QR code was not in the email to leave Bath to London! PS. for anyone purchasing tickets with Trainline, make sure to have an account setup. My purchasing a ticket as a 'guest' made this problem arise. Anyhow before even boarding the train, someone who works for GWR, assisted me to the point of downloading the Trainline app on their phone (my phone is a dinosaur) , helping me set up an account, and emailed mailed me the QR code through their phone (Thank you Mike!) All to say, I thought this was going above and beyond helping a customer (me!) to not pay double! Thank you!

items.title: Dishonest untrustworthy company
items.review_text: Dishonest untrustworthy company. Avoid.

items.title: I usually travel by car
items.review_text: I usually travel by car, but a damaged strapped up arm and a visit to hospital meant no!!!My return journey from St Austell to Truro was effortless and I was helped by friendly staff at both stations.. Might leave the car at home bit more.

items.title: The worst app ever?
items.review_text: Downloaded the GWR app in order to purchase tickets for a returm journey to be taken. Took all my details credit card details and the money. Then the e-ticket was presented on the phone, the app hung and the ticket has now vanished. So perhaps get a refund and do it again? Ah, you can only get a refund if you can present an image of the replacement ticket for the journey. Call someone for help? Good luck with that one. Don't touch this app with a bargepole, you will just be letting yourself in for a world of worry and frustration.

items.title: ATROCIOUS customer service
items.review_text:
Appalling customer service both by the conductor on the train (December 2021) and then subsequently with the customer service HQ.

Am currently trying to escalate a complaint to management but instead of responding they are ignoring my email.

items.title: Happy with GWR's Twitter Customer Service
items.review_text:
Today I interacted with Celia, on GWR's Twitter Customer Service team.

She responded to my questions very promptly, politely and helpfully. She also showed compassion with my difficult situation.

Well done to Celia and GWR.

items.title: The worst customer service I have ever experienced!
items.review_text: The worst customer service I have ever experienced and I had to successfully take to the Rail Ombudsman to recover the additional cost of changing trains when my original train was cancelled by GWR. I still cannot believe that GWR took my money and then tried to keep my money, while the professionalism that GWR showed in handling this over more than 3-months was almost non-existent!

items.title: Masks.
items.review_text: I am a British citizen, resident abroad. When I enter the UK, I scrupulously respect and honour laws regarding social distancing, masks, tests...Why is it therefore that I am sitting on a GWR train where many passengers are not  wearing masks?  Please renforce law to protect customers.

items.title: Zero Flexibility and No Compassion from GWR
items.review_text:
I had booked and paid for return tickets for myself and my wife from London Paddington to Torquay for 21/6/21 and returning 23/6/21 at cost of £194.80, even with my Senior railcard discount. On the 20th June I had an unexpected arthritis flare-up and was in considerable pain. I cancelled the holiday - the B+B Hotel immediately agreed we could switch to other dates at no cost. I know the ticket type with GWR did not provide for a refund. I booked the B+B for 4/10/21 to 6/10/21. I asked GWR if - in the circumstances, they would switch my tickets - I was happy to provide medical evidence - they refused and offered me nothing whatsoever. I paid ANOTHER £194.80 for the October journey. I also have to say it took repeated calls to GWR to get any type of response - they effectively have NO real Customer Service Team.

GWR deserve to lose their franchise.

items.title: Messenger Service is Very Good
items.review_text:
This review is specifically about the online support using the Messenger Service.
Twice now in the last year I've had trouble in booking up space for a bike and getting seat reservation sorted and each time I've contacted GWR on Messenger I've had a response within minutes. Each time, they have solved and sorted my issues within 10 minutes.
It really is a superb service and if anyone is having trouble with the booking side of things I would recommend using Messenger.

items.title: Excellent remote support for claiming…
items.review_text: Excellent remote support for claiming for delay. Used WhatsApp option and had immediate response that was specific and supported me so well

items.title: Efficient and helpful customer service after wrong ticket purchased
items.review_text: On 16 January, my son brought the wrong ticket (single from Didcot to Paddington, instead of a travelcard).  Chris at the ticket office in Paddington rolled his sleeves up, undertook the considerable admin necessary to cancel the original ticket and issue a new one (and apologised for the time it took to do it all!) and got us on our way.  He was very courteous and helpful throughout.  Thank you, Chris.

items.title: Really impressed
items.review_text: Really impressed with the communication. All through WhatsApp on a Sunday evening! This is how customer service should be.

items.title: Friendly & helpful staff made the journey exceptional
items.review_text: I made a journey from Kidderminster to Paddington with my mother, who was in a wheelchair. The staff throughout our journey were extremely helpful and courteous. They made the whole experience a pleasure.  I am only sad that I didn't take the names of each member of staff in order to make my thanks more personal.

items.title: Clunky/ poor website - overly complicated ticket selection
items.review_text: Poor website, slow to search the ticket database.  Unnecessarily complicated ticket selection for the sleeper.  Very unclear if a cabin is included or not. Poorly named tickets/ options.  Bad booking engine often shows up 'sorry unable to reserve seat/cabin for this journey' please amend your search.  In all, a terrible booking system.  Puts me off taking the train, but usually now just book using another site.

items.title: Unreliable late night journeys
items.review_text: In my experience, during the day they’re reasonably reliable. I travel from Swindon into London most days. The journey home is often rubbish. I travel later at night and even if the train leaves Paddington on time (rarely), they manage to find a way to delay en route. It’s really awful considering the cost of the tickets. Very frustrating to be perpetually late home with no explanation.

items.title: Two early trains cancelled last minute
items.review_text: Two early trains cancelled last week. Refunds don’t apply- seems harsh. Couldn’t get to Birmingham on time. Both were cancelled very close to departure time which causes maximum grief for your customers.

items.title: just another disgraceful rail co....no…
items.review_text: just another disgraceful rail co....no concept of customer service...

items.title: Stick to your own Timetable
items.review_text:
After paying £109 for a return to Ivybridge. I would have thought GWR would respect their own Timetable.
I arrived at 11.15 for the 11.19 train.
Only to be told it departed 6 mins early. Leaving me waiting two hours for the next train. Never Again!
Disgusting.

items.title: Never use their online service
items.review_text: Never use their online service. I paid 150 pounds for tickets online that failed to be delivered via post in time for the train. At the station the GWR desk then required me to purchase a second set of tickets with the promise of a refund on the original tickets that needed to be processed online. It has now been 6 months and GWR are refusing to process a refund despite this whole issue being their own fault. Staff have been unhelpful and combative throughout the process. Truly the worst customer experience of any railway in the UK.

items.title: Frosty the ice guard at Torquay…
items.review_text: Frosty the ice guard at Torquay Station.  Missed the train by the doors closing in front of me due to delayed taxis on Chritmas eve. Got to the train as the doors closed, fair play if I'm late I of course accept that although I'm sure if she had wanted to, she could have let me board... what leads to the review was her rude attitude, "come early next time"  fair play but you really shouldn't judge not knowing the context as to why I'm late. Also a little help would have been nice to save another £60 fare for the next train. Cold... merry Christmas to you!

items.title: Nightmare turned into a Christmas…
items.review_text:
Nightmare turned into a Christmas miracle due to fab customer service at Bristol: 
My son left his suitcase, full of his work and Christmas presents on the train when he got off at Chippenham as he had met an old friend on the train and gotten deep in conversation. Anyways on realising his mistake Chippenham rang Bristol and we drove there to collect only to find they hadn’t rung the lost property but the train coordinator who has now gone home! Disaster! But we talked to the train supervisor, Ian who worked out where the train was now (on its way back to London) phoned the train manager in the train a lady called Tracey and tracked down said missing suitcase. Another gentleman in the office (sorry I didn’t catch his name) then phoned the manager on the returning train (London to Weston super mare) and Ian collected it from him for us as it passed Bristol again.  Fantastic team effort from conscientious staff. Thank you to Ian and his team. 🎅🎄🎁

items.title: Absolute joke
items.review_text: Absolute joke, cancelled both of my trains, one of them without any notice until its arrival. What the actual .. ! This is what happens with private-own railways. We need a national rail.

items.title: The staff and company are inept
items.review_text: The staff and company are inept.  Would rather ride a donkey to Reading than use this service.

items.title: Long trip from Exeter
items.review_text: Long trip from Exeter, couldn’t find railcard with discount, already had paid £70 for my ticket, inspector was so abrupt and charged me an additional £103 which I couldn’t afford but had no choose but pay. Found discount rail card after journey, emailed straight away proof etc auto email back expect reply in 4 weeks!!! I really  need to be reimbursed now, what with Christmas etc. please help

items.title: Basingstoke reading line .
items.review_text:
Second consecutive morning the  train between Basingstoke and reading is cancelled .first day faulty break! ,second day staff shortage !! Very bad service and the delay / cancellation refund is a joke .the trains also not always clean enough .
Its time for the government to take action to improve the train services because train fares are not cheap !

items.title: The GwR app is a complete waste of…
items.review_text: The GwR app is a complete waste of time. I am always receiving Technical Fault etc when im trying to book a ticket. I have to travel alot and find this app absolutely Useless....Surely in these modern times of technology a big company like GWR should at least have an app that works....extremely dissapointing to say the least. It would be quicker for me to walk an hour to a station to purchase my tickets as my local station 10mins away does not have a ticket machine to purchase from. How absurd....will use TFW from now on at least they are reliable.

items.title: £63 to travel 1,5h from London to Bath…
items.review_text:
£63 to travel 1,5h from London to Bath on a so-called “super off peak” ticket (cheaper flying to Spain!) sitting in an overcrowded train no way to social distance - UK public transport sadly makes owning a car a way better solution - climate change, who cares, right? 

But seriously, make public transport state owned and prices fair and low. Travel within a country shouldn't be this bad.

items.title: Second time on the direct train from…
items.review_text: Second time on the direct train from Reading to Plymouth. It’s stopping very often always with different excuses. The delay this time definitely will not be less than 1 hour! It’s seriously bad I wonder what would be the next step to complain. This company have to do better!

items.title: Awful Service
items.review_text: Both trains were cancelled without notice or email. I was only aware of the train cancellation when I arrived at Paddington.

items.title: Terrible experience
items.review_text: Terrible experience. Both on the train service (that was delayed by 40 minutes and then cancelled last minute) and customer service.

items.title: Arrived on train to an empty carriage…
items.review_text: Arrived on train to an empty carriage with windows open, we wasn’t wearing a mask as was in the evening and to be honest forgot as rules continue changing - ticket officer abruptly and rudely asked me and my boyfriend to put on a mask. We apologised and both put one on. At the next stop four more people got on our carriage, all not wearing a mask. She proceeded to check the tickets off the four people who got on our carriage, but didn’t once ask anyone to put on a mask. Of course I / we have no problem at all with wearing a mask but really didn’t appreciate the tone she had with us and the fact she for some reason singled us out. She was polite and professional with the four other passengers, but clearly just didn’t like the look of us.

items.title: Well and truly annoyed at the service…
items.review_text:
Well and truly annoyed at the service from Bristol Temple Mead to Exeter this evening. Arrived an hour before our train was due to leave. The amount of people trying to get on a teatime train with 3 carriages was crazy. We were the first on the platform and the only ones who couldn’t get on the train as people would not move along the carriages and the staff didn’t move them. This left 5 woman, one 6 months pregnant and a 75 year old stuck on the platform for more than an hour to wait for the next train, with no guarantee we would be able to get on that either.

GWR charge so much for the train and should not be able to sell tickets if you cannot have a seat. 

Profiteering at its worse - money over the safety of their passengers.

items.title: Ryan Air of railways
items.review_text:
+clean 

- first class basic. No good and service outbound to Exeter. Return offering was coffee, water and snack box(yoghurt, biscuit, pretzels).

ADDED COMMENT 31/12/21
Just received eventual response from GWR customer services after being asked to make contact as below. Response was ‘we sometimes tun out of refreshments, sorry’ - or should read don’t hold any stock. Woeful Customer service on every level.

Don’t travel first class and save your money.  This is the ‘Ryan air of rail’

items.title: Travelling on 2140 from exeter to…
items.review_text:
Travelling on 2140 from exeter to penzance
Train “manager” rude and offensive- a lesson in manners would assist her in her managerial skills

items.title: Quite possibly the worst experience I…
items.review_text: Quite possibly the worst experience I have ever had! I booked online and made a mistake. Website I could make change at 10 pound per journey but could not be done online. I rang customer services, waited 15 mins to then speak to a rude, disinterested, unhelpful woman who said that there was nothing she could do. I had to book another ticket and apply for refund which will take 28 days. Coming up to christmas, Cardiff to Paddington return tickets are not cheap. I have to go to London for work but cant afford this. Lady not interested. I said I wanted to complain. She couldn't understand me so I had to use phonetic alphabet. If this was another industry such as financial services, the regulator would be all over it. Surely, they cannot get away with treating people so appallingly. As I havent been able to sort...guess what, as journey date is now closer, ticket prices has increased!

items.title: So happy to get my refund
items.review_text: About 3 weeks ago I had to cancel a journey on GWR as my son and one of his family who I was going to visit had Covid. I was quite upset about this and I had bought advance tickets so I thought that I would lose the money. However GWR policy until the end of the year is to provide e vouchers for future travel if you have to cancel an advance ticket - I got my voucher today and am so happy. Of course I will be travelling GWR a lot in the future to see son and grandchildren. Thanks - it means a lot!

items.title: Customer versus Process
items.review_text:
Most weeks I commute once between Exeter St. David’s and Paddington.  06:48am from Exeter and 18:04 or 19:04 from Paddington.  As the 06:48 has been cancelled or delayed quite few times lately (“lack of train crew” or “delays”), including 10 minutes late this morning, which can happen, I thought surely they would be flexible to their customers (if possible) and allow me to travel back, one hour early back @ 18:04.  So I arrived at the train and asked the conductor if that was possible, as there clearly were quite few free seats (double green lights), her answer was flat no, but I “could buy full fare.” When I protested that it was being quite inflexible the response was “I don’t make the rules”. 

Surely some discretion and flexibility, where possible, can be adopted.  If the train had been full, I would have understood. 
This is where people should trump process.

items.title: Second world service all over the…
items.review_text: Second world service all over the "first class" expensive prices. Horrid uncomfortable seats. Barely ever a full food/drinks service, no action taken against rude or obnoxious or drunk or loud passengers, meh. Typical Britain.

items.title: No Refund on a Long Delay
items.review_text:
A Halloween weekend trip up to Reading was awesome all except the travel...

I had been delayed by several hours due to a crash so instead of getting home at around 5, I ended up getting home at 1am through generous lift donations. 

They note the delay repay request through the website yet mine was unsuccessful as I used "splitfare" so I paid for a train that I couldn't get on & cannot get a refund!

Ridiculous!

So many people, so little space yet cost so much money! I will not be using their services again.

items.title: Fabulous
items.review_text: Fabulous! This is the way to travel. Food and service was excellent.

items.title: Website almost deliberately impossible
items.review_text: I found the online booking process on mobile phone finicky. Kept jumping to time of travel I did not want. Having double checked everything committed payment. But email confirmation showed I was booked a week later than intending to travel. Then fun started trying to contact GWR to cancel, and realising too late to do that, to amend tickets. But they were both advance tickets which I learnt complicated things. Online amendment not suitable. Phoning hopeless, complaint process ridiculous (4 weeks later got answer to complaint saying cannot help as short staffed owing to covid (November 2021!). Read similar experiences from trust pilot with one review recommending Facebook page. Sent Messenger on gwr fb and within 5 minutes Jo replied with a link taking to a form for cancelling tickets which if submitted within 24 hours, amendment charge of £10 each way would not be charged. 4 weeks later refund was in my account. There was no way I would have found this link during time spent trawling gwr website. This review would have been zero stars if not for Jo.

items.title: Impossible to print out tickets at the…
items.review_text:
Impossible to print out tickets at the station. Always sends me to the ticket office instead and I lose lots of time (and occasionally my train).
The staff are nice otherwise.

items.title: Had a long three month wait for a refund And read the small writings before buying !
items.review_text: I did have big problems getting a refund However after a few emails and text I finally got a refund due to a couple of good team members thank you 🙏

items.title: Never take their train!!
items.review_text: Never take their train!!! Even when you don’t have choice. Took the train from swansea to London Paddington at 8pm and was stuck on train by reading middle of nowhere till 3am in the morning. I was meant to go Newcastle at 5am in the morning and didn’t have any sleep!! Nearly had a panic attack because the windows weren’t open and left my asthma pump at home!!

items.title: customer service via Twitter
items.review_text: I recently had cause to contact GWR via Twitter. Jess, the customer service rep, answered my question, sorted my seat reservation and answered my follow up questions. It was all very quick and efficient.

items.title: awful company!
items.review_text: awful company! expensive, and they never ask for feedback, as they know it'll be bad! i caught 2 trains on sat, bristol to london return, both were 10 carriages reduced to 5 so all the reservations were messed up.The return from London (last train 9.02pm!! its 2021!!!) was so full that pensioners and pregnant woman had to stand. It's worse than a 3rd world train service, and the prices are a rip off! Please remove the word 'great' from your company name. not impressed!!

items.title: Primitive cold cold train and late
items.review_text: Primitive cold cold train and late, I'll use my Trucking car rather than this overpriced dog mess

items.title: Reading to Exeter and back this week
items.review_text: Reading to Exeter and back this week. For £20 each we upgraded to first class meaning we had plenty of room and about 30% of seats occupied both ways. Both trains were on time. We have trips planned to the Lakes and Cornwall. On both we will again check the cost of the upgrade.

items.title: Awful
items.review_text: Awful. i payed £60 online from bristol to newcastle and the ticket man on the train said i needed to pay £170 because my railcard was a month out of date. I take responsibility for not double checking my railcard but the fact its only recently run out is digraceful. And i wasnt even able to get a refund or money off the additional £170.

items.title: Exceptional customer service at GWR station Yeovil Penn Mill…
items.review_text:
I was travelling via Yeovil Penn Mill (Maiden Newton to Paddington) where I needed to collect my tickets.  The ticket office staff Corrie and Jo were immediately friendly and obliging.  I had a very large suitcase with me and we briefly discussed my concerns about navigating the escalators on the London underground and Corrie suggested I enlist some help from one of the staff for my change of platform at Castle Cary which involved steps up and over the bridge.
Having provided my tickets, a few moments later, Corrie came on to the platform to let me know there would be no staff at Castle Cary to assist me and offered a solution, to instead change at Westbury where the platform change was a mere few yards at the same level.  The arrival time at Paddington would be the same.  She printed new journey information for me and endorsed my tickets.  These two ladies seemed to work together exceptionally well, provided great customer service, had excellent knowledge of the stations, trains and staffing and are an absolute credit to Great Western Railway.  I am indebted to them for my hassle free journey, thank you.

items.title: DONT WAST YOUR TIME
items.review_text: Well absolute crock of crap get to Bristol Station no actual directions to were to go missed the train  staff are amazing told us not to reply on the app don't both buy a car or take a taxi

items.title: Was delayed by truck hitting the bridge…
items.review_text: Was delayed by truck hitting the bridge at Plymouth, got sent to Exeter to pay £70 Taxi which will be paid back from railway staff, was told to place it on the delay repay form. Sent off by post my ticket and Taxi Fare. Eventually got the ticket back, but didn't receive my £70. Spoke on the chat to which they say it goes through different department. Sent it off by email, never had a response, then told to send it via Online, which the website doesn't work funny enough as it is, they failed to refund me the money 2 months on. If you are reading this GWR, hope you are a shamed by your poor service, this has now gone through the Railway Ombudsman which I hope your name is gone. Could have made it easier for yourself, but decided as always to not listen and not bothered to do anything. Will be driving than using the train. Never ever use this company unless you have to. If this happens to you, keep a record evidence for what you pay.

items.title: Tbh every railway service in the uk
items.review_text:
Tbh every railway service in the uk, but gwr is the one I have used the most over years.
It is not hyperbole to say that I have not been on a long distance train that has arrived exactly on time in my life. Like ever. Gwr has stolen time from me and their fairs are extortionate.

items.title: Bad Manners By GWT
items.review_text:
GWT have just cancelled my train today, so completely messing up my arrangements.  No proper apology which is what really irritates me.  Just to say "Unfortunately" your train has been cancelled you can take the next one, doesn't cut it.
The GWT client services should get a grip and learn how to do a proper apology.  Learn some manners.

items.title: Would give zero stars if I could tbh
items.review_text: Would give zero stars if I could, I’ve literally had to take on a second job to afford my train tickets to my job in London and even then can’t actually remember the last time I could find a seat on the train. Lucky if they’re only five minutes late but more often than not they’re unacceptably late or cancelled. Most unreliable and worst value for money around. Cheers lads!

items.title: GWR trains saved my life
items.review_text: GWR trains saved my life. Simple as that. They provided the service as promised and got me home. The train was on time and very comfortable. GWR are life savers - unlike Stagecoach buses and the local taxi companies that left me to die. GWR are heroes!

items.title: Extremely helpful
items.review_text:
I have recently contacted GWR via Twitter, regarding merchandise and have nothing but praise for the way my query was handled. The responses were swift, pertinent and the staff involved, Brad and Michaela, were extremely helpful.
GWR is my local train provider and the last journey I undertook was as smooth and unproblematic as usual. I use trains as much as I can and it is certainly my preferred mode of travel. Thank you, GWR.

items.title: I needed to change my seat bookings and…
items.review_text: I needed to change my seat bookings and contacted GWR via Facebook.  Thank you to Brad whose customer care was exceptional - all sorted out.  Recommended!

items.title: Great refreshments
items.review_text: There’s a great selection of refreshments on offer in 1st class: peanuts, biscuits, fruit cake, crisps and now flapjack.  It has been updated since the summer to include deliciously tasting flapjacks. The seats are comfy and the decor’s nice too.

items.title: Have someone manning the phones please...
items.review_text: They need to get more people in their call centre. I've phoned three times this week and waited for between 20-45 minutes each time before giving up. They warn you may be waiting "up to 15 minutes" which is presumably a bad joke.

items.title: Terrible customer service
items.review_text: I never usually do this, but I literally took it upon myself to go on the web and write a review. GWR customer service division needs total revamping. A bunch of unresponsive and slow representatives. My trip was delayed by 3 whole hours, to and fro. I requested a refund, they refused me one and their reason was "Used Ticket". What does that even mean??? I kept calling their customer service to demand an explanation and I waited a whole 1 HOUR with no response.

items.title: The worst reply’s
items.review_text: This was on gwrs Twitter and I was train spotting at Bridgwater and saw a HST and got a 2 tone and then after got barked at by other train spotter who where there and gwrs responded with this “good morning Thomas, toot toot! Excellent video of our HST Castle class leaving Bridgwater railway station- Ben”

items.title: Constant delays
items.review_text: Constant delays. The driver's seem too embarrassed to give reasons as to why trains are running into London an average of 10 to 20 minutes late every F morning. Total BS service.

items.title: A real pain if you travel with a bike.
items.review_text:
A real pain if you travel with a bike.

GWR trains are nice and run as on time as any in the South West. But, I hate the fact you have to reserve a space for your bike every time you travel. They are one of the very few operators that mandate this... and it's so much bureaucracy. It's also really annoying when you don't know exactly what train you are going to want to get when coming back from an event. Wish they were like most operators where it's just first come first served.

items.title: Why pay when you can get a free ride
items.review_text:
I can understand why people complain about train fairs. Caught train with my wife on Sunday. Seats reserved or so we thought. Was told to f*** off a number of times by what appeared to be a drunk passenger. As the computer system wasn't working moved to 2 vacant seats which we vacated when it's occupiers arrived. Later on into the journey conductor arrived only to find drunk passenger had no ticket and too was abused by him. Was told to get off at next stop....surprisingly didn't. Conductor didn't return and we heard him laugh as we pulled off and laughed an hr later when we arrived into London. There was also 2 other passengers who decided to get on this train early (never paid the extra and never got off) preventing a family of 4 sitting together around the table they too reserved. Don't blame the conductor as can't deal with someone like this on his own
Disgraceful....I feel for the people who continuously pay good money for this poor service!!!!

items.title: Really excellent customer service.
items.review_text:
Really excellent customer service.
Saturday 2.29pm train to Cheltenham from Paddington, the staff I encountered were so professional and helpful and attentive and this was not just me. They were patient explaining things to other passengers too. Train was clean, modern and comfortable. This is how train travel should be and unfortunately in the UK, often as not it isn’t, but please GWR keep this up, as I am not often this impressed to actually write a review!

items.title: I would like to thank GWR for an…
items.review_text:
I would like to thank GWR for an excellent customer service. I took my parents who both have mobility problems to their train at Gloucester last Monday morning. I was worried about how they would manage to get a heavy case onto the train.
I didnt have to ask, the train attendant spotted they made need help, unfortunately I didn't get his name, but he was so helpful. He even rang Weymouth to make sure they had help when they arrived. 
They were met and helped to a waiting taxi.
Excellent customer service from the staff at Gloucester Train Station. 
And of course Weymouth!

items.title: Updated: negative experience fixed with help from Michaela
items.review_text:
Train was apparently 58 minutes late, so I was not entitled to the full compensation as it was not 60 minutes. We were told on the day we would receive full compensation. They take abreally long time to respond to emails and Facebook messages. 

The train stopped without clear communication on the tracks and at another station. We couldn't sit next to each other despite our tickets as we needed to switch trains due to the issue that caused the delay. To not get the full compensation because we were 2 minutes short despite these conditions is hugely insulting. 

A member of staff I spoke to on Facebook was blunt and she did not listen to my query properly, confusing it with something else. 

Edit: after some time GWR did contact me below and were eager to get this sorted for me, which I really appreciate. Michaela was able to secure a good resolution and I have changed the rating accordingly. Thank you for your help.

items.title: Split & Save is RUBBISH.
items.review_text: Literally the worst company I've ever had the misfortune of using. I bought an open return ticket, to which they 'split and saved' me money on (sounded great!). Only to go and use it and it's gone? Oh, because they bought me a ticket that went out of date before the month period was up and booked me another 'super off peak', which means I can only travel after 7pm till 5am, but the only train they offer after this time is 10:30pm, getting in at 05:37 into London ....hmmm a single young female travelling on an overnight train for 7 hrs, with a full-time job to go straight too.... sounds ideal, not. The phone service is no help either, they are a 'third-party' so can't do anything remotely helpful. Brilliant. So, I'm having to travel during my work day tomorrow because SUPER off peak means I can only travel after 10am till 4pm. I didn't even book this, THEY changed my ticket and sold it to me as a better price?! I am NOT happy.

items.title: Simply the worst
items.review_text: Simply the worst. Were very rude to my disabled friend have escalated

items.title: Really great quick efficient service…
items.review_text:
Really great quick efficient service from GWR (specifically Jess) 
Using WhatsApp meant my question was answered far quicker than sitting in a telephone queue! 
Would highly recommend and use again

items.title: Where do I even start?
items.review_text:
Stupidly overpriced tickets, hit and miss service and rude staff at stations.
Your amazing ticket machines weren't working on the day before my trip (at 6:57am!) so I took a picture of your sign on said machines which said to use the reference number in the meantime.

Your rude, unempathetic staff didn't care at all and made me run to get a ticket from the machines which were now working. There is NO logical reason at all to not open the stupid gates AT ONCE since they are always open shortly before that time. Your people are simply @ssholes, that's it.

I've had enough of your lousiness and expensive gold-plated tickets.

Buzz off GWR!

PS: Drive yourself to work and you won't have to put up with any of this.

items.title: No tickets sent & had to pay for same journey twice
items.review_text:
When purchasing my train journey, I opted for tickets to be posted by 1st class mail. Never again.

I was advised that if my tickets do not arrive 24 hours before departure to call GWR who will arrange for the tickets to be collected at the station. After 50 minutes of being on hold, I told Great Western Railway that they didn't arrive. GWR Fill in a form whilst I am on the phone and say that everything has been arranged for my ticket collection.

Got to the station and the desk know nothing about the collection and I have to pay for a new ticket in order to travel.
I call GWR once again to explain the situation. I was told that a manager will call me back in 24 hours to resolve my case. I am also given a case ID to reference the issue. 
I have received no call back and now I am back on hold to Great Western Railway.
Absolutely shocking customer service. I will never buy train tickets from GWR again and will advise anyone to shop elsewhere.

items.title: Ticket Issue Resolved!! Thanks Sam!
items.review_text:
At my local station I couldn't collect my tickets and staff were beyond useless, giving me a handwritten note to allow me to travel!!! Didn't even put my destination on it, attempting to travel from London to Bristol and return a week later! I was so upset and managed to blag my way to London Paddington where Sam at the GWR Ticket Office actually understood what the issue was and fixed it, managing to print me tickets to make my journeys so much easier. Unfortunately I can't find anywhere on their website to say thank you to Sam, I did thank Sam at the time, before running for my train, but everyone at GWR should also know how great he was.
(Paddington 3087 on 11.10.2021 @10.56)

items.title: Indifference to passenger safety.
items.review_text:
Bristol Parkway Staff displayed an appalling disregard, indifference and arrogance to my criticism of their Safety Procedures on their premises.  I took it on myself to verbally warn the perpetrator that I feared an accident was possible but he was unconcerned and hostile, even attempting to prevent my complaint.  I reported this to the Station Supervisor who refused to identify himself and stonewalled my request for action and a method of reporting the situation as I was seeing it.  Within fifteen minutes of my conversation an accident occurred as I predicted, fortunately this was property damage only and no persons were hurt.
I have called the GWR Customer ‘Helpline’ and written a Complaint using their on-line system but received no reply other than the generic “We are experiencing high call volume during Covid” and “It will take up to four weeks to reply to your message”.
My later telephone conversation with the Parkway Manager merely confirmed that I am in no position to criticise their arrogance and that he would take action against me!

items.title: GWR died the moment they took away the…
items.review_text: GWR died the moment they took away the HST Inter City Experience, Buffet Carriage,Fully stocked Bar, with ice cold Beers Wines and Ciders, Bacon Rolls, cakes everything to travel on a 5 HR Service to Penzance from Paddington , Comfy seats, Plush Beautiful leather seats in First Class, curtains, Tinted windows, AC that can be controlled on the Train not at the Depot, It is a total Joke now, But Hey GWR don't care ANYMORE , so Sad.

items.title: Who on earth decided that the seats on…
items.review_text: Who on earth decided that the seats on these trains were acceptably comfortable? It’s physically painful sitting on them for more than about 20 minutes. Absolutely laughably bad decision.

items.title: Very good service. No major complaints (so far).
items.review_text:
I've never had any problems with the website or the app (except a few bugs here and there on their app). 
Also, they have been very good at giving money back for any delays and cancellations.
However, I haven't used their services since Covid hit so I'm not sure if there have been any major changes since.
Deducted a star because trains on the app are no longer labelled as peak, off peak and super off peak. Also, train seat reservations are useless because they are never working on the train/ people don't ever seem to follow them.

items.title: Can't take a screenshot of my eticket…
items.review_text: Can't take a screenshot of my eticket to claim delayrepay, when I try it won't let me 'for security reasons'. My train was two and a half hours late arriving at my destination. Tried multiple ways to send proof of ticket purchase with my delay repay application form. Ticket number is not visible on etickets which you need to submit a claim. Eventually found a way to send what I hoped was proof of purchase and received a response today telling me my claim was unsuccessful. I'm furious. My delayrepay refund that gwr assessed is 70.60, not an unremarkable amount. Do not know where to turn next. Will never purchase etickets again, will stick to paper tickets, as I have made delayrepay claims before with paper tickets and it is a straightforward, easy process.  If anyone can help me I'm open to ideas to resolve this problem!

items.title: Delay Repay
items.review_text:
Delay Repay. My train was one hour late arriving at final destination.
So I claimed on Delay Repay.
GWR 2341 351 981 was unsuccessful due to not all the tickets being uploaded. Not true they were all uploaded.
So I appealed GWR 2491 352 923. Now they say ticket number not visible. Not true the ticket number is clearly visible.
They obviously have no intention of compensating even though one hour late does qualify for compensation!

items.title: I made an error in my booking...
items.review_text:
I made an error in my booking and in my panic I messed up my refund form. 

Contacted GWR through Facebook to see if they could help and sure enough my request to cancel the refund(in order to complete the process correctly the second time around) was promptly approved by Celia. 

Very happy with the polite service and help I received.

items.title: A superb Pullman Dining experience!
items.review_text: Just got home after a trip down from London on the 1848 London to Swansea service on 27th Sept. From the second we turned up at the dining car to the minute we arrived home, the whole experience was superb. The crew greeted me by name when we arrived at the door to the dining car, showed us to our table and got us settled. There was no rush to take our orders, nothing was too much trouble and we were made to feel so welcome. Even though it is a limited menu, the food was fabulous. I had smoked trout to start, cod loin and plum tart for dessert. We jokingly mentioned that we enjoyed custard and they certainly obliged! The starter and main course were gorgeous and the dessert really was the metaphorical "icing on the cake". The chef even gave us an extra jug of custard to ensure we did not go hungry. Julie, Diane and Kay, you were superb. Absolutely superb! Chef was not bad either!  The "Custard Boys" went home happy and We Will Be Back! Thank you so much for making our trip so enjoyable, a real Dining Club atmosphere.

items.title: I booked return tickets with reserved…
items.review_text: I booked return tickets with reserved seats.  On both trains the seats I had reserved were showing as available.  Not a problem as I was getting on a the beginning of each journey but if I had been getting on part way through I would have been standing.

items.title: Avoid. Management clearly have no clue how to run a transportation service.
items.review_text: They'll cancel most of the trains 20 mins before they're scheduled to leave. No service improvement in years, management clearly have no clue how to operationalise a transport business. Children could do a better job. Utterly useless.

items.title: Good trip
items.review_text:
Travelled from London to St Ives first class.
Train was punctual and clean. Seats not as comfortable as some but adequate once I'd mastered the recline, good width and legroom for a big woman.
Very attentive and polite staff who were unfailingly polite and helpful dealing with a elderly and rather demanding passenger sitting near to me. Four drink and snack trolley visits. Overall first class not as good as some other intercity rail companies but not bad.

items.title: No customer service
items.review_text: No customer service, been on hold for over an hour. Been promised a refund for a train that was over 12 hours delayed - but they will not send it to my bank account. Get a bus.

items.title: No reply to my tweet giving false…
items.review_text: No reply to my tweet giving false information on their app could of cost me £60 when their useless app stated to go through London however my ticket doesn’t allow that 4 hours ago I sent them a message no reply useless incompetent TOC

items.title: Just-avoid gwr
items.review_text: Just bad on every level

items.title: Ticketing IT is hopeless.
items.review_text:
A few days ago I tried to buy a return ticket via GWR's ticketing website from Bath Spa to London Paddington, which came up 'Ticket Unavailable'.
After retrying, and failing - and having had problems before - I went to thetrainline.com and bought the tickets I needed there and then.
GWR IT just not fit for purpose.
Bad customer service, or more accurately, no service.

items.title: Lounge facilities at Penzance Station
items.review_text:
We travelled with two friends on the overnight sleeper from Paddington to Penzance on 9 September. An excellent journey with very helpful and cheerful carriage staff.
We were particularly pleased to be able to spend time in the lounge at Penzance station as we waited for transport which was transferring us to Lands End airport. The steward on duty was very welcoming and informative. She was an impressive an impressive ambassador for the Company. The facilities were excellent: comfortable seating, tea and coffee, light snacks and TV all contributed to a very pleasant experience after a long journey.

items.title: Truly the worst of the worst
items.review_text:
Website is impossible to use, insisting on; booking a seat - then won't let you, making an account - then won't let you, selecting e-ticket - then won't let you

GWR is going under in 2023/24 - you heard it here first

items.title: Great customer service
items.review_text: Both Brad and Celia were incredibly helpful regarding my GWR booking. I can't praise them enough. Thank you.

items.title: Brilliant experience brad was…
items.review_text: Brilliant experience brad was incredibly helpful!

items.title: Cancel too many trains at weekends…
items.review_text: Twice I have had cycle reservations in the last three weeks on trains to London, then within 3 hours of leaving the train is cancelled, I can't get a cycle reservation on the next train so can't travel.

items.title: Abusive fares and unreliable services
items.review_text: Reading to London must be the most abusive fare on the planet. Further more there aways are disruptions and delays.

items.title: No response from GWR - Totally unacceptable and terrible…
items.review_text: Totally unacceptable and terrible customer service. My online query was never answered. At least compensate us for your shocking lack of care for your customers.

items.title: Unimpressed with GWR.
items.review_text: GWR are usually very good but they seem to have a problem with their seat booking. After booking return tickets from Liskeard to Gloucester I noticed I had no reserved ticket for return leg Bristol Temple Meads to Liskeard on 11 th Sept .After numerous phone calls eventually a customer representative informed me via Twitter that ' nobody can reserve a seat on this train. This is totally contrary to previous information stating ..You must have  a seat reservation to travel !!! So frustrating to have wasted so much time trying to reserve a seat on this service. You can do better than this GWR.

items.title: Tried to make reservations from…
items.review_text: Tried to make reservations from Guildford to Oxford to Worcester to Guildford.  Website insists you reserve seats and then tells you you can’t.  No e-tickets, they have to be collected from a station.  Insists you open an account, and then won’t let you.  Given up, I’ll drive.

items.title: Salisbury to Southampton GWR "services"
items.review_text:
Salisbury to Southampton service around 1230 on Sat 4th Sept. Service was overly full (3 carriages only). Only one window open making for a very hot and uncomfortable journey. No Guard to be seen or heard on this service.
Are GWR aware that there is a pandemic ?
Returning on the 1710 from Southampton, there were no toilet facilities working on any part of the train and reportedly not to be fixed before the train arrived in Bristol. There was a Guard who offered to oblige customers with comfort stops at stations along the way. "Please sir, I need a wee".
Nothing like C21st travel on GWR trains!
Members of the GWR Board should try travelling on trains like these. Might it be pointed out that the service is for human beings and not for cattle. Noting, of course, that many services offered by GWR, at least those seen to be passing through Salisbury, would not qualify to carry cattle, as assessed against Health and Safety standards for livestock - too hot, too crowded and inadequately ventilated.
For many people, this service is a necessity in getting to Bristol, Cardiff, Southampton,  etc., perhaps to access the hospitals. They do not have the option to travel by other means, or to pay less elsewhere.
How about providing them with a service that is consistently fit for purpose ?
Is this so much to ask for the ever-increasing cost ?!

items.title: The worst experience ever
items.review_text: The worst experience ever. It's the hottest I've ever felt in my live. There's no windows to open, no vents to blow out cold air. Literally the worst 45 minutes ever. I was so close to getting off early and catching a taxi the rest of the wat, I've neve had so much sweart pour out of me. Never again will I catch one or you trains.

items.title: Never trust this railway
items.review_text:
Never trust this railway, the only thing you can guarantee about them is they will find a way of fining you no matter what ticket you purchase. 

I have travelled on railways all over the uk but never have I found a railways so incompetent.

You can buy anytime returns which are not valid anytime, you can buy tickets for specific trains which are not valid on the named train. 

They bring a whole new level to criminal travel companies.

Absolute disgrace

items.title: Theale Station staff are fab
items.review_text:
(OK, I'm putting aside all the other issues I have about travelling on the rail network.)
I wanted to thank your ticket staff working on Monday at Theale station. I bought tickets and renewed my railcard, and his help, patience and genuine friendliness brightened my day. 
Send gratitude his way!

items.title: The worst.
items.review_text:
The worst.
Was standing 3 hours to Swansea, from London
The train was overbooked by some reason
On Monday morning!!!!

items.title: Messenger communication
items.review_text: I had recent communication regarding a change time and the possibility of changing it. I had an extremely quick response which was very helpful. Celia, who I spoke to, was so helpful and very attentive.

items.title: Can't even book my tickets
items.review_text: Can't even book my tickets. The site keeps telling me that it can't reset my password and to try again later. Waste of time.

items.title: We had seats reserved on the train from…
items.review_text: We had seats reserved on the train from Bodmin to Reading. When we got to the station we found our carriage didn't exist. They had taken off several carriages. So staff very helpfully found us a seat to sit together. The toilet hadn't been cleaned. Urine on the floor plus abandoned clothing. Put soap on my hands only to find no water to rinse them. Tried to get on the website to complain and found I had to answer so many questions and upload my eticket onto the email. I couldn't do it so wasn't able to complain. You see, l don't actually believe they cancelled all those carriages because of staff shortages as there were plenty of stewards on the train. I believe it's because they couldn't fill the train so it was a cost cutting exercise. Not so many customers since covid and that's why they are advertising. Problem is they don't tell you GWR is not so great! And not hygienic. Go by car or bus!

items.title: GWR is usually a reliable service with…
items.review_text:
GWR is usually a reliable service with polite and friendly staff. I also like the recycling services at key stations. 

Usually I’d give them 4 stars. However, engineering work got delayed so all services on the Bristol Temple Meads line to Severn Beach and back got cancelled today. I know COVID rates have meant people have been off work recently, but GWR failed to provide replacement buses from the station. I work at Severn Beach and there is no direct bus service there from where I live. I would have had to take a two or three buses and ended up spending £25 on a taxi to work! I hope GWR provide replacement buses from stations in the future… Thank you. Tim Woodward.

items.title: Rubbish service
items.review_text: Rubbish service

items.title: Truly awful service..
items.review_text: Truly awful service... Always breaking down, never enough carridges when it's very busy so have to stand up with the kids... Avoid like the plague unless you enjoy being very stressed and herded about like cattle.

items.title: Used WhatsApp to reserve bike spaces
items.review_text: Used the WhatsApp service to speak to a customer representative about booking two bikes onto a train as I couldn't find any spaces. Jess found a train with two spare bike spaces and booked the reservation for me. This all took less than 10 minutes on a WhatsApp chat so I didn't need to be glued to my computer or waiting on hold.

items.title: Great service great staff
items.review_text: Today we cought the St Erth to St Ives train . My wife unfortunately has to use a mobility scooter and the staff namely Louise and Andrew bent over backwards to help us board and leave the train.I cannot thank them enough for the assistance they gave on our two trips. If I could give them more stars I would.

items.title: Jess should be in charge
items.review_text: Jess should be in charge, problem solved :-)

items.title: My query about the Night Riviera…
items.review_text: My query about the Night Riviera service was answered quickly and efficiently by your customer service team on twitter. It can be confusing trying to find out specific information regarding a journey scheduled beyond ten days.  Whilst others can be quite scathing about customer service in general these days I believe the team at GWR went above and beyond to answer all my queries - well done, I will be leaving a review once i've travelled but going on other reviews i've read I have high hopes of a smooth and relaxing journey in the capable hands of the GWR staff.

items.title: What’s app text service is so helpful!
items.review_text:
What’s app text service is so helpful!! 
Spoke to a lovely Jess who was able to answer my query In minutes. I’m now sat on the correct train home thanks to her.

items.title: Beware of fraud!
items.review_text:
On the compensation request they warn you that lying about being delayed will be considered fraud.

However, they respond by lying to weasel out of giving you compensation. I was over 2 hours late and they committed fraud to avoid paying me a penny. They claimed my ticket for Cosham - Exeter at 10:05 was not valid for the journey from Cosham - Exeter at 10:05 on that same day...

items.title: Brilliant service over WhatsApp
items.review_text: We were struggling to make a bike reservation so contacted GWR on their WhatsApp. We were looked after by a representative called Jess and she was a star! Answered all our questions, made the reservations we needed, and all in a timely and friendly manner. Thanks Jess!

items.title: The nicest staff and cleanest trains
items.review_text: The nicest staff and cleanest trains, however recently I've felt unsafe on their trains and no one seems willing to help.

items.title: Ticket to hide
items.review_text:
One can only assume that GWR management never have to try to book tickets using their website.  If they did, they would doubtless address all its buggy and exceedingly frustrating characteristics.

Hopeless!

items.title: Highly unprofessional
items.review_text:
I am currently on the Barnstaple to Exeter train.
The Two carriages are completely packed. Every seat is taken.
People stood in the aisle and no gwr member of staff seem to care much.
It is great to see life back to some sort of normality, but it is highly Hippocratic to tell us to social distance and then not give us the space to do it.
I'd also like to point out, gwr trains generally are the dirtiest trains on the tracks.

items.title: Why did I pay for First seats?
items.review_text:
I travelled on the 2.28 from London to Cheltenham on Thursday 5 th August in first class. 
The train manager came through to check tickets as soon as we left Paddington and discovered the two passengers behind me had second class tickets. They also had some large bags snd took up four seats. He did not move them on despite telling them there was plenty of room in second class. Instead the two women remained in first until Reading where they got off. 
I asked the train manager why he hadn’t asked them to move and he said it was because they had a lot of bags with them and it was his discretion. REALLY!!!!
Then why did I have to work hard to pay for first class????

items.title: Why are your trains always so late
items.review_text: Why are your trains always so late! Its so frustrating

items.title: Worst service ever
items.review_text: Worst service ever. Trains are always delayed, no ticket machines are working in their Paddington station, just utterly useless. And they charge quite a bit for this very poor experience

items.title: Absolutely f****** useless
items.review_text: Absolutely f****** useless. Trains are constantly late or randomly cancelled, fares are ridiculously high, and the staff are beyond any help. You'd think with all that money they receive that they can do a better job.

items.title: GWR is one of the most reliable…
items.review_text: GWR is one of the most reliable services I have ever used, they are consistently terrible. Late trains, overpriced. If I performed at my work at the same level as the people that work for GWR I would be sacked with good reason.

items.title: Announcement
items.review_text: Am currently on a GWR train from Penzance to London Paddington: it's on time & in general, the service is good. However, there was an announcement made a few moments ago reminding all passengers in a very serious tone that they must wear a mask "to protect us all"-no mention at all of those passengers like myself who are exempt from this & who wear a badge stating this fact. I also suggest that some research is done into the claim that masks "protect" the wearer from anything.

items.title: Worst website in the world IMO
items.review_text: Worst website in the world IMO

items.title: Did not provide a refund for delay
items.review_text: Did not provide a refund for delay when it was due. Incredibly awkward process to navigate and the genuine delay I experienced wasn't recompensed. Very frustrating. The delayed journey was also very hot, uncomfortable and non covid-19 secure as it was a packed bus.

items.title: Horrendous and Harrassment on Train
items.review_text: If I could give less than one star I would! I have travelled pre-pandemic many many times London Paddington to Bristol Parkway and always the staff were friendly.  Not after the 19th July....I booked my ticket on the 4th July and bear in mind this was my first time on a train since coronavirus since I was so anxious about the covid rules....so on the 21st July 2021 I decided I would still take the train hoping things would go okay.  No they didnt.  As soon as I boarded I was verbally abused by another passenger and then the Train Manger of this train James proceeded to also harass, intimidate and bully me on the whole jouirney - I have never felt so scared abused and intimidated he was trying to force me off the train the whole trip and acted very unprofessionally and rudely - he obvious had some sort of agression issues and was shouting at me the whole journey.  Is this how GWR treat their loyal customers and abuse and harass them by their own staff?  It was outrageous and unacceptable. This specific train manager took it upon himself to bully and intimidate a young woman because he felt he had the power to do.  I am still awaiting my refund.  GWR have really gone downhill, the service is awful and ride and crowded on their trains.  No people were wearing masks, no social distancing in place at all.  Your trains are not safe this is not right with the Delta variant going around.  I will never use your trains or your service again.

items.title: AWFUL CUSTOMER SERVICE - SCAMMERS!
items.review_text: bought tickets online on the GWR website, paid for first class delivery. Tickets did not arrive within 2 weeks. I called the customer service, they said to ask for tickets at the train station. At the train stations - sorry, we can't help please call to GWR... finally bought a ticket at the train station, made a claim for a refund - they refused, the reason - you did not send us the original ticket! How can I send it if you didn't send it to me ??? SCAMMERS !!! Also waiting time by phone - 48 minutes!!! no more trains, wish you a great BANCRUPT!!!

items.title: From 27th July until hnow (03/09/21) I tried to…
items.review_text:
Over 2 days 26th & 27th July I tried to phone "customer service" (please don't laugh this is serious!!) 3 times before giving up. The first time I was on hold 25 minutes; the second time 65 minutes & the last time 30 minutes. I now realise that should I wish to speak with someone in "customer service" -who appear to be dead - then I should go to my local cemetery and try to contact one of the residents there

It is now the 3rd September - Another 30 minutes before I gave up hanging on without speaking with a human! if anyone should read this could they verify that GWR how now closed and all customer service (that term should be reported for the miss use of "service") and staff have been laid off.

items.title: I was travelling to Dorset yesterday to…
items.review_text:
I was travelling to Dorset yesterday to see my grandson my train was cancelled from Bath to Axminster and the one back so I was told in Bath to get the train to Westbury and then Yeovil pen Mill so I did so and got to Yeovil pen Mill and was told by very sweet lady behind the counter Corrin she was called 
she said there were no links to Axminster from there I would have to walk to Yeovil Junction  an hour along a very busy road so she made some phone calls spent about quarter of an hour on the phone chatting with lots of people and she arranged for me to have a taxi all the way to Axminster it was really helpful of her and I really appreciate it could you please let her know it made by day amazing woth my new grandson , thankyou very much for your support and help  Corrin😀

items.title: The worst service and checking I had in…
items.review_text: The worst service and checking I had in my life.On date 26th July 2021 I issued a ticket without representing my rights and introduction who is gave me a ticket.After he  got my details gave me a card to direct me to the company policy and there find out I will receive a letter for court for not knowing my ticket wasn’t valid! Really

items.title: George Spice in Cheltenham gave…
items.review_text: George Spice in Cheltenham gave excellent service. Was a mind of information, tips and knowledge. Very pleasant, patient and professional. Genuine customer success and journey thank you

items.title: Gave one star as can't give less
items.review_text: Gave one star as can't give less. Absolutely terrible customer service been on the phone for 2 hours waiting done this several times and no one will reply.. aend emails get no relies to the simple question I asked.. total joke ...what a joke if a company.

items.title: Expensive but helpful…
items.review_text: Expensive trains but very helpful facebook team if you need reservations

items.title: Excellent customer care from Brad
items.review_text: Excellent customer care from Brad when I reserved seats from Paddington to Bristol TM. Rapid reply to my WhatsApp & when I messed up, not saying I needed one front facing seat, it was immediately changed. Very kind & professional service

items.title: EXCELLENT customer service and…
items.review_text: EXCELLENT customer service and communication from Brad on WhatsApp.  Answered all my questions, sorted seats and bike bookings.  Thank you.

items.title: Absolutely useless
items.review_text:
On 5 July I bought an advanced first class ticket on line from London to Plymouth. I paid extra for the ticket to be posted to me as I did want the hassle of picking it up from the station. By 14 July it had not arrived. I telephoned their customer services and waited 20 minutes for the phone to be answered. After a discussion I was told that due to Covid19 Royal Mail was delayed. However I said this was rubbish as a few days earlier I had ordered some euros which had been delivered promptly. I was advised to go onto the website, ask for a refund and buy another ticket. I did so but was unable to get a refund because advanced tickets cannot be refunded! I therefore telephoned again this time waiting 30 minutes for the phone to be answered. I was told how to use the help to claim on the website. I decided to wait two more days in case the ticket arrived. It didn’t so went online to book a new ticket. To my horror the price had increased by £83. 
Obviously I did not purchase one but telephoned again saying that no one had told me that the price would increase. My only option now I am told is to telephone the day before I am due to travel (and no doubt wait ages for the phone to be answered) to tell them my ticket has not arrived. I am told that it will then be a “manager to manager” agreement that I can pick the ticket up from the station; something I did not want to do in the first place!
Incidentally I have made a formal complaint on line and have heard nothing, not even an acknowledgment. 
Why could they not have posted another ticket? Why couldn’t they have emailed me a ticket?
I will never book with them again!

items.title: Absolutely appalling service
items.review_text: Absolutely appalling service. Trains constantly incredibly late and often cancelled without warning. Ticket prices are ridiculous, it's actually cheaper and quicker to drive the vast majority of the time (and yes, that includes both petrol and parking).

items.title: Great customer service from Brad
items.review_text: Great customer service from Brad. Really helpful on the Twitter chat and answered all my questions. Booked me an extra reservation for a bike too. Amazing service thank you!

items.title: Great Western Railway - always rude and hostile
items.review_text: Accidentally booked for the wrong date and they was unwilling to help me. Unfortunately this is no surprise as I regularly get great western into work and the staff are always so rude and unhelpful. I remember a train being delayed and when asking about whether a bus replacement service was being put on it I was met with hostility and annoyance which I have learnt is a common response from Great Western railway staff as evidence today by an honest mistake of booking for the wrong day. It's like they teach their staff to be rude and unfortunately they can afford to due to capitalism there are no alternatives. We all have to pay the ridiculous prices and then be treated appalling for the pleasure. I like trains but hate great western.

items.title: Customer service team is shocking
items.review_text: Customer service team is shocking, chased multiple times to get an answer to my complaint and still not heard back after 4 weeks. Complete nightmare.

items.title: The app is useless!!!!
items.review_text:
The app is useless!!!!
Doesn't allow you to see the whole screen to add railcards etc, times out when you try and books tickets. Infuriating!

items.title: If you need customer support drive to the station!
items.review_text: You can't phone the station with your question as they don't give out the numbers. Their customer support team do not answer questions put to them. IN the end as the query was desperate I had to travel all the way to the station to ask the ticket office staff. They can take your money fast enough!

items.title: Worst App I have ever used
items.review_text:
This is the worst App I have ever used. And the idea that the planned future is to phase out the Train Line app and impose the GWR app on everyone for online train bookings is beyond surreal. It is a nightmare. 

It constantly requires you to change your password time after time after time and even then fails to give you access to the one thing you want - your ticket if you have booked with them. 

As to changing your ticket - first you have to buy a new ticket ( and when you get to payment it stops working time after time) Then you try to cancel the old one. Time after time it fails. Then you call GWR and after 40 mins they say they can’t help you over the phone but you should go to the station. 

Except that NO train station will help you change a GWR ticket bought on line even though the ticket office is operated by GWR. 

Thanks to a wonderful man  whose identity I shall protect I managed to get a refund and compensation

But I shall never ever use this App again until GWR realises that in 2021 the only thing that matters  to a consumer trying to book on line is that its App is fit for purpose.

items.title: Overcrowded due to lack of carriages. Covid nightmare
items.review_text:
16.30 from Paddington to Plymouth. 

Problems starts with 5 coaches instead of the 9 it should have. Those who booked seats including families with children forget it. Free for all and arguments as no announcement made saying free for all….

Add in let’s add some stops in unplanned to get even more people onboard and it’s like the tube as rush hour.

Social distancing is impossible and half people not wearing masks. Train manager could probably walk through but of course it’s that full he can’t. I suspect he is staying well away as no way is this safe for Covid social distancing.

Few like like profit over safety

items.title: Im appalled by lack of customer service and respect
items.review_text: Im appalled. having submitted a detailed complaint on 10 07 - a month ago re assistance that didn't materialise etc.  Despite receiving instant automatic confirmation of receipt the email,  I still haven't heard anything from them. Meanwhile having tried to contact them twice to chase this up, on both occasions I have been left holding on the helpline listening to the recorded message for more than an hour. I am now giving up in disgust and strongly suggest the customer services director needs to deal with this. Covid cannot be used as an excuse for not having adequate trained staff to answer telephones

items.title: Absolutely hopeless
items.review_text:
Absolutely hopeless, I will never be booking with them again!

I have been trying to book train tickets to Cornwall in August for about a month now. Everytime I went to reserve a seat and pay, it would tell me there was an issue (though wouldn't tell me what that issue was) and it couldn't process the booking. After doing some research it seems you can't book more than 6 weeks in advance at the moment until timetables are confirmed. A little annoying but fine, I waited. 

Went to buy the tickets this morning and it finally let me reserve my seats, so I went through to the payment, confirmed through my banking app, and the GWR website said booking failed. Tried it again, and the same thing happened. Checked my bank statement and I have been charged TWICE and don't have a booking to show for it. 

I try to call their customer line, twice, and both times was waiting for an hour with nobody answering the phone. Tried to message on Facebook and Whatsapp as they otherwise recommend, and I did get a response here, though very unsympathetic saying I had to wait for the bank to refund me.

To add to the context here, each attempted booking was £250, so this is £500 I am missing at the moment, with no idea when it will be returned to me. All because they have a terrible website that doesn't work and an unresponsive support team.

I then this afternoon get a response to a case I made 4 weeks ago asking why I couldn't book the train back then, and it says if I have any questions to email back, and to expect a response in 20 days. Laughable.

They are obviously understaffed, perhaps from making redundancies due to COVID. Obviously they don't understand that maintaining good customer service will keep people using your service, therefore this is not a department that you can afford to make cuts in.

Booked in the end with Trainline and as always they are great and reliable so I have my tickets. Though am still £500 down.

items.title: Brilliant response from Brad in…
items.review_text: Brilliant response from Brad in customer services with help in reserving seats for our journey. Someone make him a cup of tea and buy him a biscuit as well. Thanks for the assistance.

items.title: COVID is no excuse to scalp people for…
items.review_text: COVID is no excuse to scalp people for tickets - £180+ for advance tickets that were maximum £50 a couple of years ago. May as well make the most of it while they can before being re-nationalised by the Government

items.title: A Disgracefull company. Shame on GWR
items.review_text:
I paid £108.20 online day before my journey. Only to be told next day that all trains were cancelled. I had to pay for a hire car. When I applied for a refund they refused saying that I applied too late. I applied with 3 weeks. They refused and then I applied again within 6 weeks.
There was no mention on there site about given time to apply for refund. They could have mentioned it in there email communication but they didn't.
THIEFS DISGRACEFUL, SHAME ON YOU GWR.

items.title: Penzance overnight sleeper, fantastic
items.review_text: Travelled on the overnight sleeper from Penzance to Paddington on Thursday 1 July. A fantastic experience, an immaculately clean and polished train, so unlike anything else on the railways today. Beautiful fresh linen sheets in a wonderful private cabin for two, which would put most hotels to shame. Superb staff from beginning to end. I really can’t compliment  enough, everyone should try it. Congratulations to GWR and their staff. Yes, this is a genuine review !

items.title: Unpleasant trip with a family who couldn't care less
items.review_text: Just a short trip from Plymouth to Truro but so angry . It was the Londin to Penzance train and quite full just wanted to voice my shock at a family from London (accents so obviously from there) travelling to South West for the weekend. 3 Adults 2 teenagers and 3 little ones all together and not a mask in sight!!! Whilst the majority of us are trying to stick to the basic rules as much as we all hate it these people have absolutely no respect or thought for anyone they can't all be exempt!!!! One of the teenagers was complaining about feeling ill which worried me a bit they couldn't care less and to make matters 20 tiimes worse they got off at Truro when I did and rushed outside for a smoke !!!clearly no respiratory problems there its disgusting they were allowed to travel with complete disregard for anyone else. What is wrong with people 😕

items.title: The  train was very crowded with no…
items.review_text: The  train was very crowded with no social distance to place to sit as there were some other passengers sitting on out seat very much disappointed with the service 😒😒😒

items.title: Thief’s
items.review_text: Terrible service! The train’s running late most of the times  You’re charging customers £140 to get from Reading to Coventry on a Sunday. I could have travelled to another country for that amount. Very disappointing!

items.title: Please I just want one journey without…
items.review_text: Please I just want one journey without you guys screwing it up, at least try and pretend you want to run a service. It's an insult to hard working commuters that the rail system hasn't been reformed. Stealing is illegal unless you run a train company evidently. Also there is a suspicious amount of 5 star reviews on here referring to a WhatsApp service and the reviewers look like bots.

items.title: Just to say thank you to the…
items.review_text:
Just to say thank you to the Guard..for GWR (I'm afraid I did not get his name) who sorted a cab for me to get home from Reading Station after I missed the last train to Sandhurst by a minute at (23.35hrs on 17/6/21) through no fault of my own.. 
That is truly customer service..once again thank you 👍☺

items.title: The worst company, shameful management, lucky if a train turns up.
items.review_text: The worst company I have ever come across. Expensive and you will be lucky if the train even turns up at all as they are constantly cancelled. Expect to be late if you use GWR, they could not care less about customers. The staff (who are great given the position they are put in) are left with little to no information and forced to take the anger of customers with little support because the greedy, disgusting execs care more about their own pockets than providing a service or looking after staff. Stop subsiding these criminals.

items.title: Very helpful staff on board and…
items.review_text: Very helpful staff on board and assisted me and my mother

items.title: Tried ordering a smart card via mobile…
items.review_text: Tried ordering a smart card via mobile from their website. Impossible. Speak to an agent function not available. Got stuck and couldn’t save details inc photo. Have no idea if this application has been started and therefore stuck in the system. This really should not be difficult!!!!

items.title: No care or thought
items.review_text:
Train was canceled, that happens.  But it was 9:30pm on a Saturday and no replacement service was laid on.  A large group of us were simply told to walk down the road, find a local bus stop and wait for a local bus (that never arrived).  40 people individually had to get a taxi (mine was £95, some people can't afford that). My phone was dead so I had to borrow someone else's.

Surely its not too difficult for the Train companies to have an agreement with local taxi firms offering a special price in these circumstances?  Or at the very least have Taxi's near the train station (we all stood around for over 1 hour)? 

Its a real lack of care, this would have been an awful experience for vulnerable people

items.title: Yet again only 5 coaches on the 8.10…
items.review_text: Yet again only 5 coaches on the 8.10 service from Swindon to Reading and the last 5 rows of the last coach reserved for travelling staff . Do you think it's funny to do that in rush hour and at the same time remind customers about the importance of social distancing on board non stop??? Can your majestic staff not use the first class as usual and can you STILL not provide the right number of coaches??? I have never seen such a rude and terrible company like yours who couldn't care less about their customers.
