I truly hope one day you will have some real competition and your ripped off so called customers will finally be able to run away from you!!!

items.title: Shocking customer service
items.review_text:
Avoid (if possible) They charge a £10 admin fee to refund tickets bought on the GWR app.) I bought tickets on the app last Sunday (since their ticket offices are closed most of the time after work these days!) and did not use them as I fell ill. Tried to get a refund or to change the day of travel on the day of travel however as the tickets cost less than £10 and GWR charge a £10 admin fee (for what? Processing a refund? Shops do this day and day out and don’t charge) a refund couldn't be processed. Also GWR customer services would not change the date of travel, choosing to stick to policy. 

I made an application to them for both sets of tickets on the medical grounds that I was sick and they denied it saying the tickets were "non refundable”. Very convenient! 

I then asked for a deadlock letter so I could go to the Rail Ombudsman and Brad on GWR’s Twitter account said "I am afraid we cannot provide a deadlock letter because a refund is not due for your tickets"

They cannot be allowed to get away with taking your money and offering nothing in return. The air of complacency is can only be down to having a monopoly. 

If there was an option for zero I'd give it

items.title: Really good response from GWR via WhatsApp
items.review_text: Really good response from GWR via WhatsApp. Needed to check trains and book new seat reservations but impossible to get through via phone. Tried WhatsApp and all sorted ASAP. I’d give 5 stars if it wasn’t for the phone option being so difficult. For those not used to newer options (elderly parents for example), speaking directly can be essential. Please don’t curtail this option - your WhatsApp team are a great addition though!

items.title: Think twice if your going on holiday.
items.review_text:
My partner pre booked a train ticket as advised with covid, from Newbury to Cornwall. Due to being hard working and self employed, he was joining myself and our children a day later, so he wouldn't let a client down.
He wanted to dive down in his work van, but i convinced him to catch a train down after work and have a rest after a long day working. Also we could then travel home as a family which includes our disabled son, so making life a little easier. 
A few days before he got a message saying his train was cancelled, so he managed to change his ticket to a train which was running a few minutes later? Pretty much the same train! To be able to do this he had to pay an extra £15 and couldn't get an allocate seat like he previously had! Seems like you just wanted to squeeze some more money out of him!
On the day of his travel, he left his van at work and got his very nice client to drop him off at newbury station to start his journey. On his way to reading station he was then informed the train he was catching next to Cornwall had be cancelled!!!!! So he was stuck at reading, and left stranded!!! We live in Benson, his work van was in newbury and his family in Cornwall. 
So as there were no more trains that would get him to Cornwall that day, and even if there were he'd have to pay for another ticket as the people at reading said his ticket was non refundable and he'd have to contact gwr (which he tried, but waited 15mins trying to speak to someone on the phone before giving up). 
So all he could do was PAY for another ticket to get him back to Newbury, where he started. And get a taxi back to his van and then drive all the way to Cornwall, in order not to disappoint our children. After a long day at work and wasting his time starting his train journey, which now seems that you really had no intention of running in the 1st place. Seems you like to take as much of peoples money as you can under false 
pretenses.
This was our 1st time putting our trust in rail to do a long distance journey. After this massive let down and lack of any sort of decent customer service, we certainly wont be using rail again. We will stick to the roads! 
In total he brought his original ticket for £79.80.
Then had to pay £14.20 to transfer his ticket to a train running a minute earlier than the original. 
Then £7.10 to get a train back to Newbury station after starting his journey. 
THEN HE HAD TO FILL HIS VAN UP WITH PETROL TO GET TO CORNWALL AFTER YOU LET US DOWN TERRIBLY.

items.title: Customers not treated equally
items.review_text:
A vehicle hit a bridge, ahich I understand is not GWR's fault. They had to run safety checks. This delayed trains. 

But the London trains managed to make it on time. They always do. But the Gloucester train, which I was catching, was late. The train was 45 minutes late. Apparently, delays of up to 15 minutes were expected. Well, my train was 3× the expected wait. I understand the incident with the bridge is not GWR's fault, but I do not believe we are treated equally. 

The big London trains always have ample coaches and the trains I catch never have more than 3 coaches. We are crowded and standing up. It's impossible to maintain social distancing. 

And why, if any train is going to be delayed or cancelled, is it always the little Gloucester or Worcester trains?

What I am saying is that it doesn't matter if you are first class, going to London or Filton Abbey Wood, we are all customers  and deserve to be treated equally. This is a serious issue that needs to be addressed.

items.title: Paying extra for first class isn’t worth it
items.review_text: Paid the extra for first class and the seating was very comfortable and lots of space. However the trolley came through around every 1.5 hours and I only found out that they didn’t have any food outside of the biscuits available other than crisps - which I had to pay for. My train was also delayed by 23 mins and my connecting train at St Erth to St Ives didn’t wait just 2 mins to make that connection. So now I’m really late and haven’t been able to get food on my 5 hour journey. I get that it’s COVID but lack of communication really made it a bad experience. Very disappointed.

items.title: Appalling! Not the Trains! The Staff!
items.review_text:
Appalling Service from Staff. I was in First Class and this staff member walked in, asked if I could read (A sign that was on a slide door that slid open as you approached it therefore wiping out any chance of you actually reading it!) and told me to pack up my things and get next door. He forcefully made sure I went, pushing me as I was 'Too slow' packing up my things, even though I am disabled with only the use of one arm and epileptic. When I explained this, he told me that me being in the wrong carriage was nothing to do with me being disabled, and I didn't look disabled in any case!
He tried to get me into the next carriage but the refreshment trolley was coming the other way. I was trapped, couldn't move. He wouldn't move, the trolley wouldn't move, and 'B' was shouting at me to get into the next carriage.
There was more, mainly about my triggers on my epilepsy which he replied that it was not his problem.
GWR - Get some good staff!
Reported it but haven't heard a thing to date.

items.title: NOT COVID SAFE
items.review_text: I was disappointed to find an evening train from Salisbury (5.42) to Cardiff via Bristol was NOT Covid safe. With a lot of travelers not wearing masks, drunk, drinking and groups standing together in carriages. Not asked to move or wear masks amazed me. A very worrying trip.

items.title: They don't have a clue.
items.review_text: Applied for a job with them.  Weirdest recruitment process ever.  Spent 2 hours telling them all of my work history, my gender, sexuality and all that nonsense (frankly none of their business). Then I get an email saying they're reviewing applications, a week later I got a rejection email and I can't apply for a similar job for 6 months?   No other company makes you wait 6 months before you can apply again!  I'll still to aviation from now on instead of this poppycock.

items.title: Wonderful customer service through WhatsApp
items.review_text: Wonderful customer service through WhatsApp, helped me secure bike reservation in less than 5 minutes! Thanks Brad :D

items.title: Reserved seats using WhatsApp
items.review_text: Just used WhatsApp to make seat reservations for tickets I already have. The website doesn’t let you do this so the WhatsApp was a real help. Quick and efficient!!  Thank you

items.title: Outdated
items.review_text: Not bad as a service overall but it’s quite an antique and outdated company that really need to improve their infrastructure and vehicles a bit better.

items.title: Helpful service.
items.review_text: My partner’s son left his jacket on a train. I contacted GWR via their Twitter helpline snd they couldn’t have been more proactive, efficient or communicative. Within minutes they’d tracked down the article, informed me of how I could collect to it a d the whole issue was solved within an hour. Great service… thank you so much.

items.title: I can't thank Phil enough for helping…
items.review_text:
I can't thank Phil enough for helping me with my seats through messenger.
He has taken so much anxiety and pressure off my on going situation, I really can't thank him enough

items.title: Staff at Paddington station were great…
items.review_text:
Staff at Paddington station were great during the recent disruption. Really happy with the service. 
Only gripe was there wasn’t a working toilet on board, for a 3 hour journey this was a bit of a pain.

items.title: Train tickets were booked for my…
items.review_text:
Train tickets were booked for my elderly sister and her husband.
Absolutely brilliant service from GWR customer assistance, called them up and they organised everything to assist them on both journeys. The operator a guy called Ricardo was excellent, helpful and caring. 
Thank you GWR very impressed!

items.title: Today GWR nothing great lost the will…
items.review_text:
Today GWR nothing great lost the will to live trying to get to London Paddington since 10:30 this morning time now 15:56 still not there
You knew you had a problem but no contingency plan just mass confusion not impressed 
David Dearden

items.title: Train cancellations customer service
items.review_text: Michaela was fantastic in the recent and ongoing spate of disruptions. Super responsive and helpful which is what is needed in this time of scrambling to make alternative arrangements.

items.title: So we got to platform 7 for our train…
items.review_text: So we got to platform 7 for our train to Gloucester. The train was there at 7.39 but the gentleman didn't let us on because the doors already closed early we got there at 7.39.how annoying. Great western could have let us on.

items.title: Bike Reservation
items.review_text:
Just booked a bike on the train from London to Carmarthen return via WhatsApp.

Literally took less than a minute. Great service, cheers Brad whoever you are 😀👍👍

items.title: Better than Crosscountry
items.review_text: Used to get the train to Banbury but they sadly removed the line at the start of the pandemic. A dying shame, they are faster, quieter and have better Internet that Cross-country, whom I have to use now.

items.title: I have been helped from Brad and he has…
items.review_text: I have been helped from Brad and he has been very helpful

items.title: Brad was very helpful for helping me…
items.review_text: Brad was very helpful for helping me book a bike reservation! Thanks

items.title: Excellent customer service via Facebook Messenger
items.review_text: Thank you to Michaela who helped me with a reservation enquiry via Facebook messenger this evening. She was prompt, articulate and clear, and helped me sort out my new reservation quickly.

items.title: Booking my bike on the train through…
items.review_text: Booking my bike on the train through whatsapp was simple, quick and so much easier than the traditional means over the phone with other operators

items.title: Great customer support from Jo and…
items.review_text:
Great customer support from Jo and Michaela no WhatsApp from GWR. A surprise to find helpful people easily available from a big country. 

Also (not needed today), but I appreciated the 'reserve your bike' option on the website as a normal part of buying a ticket.

items.title: Quick and very helpful
items.review_text: Quick and very helpful response from Michaela at GWR on Facebook Messenger! Booked me several reservations without any problems

items.title: Brilliant
items.review_text: Brilliant , fast and prompt service from the team member called Michaela on messenger - completely sorted me out in a matter of minutes , very impressed . Thanks .

items.title: Amazing service
items.review_text: Amazing service! The team always reply quickly and efficiently. Booking a bike onto the train always used to be long and difficult but that is no more!

items.title: Reserving space for a bike via Whatsapp
items.review_text: Needed to reserve a space for my bike. Amazing service via Whatsapp. Done within 5 minutes. Super easy!

items.title: Excellent WhatsApp serve for bicycle…
items.review_text: Excellent WhatsApp serve for bicycle reservations queries. Quick, friendly and a accurate. Just what's needed. Thank you 😊

items.title: Excellent!
items.review_text:
Excellent service, super speedy replies! 
I tried to book a bike on a train and wrote to them on Whatsapp. The replies came within minutes and Brad got me booked super quickly.

items.title: I left my bag by accident on the train…
items.review_text: I left my bag by accident on the train and their WhatsApp service (Mr Brad) found it for me - finally 2021 technology showing its use

items.title: Reserving bike spaces
items.review_text: I wasn’t able to reserve bike spaces on GWR website but contacted customer services using the what’s app number provided on the website.  They were brilliant, responded quickly and reserved bike spaces on both journeys easily.   Very grateful as the planned bike adventure can now happen.

items.title: Tickets
items.review_text:
My Wife and I went to Torquay train station today to book tickets and was assisted by a colleague named Zulamar, what brilliant service, nothing was rushed all tickets were put in order and everything was explained clearly.
Thank you for a great service.

items.title: Great service via WhatsApp
items.review_text: Great customer service via WhatsApp while booking bikes. Only thing they could do it make it more obvious that you can contact them via WhatsApp as I didn’t immediately see the option.

items.title: Bike spaces- great service
items.review_text: Very quick replies on WhatsApp when reservating bike spaces.!

items.title: Bike booking much improved
items.review_text: Super easy to book bikes now via their WhatsApp number

items.title: Abysmal customer service
items.review_text: I travel from cardiff to woking on a regular basis 3 times a month and there has never been a time where my train hasn't been delayed or cancelled. The information provided to you is abysmal which makes it impossible to plan your journey as you always miss your connections. The customer service person to person most of the time is rude and not helpful. It has been countless times these scenarios have happened and doesn't ever seem to improve, actually seems to be getting worse.

items.title: A great service from Staines to Looe…
items.review_text: A great service from Staines to Looe and back. Everything on time and staff very helpful. I left my phone on the train on Liskeard and the staff there were so helpful.. contacted the train,  found the phone and had it waiting for me the next day. Thank you so much Em.

items.title: Website awful
items.review_text: Website awful, lags, is slow and does not give anything of value: The old website was simpler, easier and actually worked.  No doubt the new site is for inadequate millenials.

items.title: Pretty chuffed with the service on my…
items.review_text: Pretty chuffed with the service on my line between Oxford and London. Always on twitter chat for any issues and bookings.

items.title: Very helpful and quick.
items.review_text: Very helpful and quick.

items.title: Trains are fantastic and trip was good
items.review_text: Trains are fantastic and trip was good. Staff at Slough train station have no people skills. Hi hey are rude and authoritarian. Should invest in having staff trained on how to be polite with public!

items.title: “I am now that guy”.....
items.review_text:
I have used GWR services on my journeys back and fore work for around 15 years or more, early mornings and early evenings. Always friendly and reliable staff.
Come 12/04/21 after countless journeys where everything is checked (keys, phone, wallet (the usual) then exit, on this day however I have now become that man - I left my “Apple Watch ON CHARGE on the seat. Not just any watch, “a 40th birthday present from my daughter!!!!!”
First things first - I panic.... worry.... stress etc etc. I then do what all men do - say nothing and hope no one will notice! 
Then brain wave - google GWR lost property, click a link, add my details then sit back and try and not bring up “I left my watch on a train” into any conversation!
I then find GWR on Twitter - I start my message with “Hi - this might be a long shot....” give the details. I’ve noticed it’s now getting quite late in the evening so wasn’t expecting any reply until the morning after, if at all.
Low and behold, minutes later,...... I confess etc etc, Mrs cursing, daughter shouting, scenes! 
A message comes through in all the distraction, so I go through my predicament about now being 
“that guy.”
They promise to try and get hold of someone and get back to me ASAP. 
A little time came and went but unfortunately nothing in the evening. 
Obviously during today I’m randomly checking to see if I’ve had any DM’s.
This afternoon I had a message from Celia via Twitter, who had also taken my message the previous evening on behalf of GWR Team “confirming” my watch had been found safe and will be held for me to come and collect at my convenience.
Excellent news, Mrs happy, daughter jubilant, scenes! 
The service I had throughout my “ordeal” has been excellent. All staff that I spoke to directly or indirectly via Twitter certainly went the extra mile for me to help and I couldn’t be more greatful!
So use the GWR lost property link - easy,
Then always worth sending a message like my long shot.
Happy days.
Thank you GWR!

items.title: Very helpful and quick
items.review_text: I have travelled on/off for the last 18 months via GWR - the digital support team / customer services are consistently helpful and quick. They are reliable, clear and always respond in full to my query. As a train company more generally, apart from lower fares, I can’t see what else they could do to improve. My train is always on time, there is space and they give good train announcements!

items.title: Almost flawless experience ! Still deserve a 5 star
items.review_text: I used the bike booking through whatsapp handy service with Quick and helpful replies. Great service. The only thing that could have made it better is if there was no exchange fees for tickets booked by mistake and changes with in fifteen minutes of purchases.

items.title: Needed to book a couple of bikes on a…
items.review_text: Needed to book a couple of bikes on a train from Bournemouth to Reading, Used Crosscountry Trains Facebook page and sent them a message. Got a response in 5 minutes from Andy. Great Service

items.title: Quick and easy change to seat reservation
items.review_text: Used WhatsApp to contact GWR after being notified a train I was due to travel on had been cancelled. Had a response (from Brad) within a few minutes and he was able to rebook a seat reservation on the next train. This was done within a couple of minutes. Great customer service!

items.title: Excellent customer service when booking…
items.review_text: Excellent customer service when booking space for my bike. Effective, easy and fast! Highly recommended doing this by WhatsApp

items.title: Quick and helpful staff (Brad)
items.review_text: Very speedy and helpful staff (Brad in particular) responded to my request for a bike reservation in less than 3 minutes. 10/10 would use again.

items.title: GWR have WhatsApp? Who knew! Great customer service
items.review_text: I needed to book a seat reservation on a train. Had no idea how to do it when I'd already bought my ticket separately. Easy to find out on the GWR website. WhatsApped their business number and I had a really quick response from an employee (Brad) who sorted it out. Thanks for the great service!

items.title: I had a query about whether i could…
items.review_text:
I had a query about whether i could have a bike on my train journey and it was sorted out by a lovely chap called Brad within minutes!

Great!

items.title: I had a problem with a refund voucher
items.review_text: I had a problem with a refund voucher.  Liaising with customer service via Twitter worked very well and Brad and Michaela sorted out my problem perfectly.  Thank you.

items.title: Very faint glimmers of hope for GWR ... ?
items.review_text: For a long while I've loathed the fact that I'm what GWR would view as a 'captive customer': no alternatives to get from Cornwall to London but to use the train. Over the years GWR has been nothing less than appalling. However, on booking a short trip to London last November 2020, and experiencing usual difficulties online, I picked up the phone in great trepidation. I can only describe the experience that followed as something of a revelation. I spoke to people who knew what they were doing and actually, seemingly, genuinely wanted to help me. I was able to book a return journey without too much difficulty. Of course, HM Government then imposed a London lockdown so travelling on my dates was not permitted. I went online and found an option to apply for a replacement travel voucher: voucher because of the nature of tickets I'd booked but that was no problem for me. There then ensued about two months of the much anticipated GWR chaos, my application rejected, not valid tickets, cursory examination of my complaints, quickly dismiss with one line emails: much more like the GWR I'm accustomed to. I picked up the phone again. Another stroke of luck. Another GWR employee actually wanting to help me. After nearly three months, my issue was resolved within a couple of days. GWR has a long long way to go before I'm convinced it's much more than the awful company I'm used to dealing with. But there are glimmers of hope. Well deserved three stars.

items.title: Super pleased with the service I…
items.review_text:
Super pleased with the service I received from GWR. I messaged them directly on WhatsApp for a bike reservation and it was pretty much instant. Twice over the weekend I used this service and I’ve been pleased with the efficiency of it! 

Thank you Celia and Michaela

items.title: Seamless Bike Booking via WhatsApp
items.review_text: Really easy to reserve bike space on GWR trains through WhatsApp with Celia this week. Answered all of my questions about the service as well.

items.title: Review for GWR’s excellent bike space…
items.review_text: Review for GWR’s excellent bike space reserve system. I use a text messaging service - this time it was Celia, who  replied promptly and got the space for me. Super easy! Thanks!

items.title: Booking bike spaces on WhatsApp—incredible
items.review_text: Can’t speak for train timeliness (I haven’t been on enough recently to judge) BUT I’ve been booking spaces for my bike over the past year via WhatsApp and the team who manage that are so helpful and absolutely delightful! Such a clever idea, so much easier than phoning someone!

items.title: Just another seamless booking of a bike…
items.review_text: Just another seamless booking of a bike space via Facebook Messenger - thanks Phil. I'm impressed every time how efficient this service is. Just sent a message to the GWR page with train details and the bike space was booked in 5min. Hassle free, great service.

items.title: The bike booking sistem is very easy…
items.review_text: The bike booking sistem is very easy and fast. Used the WhatsApp number and Brad was nice and helpful.

items.title: GWR should be ashamed
items.review_text: Great Western Railway hire racist staff, and then hire staff to protect those racist staff. I was harassed and targeted by a ticket officer whilst waiting for my girlfriend to top up my oyster. He told me I "looked like someone who would skip trains" and that "if I resisted he would call the police who would just put me in cuffs". I was left waiting for a response too my complaint for 5 months. When they did get back to me I was met with an allegation of lying, fire backlash and an empty response stating that an investigation had taken place. When I asked for details of the investigation I was pushed to the curb. I was then told to stop emailing the team after asking them valid questions and calling them out on the fact they had actually overcharged me for my fine. Poor company. Racists.

items.title: The bike booking Whatsapp system is so…

The bike booking Whatsapp system is so efficient and easy!

Thanks Michaela and Brad you were both really helpful.

items.title: Average service and would travel on…

items.title: A very big “Thank You” to the team on…
items.review_text: A very big “Thank You” to the team on board the 08.28 from Truro to Plymouth. It’s a stressful enough day going to Hosp every three weeks for treatment for several hours. So a huge thank you again for your kindness and help from Gary Bennett. Lewis Caspall. Jeremy Mepham. Lisa Wooton and Gemma Topping. You are all a credit to GWR. Kind regards. Maggie Lewis.

items.title: Excellent Service as Always
items.review_text: Excellent Service as Always.  The honours go to Michaela tonight,  thank you

items.title: Overall great service where it matters
items.review_text:
Pros: Bike reservation service is speedy and easy to use. Trains are modern, quiet and clean. Throughout 2020 they have been running on and ahead of time. All GWR staff are friendly, approachable, and helpful.

Cons: Website is hard to use. Bike space is fine for just one bike but even though it is designed for 2 they rarely  both fit. I would appreciate more non-stop services to Oxford from Paddington (I believe there is just one a day).

items.title: Excellent
items.review_text: I have been travelling to work with GWR throughout the latest lockdown period with my bike and their customer service and app have been excellent. With extremely fast response times at all hours of the day, I have been very happy with their service.

items.title: The internet site is AWFUL
items.review_text: The internet site is AWFUL. Just horrendous. Enough to make me want to never use the company unless I had to. Took an hour to book a ticket because the site would not load. Each page was so SLOW- other site working fine. I'd rather drive. I hope they go under.

items.title: Lost bag sourced very quickly!
items.review_text: My partner left his bag on a train from Bristol to Chippenham, containing his laptop, passport and other essential things! After contacting GWR through facebook, an employee named Phil quickly responded and within less than 2 hours the bag was sourced. A massive thank you goes to both Phil and his colleague Madhuri who located the bag at Paddington station. Such a relief! Many thanks again, you both are stars.

items.title: Phenomenal Customer Service
items.review_text: I was pretty annoyed when my train was cancelled, but I received such amazing service from Michaela and Phil from GWR over WhatsApp that the annoyance didn't last long at all. They were SO helpful and replied in a matter of minutes, if not seconds, every time I messaged them, even at 11pm/Sunday morning.

items.title: Amazing customer service for Disabled
items.review_text:
Amazing - Customer Service for the disabled.

I frequent need to travel between South Wales and London Paddington for medical treatment.

First great western Paddington station staff always go above and beyond in customer service to help me out in what ever ways they can. For what would otherwise be a very long day.

items.title: Horrible company that chased me for…
items.review_text: Horrible company that chased me for hundreds when their card machine didnt work. Very cold company who are not fit to run the railways

items.title: Fantastic service clean and on time
items.review_text: Fantastic service clean and on time. My guard Callum on the 9.15 Newton Abbott to Paddington exsplained all I need to know about my on wood journey in detail, and arranged a golf cart to transport me to the underground as I have r sciatica. What a great guy great service

items.title: Actual false advertising
items.review_text:
If it were possible to give 0 stars I would.
Purchased off peak return for a tfl rail train from London Paddington to Reading at 7.28 in the morning (note the off peak option was not available on other trains as they were direct trains and at peak times it makes sense that they would cost the full price). I checked both the trainline and GWR app and the off peak ticket option was available. So I brought the tickets, and it confirmed the train time at 7:28 was the recommended route.
Get to the gate at 7:27, and I'm turned away for the wrong ticket type, even though it was available online and even has it on my confirmation email and e-tickets? 
I'm expecting a full refund, none of this £10 deduction fee. Buy your tickets in person folks, much easier to return that way.

items.title: Bought the whole ticket instead of a fine
items.review_text: I felt so bad, didn't know 17:30 was peak time. I thought the peak times varied as the train was almost empty. When I looked up in the tickets online, the price was £ 90.00 but anyway, as I've already boarded the train and was unwell, I stayed. Eventually, the checker came around and he charged me £ 75.00 he said the tickets are about £ 110.00 that's why I must pay it as anytime train ticket. And I immediately knew it wasn't the truth, as I already saw it was £ 90.00 and I wasn't well enough to talk more so I paid. I was expecting a fine to be taken but instead got a heart attack. I better not travel ever again by train I guess. Unexpected slap on the face

items.title: If it were possible to give less than a…
items.review_text:
If it were possible to give less than a star I would.
Rude staff, ridiculous fines, outrageous prices, poor hygiene (especially bathrooms).

items.title: The Great Train Robbery..
items.review_text: The Great Train Robbery..

items.title: Very polite and helpful staff on the…
items.review_text: Very polite and helpful staff on the phonelines who did their best to help when Trainline messed up my booking with GWR.

items.title: Great Rip Off
items.review_text: Great Rip Off. £118.00 from Newport to Paddington in a service that is 70% unreliable with diversions for construction paid for at the customer's expense. Frequent replacement Bus services making for a third world travel experience. Occasionally they forget to provide enough carriages and you stand for £118. Consequences of a system endemic with corruption from contractors and government alike.

items.title: I am so disgusted with Great western…
items.review_text: I am so disgusted with Great western railways. I had a booking in May which I had to cancel in April because of the covid19 restrictions as we were in lockdown.I was told I would be getting a full refund with no fee taken for cancelling. Eight months on still waiting for a refund and now been told because I didn't apply for a refund in the 28 days of booking I will not get my money back. This is total wrong national rail states any booking for travel before September 6th will get a full refund from the train providers because of covid19. I don't know how they can think this is okay. Update! A year on, after alot of arguing and debate I now receive a refund has they made an mistake with my paper work.  I could only really thank one customer service employee for actual listening to me and taking it on his self to deal with this.

items.title: Bike Reservation
items.review_text: I needed to book a space for my bike. AN excellent service via whatsapp - couldn't have been better

items.title: GWR are trash
items.review_text: GWR are trash, there's nothing good to say about them. Overpriced tickets for trains that are always late, scabby trains, random cancellations etc. Extremely unreliable, basically useless if you need to get anywhere on time, and they won't refund you the vast majority of the time. Don't use them if you don't have to.

items.title: Great

items.title: SO SO HELPFUL
items.review_text: So so helpful  2 of my trains were cancelled and managed to help me with quick replies and help answering what were probably obviously questions ahaha

items.title: Having paid an extortionate £250 return…
items.review_text: Having paid an extortionate £250 return for 2 tickets to Cornwall from London, my partner couldn't travel due to illness. I travelled and had to return early due to their Covid infection and deterioration. Had to pay an extra £32 to go back early and no refund possible on any of the unused tickets. 3 months for a reply from their Customer Services which told me station staff had been wrong to advise me to write in to ask in the circumstances for even a partial refund or credit voucher for future travel. Not a chance! No compassion or flexibility. This company doesn't know the meaning of a goodwill gesture, and no apology for a 3 month delay in responding.

items.title: Not Covid Compliant
items.review_text: I recently needed to travel to London. On my outbound and inbound journey I found there was nobody checking passengers as they boarded to ensure they were wearing masks correctly and no monitoring onboard. Numerous passengers with masks around their necks or on their chins during my journey and the trolley staff said nothing. GWR failed to comply with the rules and failed in their duty of care to protect their passengers. Extremely disappointing

items.title: Wifi never works.
items.review_text: Wifi never works.

items.title: Booked a bike place via WhatsApp
items.review_text: Booked a bike place via WhatsApp - simple, excellent and speedy service. Highly recommended!

items.title: The worst customer service I ever experienced.
items.review_text: Single most embarrassing, anti-customer and greedy service i ever experienced. When the train is cancelled there is no alternative provided and refund is next to impossible. Moreover, if you are in a hurry and can't  get a ticket on  time you will be eligible for a penalty if you get on  a train without it. Finally, it is cheaper to get a car if you need commuting regularly.

items.title: The worst train experience of my life.
items.review_text: The worst train experience that I have ever had. The tickets were extortionate the train to Penzance costing £140. My railcard had run out by a day and they fined me £237.00, they then stated in email correspondence that I hadn't bought a ticket and threatened to take me to court, stating the impact that this would have on the rest of my life. I recognise my mistake in having an out of date railcard, but the ensuing treatment and the punishment seems so far from the crime when a railcard costs £30 to renew and they just seem to use the vast size of the organisation to squeeze the money out of me when i had just made a simple mistake. In order to fine me they also interviewed me under caution which was highly stressful, and the interrogator seemed to delight in this, no wonder as I have since discovered these conductors receive a commission when handing out cautions. They have treated me like a criminal when I am a high paying customer and show no sympathy or understanding as they look to extract every last pound from my pocket.

items.title: Great service!
items.review_text: I just booked a ticket and had some issues with the payment. Josh of GWR on Twitter helped resolve the issue and did it in a very timely manner. So my experience so far dealing with GWR has been awesome!

items.title: Worst than bad
items.review_text: I use this service 5 days out of 7 a week. Seldom I can make on time to my commitments, there's always something happening. However is very expensive service and keep charging peak time tickets over the lockdowns when the trains are always empty. Pure joke, gold diggers, is always the worst part of my day.

items.title: I used the GWR WhatsApp service to book…
items.review_text: I used the GWR WhatsApp service to book a space for my bike on the train. So impressed with the service, very speedy and efficient.

items.title: CX support level 100🙌🏻
items.review_text:
My journey from CDF to GTW was impacted due to engineering works in the network, leading to cancellation. Thanks to the absolutely polite and quite fast responses of Josh, I was recheduled to an earlier one.

Great service, great customer experience! Happy customer 💪🏻 

(In the end all you need is someone on the other side of the screen to listen and act! great job GWR, keep up🙌🏻)

items.title: Took 8 months to not get a refund
items.review_text:
Applied for a refund on tickets back in March due to COVID-19. I sent in all the needed documents and waited. After no correspondence for a few months, I contacted Support. In September, I finally got a response asking for more information. I sent the information in, waited til October to be told the refund couldn’t be issued. I had to give a passive aggressive reply for Support to tell me they would look into it further. Waited til November and emailed in to see if anything had happened. They replied the refund couldn’t be issued because the tickets for the journey was in March.

I gave them some slack (probably too much which is my fault for being sympathetic to a travel company during a pandemic where you’re not supposed to travel) seeing as it’s a busy time in the pandemic situation, and I’m not happy that they didn’t tell me the tickets weren’t refundable when I originally applied for a refund and that they then sent me emails implying they were going to issue me one.

items.title: Fantastic service
items.review_text: Massive heartfelt thanks to Josh this morning ... my son left his laptop on a train destined for London, on his way to school; by 9.30 the laptop was located! Josh responses very quickly, politely and helpfully. A*++++++ from me!

items.title: Refusing to modernise
items.review_text:
So somebody is abroad and is travelling to the UK and wants to buy a ticket with this lot. For delivery they give you the option to either post it to a UK address or pick it up from a machine/ticket office at the station. Great. So now you pay by Paypal and because you're not in the UK you can't have it delivered at your UK address so you choose the station pickup option. Excellent. Now we are in the coronavirus pandemic and things change from one day to the next so it turns out you can't come into the UK on the selected date. So now you're looking to change that ticket to a different date. Now the only option to have it delivered is via a UK address which creates a conundrum only they know how you can solve. 
So you have a relative who can receive the ticket to their UK address and then post it to you so you pick that option. But they don't send you the full amended ticket, they send you an excess ticket which is not valid unless you have the original ticket. Nobody is going to tell you that you have to pick up the original ticket from the machine to use the excess ticket. And if you used Paypal as the method to pay then you cannot pick it up from a machine because there is no provision for that, you have to go to the ticket office and get it from there. But not all stations have ticket offices and they're not open 24/7, not even at the airports!

Why on earth can't they just issue an e-ticket for your devices countless other companies do and they use this archaic and convoluted system only they know. Perhaps they can't be bothered.

items.title: Horrible
items.review_text: Horrible. Rude late expensive

items.title: Many thanks to a guy called Brad who…
items.review_text:
Many thanks to a guy called Brad who dealt with my enquiry efficiently and quickly this morning.
Thank you Brad very much appreciated

items.title: 08:31 Taunton to London Paddington
items.review_text: Currently on the 8.31 from Taunton to London Paddington and the train manager David is magnificent. Honestly hilarious. "Next station is Castle Scary" just the tip of the iceberg, get that man a pay rise. His enjoyment of his job is evident and his humour and chirpiness is just what we need in these times.

items.title: Friendly and efficient service for cyclists
items.review_text: I am always so impressed with the efficiency and comfort of services with GWR. I regularly rely on GWR/bike to ²go back to my hometown and I have always been able to book a bike reservation within minutes via their WhatsApp service. Particular shout out to Brad and Michaela who have recently provided an extremely friendly and quick service!

items.title: I was supposed to go back to Reading…
items.review_text: I was supposed to go back to Reading from Oxford but somehow managed to catch the wrong train towards Hanborough which is in the opposite direction. The train manager Kirsty W. was so lovely and helpful. She even came back to me and said: "16:19", to point out when is my next train to Reading. She really made my day. Thank you so much, Kirsty, for your kindness and professionalism. The lost guy in dark blue T-shirt.

items.title: Extremely rude GWR staff member at Bristol Temple Meads
items.review_text: Quite alarmed by the rudeness and contempt that is clearly permissible by GWR. Myself and my partner were travelling from Cornwall and needed to make a change at Bristol Temple Meads. Having been on various trains over the course of 5 hours we were understandably rather tired by the time we arrived. We regularly travel so we are used to making changes and we are also familiar with Bristol Temple Meads. I arrived roughly in the area where we needed to catch our next train but was momentarily disoriented and looked towards my partner who was slightly behind me to confirm which platform we needed to be on. I was stood near, but not too close to a train on the opposite platform bound for London Paddington. Suddenly a tall GWR staff member wearing a black mask with short black hair launched himself at me and shouted “where are you going?” In a tone which suggested I am totally devoid of a brain. He was glaring at me so I took a pause as I couldn’t work out why I was being spoken to in this way and for a moment wasn’t even sure whether he was a member of staff owing to his complete lack of professionalism. He continued, again in a mocking tone, “this train will leave in a minute so you need to know where you’re going”, my partner then confirmed where we were headed to which the GWR member of staff pointed at platform 13 where the 2.39pm service to Great Malvern from BTM (the train we required, 23rd October) was arriving into the platform. “That one” he spat, towards my partner. A much more helpful member of staff almost seemed to intervene at this point as if also dumbstruck by his colleague’s rudeness and confirmed what we had just been told. As we went to board the train I remarked “slightly rude, but thank you” as I was disgusted at the way we had been treated. His anger came out of nowhere and we had not sought any help so his presence was a surprise. We would of been grateful for his assistance had it not been brought forward with abrasiveness and contempt. I was hardly holding up the other train as I was nowhere near it and after all, if confused passengers miss their train, that’s their fault, so there was no need for any of his attitude. The situation was compounded by the fact that as our train left the platform and began on its journey we turned to the passenger window and clocked the same member of staff on the platform waving at the carriage and blowing a kiss! Perhaps this was jokingly intended for the driver of the train but as it came so soon after our minor altercation it seemed too much of a coincidence. The action also seemed to be deliberately sarcastic and however you cut it, it’s rather strange behaviour! He clearly has little time for members of the public and is deeply dissatisfied in his role and he certainly should be nowhere near customers. He seemed to be fizzing with anger and attitude so I can only assume we were not the only recipients of his particular brand of charm this afternoon.  I would add I have never had a problem with train staff before and think they do a marvellous job, often under immense pressure. Coming from a customer service background myself I can appreciate that totally. However, I hope this complaint is taken seriously and the member of staff in question (whom, unfortunately I am not able to name) is given thorough customer service training and guidance on how to maintain his composure and control his anger.

items.title: Great customer service via facebook
items.review_text: I booked a train ticket via a 3rd party website and the booking stated that seat reservations were not possible. GWR's website however says seat reservations should be made. Contacted GWR this evening via facebook and all quickly sorted - Thanks Josh!

items.title: Failure of e-ticketing system, and general competence
items.review_text:
Bought e-ticket, which vanished. Got to station, couldn't access it. 
Spent 30-min waiting for answer from helpline: was told all about the failure of GWR e-ticketing system, advised to buy new ticket and to raise the issue where I would be compensated.
6-weeks later, GWR customer services are totally unaware of the issue they were acutely aware of on the day, no refund as yet, and no sense of pwnership or accountability.
Can't afford to lose work again in this way. GWR, never again!

items.title: More often than not the staff are rude...
items.review_text: More often than not the staff are rude to paying customers such as myself. I actually had one physically try and shut the door in my face today because I had my two small dogs with me and I couldn't carry them both on because of the huge gap between the train and the platform. On other occasions I have been cat called by staff on the way out of the station and charged extra for adult tickets despite at the time being a child because I didn't have ID (who does at 15?)Other than the staff being rude the trains are often packed due to lack of carriages at peak times yet passangers are still expected to pay the full fare.

items.title: Amazing
items.review_text: Amazing. Can’t believe it was so easy!

items.title: Book ya bikes with Brad
items.review_text: Big love for the service from Brad on the WhatsApp If you’re booking bikes, couldn’t be simpler.

items.title: Booked my bike into the train via…
items.review_text: Booked my bike into the train via WhatsApp and it was sorted instantly by Brad. Much better service than booking over the phone!

items.title: Booked a bike place via Twitter
items.review_text: Booked a bike place via Twitter and was sorted within minutes! Very quick and friendly service from Brad. Top job.

items.title: The Facebook service for booking a bike…
items.review_text: The Facebook service for booking a bike place was very efficient and helpful. The bike racks are very well managed on the trains themselves too.

items.title: The train service and on board staff…
items.review_text:
The train service and on board staff are great, comfortable enough and usually run to time.
I will say that the app is abysmal and absolutely not fit for purpose, on top of that if you do have an issue trying to get through to customer service department is near impossible. Forget phoning, filling in the online form or emailing, the only way to get any kind of assistance is via their Twitter feed, though I must say Celia on their Twitter team was a marvel.

items.title: This is a curates egg type of company
items.review_text:
This is a curates egg type of company, the Passenger Assist Service both on the telephone, on the trains and at the stations is totally excellent. Great helpful, polite and always friendly staff, not afraid to remove passengers from the disabled seats either. That bit is a 5 star operation.
However the actual train supply function is very much 1 star. Being very elderly and with one of us disabled we always travel from Weston Super Mare where we live to Paignton paying extra for 1st class travel for the extra space and service. We booked about a month in advance and checked each day to see if there were rail works etc. You can imagine our dismay on Monday 14/09 to find the train we were booked on had disappeared from the schedule and been replaced by one departing about 50 minutes earlier with one change or an hour later with two changes and the journey taking 3.5 hours instead of 1.5 hours. Our local taxi company got us to the staion in time to catch the earlier train and the Passenger Assist staff were very helpful indeed. NO FIRST CLASS until we reached Taunton. Same on the way back FIRST CLASS only for part of the journey. We really loved sitting on Taunton station for 45 minutes waiting for the train, it was only the Passenger Assist staff who kept us going. Why GWR seeing that you are getting money from the Government are you so uncaring of your customers and the damage you are inflicting on the West Country. Our Hotel had had quite a few regular guests cancel as they were unable to book suitable trains.
Thank you for the response nearly a month later however over a month ago I had complained to customer services and given them ALL details - nothing back from them at all after 5 weeks.

items.title: Excellent online service
items.review_text: I bought a ticket online but the bike reservation did not work. I have sent a general query via email. They responded in minutes giving me various options on how to reserve a space for the bike. I have selected WhatsApp and the matter was resolved in minutes! Very pleased.

items.title: I forgot to book a bike space with my…
items.review_text: I forgot to book a bike space with my ticket. Contacted GWR via WhatsApp 2 hours before my journey and Brad helped me instantly! Very pleased

items.title: Beware, health risk!
items.review_text:
Beware, GWR deals with Covid Pandemic irresponsibly!!!

Currently on the 19:16 train from Exeter St David’s, travelling first class, just to get a bit of extra space and comfort, and in current times, safety, or so one would think.
Being comfortable in first class coach L, travellers were told this coach wasn’t currently in use. So basically everyone had to bunk up together in the small part of coach K, making social distancing difficult, whilst the second first class coach was empty!? Train attendant told us this is GWR policy. Unacceptable customer service. GWR urgently needs to review its safety and Covid procedures!!

items.title: I am delighted with your Customer…
items.review_text:
I am delighted with your Customer service.  Adele dealt with my problem and sorted it out having spent some time with me. Her professionalism and expertise is to the highest esteem and is a credit to GWR. So helpful, caring and polite on the telephone.  I wish her every success in her career with GWR.  I do not know her last name, but I contacted her on 03457000125, option 6 and then option 5.  I hope this post is brought to her attention and supervisors.
Thank you Adele.    Roger Lashbrook

items.title: Great Western Expectation
items.review_text: From my experiences I have used GWR for short journeys from Swansea and I do like the 800 but what it's lacking for a 5 star is that there are no buffet cars. Yes I like the blinds, yes I like that there's not toilets and seats and the fact that there's more space and air conditioning makes things much nicer. Shame you can't open the windows like the HST but still air conditioning is good enough for me. But seriously GWR a buffet car is needed.

items.title: Beyond the call of duty
items.review_text: Beyond the call of duty. What fantastic customer service. Josh (and Michaela) took ownership of my problem and sorted it when others in gwr wouldn’t. Thank you both, especially Josh. Extremely grateful for your help. Thanks very much.

We have multiple times been refused bikes on absolutely empty trains by zealous agents threatening to call the police to kick us out. These rules are purely impractical and followed by no other companies we’ve experienced with.

items.title: Absolutely appalling service and easily…
items.review_text:
Absolutely appalling service and easily THE WORST train service provider operating in Britain right now. 
More than 4 trains cancelled on the same line in less than 18 hours!!!
Most trains cancelled are at peak times and very rarely during non peak.
Mickey Mouse Company, avoid if you can.

items.title: Utterly chaotic GWR
items.review_text:
The ticket buying process would get one star. Their website didn't work and no one answered the phone. When I wrote to complain they asked me to contact them on social media. How dare they assume I use social media?
Fortunately Trainline exists and I was able to buy a ticket through them without any problems.
The outward journey did not go well. As we boarded the conductor told us to move forward as the train would divide at Plymouth. We walked the whole length of the train to carriage A and didn't find another first class carriage which was annoying as we had paid for first class seats. While waiting for the train to leave I went to the toilet and could not unlock the door by pressing the usual lock/unlock button. I pressed the emergency button but no one spoke to me through the intercom. After a few minutes of waiting I called my husband (luckily I had my phone on me) who came and prised the door open manually. I would hate to be in a real emergency on GWR. Then there  a message was broadcast that the train would not divide after all. By this time the train was moving so we had to walk the whole length of it with our luggage. The conductor was very apologetic and found us seats together. He said the notice board had put up the wrong message. The return journey passed without incident, to my relief. A pity, as ten to fifteen years ago they provided a good service.

items.title: V easy to book bikes on train via…
items.review_text: V easy to book bikes on train via WhatsApp - thanks Brad!

items.title: WhatsApp, bike reservation.
items.review_text: I used the WhatsApp service to book a bike reservation onto my journey. I was a little apprehensive but within about 1 minute they sent a reply with a copy of the reservation. Very impressed!

items.title: Booking a bike space on Whatsapp
items.review_text: I noticed that you could book a berth for your bike via Whatsapp. So, I sent a message with the details of my journey and seconds later I received confirmation that it was booked! Including a photo of the booking for my record.

items.title: Ripped me off for over a hundred quid
items.review_text: Their system for rebooking is so archaic that it can't be done without booking a new separate ticket then refunding your old one. I made a small mistake and changed the station to a station that is 600 yards away from the original one. Same price. Apparently that invalidates the refund. Customer service "couldnt do anything about it". Completely ridiculous thing to do to a loyal customer. I guess National Express or BA will get my business from now on.

items.title: Bike reservation made via WhatsApp
items.review_text: Just reserved a place for my bike on a return trip out of London Paddington using the GWR WhatsApp account. A confirmation booking was messaged back to me within minutes! Absolutely brilliant outcome. Thank you GWR

items.title: Great customer service
items.review_text: Great customer service experience. WhatsApp GWR to book my bike on & got it sorted almost immediately. No hassle.

items.title: Great customer service via Facebook

items.title: V good service once you find out how to…

items.title: Brad was fantastic
items.review_text: Brad was fantastic! Great response

items.title: Whats app service - amazing
items.review_text:
Brad (on whats app) is a champion.  Had been waiting for ages on the phone and noticed there was a whats app mode of contact so I tried that.  Brad replied instantly with guidance to resolve my issue.

Backstory - I accidentally typed in the wrong date of travel for my train trip when I purchased my ticket online. GWR allow you to submit a refund form if you realise on the same day.  Luckily for me I immediately noticed my error in the confirmation email for the purchase.

items.title: Really helpful!
items.review_text: Brad was really helpful on Twitter - even when we changed our minds he was super quick and accommodating! Thanks for your help!

items.title: All services should have a WhatsApp service, like GWR
items.review_text: Although my journey got terminated early, and I missed my connection, Brad, on their WhatsApp service, has been amazing with helping me fill out my compensation form. He was helpful, informative and witty. Everything the world needs right now. Well done Brad. I hope you managed to finally get a cup of coffee in ya.

items.title: Great efficient service
items.review_text: Great efficient service. I used Facebook messenger to book 2 bike places on a train and it was all done within minutes.

items.title: My son purchased a return ticket from…
items.review_text:
My son purchased a return ticket from London Paddington 29/08/20 to Cheltenham. Returning at 11.58am on 31/08/2020.

Due to circumstances beyond our control, he missed the train at Cheltenham.  We drove him to Swindon to get on the same train at 1pm. 

Staff at Swindon refused him entry despite having a valid ticket for that journey. He was told that he  had to purchase another ticket and ended up paying twice for the same seat on the same train.

The refusal of entry in Swindon and then having to purchase another ticket resulted in him missing the 1pm train and having to catch the next train. 

I find it unbelievable that GWR would knowingly charge a student twice for the same journey!

items.title: Phone & debit card untouched!
items.review_text:
I left my iPhone on a service to Plymouth. I was delighted to discover that it had been handed in at Bristol Temple Meads the next day. I received an email reply to my Missingx form within hours & was able to collect it that afternoon,as coincidentally I was up in Bristol visiting my mother. There are still very honest people around. My Visa debit card was tucked inside the cover. Thank you GWR. Impeccable customer service & absolutely free.
Kate Howard

items.title: 16.05 Train from Torquay to Paddington…
items.review_text: 16.05 Train from Torquay to Paddington cancelled and advised tickets valid for next train 16.23... which was also cancelled. Advised by station staff to travel to Newton Abbot and catch 16.55 which cost us a further £30 in a taxi. Arrived 16.53 As train arrived however station supervisor Alan and his unhelpful staff would not allow us through the barrier and we had to wait a further hour  for train...great job GWR...never again.

items.title: Great journey
items.review_text: From the ticket office at Paddington to the ticket barriers at slough, we had an amazing experience. The staff were friendly and hard working. The only problem was social distancing but most people wore masks and the conductor made clear the rules of the journey.

items.title: tried to by a ticket online
items.review_text:
tried to by a ticket online. no Ticket, money taken twice.
Phoned, waited 51 minutes and 38 seconds for a reply, no help, could I buy a ticket, "no, no availabilty"
Downloaded train line app bought ticket, no hassle.

still waiting for refund. wil probably use small claims court

My issue I needEd to get two bicycles on the train for a charity ride and the train I wanted to book had no space. Brad directed me to a alternative train and reserved the space for me within minutes. Job done hassle free. Thanks Brad. Awesome, excellent service.

items.review_text: GWR answered my query quickly. They were able to book my bike on to the train and they did so in a matter of minutes. Also responded quickly when I had follow up questions.

items.title: Enough
items.review_text: Just saying. Trains have been late for me for almost 5 days in a row. I wasted so much money and so much of my time it makes me want to walk 5 hours to go to work just to avoid this company.

items.title: Overpriced and unreliable
items.review_text: I've used gwr for more than 18months as a commuter Swindon-Bristol. Prices are extremely high and not appropriate to the service given. I had much more weeks with a delay than weeks going smoothly. The refund policies are not fair at all with commuters, probably they are more reasonable for single tickets. Tickets bought in one station might be questioned in another one, expecially regarding the peak/off peak definition, which is not defined at all. The company takes advantage to the fact that they have the monoploly on some fares (not even buses), and the customer is not considered at all. For the same money I could have bought a used car and covered all the expenses to do the commute by car.

items.title: So helpful!
items.review_text: Fantastic customer service from Brad on Facebook Messenger!  From the first message I sent he was so helpful, knowledge and patient in responding to all my queries at any time of day. In what could have been a stressful situation with changing train times, seat reservations and with a booking having been made through a different company Brad made the whole thing so much easier and hassle free! Would totally commend him personally, a truly great asset to the company! Thank you again so much Brad for your help 😊

items.title: Very quick response time from their…
items.review_text: Very quick response time from their help desk and friendly staff

items.title: Josh was just brilliant
items.review_text: Josh was just brilliant.  Wrote to them via Facebook Messenger late a night on the trail of a poster my partner has been searching for (two years!).  Got a response in ten minutes which amazed me and he kept in touch on progress, liaising with another agency to achieve a positive result. Service beyond everything I could have expected and frankly I am totally bowled over.  Thank you Josh - you are a star and a wonderful ambassador for your organisation.

items.review_text: Brad from the social media team was brilliant, 5 stars, dealt with my issue v quickly and was very helpful. I have also contacted them before and they were equally as helpful.

items.title: Trains too slow
items.review_text:
Booked to go to Newquay for the weekend, 
The train journey is far too long for the same distance you can travel up north in half the time. 
My return journey today I was allocated 7 mins to transfer trains. 
Unfortunately for me they was a crowd of 20 5year olds descending the stair well in front of me making me miss my connecting train to London. 
My journey today is taking 8 hours 
Not good enough 
The trains are not fast enough not only have I had to wait 2 hours for another train at Plymouth but this train is now running late 
What ever you do do not book a train to Cornwall ridiculous 
I could have traveled to Florida in this time or even Scotland 
The journey is only 260 miles for god sake 
Never book these slow services 
Rubbish trains at a snail pace update the tracks for god sake

Can not praise the service enough particularly under the current Covid circumstances.
Very well done 10 out of 10 an extremely satisfied customer.

Employ lots more Bradley's GWR - he's a star

items.title: Only Great at Dissapointment
items.review_text: Service is regularly late which is disappointing considering the ever rising ticket costs. Prior to Covid, the service update just cased more unecessary chaos for commuters leaving many of us worse off to either raise ticket prices (by removing split ticket destinations from peak times) or removing some smaller local services all together. Finally it seems like many of the recent changes made, also negatively affect the staff. GWR upper management seems to only care about the bottom line at the cost of their customers and staff. The only great thing about them is their ability to disappoint.

items.title: Good service and friendly train…
items.review_text: Good service and friendly train manager. Please bring back the food/drink trolley as a coffee on a long journey would be great.

items.title: Lost suitcase
items.review_text: I forgot my bag on a train from London to Reading and the station management at Reading/Oxford/Paddington were excellent in helping me return it securely. They were compassionate and empathetic to my concerns and tried to reassure me. They went out of their way to call different stations to see if my bag had been found. Once it had been found I was immediately emailed with a photograph and I could go pick it up on that day. Not only were professional in their dealings but they handled the matter with great care and empathy. I am extremely grateful.

items.title: Great website and awesome service
items.review_text:
I will be booking tickets for me and my Son to visit Bournemouth in early August. I found the GWR website very user friendly and easy to navigate. It quickly showed the availability and prices for my chosen dates. I was surprised how good the prices are and indeed GWR are far cheaper than any of the various other sites on the internet. I won’t bother with them in the future and will go straight to GWR to book tickets.
I did have a query and needed to contact GWR to seek clarification. 
It clearly shows how you can contact them using Twitter / WattsApp / Phone or e mail. It states you can use WattsApp up to 11pm so at 9.15pm Saturday evening I sent them a message on WattsApp.
I thought I would probably get a reply within a couple of days and was amazed that Josh in their customer service team replied within 30 minutes!!
His tone was very polite and he answered my question straightaway. 
This really is awesome service and the best experience I’ve had from any rail operator. Josh deserves some recognition for sure and thanks to GWR for making it all so easy. 
Kind regards 
Simon

items.title: Great experience of customer service…
items.review_text: Great experience of customer service via Whatsapp, very easy way to communicate. Michaela booked bike places for me after I had bought my tickets online.

items.title: 4 months of emails and still no word of a refund
items.review_text: Following cancellation of my sleeper tickets due to the pandemic, and after 4 months of slow though courteous email exchanges, I am again told I am in a queue for processing refunds.  This despite previously been told my case would be escalated because it has passed 56 day turn-around threshold.  The pandemic was beyond GWR's control; an efficient refund service is not.  Trainline refunded my return ticket within a week!

items.title: Brilliant support from David @ Castle Cary during Covid
items.review_text:
Brilliant support @ Castle Cary from David as my daughter Eleanor has travelled to London for medical treatment during Lockdown. It's not easy travelling with a wheelchair - and David has been most helpful in assisting us at CLC and ringing ahead to his colleagues at Paddington for support at the other end - really appreciated :-)

PS David always has a smile and a wry sense of humour .. much appreciated :-)

items.title: 5 Star treatment with season ticket refund
items.review_text: I have been organising a refund for my season ticket. It has been very complicated because it was a company season ticket loan but i cannot say enough how professional the twitter help has been. Fast, accurate, polite and an excellent service. I almost never write a review but felt compelled to this time. Thanks team GWR

items.title: Top quality problem solving
items.review_text:
Top quality problem solving
I had quite a number of difficulties that needed sorting and not only were they solved, but they were done with great speed and also a friendly approach.

items.title: Everyone loves Brad
items.review_text: Messaging Brad to book my bike onto the train isn't quite the highlight of the trip but its not far off. Always very polite and sorts it in a matter of minutes

items.title: Easy cycle reservation via WhatsApp on…
items.review_text: Easy cycle reservation via WhatsApp on GWR Lon Pad to Ply thanks to Celia

items.title: I would give 0 if I could
items.review_text: I would give 0 if I could. Absolutely disgusting that the level of actual trains is apparently at around 80 percent when my station has 2 trains per day at completely ridiculous times that you can't use for work. Facebook gives you awful generic answers and the timetables are incorrect. If you live north of Oxford then you can't go to work! The country lines are probably the people that need them the most and your company is the only one that stops at my station leaving me no options. Terrible service.

items.title: Great customer service
items.review_text:
Great customer service through Facebook. Brad answered my initial message less than 5min after I sent it. 
Quick to get me an answer too.

items.title: amazing WhatsApp service
items.review_text: I’ve used the WhatsApp service twice now, for questions (about booking bikes on trains) that would previously have needed navigating through automated menu options and lots of waiting around on the phone. It’s fab, the team are helpful and seem well-informed. I’ll be using it again!

items.title: Have been waiting for a season ticket…
items.review_text:
Have been waiting for a season ticket refund due to Covid-19, and had acknowledgment of my bank details on 01/04/2020. Since then I've had only one email from GWR stating my claim number on 05/04/2020. I've had no updates on how long the process may take, not even an apology for the delay! I do understand that this is a difficult time, and there is a backlog in processing claims, however I don't think it's unfair to be updated on what's happening! 
Everybody's struggling, some of us are about to loose our jobs, every penny is precious! If you just took the time to let people know how there claim is being processed it would ease some of the anxiety and tension everyones trying to deal with at the moment!

items.title: The Twitter team are amazing.
items.review_text: The customer service Twitter team are fantastic. Answered all the questions that I asked them, and were able to answer everything. They were also very professional too!

items.title: Very helpful customer service
items.review_text: Very helpful customer service, quick and reliable

items.title: Get some more employees
items.review_text: Called you, no response for half an hour, no response. Emailed you, no response, messeged you no response. What the hell? Thanks for wasting my time and money.

items.title: Contact through whatsapp
items.review_text: If contacted directly on WhatsApp most issues can be solved without a problem!

items.title: Very speedy response from Michaela on…
items.review_text: Very speedy response from Michaela on Twitter who helped me book my bike onto two upcoming journeys. Thanks, Michaela!

items.title: Very Efficient Customer Service
items.review_text: Excellent service from Michaela on Messenger this evening. She replied to my messages very promptly and sorted out our seat reservation very efficiently. Thank you!

items.title: Excellent bike booking service
items.review_text: The whatsapp bike booking service is very efficient. I have used it a couple of times now and they have been very prompt and quick in reserving bike spaces.

items.title: I couldn't reserve spaces for bicycles…
items.review_text: I couldn't reserve spaces for bicycles on the GWR website when booking my tickets so messaged GWR on Facebook. They replied within 10 minutes and had reserved us bicycle spaces for the train we wanted. Very good service!

items.title: Great customer service
items.review_text: Have booked a bike space through the Messenger app a couple of times and has always been quick and efficient. A refund for a delay was also effortless.

items.title: Excellent service
items.review_text: Excellent! Where the website and phone call failed on booking bicycles onto trains, the WhatsApp support came up trumps! The staff couldn't have been more helpful (and patient!)

items.title: Extremely efficient WhatsApp customer service
items.review_text: I used the WhatsApp service and found the help I received extremely efficient! I had a reply within a minute. Would highly recommend!

items.title: Needed to change a ticket time
items.review_text: Needed to change a ticket time, the operator Michaela was super helpful, gave me all the links i needed and answered all my questions. Super happy.

items.title: Wanted to reserve a spot for my bike…
items.review_text: Wanted to reserve a spot for my bike and using Facebook I had it arranged within 10 minutes of messaging!

items.title: Really easy to make bike reservations…
items.review_text: Really easy to make bike reservations for a specific train via WhatsApp - extremely quick response time, friendly service and easy to do.

items.title: Phone lines are so old school
items.review_text: I waited on the phone  for nearly an hour then tried what's app and Facebook messenger and got a reply straight away, and got the issue sorted,   amazing cant believe I didnt think of it sooner

items.title: Efficient and friendly service
items.review_text: Used the text service, simple and easy to use and Celia was very helpful

items.title: Extremely helpful booking a bike…
items.review_text: Extremely helpful booking a bike reservation, I was unable to book via the website but Brad immediately found the availability and booked for me

items.title: Very helpful booking a bike reservation…
items.review_text: Very helpful booking a bike reservation through FB messenger. Cila was very helpful indeed! Cheers

items.title: Brilliant staff at Truro Station!!
items.review_text:
Caught train from Truro to Penzance- wanted to take my bicycle as well.
Initially I contacted GWR by What’s App ( first time for me)... Celia replied immediately with advice ( no reservation needed for bike). 
On arrival at station- I stupidly forgot my mask. The very kind and helpful staff at Truro Station offered me a spare one. Brilliant. 
Thanks for helping me out and thanks for keeping us safe.

items.title: Used the WhatsApp number to make a bike…
items.review_text: Used the WhatsApp number to make a bike reservation. Very quick response, out of hours, on a Saturday. Cheers Josh!

items.title: contacted customer service via Facebook…
items.review_text: contacted customer service via Facebook messenger. Josh was very helpful and prompt with his responses!

items.title: Super quick feedback via facebook…
items.review_text: Super quick feedback via facebook messenger when reserving space for my bike

items.title: Needed to reserve a bike space
items.review_text: Needed to reserve a bike space, hopped on Facebook Messenger, Brad squared me away in minutes, could not have been easier. My man Brad putting the "Great" in Great Western Railway.

items.title: Brad
items.review_text: Brad - via the WhatsApp line - was extremely helpful getting our bikes booked on a train. He was friendly and efficient and helped us out with a (virtual) smile. Thanks very much! Everything was smooth and worked as it should. Great service.

items.title: Needed to reserve a bike space so I…
items.review_text: Needed to reserve a bike space so I used the whatapp service. An amost instaneous response and all as sorted in <5 minutes. Excellent service

items.title: I can only speak as I find and the…
items.review_text: I can only speak as I find and the helpfulness of Michaela through the WhatsApp chat has been brilliant. She was able to sort my query out and put my mind at ease.

items.title: Great  service through Facebook
items.review_text: Great  service through Facebook. Quick and helpful response!

items.title: Great Facebook experience
items.review_text: Using Facebook was by far the best interaction I have had with GWR (or in fact any train operating company). Quick, friendly, and got my reservation sorted.

items.title: Great Twitter team
items.review_text: Answered my query with ease and clarity, keep up the good work Twitter team. thank you.

items.title: This has been a joke so far
items.review_text: This has been a joke so far. 13 weeks later still no refund! I’ve wasted hours & hours trying to sort this out & put in several complaints & all I get back is refunds are taking 56 days. Obviously they didn’t pass maths at school! I will never book with GWR again!

items.title: 84 Day Refund Saga
items.review_text:
GWR refunds over the COVID period have been the worst by far of the rail companies I've dealt with. Taking a marathon 84 days from initial refund request to actual refund, including 12 responses back and forth, and 3 requests made as instructed.

Compared with, during the same period:
- thetrainline (instantly)
- LNER ( 5 days, and done automatically)
- ScotRail ( 7 days )

items.title: Season Ticket Refund Delay
items.review_text: I applied for a season ticket refund on 1st May and have heard nothing since. This may be a small sum to GWR but it really matters to us. I have chased online and over the phone but nothing happens.  Shocking.

items.title: Season ticket refund, still waiting....
items.review_text: I applied for a refund on 16th March, 64 working days ago and still no refund of my season ticket. I initially contacted them after the standard 28 days they normally take to reply. Then I was told it would be 56 days. I've tried emailing since and all I am given is excuses and told it has been escalated to finance. I'm even more concerned as some have been asked for card details and as I haven't, I'm really no further ahead than when I started this process in March. Having been furloughed and faced salary cuts, this is already an anxious time, which is being exacerbated by GWR.

items.title: Refund requested 82 days ago and counting
items.review_text: Requested refund on season ticket on 27nd March. Still waiting. Kept being told that the processing time had increased, then that it was passed on to the escalation team for payment within 2 weeks which didn't happen. The escalation team was not responding to being chased for over a week after that, then came up with an issue "processing" the payment (whatever the hell that means) which has now been going on for a week. Contacted the complaints department 10 days ago and no sign of life either. Considering that I have been furloughed on reduced pay and that the exorbitant cost of the ticket was covered by a season ticket loan that I still need to reimburse, this keeps getting worse. I'm discussing with my company a WFH schedule going forward so that I don't have to get a season ticket ever again because this experience, in addition to the crowded and delayed trains when they were functioning has been nothing short of appaling.

items.title: Still waiting for my claim dated…
